description: This repository is a collection of reference implementations for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), showcasing how it can be used to give Large Language Models (LLMs) secure, controlled access to tools and data sources. The servers are implemented with either the Typescript MCP SDK or Python MCP SDK and cover a wide range of functionalities including web scraping, database interaction, cloud services, and more.

This repository is a collection of reference implementations for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), which allows Large Language Models (LLMs) to securely and controlledly access tools and data sources. The servers in this repository showcase the versatility and extensibility of MCP, with each server implemented using either the TypeScript or Python MCP SDK. The repository includes a wide range of servers, from AWS Knowledge Base retrieval and web scraping to database interactions, browser automation, and more.

This repository is a collection of reference implementations for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), which provides secure, controlled access to tools and data sources for Large Language Models (LLMs). It includes a variety of servers for different purposes such as AWS Knowledge Base, Brave Search, EverArt, Filesystem, Git, GitHub, Google Maps, PostgreSQL, Puppeteer, Redis, and more. The repository also lists third-party and community-built MCP servers, frameworks, and resources for developers.

This repository is a collection of reference implementations for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), which allows Large Language Models (LLMs) to securely and controlledly access tools and data sources. The servers in this repository demonstrate MCP features using TypeScript and Python SDKs, covering a wide range of functionalities such as web scraping, database interaction, file operations, cloud services, and more.

It includes a wide range of servers and integrations with various platforms and services, such as AWS, GitHub, Google Maps, PostgreSQL, and more. The repository also provides frameworks and resources for building and managing MCP servers and clients.

It includes a wide range of MCP servers, such as AWS KB Retrieval, Brave Search, EverArt, Filesystem, Git, GitHub, Google Drive, Google Maps, Memory, PostgreSQL, Puppeteer, Redis, Slack, SQLite, and more. These servers are implemented using either the TypeScript or Python MCP SDKs and provide a variety of functionalities including web scraping, database interaction, file operations, and more.

It includes a wide range of MCP servers, each with specific features such as AWS Knowledge Base retrieval, web and local search, AI image generation, secure file operations, Git and GitHub integration, Google Maps, persistent memory systems, database interactions, browser automation, and more. The repository also provides resources and frameworks for building and managing MCP servers.

It includes a wide range of servers and frameworks for various purposes, such as database interaction, web scraping, cloud services, and more. The main features include reference servers, third-party servers, and frameworks for building MCP servers and clients.

This repository is a collection of reference implementations for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), which provides secure, controlled access to tools and data sources for Large Language Models (LLMs). It includes a variety of servers for different purposes such as AWS KB Retrieval, Brave Search, EverArt, Filesystem, Git, GitHub, Google Maps, Memory, PostgreSQL, Puppeteer, Redis, Slack, and more. The repository also lists official and community-built MCP servers, frameworks for building MCP servers and clients, and additional resources for MCP.

This repository is a collection of reference implementations for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), which allows Large Language Models (LLMs) to securely and controlledly access tools and data sources. The servers in this repository demonstrate MCP features using TypeScript and Python SDKs, and cover a wide range of functionalities including web scraping, database interaction, file operations, cloud services, and more.

Prisma is a next-generation ORM that provides tools for working with databases in Node.js and TypeScript. It includes Prisma Client, an auto-generated and type-safe query builder, Prisma Migrate for declarative data modeling and migrations, and Prisma Studio, a GUI to view and edit data. Key features include auto-generated and type-safe queries, support for multiple databases, and seamless integration into existing projects.

MindsDB is an open-source server that enables the connection, unification, and querying of data from various sources, including databases, data warehouses, and SaaS applications. It provides a full SQL dialect for federated queries, supports virtual tables, knowledge bases, and ML models, and offers built-in agents to answer questions over connected and unified data. MindsDB can be deployed anywhere, from laptops to the cloud, and supports Docker and PyPI installations.

Repomix is a powerful tool that packs your entire repository into a single, AI-friendly file. It is designed to be used with Large Language Models (LLMs) and other AI tools. Main features include AI-Optimized formatting, Token Counting, Customizable inclusion/exclusion, Git-aware, Security-focused, Code Compression, and support for multiple output formats (XML, Markdown, Plain Text). It also supports remote repository processing, Docker usage, and can be run as an MCP server for AI assistant integration.

Activepieces is an open-source, extensible automation platform that allows users to create workflows and integrations with a variety of services. It supports over 200+ pieces (integrations) and is designed to be both developer and non-technical user-friendly. Key features include type-safe pieces in TypeScript, AI-first capabilities, enterprise readiness, and a secure, self-hosted environment. The platform also includes features like loops, branches, auto retries, and human-in-the-loop approvals.
This tool enables searching and retrieving screen recordings and associated data, which is useful for productivity tracking, user behavior analysis, and workflow documentation.

GitHub MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with the GitHub API. It allows LLM agents to manage GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, branches, files, and releases through a standardized interface. Key features include GitHub API integration, comprehensive GitHub feature management, atomic feature architecture, input validation, error handling, and rate limiting.

Skyvern is a tool that automates browser-based workflows using LLMs and computer vision. It provides a simple API endpoint to fully automate manual workflows on a large number of websites, replacing brittle or unreliable automation solutions. Key features include web scraping, form filling, data extraction, file downloading, and support for various authentication methods. Skyvern uses a multi-agent architecture with agents responsible for parsing HTML, planning navigation, extracting data, handling passwords, and more. It also offers a managed cloud version with anti-bot detection, proxy network, and CAPTCHA solvers.

Mastra is an opinionated TypeScript framework designed to help developers build AI applications and features quickly. It provides a set of primitives including workflows, agents, RAG, integrations, and evals. Key features include LLM model routing, agents with tools and workflows, durable graph-based state machines, retrieval-augmented generation, auto-generated type-safe API clients for third-party services, and automated tests for LLM outputs.

BlenderMCP is an integration that connects Blender to Claude AI through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling prompt-assisted 3D modeling, scene creation, and manipulation. Key features include two-way communication, object manipulation, material control, scene inspection, and code execution. It also supports Poly Haven assets and Hyper3D Rodin for 3D model generation.

Cloudflare Playwright MCP is a tool for automated browser testing and interaction, integrating with Cloudflare Workers and Browser Rendering. It supports various actions such as navigating, clicking, typing, taking screenshots, and more. The project can be deployed to Cloudflare Workers and used with Cloudflare AI Playground or Claude Desktop. It also includes support for VSCode integration.

Supermemory is a tool designed to serve as a universal engine for memory, allowing users to organize and search through personal information, bookmarks, contacts, and more. Key features include ideation, powerful search, chat with collections, memory refresh, and integrations with various platforms like Telegram, Twitter, Chrome bookmarks, and Notion. It also provides a self-hostable, open-source solution with a focus on privacy and security.

PydanticAI is a Python agent framework designed to make it less painful to build production-grade applications with Generative AI. Key features include model-agnostic support, Pydantic Logfire integration, type safety, Python-centric design, structured responses, dependency injection, streamed responses, and graph support. It provides a powerful and ergonomic way to build and manage AI-driven projects.

Graphiti is a framework for building and querying temporally-aware knowledge graphs, specifically tailored for AI agents operating in dynamic environments. It supports real-time incremental updates, bi-temporal data model, efficient hybrid retrieval, custom entity definitions, and scalability. Key features include episode management, entity management, semantic and hybrid search capabilities, and group management for organizing related data. The framework integrates with Neo4j and various LLM providers like OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google Gemini.

Context7 MCP is a tool that provides up-to-date, version-specific documentation and code examples for developers. It integrates with various IDEs and MCP clients to fetch the latest code examples and documentation directly into the LLM's context, ensuring no outdated or hallucinated APIs are used. Main features include support for multiple IDEs, easy installation via Smithery, Docker, and other methods, and tools like `resolve-library-id` and `get-library-docs`.
Figma MCP 服务器是一个基于模型上下文协议(MCP)的工具，允许将Figma设计文件与AI编码工具如Cursor、Windsurf等无缝集成。主要功能包括将Figma设计数据转换为易于理解的格式、获取布局和样式信息、下载图片和图标资源，并优化了数据结构和转换逻辑以提高AI响应的准确性和相关性。

C/ua (pronounced 'koo-ah') is a tool that enables AI agents to control full operating systems in high-performance virtual containers with near-native speed on Apple Silicon. It provides a Computer-Use Agent UI and VM management through Lume CLI, supports various AI models like OpenAI, Anthropic, and OmniParser, and includes features for controlling the virtual machine's interface, such as mouse and keyboard actions, screen captures, and file system operations.

Phoenix is an open-source AI observability platform designed for experimentation, evaluation, and troubleshooting. It provides features such as Tracing, Evaluation, Datasets, Experiments, Playground, and Prompt Management. Phoenix is vendor and language agnostic with out-of-the-box support for popular frameworks and LLM providers. It can be installed via pip or conda and runs on various environments including local machines, Jupyter notebooks, and cloud deployments.

jsondiffpatch is a JavaScript library for diffing and patching JSON objects. It supports deep diff, array diffing, text diffing, and multiple output formats including pure JSON, visual HTML, annotated JSON, and JSON Patch. It also provides features like reverse delta, unpatch, and deep cloning. The library is useful for developers working with JSON data in both browser and server environments.

GhidraMCP is a Ghidra plugin that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for AI-assisted binary analysis. It provides features such as AI-Powered Binary Analysis, Natural Language Interface, Deep Code Insights, Binary Structure Analysis, Automated Security Analysis, and Socket-Based Architecture. The plugin enables AI assistants to connect to Ghidra and assist with binary analysis tasks, making reverse engineering more efficient and accessible.

BrowserTools MCP is a powerful browser monitoring and interaction tool that enables AI-powered applications to capture and analyze browser data through a Chrome extension. Key features include web scraping, crawling, content extraction, SEO, performance, accessibility, and best practices audits, as well as headless browser automation and structured results in JSON format. The system consists of a Chrome extension, a Node server, and an MCP server, and it supports various MCP-compatible clients like Cursor, Cline, Zed, and Claude Desktop.

WhatsApp MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for WhatsApp that allows you to search and read personal WhatsApp messages, including media, and send messages to individuals or groups. It connects to your personal WhatsApp account via the WhatsApp web multidevice API and stores message history in a SQLite database. Key features include searching contacts, listing messages and chats, sending and receiving various media types, and integrating with AI tools like Claude.

Cursor Talk to Figma MCP is a project that integrates Cursor AI with Figma, allowing for reading and modifying designs programmatically. It includes features such as design automation, bulk text content replacement, instance override propagation, and various MCP tools for interacting with Figma, including document and selection management, annotations, prototyping, creating and modifying elements, styling, layout, and organization.

Playwright MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides browser automation capabilities using Playwright. It enables LLMs to interact with web pages, take screenshots, generate test code, and execute JavaScript in a real browser environment. Key features include web scraping, test code generation, and real-time event streaming via Server-Sent Events (SSE).

Firecrawl MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that integrates with Firecrawl for web scraping capabilities. Key features include web scraping, crawling, and discovery, search and content extraction, deep research and batch scraping, automatic retries and rate limiting, cloud and self-hosted support, and SSE support. It also provides tools for scraping, batch scraping, searching, crawling, extracting, and conducting deep research.

Vizro is a low-code toolkit for building high-quality data visualization apps. It allows users to create beautiful and powerful data visualization apps quickly and easily, without needing advanced engineering or visual design expertise. Key features include quick and easy app building, in-built visual design best practices, flexibility with open-source packages, almost infinite customization, and scalability for rapid prototyping and deployment.

Desktop Commander MCP is a powerful tool for developers that allows them to search, update, manage files, and run terminal commands with AI. Key features include executing terminal commands, managing processes, full filesystem operations, code editing capabilities, and more. It integrates with Claude Desktop and provides a comprehensive set of tools for development and automation.

GitMCP is a free, open-source, remote Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that transforms any GitHub project into a documentation hub. It enables AI tools to access up-to-date documentation and code, reducing code hallucinations. Key features include latest documentation access, no setup required, embedded chat, and support for multiple AI assistants like Cursor, VSCode, Claude, and more.

Cognee is a tool designed to provide memory for AI agents with features such as interconnecting and retrieving past conversations, documents, images, and audio transcriptions. It also reduces hallucinations, developer effort, and cost. Cognee supports loading data into graph and vector databases using Pydantic and can manipulate data from 30+ data sources.

Cloudflare MCP Server is a repository that provides several MCP servers to connect to Cloudflare's services from an MCP client, allowing natural language interaction for various tasks. Features include documentation, workers bindings, observability, radar, container, browser rendering, logpush, AI gateway, AutoRAG, audit logs, DNS analytics, digital experience monitoring, and Cloudflare One CASB. These servers enable configuration management, information processing, and automated changes across Cloudflare's services.

Cloudflare MCP Server is a repository that provides several MCP servers to connect to Cloudflare's services using natural language. Features include reading configurations, processing information, making suggestions, and implementing changes across various Cloudflare services such as application development, security, and performance. The repository includes servers for documentation, workers bindings, observability, radar, container, browser rendering, logpush, AI gateway, AutoRAG, audit logs, DNS analytics, digital experience monitoring, and Cloudflare One CASB.

Cloudflare MCP Server is a repository that provides several MCP servers to connect Cloudflare's services with an MCP client, allowing natural language interaction for various tasks. Features include managing configurations, processing information, making suggestions, and implementing changes across Cloudflare's services such as application development, security, and performance. The repository includes multiple servers like Documentation, Workers Bindings, Observability, Radar, Container, Browser Rendering, Logpush, AI Gateway, AutoRAG, Audit Logs, DNS Analytics, Digital Experience Monitoring, and Cloudflare One CASB.

Cloudflare MCP Server is a repository that provides several MCP servers to connect to Cloudflare's services from an MCP client, allowing natural language interaction for tasks such as application development, security, and performance. Features include documentation, Workers bindings, observability, Radar, container sandbox, browser rendering, Logpush, AI Gateway, AutoRAG, audit logs, DNS analytics, Digital Experience Monitoring, and Cloudflare One CASB. The servers can be accessed directly from MCP clients or configured using mcp-remote.

It includes various servers for different functionalities such as documentation, workers bindings, observability, radar, container, browser rendering, logpush, AI gateway, AutoRAG, audit logs, DNS analytics, digital experience monitoring, and Cloudflare One CASB. These servers enable tasks like reading configurations, processing information, making suggestions, and even making changes across Cloudflare's services.

Unity MCP (Server + Plugin) is a bridge between LLM and Unity, allowing developers to expose and explain Unity's tools to LLMs. It supports various features such as GameObject manipulation, Editor operations, Prefabs, Packages, Assets, Scenes, Materials, Shaders, Scripts, Scriptable Objects, and Debugging. The project is designed to be extensible, allowing developers to add custom tools and integrate AI-driven features into the development process. It also includes an AI Connector for integration with LLM clients like Claude and Cursor.

Sourcebot is an open-source alternative to Sourcegraph, designed for indexing and searching through multiple public and private repositories and branches across various code hosts such as GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, Gitea, or Gerrit. Key features include one-command deployment, multi-repo search, lightning-fast performance, a modern web app interface, and full file visualization.

Genkit is a framework for building AI-powered applications, providing open source libraries for Node.js and Go. It includes features such as a unified generation API, vector database support, enhanced prompt engineering, AI workflows, and built-in streaming. Genkit also offers development tools like a CLI and a local UI for testing, debugging, and iterating on AI applications. It supports various use cases, including intelligent agents, data transformation, and retrieval-augmented generation.

IDA Pro MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed for reverse engineering in IDA Pro. It provides functionalities such as checking connection, getting metadata, retrieving and renaming functions, decompiling and disassembling functions, searching strings, and more. The tool integrates with various MCP clients and supports headless operation. It also includes tips for enhancing LLM accuracy and detailed installation and development instructions.

21st.dev Magic AI Agent is a powerful AI-driven tool that helps developers create beautiful, modern UI components instantly through natural language descriptions. It integrates seamlessly with popular IDEs and provides a streamlined workflow for UI development. Key features include AI-Powered UI Generation, Multi-IDE Support, Modern Component Library, Real-time Preview, TypeScript Support, SVGL Integration, and more.

Lingo.dev is an open-source, i18n toolkit designed to help use LLMs for localization and translation of web, mobile apps, and markdown content. It includes Lingo.dev CLI for fast and accurate translations, Lingo.dev CI/CD for automatic updates, and Lingo.dev Compiler for making React apps multilingual at build time without changing existing components.

Notion MCP Server is a tool that allows you to query and interact with Notion Pages. It enables you to create, read, and update entries in Notion databases. The server integrates with Notion through an API token and can be used to add or modify data in Notion pages, such as creating a new database entry for a list of movies to watch in 2024.

Browserbase MCP Server provides cloud browser automation capabilities using Browserbase and Stagehand. It enables LLMs to interact with web pages, take screenshots, and execute JavaScript in a cloud browser environment. Key features include Browser Automation, Data Extraction, Console Monitoring, Screenshots, Web Interaction, Atomic Instructions, Model Flexibility, Modular Design, and Vision Support.

Markdownify MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that converts various file types and web content to Markdown format. It supports conversion of PDFs, images, audio files, DOCX, XLSX, PPTX, YouTube video transcripts, Bing search results, and general web pages into Markdown. It also allows retrieval of existing Markdown files.

Exa MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with AI assistants like Claude to perform web searches and content extraction. It includes tools for real-time web searches, research paper searches, company research, crawling, competitor finding, LinkedIn searches, Wikipedia searches, and GitHub searches. The setup allows AI models to get real-time web information in a safe and controlled way.

AbletonMCP is an integration that connects Ableton Live to Claude AI through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling prompt-assisted music production, track creation, and Live session manipulation. Key features include two-way communication, track manipulation, instrument and effect selection, clip creation, and session control.

Apple MCP tools is a collection of Apple-native tools for the MCP protocol. It provides features such as sending and reading messages, managing notes, contacts, emails, reminders, calendar events, web search, and map functionalities. The tool supports daisy-chaining commands to create workflows and can be integrated with various clients like Claude Desktop and Cursor.

DevDocs by CyberAGI is a tool designed to streamline the process of understanding and implementing technology documentation. It offers features such as intelligent crawling, performance and speed optimizations, content processing, and enterprise-level features. DevDocs is useful for enterprise software developers, web scrapers, development teams, and indie hackers. Key features include smart depth control, automatic link discovery, selective crawling, parallel processing, smart caching, clean extraction, and MCP server integration. The tool aims to turn weeks of documentation research into hours of productive development.

Solana Agent Kit is an open-source toolkit for connecting AI agents to Solana protocols, enabling over 60 Solana actions such as trading tokens, launching new tokens, lending assets, sending compressed airdrops, executing blinks, and more. It includes features like token operations, NFT management, DeFi integration, Solana blinks, market data integration, and AI integration with LangChain and Vercel AI SDK. The toolkit supports autonomous modes, streaming responses, and memory management for persistent interactions.

MCP Atlassian is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with Atlassian products, specifically Confluence and Jira. It allows AI agents to search content, get spaces, retrieve content, list pages in Confluence, and search issues, get issue details, list projects, and more in Jira. The project includes installation instructions, usage examples, and development guidelines.

Supabase MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides comprehensive tools for interacting with Supabase databases, storage, and edge functions. It enables seamless integration between Supabase services and MCP-compatible applications. Key features include database operations, storage management, edge function invocation, user authentication and management, and role-based access control.

Supabase MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides comprehensive tools for interacting with Supabase databases, storage, and edge functions. It enables seamless integration between Supabase services and MCP-compatible applications. Key features include database operations, storage management, edge function invocation, user authentication, and role-based access control.
A connector for the Perplexity API, enabling web search capabilities within the MCP ecosystem.

mcp-installer is an MCP server designed to install other MCP servers. It supports installation of MCP servers hosted in npm or PyPi. The tool requires `npx` and `uv` for node and Python servers, respectively. Users can configure it in their `claude_desktop_config.json` and use it to install various MCP servers with specific commands and arguments.

arXiv MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables interacting with the arXiv API using natural language. Main features include retrieving metadata about scholarly articles, downloading articles in PDF format, searching the arXiv database, and loading articles into a large language model (LLM) context. Tools provided include get_article_url, download_article, load_article_to_context, get_details, and search_arxiv.

mcp-server-chatsum is an MCP Server designed to summarize chat messages. It includes features such as querying and summarizing chat messages, setting up a chat database, and integrating with Claude Desktop. The server also provides tools for development, installation, and debugging.

DevDb is a VS Code extension that auto-loads your database and provides various features to aid development and debugging. Key features include MCP Server for providing database connections, quick table access, zero-config support, rich database client with intuitive UX, data export, comprehensive multi-database support, and integrated framework & tool support. It supports SQLite, MySQL, MariaDB, PostgreSQL, and Microsoft SQL Server.

MCP Toolbox for Databases is an open-source MCP server for databases that simplifies development, improves performance, and enhances security. It provides features such as simplified development, connection pooling, authentication, and end-to-end observability. The toolbox helps in integrating tools to agents with fewer lines of code, reusing tools between multiple agents or frameworks, and deploying new versions of tools more easily.

Obsidian Model Context Protocol is a connector that allows Claude Desktop (or any MCP client) to read and search any directory containing Markdown notes, such as an Obsidian vault. Main features include easy installation via Smithery, support for VS Code, and the ability to add the configuration to a `.vscode/mcp.json` file for sharing.

Obsidian Model Context Protocol is a connector that allows Claude Desktop (or any MCP client) to read and search any directory containing Markdown notes, such as an Obsidian vault. It can be installed via Smithery or manually in VS Code, and it provides the ability to integrate with Markdown note directories for enhanced search and access.

Serena is a powerful coding agent toolkit that can turn an LLM into a fully-featured agent working directly on your codebase. It provides essential semantic code retrieval and editing tools, integrates with various IDEs, and supports multiple programming languages. Key features include multi-IDE support, semantic code analysis, and the ability to work with different LLMs through MCP or Agno. Serena is free and open-source.

operative.sh web-eval-agent MCP Server is a tool that launches a browser-use powered agent to autonomously execute and debug web apps directly in your code editor. Key features include navigating web apps, capturing network traffic, collecting console errors, and autonomous debugging. It integrates with popular IDEs like Cursor, Cline, and Windsurf.

Atlan Agent Toolkit is a repository that contains tools and protocols for interacting with Atlan services for AI agents. The main component, Model Context Protocol (MCP), enables interaction with Atlan services through function calling, providing tools for asset search and retrieval using pyatlan.

Minima is an open-source RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) on-premises solution that can integrate with ChatGPT and MCP. It supports three modes: Isolated installation, Custom GPT, and Anthropic Claude. Key features include local document indexing, support for various file types, and integration with different LLMs and rerankers. The system ensures data security by running all neural networks locally.

Notion MCP Server is a tool that enables LLMs to interact with Notion workspaces. It supports various operations such as creating, retrieving, and updating pages and databases, appending and deleting blocks, and more. The server also includes experimental Markdown conversion to optimize token usage and improve readability. Key features include: Notion API integration, Markdown conversion, and a wide range of tools for managing Notion content.

Query MCP is an open-source MCP server that lets your IDE safely run SQL, manage schema changes, call the Supabase Management API, and use Auth Admin SDK — all with built-in safety controls. Key features include: Database query tools with three-tier safety system, SQL parsing and validation, automatic migration versioning, management API tools, auth admin tools, logs and analytics, and universal safety mode for consistent risk management.

Basic Memory is a tool that allows you to build persistent knowledge through natural conversations with Large Language Models (LLMs) like Claude, storing everything in simple Markdown files on your computer. It uses the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to enable any compatible LLM to read and write to your local knowledge base. Key features include local-first storage, bi-directional communication between users and LLMs, structured yet simple Markdown files, traversable knowledge graph, and integration with tools like Obsidian and VS Code.

Fetcher MCP is a server that uses the Playwright headless browser to fetch web page content. Key features include AI-Powered Content Fetching, Playwright Integration, Fast and Efficient performance, and Easy Setup and Configuration.

Claude ChatGPT MCP Tool is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) tool that allows Claude to interact with the ChatGPT desktop app on macOS. Main features include asking ChatGPT questions directly from Claude, viewing ChatGPT conversation history, and continuing existing ChatGPT conversations.

JetBrains MCP Proxy Server is a tool that proxies requests from clients to JetBrains IDEs, enabling seamless integration and remote access. Key features include installation via JetBrains plugin, configuration for specific IDE ports and hosts, troubleshooting for Node.js version requirements and MacOS nvm issues, and setup for external clients or Docker containers.

OpenAPI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Claude/Cursor that enables searching and exploring OpenAPI specifications. Main features include getting an overview of any OpenAPI specification, retrieving details about specific API operations, support for both JSON and YAML formats, and integration with Claude Desktop and Cursor. It is useful for code generation and understanding the structure and functionality of APIs.

Notte is an open-source framework for web browsing agents that provides a full-stack solution for developing, deploying, and scaling web AI agents. Key features include browser sessions with headless browser instances, automated LLM-powered agents, natural language commands for website interaction, and a secrets vault for credential management. The framework also includes a perception layer to abstract DOM noise, enabling smaller models to perform complex tasks, and offers cloud-hosted SDKs and API endpoints for session and agent management.

MCP Server Kubernetes is a tool that connects to a Kubernetes cluster and allows for management and interaction with the cluster. Features include connecting to a Kubernetes cluster, listing and managing pods, services, deployments, nodes, namespaces, ConfigMaps, and more. It also supports Helm v3 for installing and managing charts, as well as kubectl explain and kubectl api-resources support.

MCP Server for Qdrant is a Machine Control Protocol (MCP) server designed for storing and retrieving information from a Qdrant vector database. Key features include the ability to store text information with optional metadata, perform semantic search, integrate FastEmbed for text embeddings, support environment-based configuration, and provide Docker support. The server also offers tools for storing and finding information in the Qdrant database.

Mobile Next - MCP server for Mobile Development and Automation is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables scalable mobile automation and development through a platform-agnostic interface. It supports iOS, Android, simulators, emulators, and physical devices. Key features include native app automation, scripted flows, LLM-driven user journeys, and agent-to-agent communication. The tool uses accessibility trees and screenshot-based coordinates for interactions, and it can extract structured data from the screen.

browser-use MCP server is an AI-driven browser automation server implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for natural language browser control. Key features include MCP Integration, Browser Automation, Visual Understanding, State Persistence, and Multi-LLM Support with various LLM providers like OpenAI, Anthropic, Azure, DeepSeek, and more.

The Azure MCP Server is a tool that integrates AI agents with various Azure services, including Azure Storage, Cosmos DB, and more. It allows users to interact with these services using natural language commands and provides features such as listing resources, querying data, managing configurations, and executing advanced operations. The server supports multiple Azure services and can be installed and run in various environments, including VS Code, Docker, and through manual setup. It also includes robust authentication mechanisms and secure handling of credentials.

Deebo is an AI agent's debugging copilot that speeds up time-to-resolution by 10x. It introduces multi-threadedness to the development workflow, helping to debug real software errors by launching automated investigations. Key features include automated debugging sessions, session tracking, and optional guidance for the investigation. Deebo works with any OpenAI-compatible SDK, Anthropic, Gemini, and OpenRouter.

`workers-mcp` is a package that provides both the CLI tooling and in-Worker logic to connect Claude Desktop (or any MCP Client) to a Cloudflare Worker. It allows developers to customize and expose functions or APIs from their Cloudflare Workers to local coding agents, enabling seamless integration and development. Key features include generating new Workers, installing `workers-mcp`, setting up the environment, and iterating on code changes. The package also supports integration with other MCP clients like Cursor and Windsurf.

QGISMCP is an integration that connects QGIS to Claude AI through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling prompt-assisted project creation, layer loading, code execution, and more. Key features include two-way communication, project manipulation, layer manipulation, processing algorithm execution, and code execution in QGIS.

hyper-mcp is a fast, secure MCP server that extends its capabilities through WebAssembly plugins. It allows developers to add AI capabilities to applications and works with Claude Desktop, Cursor IDE, and other MCP-compatible apps. Features include writing plugins in any language that compiles to WebAssembly, distributing plugins via standard OCI registries, built on Extism for robust plugin support, lightweight for resource-constrained environments, and supports multiple protocols. It also includes security features such as sandboxed plugins, memory-safe execution, and secure plugin distribution.

MCP Unity Editor is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol for Unity, allowing AI assistants to interact with Unity projects. It provides a bridge between Unity and a Node.js server that implements the MCP protocol, enabling AI agents to execute operations within the Unity Editor. Key features include IDE integration, executing Unity menu items, selecting game objects, updating components, adding packages, running tests, sending console logs, and adding assets to the scene.

MySQL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation that enables secure interaction with MySQL databases. It facilitates communication between AI applications and MySQL databases, providing features such as listing available tables, reading table contents, executing SQL queries, secure database access through environment variables, and comprehensive logging.

iMCP is a macOS app that connects your digital life with AI, supporting capabilities like Calendar, Contacts, Location, Maps, Messages, Reminders, and Weather. It works with Claude Desktop and other MCP-compatible clients, allowing for personalized and contextual interactions using your personal data without manual sharing.

Shell and Coding agent for Claude and other MCP clients is a tool that empowers chat applications to code, build, and run on your local machine. It provides tightly integrated shell and code editing tools, supports large file edits, syntax checking, interactive command handling, and more. Key features include creating, executing, and iterating on code, running shell commands, and managing project contexts.

browser-use-mcp-server is an MCP server that enables AI agents to control web browsers using browser-use. Key features include browser automation, support for both SSE and stdio protocols, VNC streaming for real-time viewing, and asynchronous task execution. It also supports Docker for a consistent and isolated environment.

Kubectl MCP Tool is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Kubernetes that enables AI assistants to interact with Kubernetes clusters through natural language. It supports core Kubernetes operations, natural language processing, monitoring, security, diagnostics, and advanced features. The tool can be used in CLI mode or as an MCP server and integrates with multiple AI assistants like Claude, Cursor, and Windsurf.

UnityMCP is a Unity Editor plugin that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling seamless integration between Unity and AI assistants. It provides real-time editor state monitoring, remote command execution, and comprehensive logging capabilities. Main features include a debug window for connection status and monitoring, WebSocket client for real-time communication, C# code execution engine, comprehensive logging system, and editor state tracking and serialization.

DBHub is a universal database gateway that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) server interface, allowing MCP-compatible clients to connect to and explore different databases. It supports various databases including PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, SQL Server, SQLite, and Oracle. Key features include web scraping, search and content extraction, deep research, automatic retries, rate limiting, and cloud or self-hosted support. The tool also provides SSL connection options, read-only mode, and multiple transport modes (stdio, sse).

IDA MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for IDA interaction and automation, providing tools to read IDA database via Large Language Models. It includes installation instructions, configuration details, and debugging methods. The server is currently in early development and is subject to changes and improvements.

Docker MCP server is a tool for managing Docker containers using natural language. It allows users to compose, introspect, and debug containers, as well as manage persistent data with Docker volumes. The server is useful for server administrators, tinkerers, and AI enthusiasts. Key features include natural language container composition, container management tools, and support for Docker images, networks, and volumes.

MiniMax Model Context Protocol (MCP) server enables interaction with powerful Text to Speech and video/image generation APIs. It supports MCP clients like Claude Desktop, Cursor, Windsurf, and OpenAI Agents to generate speech, clone voices, generate video, and images. Features include support for different transport types (stdio and sse), and a variety of tools such as text_to_audio, list_voices, voice_clone, generate_video, text_to_image, and query_video_generation.

Deepwiki MCP Server is a tool that crawls Deepwiki URLs, converts them to Markdown, and returns either one document or a list by page. Main features include Domain Safety, HTML Sanitization, Link Rewriting, Multiple Output Formats, and Performance with adjustable concurrency and depth. It also supports NLP for searching library names.

Godot MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Godot game engine. It enables AI assistants to launch the Godot editor, run projects, capture debug output, and control project execution. Key features include launching the Godot editor, running Godot projects, capturing debug output, controlling execution, getting Godot version, listing Godot projects, project analysis, scene management, and UID management for Godot 4.4+.

MCP LLMS-TXT Documentation Server is a tool for developers to have full control over the tools used by applications like Cursor, Windsurf, and Claude Code/Desktop. It provides a way to retrieve and audit context from `llms.txt` files, which contain background information, guidance, and links to detailed markdown files. The server supports multiple IDEs and apps, and it allows users to specify and manage documentation sources, including remote and local `llms.txt` files. Key features include domain access control, tool call auditing, and integration with various development environments.

Tavily MCP Server provides real-time web search capabilities and intelligent data extraction from web pages. It integrates with various MCP clients like VS Code, Cline, Cursor, and Claude Desktop, allowing seamless interaction with tavily-search and tavily-extract tools. Key features include real-time web search, data extraction, and integration with multiple IDEs and platforms.

fetch-mcp is an MCP server designed for fetching URLs and YouTube video transcripts. It supports different server types including stdio, SSE, and HTTP. The main tools provided are fetch_url, which can return HTML or Markdown, and fetch_youtube_transcript, which fetches YouTube transcripts.

MCP Server for MySQL based on NodeJS is a Model Context Protocol server that provides access to MySQL databases, enabling LLMs to inspect database schemas and execute SQL queries. Key features include support for multiple IDEs, comprehensive database information, security features like SQL injection prevention, performance optimizations, and advanced configuration options. It also supports multi-DB mode and schema-specific permissions.

Android MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides programmatic control over Android devices through ADB (Android Debug Bridge). It exposes various device management capabilities such as ADB command execution, device screenshot capture, UI layout analysis, and package management. The server supports flexible device configuration and can be used with MCP clients like Claude desktop and code editors.

mcp-gsuite MCP server is designed to interact with Google products, primarily Gmail and Calendar. It supports multiple Google accounts, email management (search, retrieval, creation, deletion), and calendar event management (creation, deletion, and time slot suggestions). The server requires OAuth2 authorization for accessing Google APIs and provides a flexible configuration for managing different environments or multiple sets of credentials and accounts.

Email sending MCP is a server that sends emails using Resend's API, allowing users to compose and send emails directly from Cursor or Claude Desktop. Key features include the ability to send plain text and HTML emails, schedule emails for future delivery, add CC and BCC recipients, configure reply-to addresses, and customize the sender email (requires verification).

YouTube MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that allows you to download subtitles from YouTube and connect them to a LLM. Main features include downloading transcripts from YouTube videos, support for both video IDs and full YouTube URLs, and inclusion of timestamps in the transcript.

PAELLADOC is an AI-First Development framework that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to facilitate more sophisticated capabilities for Large Language Models (LLMs). It focuses on context as the primary creation, intent-driven architecture, and human-AI collaboration. Key features include context versioning, knowledge graphs, natural language conversations, and seamless LLM integration. The framework provides commands for project initialization, documentation, and code generation, and is designed to be used in a dedicated Python virtual environment.

CentralMind Gateway is a tool that exposes your database to AI agents via MCP or OpenAPI 3.1 protocols. It automatically generates secure, LLM-optimized APIs for structured data, supports multiple databases, and provides features like PII protection, flexible configuration, and deployment options. Key features include automatic API generation, support for multiple protocols, PII protection, and integration with various AI providers.

iOS Simulator MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with iOS simulators. It allows you to get information about the simulators, control UI interactions, and inspect UI elements. Key features include getting the ID of the currently booted iOS simulator, interacting with the simulator UI (tapping, inputting text, swiping, taking screenshots), and filtering specific tools using environment variables. This tool is particularly useful for Quality Assurance tasks, such as verifying UI elements, confirming text input, checking tap responses, validating swipe actions, and more.

iterm-mcp is a Model Context Protocol server that provides access to your iTerm session. It allows the model to inspect and interact with the terminal, including running commands, reading output, and sending control characters. Key features include efficient token use, natural integration, full terminal control, and minimal dependencies. It is designed to be easy to integrate with Claude Desktop and other MCP clients.

Claude Debugs For You is an MCP Server and VS Code extension that enables Claude (or any other LLM) to interactively debug and evaluate expressions. It supports both stdio and SSE, and is language-agnostic. Key features include interactive debugging, support for multiple clients, and integration with VS Code.
Obsidian MCP (Model Context Protocol) 服务器实现了一个 Model Context Protocol (MCP) 服务器，用于连接 AI 模型与 Obsidian 知识库。主要功能包括与 Obsidian 知识库的无缝集成、支持笔记和文件夹的读取、创建、更新和删除、全文搜索功能等。

AI Development Assistant MCP Server is an AI-powered development toolkit designed as a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Cursor. It provides intelligent coding assistance through custom AI tools, including Code Architect for generating plans and instructions, Screenshot Buddy for UI design analysis, and Code Review for reviewing code changes. The project includes setup instructions, environment configuration, and tool usage examples.
微信读书 MCP 服务器是一个桥接微信读书数据和Claude Desktop的轻量级服务器，使用户可以在Claude中无缝访问微信读书的笔记和阅读数据。主要功能包括获取用户的书架信息、带笔记的书籍列表、特定书籍的所有笔记内容、书籍详细信息、搜索笔记中的关键词以及获取最近阅读的书籍和相关数据。该工具通过MCP协议与AI客户端集成，支持基于读书笔记的深度对话与知识提取，提升阅读效率与质量。

spotify-mcp MCP server is a project to connect Claude with Spotify, built on top of spotipy-dev's API. Main features include controlling playback (start, pause, skip), searching for tracks/albums/artists/playlists, getting info about a track/album/artist/playlist, and managing the Spotify queue.

Crawl4AI RAG MCP Server is a powerful implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) integrated with Crawl4AI and Supabase. It provides AI agents and AI coding assistants with advanced web crawling and RAG capabilities. Features include smart URL detection, recursive crawling, parallel processing, content chunking, vector search, and source retrieval. The server also supports multiple embedding models and can be run locally or in a Docker container.

Neo4j MCP Clients & Servers is a tool that allows for the management and interaction with Neo4j databases using natural language. It includes features such as translating natural language to Cypher queries, storing and retrieving entities and relationships in a knowledge graph, and managing Neo4j Aura cloud service instances. The primary use cases involve database schema retrieval, executing read and write Cypher queries, and managing cloud instances.

Linear MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Linear, allowing AI assistants to fetch data from Linear through the MCP standard. Key features include getting a user's todo tickets by user ID or email address, and it can be used with any MCP client. The server also provides instructions for installation, development, and production use, as well as an example of how to use it with Claude Code.

MoLing MCP Server is a tool for system interaction through operating system APIs, enabling file system operations such as reading, writing, merging, statistics, and aggregation, as well as the ability to execute system commands. It also supports browser control powered by `github.com/chromedp/chromedp` and is compatible with multiple operating systems. Features include File System Operations, Command-line Terminal, and Browser Control.

Memory Bank MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for remote memory bank management. It provides remote access to memory bank files, supports multi-project memory bank management, maintains consistent file structure and validation, and ensures proper isolation between project memory banks. Key features include multi-project support, remote accessibility, and core operations like read/write/update memory bank files, list available projects, and list files within projects.

Jupyter MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides interaction with Jupyter notebooks running in any JupyterLab. It supports real-time collaboration and offers tools to add and execute code cells and markdown cells in Jupyter notebooks. The server can be used with Claude Desktop and can be installed via Smithery.

Semantic Workbench is a versatile tool designed to help prototype intelligent assistants quickly. It supports the creation of new assistants or the integration of existing ones, all within a cohesive interface. The workbench provides a user-friendly UI for creating conversations with one or more assistants, configuring settings, and exposing various behaviors. Key features include a backend service, a frontend web user interface, and the ability to integrate with assistant services via a RESTful API.

Semantic Workbench is a versatile tool designed to help prototype intelligent assistants quickly. It supports the creation of new assistants or the integration of existing ones within a cohesive interface. The workbench provides a user-friendly UI for creating conversations, configuring settings, and exposing various behaviors. It includes a backend service, a frontend web user interface, and assistant services that can be developed using any framework and programming language. The workbench facilitates experimentation, development, testing, and measurement of agent behaviors and workflows.

Semantic Workbench is a versatile tool designed to help prototype intelligent assistants quickly. It supports the creation of new assistants or the integration of existing ones, all within a cohesive interface. The workbench provides a user-friendly UI for creating conversations with one or more assistants, configuring settings, and exposing various behaviors. Key components include the Workbench Service (Python), Workbench App (React/Typescript), and Assistant Services (Python, C#, etc.). It facilitates experimentation, development, testing, and measurement of agent behaviors and workflows, and integrates with assistants via a RESTful API.

Semantic Workbench is a versatile tool designed to help prototype intelligent assistants quickly. It supports the creation of new assistants or the integration of existing ones, all within a cohesive interface. The workbench provides a user-friendly UI for creating conversations with one or more assistants, configuring settings, and exposing various behaviors. Key components include a backend service, a frontend web user interface, and assistant services that can be developed using any framework and programming language.

Semantic Workbench is a versatile tool designed to help prototype intelligent assistants quickly. It supports the creation of new assistants or the integration of existing ones, all within a cohesive interface. The workbench provides a user-friendly UI for creating conversations with one or more assistants, configuring settings, and exposing various behaviors. Key features include a backend service, a frontend web user interface, and support for multiple assistant services via a RESTful API. It also includes examples and guides for developing new assistants.

MCP K8S Go is a Golang-based MCP server that connects to Kubernetes, providing features such as listing Kubernetes contexts, namespaces, resources, nodes, pods, and more. It also allows getting Kubernetes events, pod logs, and running commands in Kubernetes pods. The tool supports multiple installation methods including Smithery, mcp-get, prebuilt binaries from npm, GitHub releases, building from source, and using Docker.

Gmail MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides Gmail integration capabilities to MCP clients like Claude Desktop. Main features include viewing recent emails, searching emails using Gmail's search syntax, and secure OAuth2 authentication with the Gmail API. It also supports resource access to recent emails, tool support for email search, and automatic token refresh.

docker-mcp is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Docker operations, enabling seamless container and compose stack management through Claude AI. Main features include container creation and instantiation, Docker Compose stack deployment, container logs retrieval, and container listing and status monitoring. It also provides tools for creating containers, deploying Docker Compose stacks, retrieving logs, and listing containers.

MCP Memory Service provides semantic memory and persistent storage capabilities for Claude Desktop using ChromaDB and sentence transformers. Key features include semantic search, natural language time-based recall, tag-based memory retrieval, persistent storage, automatic database backups, memory optimization tools, exact match retrieval, debug mode, database health monitoring, duplicate detection and cleanup, customizable embedding model, cross-platform compatibility, and hardware-aware optimizations.

tfmcp is a command-line tool that helps you interact with Terraform via the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It allows LLMs to manage and operate your Terraform environments, including reading configuration files, analyzing plan outputs, applying configurations, managing state, and creating or modifying configurations. Key features include deep Terraform integration, MCP server capabilities, high-speed processing, automatic setup, Docker support, and seamless integration with Claude Desktop.

MCP Language Server is a tool that runs and exposes a language server to LLMs, helping MCP-enabled clients navigate codebases more easily by providing semantic tools like get definition, references, rename, and diagnostics. It supports multiple programming languages including Go, Rust, Python, and TypeScript, and integrates with various language servers such as gopls, rust-analyzer, pyright, and typescript-language-server.

AWS MCP (Model Context Protocol) is a server that allows AI assistants like Claude to interact with the AWS environment using natural language. Key features include querying and editing AWS resources, support for multiple AWS profiles and SSO authentication, multi-region support, secure credential management, and local execution with your AWS credentials. It simplifies AWS resource management and can be seen as a powerful alternative to Amazon Q.

mcp-hfspace MCP Server connects to Hugging Face Spaces with minimal setup, providing capabilities for Image Generation, Vision Models, Text-to-Speech, Speech-to-Text, and more. It supports file handling, private spaces, and can be used with Claude Desktop. Features include Gradio MCP Support, file upload/download, and the ability to specify working directories and API endpoints.

MCP Web Research Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for web research. It integrates with Claude Desktop to provide real-time information and research capabilities. Key features include Google search integration, webpage content extraction, research session tracking, and screenshot capture. The server also provides tools for performing searches, visiting webpages, and taking screenshots, as well as a guided research prompt for thorough web research.

The Graphlit MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with the Graphlit platform to enable ingestion, search, and retrieval of data from various sources such as Slack, Discord, websites, Google Drive, email, Jira, Linear, and GitHub. Key features include web crawling, web search, content extraction, and integration with multiple IDEs and platforms. It supports data connectors for popular services like Microsoft Outlook, Google Mail, Notion, Reddit, and more.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools like get_income_statements, get_balance_sheets, get_cash_flow_statements, get_current_stock_price, get_historical_stock_prices, get_company_news, get_available_crypto_tickers, get_crypto_prices, and get_historical_crypto_prices.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial data and crypto prices, and can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude.

n8n MCP Server provides access to n8n workflows, executions, credentials, and more through the Model Context Protocol. This allows Large Language Models (LLMs) to interact with n8n instances in a secure and standardized way. Key features include listing and managing workflows, viewing workflow details, executing workflows, managing credentials, handling tags and executions, generating security audits, and managing workflow tags. It also supports enterprise features like project management, variable management, and advanced user management.

ClickHouse MCP Server is an MCP server for ClickHouse, providing tools to execute SQL queries, list databases, and list tables. It includes features such as `run_select_query` for executing SQL queries, `list_databases` for listing all databases, and `list_tables` for listing all tables in a specified database. The server also provides configuration and development setup instructions.

Filesystem MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides file system operations, analysis, and manipulation capabilities. It includes features such as directory and file operations, text analysis, file hashing, and ZIP compression and extraction. The server is built on the MCP SDK and organized into distinct layers for handling MCP protocol communication, tool registration, and core functionality.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving both company and cryptocurrency data, and can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude for financial data retrieval.

MCP-Mem0 is a template implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) server integrated with Mem0, providing AI agents with persistent memory capabilities. Key features include storing and retrieving memories, semantic search, and seamless integration with MCP-compatible clients. The project includes detailed instructions for installation, configuration, and running the server using Python or Docker.

EVM MCP Server is a comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides blockchain services across multiple EVM-compatible networks. It enables AI agents to interact with Ethereum, Optimism, Arbitrum, Base, Polygon, and many other EVM chains with a unified interface. Key features include multi-chain support, token services (ERC20, ERC721, ERC1155), smart contract interactions, and comprehensive transaction support. The server also supports ENS name resolution for human-readable Ethereum addresses.

DeepSeek MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates DeepSeek's powerful language models with MCP-compatible applications like Claude Desktop. It provides features such as natural language request handling, automatic model fallback, resource discovery for available models and configurations, and enhanced conversation features including multi-turn conversation support. The server is useful for training and fine-tuning dialogue models and managing complex interactions.

MCP Node.js Debugger is a tool that provides Cursor or Claude Code access to Node.js at runtime for debugging purposes. It includes features such as adding the debugger to Cursor or Claude Code, running a Node.js server in debug mode, and using the debugger to set breakpoints and inspect runtime state. The tool helps in diagnosing and fixing runtime errors in Node.js applications.

Neon MCP Server is an open-source tool that allows interaction with Neon Postgres databases using natural language. Key features include natural language interaction, simplified database management, accessibility for non-developers, and support for database migrations. It provides tools for project and branch management, SQL query execution, and query performance tuning.

Google Calendar MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides integration with Google Calendar, allowing LLMs to read, create, and manage calendar events through a standardized interface. Key features include listing available calendars, listing and managing events, processing events from screenshots and images, and supporting OAuth 2.0 for secure authentication.

Base MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides onchain tools for AI applications, allowing them to interact with the Base Network and Coinbase API. Main features include retrieving wallet addresses, listing wallet balances, transferring funds, deploying smart contracts, interacting with Morpho vaults, calling contract functions, onramping funds via Coinbase, managing ERC20 tokens, listing and transferring NFTs, and buying OpenRouter credits with USDC.

Xcode MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for building and testing Xcode projects directly from LLM applications. It allows AI assistants to trigger builds, run tests, monitor progress, and access logs through a standardized interface. Key features include building Xcode projects with custom schemes and configurations, running unit tests with granular control, generating code coverage reports, streaming build and test logs in real-time, and providing detailed build and test reports.
dify-server MCP 服务器是一个基于 TypeScript 的 Model Context Protocol 服务器，通过集成 Dify AI API 提供 Ant Design 业务组件的代码生成能力。主要功能包括聊天完成功能、支持文本和图片输入、流式响应处理等。

Software Planning Tool is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to facilitate software development planning through an interactive, structured approach. It helps break down complex software projects into manageable tasks, track implementation progress, and maintain detailed development plans. Key features include Interactive Planning Sessions, Todo Management, Complexity Scoring, Code Examples, and Implementation Plans.

MCP Git Ingest is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that helps read GitHub repository structures and important files. It provides tools for generating a tree-like directory structure and reading specified files in a repository. Key features include deterministic temporary directory creation, Unicode tree representation, flexible file reading with error handling, and performance optimizations.

An open-source automated video creation tool for generating short-form video content. It combines text-to-speech, automatic captions, background videos, and music to create engaging short videos from simple text inputs. The project serves as both a REST API and an MCP server, providing flexibility for video generation. Key features include text-to-speech conversion, automatic caption generation, background video search via Pexels, and background music with genre/mood selection.

LLM Context is a tool that helps developers quickly inject relevant content from code/text projects into Large Language Model chat interfaces. It leverages .gitignore patterns for smart file selection and provides both a streamlined clipboard workflow using the command line and direct LLM integration through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Key features include Direct LLM Integration, Chat Interface Support, Smart file selection, Multiple rule-based profiles, and Code Navigation Features like Smart Code Outlines and Definition Implementation Extraction.

X (Twitter) MCP Server allows clients to interact with X (formerly Twitter), enabling comprehensive platform operations including posting tweets, searching content, managing accounts, and organizing lists. Features include post operations, account management, and list management. The server can be used with a MCP client like Claude and requires Node.js 18.x or higher, an X Developer account with API keys, and API v1 and v2 access.

MCP MongoDB Server is a Model Context Protocol server that enables LLMs to interact with MongoDB databases. It provides capabilities for inspecting collection schemas and executing MongoDB operations through a standardized interface. Key features include Smart ObjectId Handling, Flexible Configuration, Read-Only Mode, MongoDB Operations (read and write), and LLM Integration.

Armor Crypto MCP is a tool for integrating AI Agents with the Crypto ecosystem, offering features such as Wallet Management, Swaps, Specialized trades (DCA, Stop Loss, etc.), Multi-chain and Cross-chain transactions, Staking, and more. It supports Solana in Alpha and will support more than a dozen blockchains in beta, including Ethereum, Base, Avalanche, Bitcoin, Sui, Berachain, megaETH, Optimism, Ton, BNB, and Arbitrum. The platform also provides Fast integration to Agentic frameworks, Social Sentiment, and Prediction tools.

mcp-pandoc is a Model Context Protocol server for document format conversion using pandoc. It provides tools to transform content between different document formats while preserving formatting and structure. Supported formats include markdown, html, pdf, docx, rst, latex, epub, and txt. The server is in early development, with PDF support under development. Key features include the `convert-contents` tool for transforming content, and it requires TeX Live installation for PDF conversion.

Postgres MCP Pro is an open-source Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to support the entire development process for PostgreSQL databases. Key features include Database Health checks, Index Tuning, Query Plans, Schema Intelligence, and Safe SQL Execution. It supports both Standard Input/Output (stdio) and Server-Sent Events (SSE) transports, and provides tools for comprehensive database management and performance optimization.

MCP Apple Notes is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for semantic search and retrieval over Apple Notes. It offers features such as semantic search using on-device embeddings model, full-text search capabilities, vector storage with LanceDB, and native Apple Notes integration. The server can be used to list, index, retrieve, search, and create notes within the Apple Notes application.

Just Prompt is a Model Control Protocol (MCP) server that provides a unified interface to various Large Language Model (LLM) providers, including OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, Groq, DeepSeek, and Ollama. It supports sending prompts to multiple LLM models, running models in parallel, and saving responses to files. The tool also includes features for listing available providers and models, and it supports environment variables for API keys.

MCP Alchemy is a tool that connects Claude Desktop to various databases, allowing users to explore and understand database structures, write and validate SQL queries, display table relationships, and analyze large datasets. It supports multiple database types including PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite, Oracle, MS SQL Server, and CrateDB. Key features include all_table_names, filter_table_names, schema_definitions, and execute_query, which provide detailed information and execution capabilities for database operations.

Apify Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server is a tool that allows AI assistants to use Apify Actors for web scraping, data extraction, and other tasks. Key features include integration with various MCP clients, support for multiple Apify Actors, and the ability to perform tasks such as web scraping, Google Maps data extraction, and Instagram profile analysis.

MCP Teams Server is an implementation for Microsoft Teams integration, providing capabilities to read messages, create messages, reply to messages, and mention members. Key features include starting threads in channels, updating existing threads with message replies, reading thread replies, listing channel team members, and reading channel messages. It also includes setup instructions, environment variables, and Docker image support.

Excel MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that reads and writes MS Excel data. It supports various features such as reading/writing text values, formulas, creating new sheets, live editing, and capturing screen images from sheets on Windows. The server also provides tools for describing sheets, reading and writing to sheets, taking screenshots, creating tables, and copying sheets.

Knowledge Graph Memory Server is an implementation of persistent memory using a local knowledge graph. It allows for the creation, management, and querying of entities and their relationships. Key features include entity and relation creation, observation management, and various API tools for interacting with the knowledge graph, such as create_entities, create_relations, add_observations, delete_entities, delete_observations, delete_relations, read_graph, search_nodes, and open_nodes. The server supports custom memory paths and can be integrated with Cursor, Cline, or Claude Desktop.

Todoist MCP Server is an implementation that integrates Claude with Todoist, enabling natural language task management. Key features include Natural Language Task Management, Smart Task Search, Flexible Filtering, Rich Task Details, and Intuitive Error Handling. It supports creating, updating, completing, and deleting tasks using everyday language, as well as filtering tasks by various attributes.

MemoryMesh is a knowledge graph server designed for AI models, with a focus on text-based RPGs and interactive storytelling. It helps AI maintain consistent, structured memory across conversations, enabling richer and more dynamic interactions. Key features include dynamic schema-based tools, intuitive schema design, metadata for AI guidance, relationship handling, informative feedback, and event support.

MCP Reasoner is a reasoning implementation for Claude Desktop that supports both Beam Search and Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) strategies. It includes experimental reasoning algorithms with features such as policy simulation, adaptive exploration, and outcome-based reasoning. The tool tracks and analyzes different reasoning paths, maps out problem-solving processes, and follows the MCP protocol. It aims to enhance Claude's complex problem-solving capabilities.

YouTube Transcript Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables retrieval of transcripts from YouTube videos. It supports multiple video URL formats, language-specific transcript retrieval, and provides detailed metadata in responses. Key features include robust error handling, support for various input parameters, and seamless integration with Claude Desktop.

dbt MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools to interact with dbt. It includes features such as configuration for Discovery and Semantic Layer, remote tools, and dbt CLI. The server can be used with various clients like Claude Desktop, Cursor, and VS Code. Main functionalities include web scraping, crawling, and discovery, search and content extraction, deep research and batch scraping, automatic retries and rate limiting, and cloud and self-hosted support.

foreverVM is a tool that provides an API for running arbitrary, stateful Python code securely. It allows users to interact with stateful Python processes (machines) by executing instructions and receiving results. Key features include the ability to create, list, and manage machines, support for tags and memory limits, and a CLI for easy interaction.

n8n Workflow Builder MCP Server is a tool for programmatically creating and managing n8n workflows. It allows users to create workflows with nodes and connections, validate workflow specifications, export complete workflow configurations, and provides a REST API interface through MCP.

langchain-mcp is a tool that provides Model Context Protocol (MCP) support in LangChain. It allows developers to create a `langchain_mcp.MCPToolkit` with an `mcp.ClientSession`, initialize it, and get a list of tools. The demo shows how to use it with Groq's `llama-3.1-8b-instant` model for tasks like reading and summarizing files.

Perplexity MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the Perplexity API, enabling AI assistants like Claude and Cursor to access Perplexity's powerful search and reasoning capabilities. Key features include web search with up-to-date information, complex reasoning tasks, seamless integration with AI assistants, simple installation, and customizable model selection.

Aider MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that offloads AI coding tasks to Aider, an open-source AI coding assistant. It enhances development efficiency and flexibility by allowing developers to delegate coding tasks, list available models, and integrate with various AI models. Key features include offloading AI coding tasks, listing available models, and support for multiple AI models like Gemini, GPT-4, and others.

Elasticsearch MCP server enables LLMs to manage indices and execute queries. Main features include executing search queries, creating new indices, listing all available indices, and indexing documents. It also provides mapping information for each index and can be used with Claude Desktop.

Razorpay MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides seamless integration with Razorpay APIs, enabling advanced payment processing capabilities. It offers a wide range of tools for payment, order, refund, QR code, and settlement management, as well as workflow automation and AI-powered applications.

@pinkpixel/mem0-mcp MCP Server provides persistent memory capabilities for LLMs, allowing AI agents to store and retrieve information across sessions. Key features include adding, searching, and deleting memories, with support for both cloud and local storage modes. The server integrates with Mem0.ai and OpenAI, offering advanced parameters for memory management and powerful filtering capabilities.

MCP Server Playwright is a Model Context Protocol server that provides full browser automation capabilities using Playwright. It enables LLMs to interact with web pages, take screenshots, and execute JavaScript in a real browser environment. Main features include full browser automation, screenshot capture, comprehensive web interaction, console log monitoring, and JavaScript execution.

Notion MCP Integration is a simple Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Notion's API to manage a personal todo list through Claude. The main features include adding new todo items, viewing all todos, viewing today's tasks, and checking off tasks as complete. It is designed for a specific use case with a minimalist todo list setup in Notion.

RAG Documentation MCP Server is a tool for retrieving and processing documentation through vector search, enabling AI assistants to augment their responses with relevant documentation context. Key features include vector-based documentation search and retrieval, support for multiple documentation sources, semantic search capabilities, automated documentation processing, and real-time context augmentation for LLMs. It also provides tools for listing, extracting, and managing documentation sources and URLs.

applescript-mcp MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that enables LLM applications to interact with macOS through AppleScript. It provides a standardized interface for AI applications to control system functions, manage files, handle notifications, and more.
