Key features include Calendar management, Clipboard operations, Finder integration, System notifications, System controls, iTerm terminal integration, Mail, Shortcuts automation, Messages, Notes, and Pages. The server is built using TypeScript and follows a modular architecture, making it easy to add new functionality.

Windows CLI MCP Server is a tool for secure command-line interactions on Windows systems, enabling controlled access to PowerShell, CMD, Git Bash shells, and remote systems via SSH. It provides multi-shell support, SSH support, resource exposure, and extensive security controls including command and SSH command blocking, working directory validation, and configurable settings. The server integrates with MCP clients like Claude Desktop and is highly customizable through a JSON configuration file.

MCP Tool Server for Logo Generation is a server that provides logo generation capabilities using FAL AI, with tools for image generation, background removal, and automatic scaling. Key features include generating logos in three sizes, maintaining transparency, and the ability to generate any image. It also includes setup instructions for running the server and integrating it with Cursor IDE.

Uber Eats MCP Server is a proof of concept (POC) for building an MCP server on top of Uber Eats. It integrates with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to enable seamless interaction between LLM applications and external tools. The setup requires Python 3.12 or higher and an Anthropic API key or other supported LLM provider. The project includes instructions for setting up a virtual environment, installing required packages, and updating the .env file with your API key. Additionally, it provides a command for running the MCP inspector tool for debugging.

The Multi Database MCP Server is a powerful tool that provides a standardized way for AI models to interact with multiple databases simultaneously. It supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, and TimescaleDB, and offers features like simultaneous multi-database support, database-specific tool generation, clean architecture, OpenAI Agents SDK compatibility, dynamic database tools, and a unified interface. The server can be deployed in various ways, including Docker, STDIO mode, and SSE mode, and it includes tools for querying, managing transactions, exploring schemas, and analyzing performance.

content_name: a share mcp is just i need
description: a-share-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server focused on the A-share market, providing a wide range of query functions including stock basic information, historical K-line data, financial indicators, and macroeconomic data. It can answer any questions related to the A-share market, whether for the overall market or specific stocks. The project includes tools for stock market data, financial reports, market overviews, indices, and macroeconomic data.

Code Sandbox MCP is a secure sandbox environment for executing code within Docker containers. It provides AI applications with a safe and isolated environment for running code while maintaining security through containerization. Main features include Flexible Container Management, Custom Environment Support, File Operations, Command Execution, Real-time Logging, Auto-Updates, and Multi-Platform support.

MCP Server for iOS Simulator is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables Large Language Models (LLMs) to interact with iOS simulators through natural language commands. It provides comprehensive control over simulator sessions, application management, UI interactions, and debugging. Key features include creating and managing simulator sessions, installing and managing iOS applications, interacting with the simulator UI, capturing screenshots and logs, and advanced features like location simulation and media injection.

DaVinci Resolve MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI assistants like Claude to interact with and control DaVinci Resolve. Key features include two-way communication, project management, timeline manipulation, media management, Fusion integration, scene inspection, and code execution. The server enables users to perform a wide range of tasks such as creating and managing projects, timelines, and media, as well as executing Python and Lua scripts.

Open Strategy Partners (OSP) Marketing Tools for LLMs is a comprehensive suite of tools for technical marketing content creation, optimization, and product positioning. Key features include OSP Product Value Map Generator, OSP Meta Information Generator, OSP Content Editing Codes, OSP Technical Writing Guide, and OSP On-Page SEO Guide. These tools help in generating structured product value maps, optimizing metadata for web content, providing semantic editing codes for content review, and offering systematic approaches to creating high-quality technical content and on-page SEO.

This MCP (Model Content Protocol) service provides A-share stock data with different levels of detail, including basic information, market data, and financial data. It can be used with MCP clients like CherryStudio and DeepChat, which offer user-friendly interfaces for connecting to the service and accessing the stock data.

Everything Search MCP Server is a tool that provides fast file searching capabilities across Windows, macOS, and Linux. It uses the Everything SDK on Windows, `mdfind` on macOS, and `locate`/`plocate` on Linux. Key features include search for files and folders, platform-specific search syntax, and various parameters for customizing the search such as `max_results`, `match_path`, `match_case`, `match_whole_word`, `match_regex`, and `sort_by`. The server can be installed via Smithery, uv, or pip, and it includes detailed configuration and debugging instructions.

Figma MCP Python is a tool that allows AI coding agents to access Figma files and prototypes directly. It provides integration with IDEs like Cursor and Windsurf, and includes quick installation instructions and setup for the environment.

Tripo MCP Server provides an interface between AI assistants and Tripo AI for generating 3D assets from natural language and importing them into Blender. Key features include 3D asset generation, compatibility with Claude and other MCP-enabled AI assistants, and integration with the Tripo AI Blender Addon.

BloodHound MCP (Model Context Protocol) is an extension of the BloodHound tool that enables Large Language Models (LLMs) to interact with and analyze Active Directory (AD) and Azure Active Directory (AAD) environments through natural language queries. Key features include Natural Language Queries, LLM-Powered Analysis, Seamless Integration with existing BloodHound data in Neo4j, and Customizable configuration for specific environments.

Perplexity MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the Perplexity API, enabling AI assistants like Claude and Cursor to access Perplexity's powerful search and reasoning capabilities. Key features include searching the web for up-to-date information, performing complex reasoning tasks, seamless integration with AI assistants, and simple installation options.

DuckDuckGo MCP Server is a Node.js server implementing Model Context Protocol (MCP) for DuckDuckGo web search. The main feature is the ability to perform web searches using DuckDuckGo, with an API that allows inputting a query and returning an array of results.

Serveur MCP Airbnb is a tool for searching and retrieving details of Airbnb listings. It provides direct links to Airbnb listings in search results. Main features include Airbnb search, detailed listing information, respect for robots.txt rules, structured JSON data, and no API key required.

MCP Claude Code is an implementation of Claude Code capabilities using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides features such as code understanding, code modification, enhanced command execution, file operations, code discovery, agent delegation, and support for multiple LLM providers. The project includes tools for reading, writing, editing files, searching and replacing content, running commands and scripts, and handling Jupyter notebooks. It also ensures security with permission prompts, restricted access, and input validation.

This package provides two Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers for accessing ACI.dev managed functions. The `aci-mcp-apps` server provides direct access to functions from specified apps, while the `aci-mcp-unified` server provides meta functions to discover and execute all available functions on ACI.dev. Features include local running, integration with MCP clients, Docker support, and debugging tools.

fetch-mcp is an MCP server designed for fetching URLs and YouTube video transcripts. It supports various modes of operation including stdio, SSE, and HTTP servers. The main tools provided are fetch_url, which can return HTML or Markdown, and fetch_youtube_transcript, which fetches YouTube transcripts.

MongoDB Lens is a local Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides full-featured access to MongoDB databases using natural language via LLMs. It supports various operations such as querying, aggregations, performance optimization, and more. Key features include natural language queries, multi-IDE support, data protection mechanisms, and extensive configuration options.

Sequential Thinking Multi-Agent System (MAS) is a sophisticated tool designed for complex problem-solving. It uses a Multi-Agent System (MAS) architecture with specialized agents (Planner, Researcher, Analyzer, Critic, Synthesizer) to process, analyze, and synthesize thoughts. Key features include distributed agent logic, active analysis and synthesis, integration with external tools like Exa, Pydantic validation, and detailed logging. The system prioritizes depth and quality of analysis over token efficiency.

airtable-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides read and write access to Airtable databases. It enables LLMs to inspect database schemas, read and write records, and perform various operations such as listing, searching, creating, updating, and deleting records and tables. Key features include list_records, search_records, list_bases, list_tables, describe_table, get_record, create_record, update_records, delete_records, create_table, update_table, create_field, and update_field.

Code Runner MCP Server is a tool for running code snippets in multiple programming languages and showing the results. It supports a wide range of languages including JavaScript, PHP, Python, and more. The server can be installed and configured in various environments such as VS Code, Claude Desktop, and Docker. It also provides workarounds for potential issues on Windows and supports Streamable HTTP Transport.

This content describes a tool for LLMs to request and run commands, such as `run_command`, which can execute various system commands and return their output. It is designed for use with Claude Sonnet 3.5 and Groq Desktop with MCP, and includes features like handling `stdin` for passing code or creating files. The content also provides instructions for installation, development, and debugging, making it a useful resource for developers working with these tools.

MotherDuck's DuckDB MCP Server is an MCP server implementation that interacts with DuckDB and MotherDuck databases, providing SQL analytics capabilities to AI Assistants and IDEs. Key features include hybrid execution, cloud storage integration, data sharing, SQL analytics, and a serverless architecture. The server supports both local and cloud-based database operations and can be used with various IDEs and tools like Cursor, VS Code, and Claude Desktop.

ATLAS is a task and project management system designed for LLM Agents, providing comprehensive tracking, dependency management, and knowledge integration. Key features include project and task management, structured knowledge repository, graph database integration with Neo4j, and unified search capabilities. The system also supports database backup and restore functionality.

Image-Gen-Server is a tool designed for generating images from text descriptions, specifically integrated with Cursor IDE. It supports text-to-image generation, automatic saving of generated images, custom save paths, and the ability to generate multiple images at once. The server uses fastmcp and interacts with Jimeng AI for image generation.

Azure DevOps MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Azure DevOps, enabling AI assistants to interact with Azure DevOps APIs. It provides tools for managing projects, work items, repositories, pull requests, and more. Key features include secure authentication, natural language interaction, and a variety of tools for common DevOps workflows.

The MongoDB MCP Server for LLMS is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables LLMs to interact directly with MongoDB databases. It provides features such as collection schema inspection, document querying and filtering, index management, document operations (insert, update, delete), secure database access through connection strings, and comprehensive error handling and validation. The server supports natural language interaction and integrates with MCP clients like Claude Desktop and Cursor.ai.

Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server for the RAG Web Browser Actor is designed to provide fast responses to AI agents and LLMs, allowing them to interact with the web and extract information from web pages. It integrates with the RAG Web Browser Actor to perform web searches, scrape top URLs, and return their content as Markdown. Key features include web search, scraping, and content extraction.

Chroma MCP Server is an open-source embedding database designed for building Python or JavaScript LLM apps with memory. It provides data retrieval capabilities, including vector search, full text search, and metadata filtering. Key features include flexible client types (ephemeral, persistent, HTTP, cloud), collection management, document operations, and support for various embedding functions.

DroidMind is a powerful bridge between AI assistants and Android devices, enabling control, debugging, and system analysis through natural language. Key features include device control, system analysis, file system access, visual diagnostics, app management, multi-device support, UI automation, app inspection, and security framework. It integrates with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to allow AI models to interact with Android devices via ADB in a secure, structured way.

RhinoMCP is a tool that connects Rhino3D to Claude AI via the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling AI-assisted 3D modeling, analysis, and design workflows. Key features include socket-based bidirectional communication between Python and Rhino, support for NURBS curve creation, and compatibility with both Claude Desktop and Windsurf as clients.

ClickUp MCP Integration is a Model Context Protocol server that provides seamless integration with ClickUp, allowing Large Language Models to interact with your ClickUp workspace tasks and data. Main features include Task Management, Document Management, Custom Fields, Assignees, and Workspace Structure tools, enabling comprehensive interaction with ClickUp.

Neovim MCP Server connects Claude Desktop (or any Model Context Protocol client) to Neovim using MCP and the official neovim/node-client JavaScript library. It leverages Vim's native text editing commands and workflows to create a lightweight code or general purpose AI text assistance layer. Features include connecting to your nvim instance, viewing current buffers, getting cursor location, running vim commands, and making edits using insert or replacement. The server also provides tools for buffer management, window manipulation, and visual selections.

ReActMCP Web Search is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that integrates web search capabilities into your AI assistant framework. It leverages the Exa API to perform both basic and advanced web searches, returning real-time, markdown-formatted results including titles, URLs, publication dates, and content summaries. Main features include Basic Web Search, Advanced Web Search, Markdown Output, and MCP Integration.

MCP Tools for Obsidian is a plugin that enables AI applications like Claude Desktop to securely access and work with your Obsidian vault through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Key features include Vault Access, Semantic Search, and Template Integration, all while maintaining security and user control.

FreeCAD MCP is a tool that allows you to control FreeCAD from Claude Desktop. It provides features such as creating and editing documents, objects, and executing Python code within FreeCAD. The repository includes an addon for FreeCAD, which can be installed on Windows, Mac, or Linux. It also offers tools for creating, editing, and deleting objects, inserting parts from a library, and getting screenshots of the active view.

Gemini MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that enables Claude Desktop to interact with Google's Gemini AI models. Key features include full MCP protocol support, real-time response streaming, secure API key handling, configurable model parameters, and TypeScript implementation.

Elasticsearch/OpenSearch MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides Elasticsearch and OpenSearch interaction. It enables searching documents, analyzing indices, and managing the cluster through a set of tools. Features include general operations, index operations, document operations, cluster operations, and alias operations. The server can be configured and used with various environments like Claude Desktop and Anthropic MCP Client.

Godot MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Godot game engine. It enables AI assistants to launch the Godot editor, run projects, capture debug output, and control project execution. Key features include launching the Godot editor, running Godot projects, capturing debug output, controlling execution, getting Godot version, listing projects, project analysis, scene management, and UID management.

MCP Selenium Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Selenium WebDriver, enabling browser automation through standardized MCP clients. Main features include starting browser sessions with customizable options, navigating to URLs, finding and interacting with elements, performing mouse and keyboard actions, taking screenshots, uploading files, and support for headless mode. Supported browsers include Chrome and Firefox.

Search1API MCP Server provides search and crawl functionality using Search1API. Key features include web search, news search, web page content extraction, website sitemap extraction, deep thinking and complex problem solving with DeepSeek R1, and seamless integration with various MCP clients such as Claude Desktop, Cursor, Windsurf, and Cline.

Firebase MCP is a tool that enables AI assistants to work directly with Firebase services, including Firestore (document database operations), Storage (file management with robust upload capabilities), and Authentication (user management and verification). It supports multiple MCP client applications and provides a comprehensive set of tools for interacting with Firebase, such as adding, listing, getting, updating, and deleting documents in Firestore, managing files in Firebase Storage, and handling user authentication.

sentry-mcp is a prototype of a remote MCP server that acts as middleware to the upstream Sentry API provider. It supports both stdio and remote transports, and includes an Inspector for testing the service. Features include local development setup, OAuth app creation, and integration with various MCP clients like Claude and Cursor.

mcp-sequentialthinking-tools is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that combines sequential thinking with intelligent tool suggestions. It helps break down complex problems into manageable steps and provides confidence-scored recommendations for which MCP tools would be most effective at each stage. Key features include dynamic and reflective problem-solving, flexible thinking process, support for branching and revision of thoughts, intelligent tool recommendations, confidence scoring, detailed rationale, step tracking, and progress monitoring.

Video Editor MCP server is a tool for uploading, editing, searching, and generating videos. It integrates with Video Jungle and supports features such as custom URI schemes for video access, project metadata, and various tools like add-video, search-videos, generate-edit-from-videos, and generate-edit-from-single-video. The server also allows for local video file searches and provides a seamless workflow for video editing and content creation.

Telegram MCP server is a bridge between the Telegram API and AI assistants, allowing for various communication and message management capabilities. Features include getting current account information, listing dialogs, marking dialogs as read, retrieving messages from specific dialogs, and sending draft messages. The server also supports message management, organization, and communication prompts.

Siri Shortcuts MCP Server provides access to Siri shortcuts functionality via the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It allows listing, opening, and running shortcuts from the macOS Shortcuts app. Main features include exposing all available shortcuts, listing and opening shortcuts, running shortcuts with optional input parameters, and dynamically generated tools for each available shortcut.

Office-Word-MCP-Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for creating, reading, and manipulating Microsoft Word documents. It provides rich document editing capabilities including document management, content creation, rich text formatting, table formatting, advanced document manipulation, and document protection. Key features include creating new documents, adding headings, paragraphs, tables, and images, formatting text and tables, and protecting documents with passwords and digital signatures.

Unsplash MCP Server is a tool that integrates with the Unsplash API to provide image search and retrieval capabilities. It uses the mark3labs/mcp-go library and can be integrated into the Cursor editor for easy access to high-quality images.

G-Search MCP is a powerful MCP server for Google search that enables parallel searching with multiple keywords simultaneously. Key features include parallel searching, browser optimization, automatic verification handling, user behavior simulation, structured data in JSON format, and configurable parameters such as search result limits, timeout settings, and locale settings.

Figma MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides integration with Figma's API, allowing you to interact with Figma files, comments, components, and more. Main features include file operations, comment management, project and team features, and webhook management.

mcp-server-weaviate is an MCP server for Weaviate, which is a database system. It provides integration with Weaviate, allowing for the management and querying of data. The server can be installed via Smithery and requires configuration with Weaviate and OpenAI API keys. It supports search and store collections, making it useful for database operations.

XiYan MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables natural language queries to databases. It supports general LLMs, Text-to-SQL SOTA models, and local models. Key features include support for MySQL and PostgreSQL, fetching data by natural language through XiYanSQL, and high-security pure local mode. The server can be configured with various transport protocols and integrates with multiple IDEs and tools.

This project contains Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers implemented in Java using the Quarkus MCP server framework. These servers extend the capabilities of MCP-enabled LLM (Large Language Model) AI applications. The project includes various servers such as jdbc, jvminsight, filesystem, jfx, kubernetes, containers, and wolfram, each with specific functionalities like database interaction, JVM inspection, file system serving, drawing with JavaFX, Kubernetes interaction, container management, and web search via Wolfram Alpha. The project also provides instructions for contributing and adding new servers.

This project contains Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers implemented in Java using the Quarkus MCP server framework. It extends the capabilities of MCP-enabled Large Language Model (LLM) AI applications. The servers include: jdbc for database interaction, jvminsight for inspecting JVM processes, filesystem for serving files, jfx for drawing with JavaFX, kubernetes for Kubernetes cluster interaction, containers for working with Docker/Podman/OCI, and wolfram for web search via Wolfram Alpha LLM API. Other Quarkus MCP-based servers, such as WildFly, are also mentioned. The project is open to contributions for new server ideas.

Pinecone Model Context Protocol Server for Claude Desktop is a tool that allows reading and writing to a Pinecone index. It provides features such as semantic search, document reading, listing documents, getting Pinecone index stats, and processing documents into chunks and upserting them into the index. The server uses Pinecone's inference API for generating embeddings and a token-based chunker for document processing.

Open Data Model Context Protocol (ODMCP) is a tool that enables access to public datasets from LLM applications and provides a platform for publishing and distributing open data. Key features include Open Data Access, Publishing, MCP server setup, and integration with Claude Desktop app. It also supports the creation of new provider modules, testing, and validation, with a focus on simplicity, standardization, and code quality.

IDA Pro MCP Server is a plugin that allows remote querying and control of IDA Pro through the Model Context Protocol (MCP) interface. It enables AI assistants to interact directly with IDA Pro for binary analysis tasks, such as getting byte data, disassembly code, decompiled pseudocode, function names, segment information, and more. The plugin also supports defining and undefining functions, and provides tools to get various data types and strings from the binary file.

This MCP Server, developed in Go, supports Bilibili-related functionalities such as querying personal information, checking the latest followed users, and searching for videos. It aims to provide AI with the ability to personalize video content selection. The server can be run using sse or stdio methods, and it requires a configuration file containing Bilibili cookies for accessing private information.

Rails MCP Server is a Ruby implementation of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Rails projects. It allows LLMs to interact with Rails projects, providing features such as managing multiple Rails projects, browsing project files and structures, viewing Rails routes, inspecting model information, getting database schema information, analyzing controller-view relationships, and more. The server can run in STDIO or HTTP mode and provides tools for switching projects, getting project info, listing files, retrieving file content, getting routes, analyzing models, getting schema, analyzing controller views, and analyzing environment configurations.

Maigret MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for maigret, a powerful OSINT tool that collects user account information from various public sources. It provides tools for searching usernames across social networks and analyzing URLs. Key features include Username Search, URL Analysis, Multiple Output Formats, Site Filtering, and Docker-based execution.

AWS MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for AWS operations, supporting S3 and DynamoDB services. It provides a wide range of operations including S3 bucket and object management, DynamoDB table and item operations, and batch and TTL operations. All operations are automatically logged and can be accessed through the `audit://aws-operations` resource endpoint.

1Panel MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for 1Panel. It provides various tools for interacting with 1Panel, including system information, website management, certificate management, application installation, and database management. The server supports multiple installation methods, including downloading from the release page, building from source, installing via go install, and using Docker. It also supports two running modes: stdio and sse.

BioMCP is an open-source toolkit that empowers AI assistants and agents with specialized biomedical knowledge. It provides structured access to clinical trials, biomedical literature, and genomic variants, enabling natural language queries to specialized databases. Key features include integration with PubTator3/PubMed, ClinicalTrials.gov, and MyVariant.info, and a comprehensive command-line interface for direct database interaction. The enterprise version, OncoMCP, extends BioMCP with additional features such as HIPAA-compliant deployment, real-time trial matching, and advanced NLP capabilities.

mcp-server-duckdb is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for DuckDB, providing database interaction capabilities through MCP tools. It allows for database operations like querying, table creation, and schema inspection. Key features include SQL query execution, read-only mode for data integrity, and integration with Claude Desktop.

any-chat-completions-mcp MCP Server is a TypeScript-based implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that integrates Claude with any OpenAI SDK compatible chat completion API, such as OpenAI, Perplexity, Groq, xAI, and PyroPrompts. The server provides a `chat` tool to relay questions to a configured AI chat provider, and it can be used in various environments like Claude Desktop and LibreChat. It supports multiple providers by configuring different environment variables.

Minesweeper MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that allows an MCP client agent to play the classic Minesweeper game. It integrates with the Minesweeper game server and provides features such as starting a new game, placing flags, and handling game interactions. The server can be configured with MCP clients like Claude Desktop.

Sequential Thinking MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that facilitates structured, progressive thinking through defined stages. It helps break down complex problems into sequential thoughts, track the progression of your thinking process, and generate summaries. Key features include a Structured Thinking Framework, Thought Tracking, Related Thought Analysis, Progress Monitoring, Summary Generation, Persistent Storage, Data Import/Export, Extensible Architecture, Robust Error Handling, and Type Safety.

FileScopeMCP is a TypeScript-based tool for ranking files in your codebase by importance, tracking dependencies, and providing summaries to help understand code structure. Key features include File Importance Analysis, Dependency Tracking, Visualization with Mermaid diagrams, File Summaries, Multiple Project Support, and Persistent Storage.

Unity MCP (Server + Plugin) is a bridge between LLM and Unity, designed to expose and explain Unity's tools to LLM. It allows developers to add custom tools, enabling advanced workflows, rapid prototyping, and AI-driven features in the development process. Main features include creating, modifying, and managing GameObjects, components, scenes, assets, and more, as well as integration with LLM clients like Claude and Cursor.

PHP MCP Server is a PHP library that simplifies the creation of Model Context Protocol (MCP) compliant servers. Key features include attribute-based definition, manual registration, automatic metadata inference, PSR compliance, flexible configuration, multiple transports, and automatic discovery. It supports various MCP clients and can be integrated with different PHP frameworks.

anki-mcp MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that integrates with Anki via the AnkiConnect plugin. It provides resources for managing Anki decks and note models, tools for creating and managing Anki notes, and integration with the AnkiConnect API. Key features include listing and accessing Anki decks and note models, adding single and multiple notes, and providing JSON representation of Anki objects.

HWP-MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI models like Claude to control the Hangul Word Processor (HWP). It provides features for automatic document creation, editing, and manipulation. Main features include document creation and management, text editing, table operations, template-based report and letter generation, and batch processing.

Lokka is a model-context-protocol server for the Microsoft Graph and Azure RM APIs that allows you to query and manage your Azure and Microsoft 365 tenants using natural language. It supports operations like creating security groups, finding conditional access policies, and retrieving device configuration policies. The tool integrates with AI models and chat clients, enabling users to perform tasks through natural language commands.

awesome-kali-MCPServers is a collection of Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers designed for Kali Linux environments. It aims to enhance reverse engineering, security testing, and automation workflows. Key features include network analysis tools (Nmap, tshark), binary analysis tools (nm, objdump, strings), and sandbox support using Docker. The project is still in its early stages but offers a range of tools and configurations for security researchers and developers.

content_name: deepseek thinking claude 3.5 sonnet cline mcp
description: Deepseek-Thinking-Claude-3.5-Sonnet-CLINE-MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that combines DeepSeek R1's reasoning capabilities with Claude 3.5 Sonnet's response generation through OpenRouter. Key features include two-stage processing, smart conversation management, optimized parameters, and tools for generating and monitoring responses.

Terraform Registry MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with the Terraform Registry API. It enables AI agents to query provider information, resource details, and module metadata. The server includes core registry tools, Terraform Cloud tools, and various prompts for generating contextual responses. It also supports multiple IDEs and can be configured using environment variables.

MetaMCP MCP Server is a proxy server that manages multiple MCP servers, fetching tool/prompt/resource configurations from the MetaMCP App and routing requests to the correct underlying server. It supports various transports (stdio, SSE, streamable HTTP), Docker compatibility, and offers features like multi-workspaces, GUI dynamic updates, and namespace isolation.

notion-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Notion's API to manage a personal todo list. Main features include showing, adding, and updating tasks in a Notion workspace. It requires Python 3.11 or higher, a Notion account with API access, and a Notion integration token. The project can be set up via Smithery or by cloning the repository and configuring the necessary environment variables.

@harshmaur/gitlab-mcp is a GitLab MCP (Model Context Protocol) Server that allows for integration with various developer tools and platforms. It provides functionality to interact with GitLab through a personal access token and API URL, and can be installed via Smithery or manually. The server supports usage with Claude App, Cline, Roo Code, and Cursor, and requires setting up environment variables for the GitLab personal access token and API URL.

This MCP server provides access to Milvus vector database functionality, enabling seamless integration between LLM applications and the Milvus database. Key features include search and query operations, collection management, and data operations. It supports various LLM applications like Claude Desktop and Cursor, and can be used for full-text search, vector similarity search, and more.

mcp-scholarly MCP server is designed to search for accurate academic articles. It includes a tool called 'search-arxiv' that allows users to search for articles related to a given keyword. The server can be installed and run on various platforms, including Claude Desktop, Docker, and Smithery. It also provides detailed instructions for building, publishing, and debugging the server.

AWS Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server is a lightweight service that enables AI assistants to execute AWS CLI commands. It provides features such as retrieving AWS CLI documentation, executing AWS CLI commands, Unix pipe support, and access to AWS resources context. The server can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude Desktop and supports Docker deployment for enhanced security and reliability.

ctx is a Context as Code (CaC) tool that helps developers provide context to AI language models like ChatGPT or Claude. It automatically builds and organizes context files from code files, GitHub/GitLab repositories, Git commits, web pages, and MCP servers. Key features include gathering and organizing code, creating well-structured markdown documents, and optionally serving context through an MCP server for direct access by AI assistants.

MCP Proxy Server is a central hub that aggregates and serves multiple MCP resource servers through a single interface. It can connect to and manage multiple MCP resource servers, expose their combined capabilities through a unified interface, handle routing of requests, and aggregate responses from multiple sources. Key features include resource management, tool aggregation, and prompt handling.

Notion MCP Server is a tool that allows you to query and update Notion Pages. It enables you to create, read, and write to Notion databases and pages. The main features include querying Notion Pages, adding new entries to Notion databases, and integrating with Notion through an API token.

playwright-server MCP server is a tool that provides browser automation capabilities using Playwright. It includes features such as navigating to URLs, taking screenshots, clicking elements, filling out forms, executing JavaScript, and more. The server also implements a simple note storage system and can summarize stored notes.

HotNews MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides real-time hot trending topics from major Chinese social platforms and news sites. Main features include real-time hot topics from 9 major Chinese platforms, MCP protocol compatibility, easy integration with AI models, markdown formatted output with clickable links, and heat index support where available.

This tool provides a convenient way to analyze and visualize AWS cloud spending data using Anthropic's Claude model as an interactive interface. It functions as an MCP server that exposes AWS Cost Explorer API functionality, allowing you to query your AWS spend in natural language. Main features include Amazon EC2 Spend Analysis, Amazon Bedrock Spend Analysis, Service Spend Reports, Detailed Cost Breakdown, and an Interactive Interface.

GPT Researcher MCP Server is a tool that provides deep web research capabilities, delivering high-quality, relevant, and up-to-date information. It includes features such as deep research, quick search, report generation, and source retrieval, and integrates with services like OpenAI and Tavily. The server can be integrated with Claude for Mac and is designed to optimize context usage and provide better reasoning for LLMs.

MCP2Lambda is a tool that allows AWS Lambda functions to be run as Large Language Model (LLM) tools without code changes. It acts as a bridge between MCP clients and AWS Lambda, enabling generative AI models to access and run Lambda functions. Key features include autodiscovery of Lambda functions, invocation of Lambda functions, support for both pre-discovery and generic modes, and integration with Amazon Bedrock and Claude Desktop. This tool is particularly useful for developers working with AWS services and LLMs.

MCP Trader Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed for stock traders. It provides tools for stock analysis and trading, including technical analysis, relative strength, volume profile, pattern recognition, position sizing, and stop loss suggestions. The server uses the Tiingo API for market data and includes features such as moving average trends, momentum indicators, volatility metrics, and volume analysis. It also supports Docker deployment and can run as a standalone HTTP server.

apktool-mcp-server is a fully automated MCP server built on top of apktool to analyze Android APKs using LLMs like Claude. It provides features for reverse engineering, vulnerability detection, static analysis, and AI code modification. Key functionalities include decompiling APKs, analyzing permissions, searching for patterns in files, modifying smali and resource files, and more.

Proxmox Manager - Proxmox MCP Server is a Python-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Proxmox hypervisors. It provides a clean interface for managing nodes, VMs, and containers. Key features include full integration with Cline, secure token-based authentication, tools for managing nodes and VMs, VM console command execution, configurable logging, type-safe implementation with Pydantic, and rich output formatting.

MCP Text Editor Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides line-oriented text file editing capabilities through a standardized API. It is optimized for LLM tools with efficient partial file access to minimize token usage. Key features include line-based editing, smart partial file access, conflict detection, robust error handling, and support for multiple file operations.

xml.Revit.MCP Tools provide a comprehensive set of tools for integrating with Autodesk Revit through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Key features include basic operations, element management, and creation tools. The library enables powerful automation capabilities and programmatic interaction with building models, and it can be integrated with AI assistants for enhanced functionality.

RAG Documentation MCP Server is a tool for retrieving and processing documentation through vector search, enabling AI assistants to augment their responses with relevant documentation context. Key features include vector-based documentation search and retrieval, support for multiple documentation sources, semantic search capabilities, automated documentation processing, and real-time context augmentation for LLMs. It also provides tools for listing sources, extracting URLs, removing documentation, managing the processing queue, and more.

ErickWendel-contributions-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools to query Erick Wendel's contributions across different platforms, including talks, blog posts, and videos. Main features include natural language querying, filtering and pagination, and integration with various AI tools such as Claude, Cursor, and MCPHost.

Bifrost - VSCode Dev Tools MCP Server is a VS Code extension that provides a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server, exposing VSCode's powerful development tools and language features to AI tools. It supports advanced code navigation, analysis, and manipulation capabilities, including Language Server Integration, Code Navigation, Symbol Search, Code Analysis, Smart Selection, and Code Actions. The extension also includes an HTTP/SSE server for MCP compatibility and integrates with AI assistants.

MCP Zotero is a Model Context Protocol server for Zotero integration that allows Claude to interact with your Zotero library. It provides tools for listing collections, getting collection items, fetching item details, searching the library, and retrieving recently added papers. The setup involves obtaining Zotero credentials, setting environment variables, and installing the MCP Zotero package.

Mindmap MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for converting Markdown content to interactive mindmaps. It provides features such as converting Markdown to an interactive mindmap HTML, creating offline-capable mindmaps, and options to hide the toolbar. The server can return either HTML content or a file path, and it supports various installation methods including pip, uvx, and Docker. It also integrates with MCP clients like Claude Desktop and other terminals' MCP servers.

Microsoft SQL Server MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables secure interaction with Microsoft SQL Server databases. It allows AI assistants to list tables, read data, and execute SQL queries through a controlled interface, making database exploration and analysis safer and more structured. Key features include listing available SQL Server tables, reading table contents, executing SQL queries with proper error handling, secure database access through environment variables, comprehensive logging, and automatic system dependency installation.

RagRabbit is a self-hosted site AI search and LLM generation tool that includes features like an embeddable AI chat widget, website crawler, LLMs.txt generation, MCP server, and flexible authentication. It integrates with various platforms and can be deployed on Vercel with one-click. The main focus is on providing AI-powered search and content indexing for websites.

Naver MCP Server is a server implementation for Naver OpenAPI using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides tools to interact with various Naver services, including Blog Search, News Search, Book Search, Adult Content Check, Encyclopedia Search, Cafe Article Search, Q&A Search, Local Search, Spelling Correction, Web Search, Image Search, Shopping Search, and Document Search.

Memory MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides knowledge graph management capabilities. It enables LLMs to create, read, update, and delete entities and relations in a persistent knowledge graph, helping AI assistants maintain memory across conversations. Key features include Knowledge Graph Storage, Entity Management, Relation Tracking, Observation System, Powerful Search, and Persistent Storage.

Powerpoint MCP server is a project that creates powerpoint presentations with various tools for adding slides, content, tables, charts, and images. It supports creating, editing, and saving presentations, and can generate images using a FLUX model. The server is useful for creating educational and business presentations.

ffmpeg-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that facilitates the ability to decode, encode, transcode, mux, demux, stream, filter, and play various types of media files. It supports a wide range of operations on both human and machine-created content.

KiCad MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for KiCad, providing features such as project management, PCB design analysis, netlist extraction, BOM management, design rule checking, PCB visualization, and circuit pattern recognition. It supports natural language interaction and can be configured to work with any MCP-compliant client.

LlamaIndex MCP demos showcase how to create an MCP server using LlamaCloud and how to use LlamaIndex as an MCP client. The main features include setting up a local MCP server, integrating with Claude Desktop, and using the MCP client to connect to the server and create an agent. The primary function is to provide search and query capabilities using RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) to answer questions with up-to-the-second private information.

Telegram MCP Server is a tool that allows Claude to access your Telegram account to read and send messages. Main features include getting a list of chats, sending and reading messages, marking messages as read, and getting conversation context. The setup involves obtaining Telegram API credentials, setting up a Python environment, and configuring the Claude Desktop application.

mcp-simple-arxiv is an MCP server that provides access to arXiv papers through their API. It allows LLM clients to search for scientific papers by title and abstract content, get paper metadata and abstracts, and access links to available paper formats (PDF/HTML). The server implements proper rate limiting according to arXiv's API guidelines.

SearXNG MCP Server is an implementation that integrates the SearXNG API, providing web search capabilities. Main features include Web Search, Pagination, Time Filtering, Language Selection, and Safe Search. It also includes tools for executing web searches with pagination and reading and converting content from a URL to markdown.

mcp-google-sheets is a Python-based MCP server that acts as a bridge between any MCP-compatible client and the Google Sheets API, enabling powerful automation and data manipulation workflows. Key features include seamless integration with Google Drive & Google Sheets APIs, comprehensive tools for CRUD operations, flexible authentication methods, and easy deployment. It supports operations like listing, creating, and updating spreadsheets, as well as sharing and formatting them.

Postman MCP Server is a TypeScript-based MCP server that integrates with the Postman API, providing comprehensive management of Postman collections, environments, and APIs. Key features include CRUD operations for collections and environments, request and response management, version control, authentication and authorization, and additional features like webhooks and enterprise role controls.

Google Drive server is an MCP server that integrates with Google Drive to allow listing, reading, and searching over files. It supports all file types and automatically exports Google Workspace files to formats like Markdown, CSV, and plain text. The server provides tools for searching files and requires OAuth authentication for access. It can be used with Docker or NPX for integration with desktop applications.

Next.js MCP Server is a tool that scans your Next.js app directory structure and extracts detailed information about all API routes, including API paths, HTTP methods, request parameters, status codes, and request and response schemas. It provides features such as `get-routers-info` and can be run via command line, Docker, or integrated with Cursor. The tool generates a structured representation of all your API routes and supports local development and testing.

SketchupMCP is an integration that connects Sketchup with Claude AI through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling direct interaction and control. Key features include bidirectional communication, component manipulation, material control, scene inspection, selection handling, and execution of Ruby code for advanced operations.

Deep Research MCP Server is an agent-based tool that provides web search and advanced research capabilities. It leverages HuggingFace's `smolagents` and is implemented as an MCP server. Key features include web search and information gathering, PDF and document analysis, image analysis and description, YouTube transcript retrieval, and archive site search. The project requires Python 3.11 or higher, specific API keys, and can be run in a Docker container.

EdgeOne Pages MCP is a service for deploying HTML content to EdgeOne Pages and obtaining a publicly accessible URL. Main features include rapid deployment of HTML content, automatic generation of publicly accessible URLs, integration with EdgeOne Pages Functions, and use of EdgeOne Pages KV store for fast edge access.

Cryo MCP is a Model Completion Protocol (MCP) server for the Cryo blockchain data extraction tool. It allows users to access and query blockchain data via an API server that implements the MCP protocol. Key features include full Cryo dataset access, flexible query options, block range and contract filtering, multiple output formats, and SQL query capabilities. The tool supports various functions such as listing datasets, querying datasets, and running SQL queries against downloaded blockchain data.

Google Ads MCP is a tool that connects Google Ads with Claude AI, allowing users to analyze their advertising data through natural language conversations. It provides features such as account management, campaign analytics and reporting, keyword and ad performance analysis, and budget and bid management. The tool also supports data visualization and can be integrated with Claude and Cursor for enhanced functionality.

Snak is an Agent Engine for creating powerful and secure AI Agents powered by Starknet. It is available as both an NPM package and a ready-to-use backend. Main features include integration with Starknet, support for various AI providers (Anthropic, OpenAI, Google Gemini, Ollama), PostgreSQL database configuration, and LangSmith tracing. The engine supports both prompt and server modes, and provides a comprehensive interface for adding and managing agent actions.

MongoDB MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides read-only access to MongoDB databases. It enables LLMs to inspect collection schemas and execute aggregation pipelines. Key features include executing MongoDB aggregation pipelines, getting execution plans for aggregation pipelines, providing schema information for each collection, and safety features such as automatic document limits and default timeouts.

Apple Notes Model Context Protocol Server for Claude Desktop allows reading and writing to the local Apple Notes database, enabling search and retrieval of notes. Key features include getting all notes, reading specific notes, and searching through notes. It currently lacks support for encrypted notes, pinned notes, cloud sync status, attachment content, checklist status, and note creation/editing. The server requires full disk access on Mac OS and can be installed using uv or pip.

Docs MCP Server is a tool that indexes and provides up-to-date documentation for libraries used in your codebase. It scrapes and indexes documentation from various sources like websites, GitHub, npm, PyPI, and local files. Key features include always-up-to-date context, version-aware search, accurate code snippets, a web interface for searching and managing documentation, broad source compatibility, intelligent processing, flexible embedding models, powerful hybrid search, local and private operation, and free and open-source availability.

JFrog MCP Server is an experimental project that integrates with the JFrog Platform API, providing features such as repository management, build tracking, release lifecycle management, and more. Key features include Repository Management (local, remote, and virtual repositories), Build Tracking, Runtime Monitoring, Mission Control, Artifact Search, and Catalog and Curation. The server also supports access control, environment and project management, and detailed package and vulnerability information.

Website Downloader MCP Server is a tool to download entire websites using wget. It preserves the website structure and converts links to work locally. Key features include recursive downloading, inclusion of all page requisites, local link conversion, appropriate file extensions, domain restriction, and preservation of website structure.

CLI MCP Server is a secure Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for executing controlled command-line operations with comprehensive security features. Main features include secure command execution, configurable command and flag whitelisting, path traversal prevention, shell operator injection protection, execution timeouts, detailed error reporting, and async operation support. It also provides tools like run_command and show_security_rules, and can be integrated with Claude Desktop.

Office-PowerPoint-MCP-Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for PowerPoint manipulation using python-pptx. It provides tools for creating, editing, and manipulating PowerPoint presentations through the MCP protocol. Main features include adding slides, populating text placeholders, adding images, textboxes, tables, auto shapes, and charts, and accessing and changing core document properties.

Atlan Agent Toolkit is a repository containing tools and protocols for interacting with Atlan services for AI agents. The main component, Model Context Protocol (MCP), enables interaction with Atlan services through function calling, providing tools for asset search and retrieval using pyatlan.

MCP-NixOS is a Model Context Protocol server that provides real-time, accurate information about NixOS packages, system options, Home Manager settings, and nix-darwin macOS configurations. It helps AI assistants avoid making incorrect assumptions about NixOS and related systems. Key features include NixOS resources, Home Manager, nix-darwin, smart caching, and rich search capabilities.

Make MCP Server (legacy) is a Model Context Protocol server that enables Make scenarios to be utilized as tools by AI assistants. It allows AI systems to trigger and interact with your Make automation workflows, turning your Make scenarios into callable tools for AI assistants. The server connects to your Make account, parses and resolves input parameters, and returns structured JSON output. It supports bidirectional communication between AI assistants and existing automation workflows.

Package Version MCP Server is a tool for checking the latest stable package versions from multiple package registries, including npm, PyPI, Maven Central, Go Proxy, Swift Packages, AWS Bedrock, Docker Hub, and GitHub Container Registry. It supports various transport modes, installation methods, and provides detailed usage examples for different package types.

Notion MCP Server provides seamless integration with Notion, enabling Language Models to interact with your Notion workspace. Key features include searching, reading, creating, and updating pages and databases, enhanced markdown support, and comprehensive database operations such as creating, querying, and managing database items.

CodeQL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that wraps the CodeQL query server, enabling tools like Cursor or AI agents to interact with CodeQL through structured commands and doc search. Main features include registering CodeQL databases, running full queries or quick-evaluating a symbol, decoding .bqrs files into JSON, and locating predicate/class symbol positions.

applescript-mcp MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that enables LLM applications to interact with macOS through AppleScript. It provides a standardized interface for AI applications to control system functions, manage files, handle notifications, and more. Key features include Calendar management, Clipboard operations, Finder integration, System notifications, System controls, iTerm terminal integration, Mail, Shortcuts automation, Messages, Notes, and Pages.

Think Tool MCP Server is an official implementation of Anthropic's 'think' tool as an MCP server, designed to dramatically improve Claude's reasoning capabilities with structured thinking. It provides a dedicated space for Claude to organize thoughts, create structured approaches, and verify policy compliance, leading to better performance on complex tasks. Key features include proven performance benefits, compatibility with other MCP tools, and optimized system prompts for enhanced results.

n8n MCP Server provides access to n8n workflows, executions, credentials, and more through the Model Context Protocol, allowing Large Language Models (LLMs) to interact with n8n instances securely and in a standardized way. Core features include listing and managing workflows, viewing workflow details, executing workflows, managing credentials, handling tags and executions, generating security audits, and managing workflow tags. Enterprise features require an n8n Enterprise license and include project management, variable management, and advanced user management.

Meilisearch MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Meilisearch through LLM interfaces like Claude. It provides features such as index and document management, settings configuration, task monitoring, API key management, built-in logging and monitoring tools, dynamic connection configuration, and smart search across single or multiple indices. The server also includes tools for connection management, index management, document operations, search, settings management, API key management, task management, and system monitoring.

Crawl4AI MCP Server is a high-performance server for web scraping, crawling, and deep research. It integrates with Crawl4AI and is deployed on CloudFlare Workers. Features include single webpage scraping, web crawling, URL discovery, asynchronous crawling, deep research, structured data extraction, content search, MCP integration, OAuth authentication, and high performance. The project also includes comprehensive documentation and a detailed development and deployment guide.

OpenAPI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes OpenAPI endpoints as MCP resources, allowing Large Language Models to discover and interact with REST APIs defined by OpenAPI specifications. Key features include configuration through environment variables or command line arguments, development tools for building, type checking, and linting, and a development workflow with automatic rebuilds and debugging capabilities.

Kagi MCP server is designed for search and summarization capabilities. It requires an API key for the search functionality, which is currently in closed beta. The server can be installed via Smithery or set up locally, and it integrates with Claude Desktop. Key features include searching for information, summarizing content, and advanced configuration options such as logging levels and summarizer engine customization.

ElevenLabs MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with the ElevenLabs text-to-speech API. It features both a server component and a sample web-based MCP Client (SvelteKit) for managing voice generation tasks. Main features include generating audio from text, support for multiple voices and script parts, SQLite database for persistent history storage, and a sample SvelteKit MCP Client for simple text-to-speech conversion, multi-part script management, voice history tracking, and audio file downloads.

Find Flights MCP Server is a tool for searching and retrieving flight information using the Duffel API. It supports one-way, round-trip, and multi-city flight queries with detailed flight offer information, flexible search parameters, and automatic handling of flight connections. Key features include contextual memory, flexible date search, and natural conversation for complex travel plans.

MCP Shell Server is a secure server for executing shell commands that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It allows remote execution of authorized shell commands with support for stdin input. Key features include secure command execution, support for standard input, comprehensive output, security with shell operators, and timeout control.

WordPress MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to interact with WordPress sites through the WordPress REST API. It supports multiple WordPress sites, secure authentication, dynamic endpoint discovery, and flexible operations like GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, and PATCH methods. The server also includes features such as error handling, simple configuration, and various tools for managing content, users, plugins, and site settings.

MCP Simple PubMed is an MCP server that provides access to PubMed articles through the Entrez API. Main features include searching the PubMed database using keywords, accessing article abstracts, and downloading full text when available (for open access articles). The tool returns XML-ized versions of full text, which are more useful for AIs as they provide additional information about the document's structure. The server requires environment variables such as PUBMED_EMAIL and optionally PUBMED_API_KEY for higher rate limits.

Unreal Engine Code Analyzer MCP Server is a powerful tool for analyzing Unreal Engine codebases. It provides features such as Class Analysis, Hierarchy Mapping, Code Search, Reference Finding, Subsystem Analysis, Game Genre Knowledge, Pattern Detection & Learning, and Custom Codebase Support. The tool is built using TypeScript, Tree-sitter, and the Model Context Protocol SDK, and it integrates with AI assistants like Claude and Cline to deeply understand and analyze Unreal Engine source code.

Trends Hub is a one-stop service for aggregating trending topics from the internet, supporting over 20 high-quality data sources. Main features include one-stop aggregation, real-time updates, MCP protocol support, easy extensibility, and flexible customization. It supports various tools to fetch trending news and content from different platforms such as 36氪, 9to5Mac, BBC, Bilibili, Douban, Douyin, Gcores, ifanr, InfoQ, Juejin, Netease, New York Times, Smzdm, SSPAI, Tencent News, The Paper, The Verge, Toutiao, Weibo, and WeRead.

Mac Messages MCP is a Python bridge for interacting with the macOS Messages app using MCP (Multiple Context Protocol). Main features include reading recent messages, filtering messages by contact, sending new messages through iMessage, and accessing messages via an API. It requires Full Disk Access permission and can be integrated with Claude Desktop or Cursor.

MasterGo Magic MCP is a standalone MCP (Model Context Protocol) service designed to connect MasterGo design tools with AI models. It enables AI models to directly retrieve DSL data from MasterGo design files. Key features include retrieving DSL data, running directly with npx, no external dependencies required, and detailed command line options for usage. The project also includes documentation and local development setup instructions.

Obsidian MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server designed for LLMs to interact with Obsidian vaults. It provides features such as file operations, full-text search, property management, and security & performance enhancements. Key features include atomic file/directory operations, full-text search with configurable context, YAML frontmatter parsing, API key authentication, rate limiting, and various tools for file and content management.

BigQuery MCP server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides access to BigQuery, enabling LLMs to inspect database schemas and execute queries. Main features include executing SQL queries, listing tables, and describing table schemas. The server can be configured with command line arguments or environment variables, and it supports installation via Smithery and integration with Claude Desktop.

Web3 MCP is a Model-Context-Protocol server for interacting with multiple blockchains, including Solana, Ethereum, THORChain, XRP Ledger, TON, Cardano, and UTXO chains. It provides simple RPC endpoints for common blockchain operations, allowing secure interactions with various blockchains through environment variables. Features include checking balances, transferring tokens, viewing transaction history, and more for each supported blockchain.

Rust Docs MCP Server is a tool designed to provide up-to-date and accurate documentation for specific Rust crates. It uses OpenAI's models to generate embeddings and summarize answers, improving the accuracy of code suggestions from AI coding assistants. Key features include targeted documentation, semantic search, LLM summarization, caching, and MCP integration.

Discord MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables LLMs to interact with Discord channels, allowing them to send and read messages through Discord's API. Key features include sending messages to Discord channels, reading recent messages from channels, automatic server and channel discovery, support for both channel names and IDs, and proper error handling and validation.

JADX-MCP-SERVER is a fully automated MCP server designed to communicate with the JADX-AI-MCP Plugin, enabling the analysis of Android APKs using LLMs like Claude. It provides features for uncovering vulnerabilities, parsing manifests, and reverse engineering. The toolset includes various MCP tools for class and method analysis, static code analysis, and AI-driven code modification. It is part of Zin's Reverse Engineering MCP Suite and is intended for educational, research, and ethical security assessment purposes.

MCP Server - Remote MacOs Use is an open-source MCP server that enables AI to fully control remote macOS systems. It provides features such as no extra API costs, minimal setup, and universal compatibility with all macOS versions. Key functionalities include remote screen sharing, keyboard and mouse control, and application management. The server also supports WebRTC for low-latency real-time screen sharing and improved performance.

Molecule-MCP is a model-context-protocol server for molecules that connects molecule science-related tools to Claude AI, allowing it to directly interact with and control these tools. It enables prompt-assisted molecule modeling and supports integration with tools like PyMOL, ChimeraX, and Gromacs Copilot.

Langfuse Prompt Management MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for managing Langfuse prompts. It allows users to list and retrieve prompts, supports pagination, and provides tools for compatibility with other MCP clients. The server is useful for developers who need to integrate and manage prompts in their applications.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial and crypto data, and can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude for financial analysis.

LlamaCloud MCP Server is a TypeScript-based MCP server that connects to multiple managed indexes on LlamaCloud. It creates separate tools for each index, allowing you to search specific indexes with a `query` parameter. The server supports auto-generated tool names and can be configured with command-line arguments. It also provides installation and development instructions, including dependency management and debugging tools.

Solana MCP Server is a tool for interacting with the Solana blockchain using your own private key. It provides features such as getting the latest slot, wallet address, wallet balance, and transferring SOL. The server can be installed via Smithery or manually, and it integrates with Cursor for easy use.

BNBChain MCP is a tool server for Binance Smart Chain (BSC) that supports sending BNB, transferring BEP-20 tokens, deploying tokens, and interacting with smart contracts. It includes features such as PancakeSwap integration, meme token creation, and secure token transfers via CLI or MCP. The tool is designed for Claude Desktop, AI agents, and developers, and it supports various MCP tools like transferNativeToken, transferBEP20Token, pancakeSwap, createBEP20Token, and more.

MCP Content Summarizer Server provides intelligent summarization capabilities for various types of content using Google's Gemini 1.5 Pro model. It supports plain text, web pages, PDF documents, EPUB books, and HTML content. Features include customizable summary length, multi-language support, smart context preservation, and a dynamic greeting resource for testing.

browser-mcp is a browser extension and MCP server that enables interaction with the browser. It includes tools for getting markdown from the current page, appending CSS styles, searching browser history, and more. The project is under active development with plans to publish the extension to various stores and add more tools.

Image Generation MCP Server is an implementation for generating images from text prompts using Replicate's model. It supports configurable image parameters such as resolution, aspect ratio, and quality, and can save generated images to a specified directory. The server is fully compliant with the MCP protocol and includes error handling and validation.

Opik MCP Server is an open-source implementation of the Model Context Protocol for the Opik platform. It provides a unified interface for interacting with Opik's capabilities, supporting multiple transport mechanisms for flexible integration into various environments. Key features include IDE Integration, Unified API Access, Platform Management, Prompts Management, Projects/Workspaces Management, Traces, and Metrics.

This repository contains MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers for integrating with OpenAI's o1 model and Flux capabilities. Key features include direct access to the o1-preview model, streaming support, temperature and top_p parameter control, system message configuration, and integration with SOTA Image Model through Flux.

Snowflake MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides database interaction with Snowflake. It enables running SQL queries and exposes data insights and schema context as resources. Main features include read and write query tools, schema tools for listing databases, schemas, and tables, and analysis tools for appending data insights.

mcp-k8s is a Kubernetes MCP (Model Control Protocol) server that enables interaction with Kubernetes clusters through MCP tools. It supports querying and managing Kubernetes resources, including CRUD operations and Helm management. Key features include fine-grained control over resource operations, Helm support, and integration with LLM for natural language interaction, making it useful for Kubernetes resource management, automated operations, development, testing, and education.

ClaudePost is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a seamless email management interface through Claude. It allows users to handle emails directly through natural language conversations, supporting features like searching, reading, and sending emails securely. Key features include email search by date range and keywords, daily email statistics, full email content reading with threading support, and secure email handling with TLS.

AgentRPC is a universal RPC layer for AI agents that allows connecting to any function in any language across network boundaries. Key features include multi-language support, private network support, long-running functions, full observability, automatic failover, and framework compatibility with MCP and OpenAI SDKs. It also provides integration with Claude Desktop and Cursor.

Minecraft MCP Integration is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration for Minecraft that enables AI assistants to interact with a Minecraft server. This integration allows AI models to observe and interact with the Minecraft world through a bot. Features include various tools for bot control such as movement, block placement, and interaction with the environment.

MCP TaskManager is a Model Context Protocol server for Task Management, allowing Claude Desktop or any MCP client to manage and execute tasks in a queue-based system. Main features include task planning, execution, and completion with support for task lists, internal queuing, and feedback mechanisms.

content_name: all in one model context protocol
description: MyMCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation with integrations for GitLab, Jira, Confluence, YouTube, and more. It provides AI-powered search capabilities and various utility tools for development workflows, including tools for Google Calendar, Gmail, Confluence, YouTube, Jira, GitLab, and RAG. Key features include AI-powered search, calendar management, email management, project management, and content indexing.

Linear MCP Server is a Node.js implementation of an MCP server for Linear integration, providing a standardized interface for AI models to interact with Linear issue tracking functionality. Key features include support for searching issues, reading details, updating, and commenting. The server can be used with various tools and platforms like Claude Desktop and Cursor, and it provides a range of tools for managing Linear issues, projects, and teams.

MCP Code Executor is an MCP server that allows LLMs to execute Python code within a specified Python environment. Key features include the ability to run code in Conda, virtualenv, or UV virtualenv, install dependencies, check installed packages, and dynamically configure the environment. It provides tools like `execute_code`, `install_dependencies`, `check_installed_packages`, `configure_environment`, and `get_environment_config` for LLMs to interact with the Python environment.

BigQuery MCP Server is a tool that allows LLMs like Claude to interact with BigQuery data by translating natural language queries into SQL. Key features include running SQL queries in plain English, accessing tables and materialized views, exploring dataset schemas, and ensuring data security with read-only access. It supports both Google Cloud CLI and service account authentication methods.

Docx MCP Service is a document processing service based on the FastMCP library, supporting the creation, editing, and management of Word documents using AI assistants in Cursor. Main features include complete document operations, formatting, table processing, image insertion, layout control, query functions, and convenient editing.

MCP Solver is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates SAT, SMT, and constraint solving capabilities with Large Language Models. It supports MiniZinc, PySAT, and Z3 for creating, editing, and solving constraint models. Key features include various tools for model manipulation, multiple operational modes, and an MCP test client for development and experimentation.

HubSpot MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to interact with HubSpot CRM data. It provides direct access to contacts, companies, and engagement data, with features like vector storage, context retention, and zero-configuration Docker deployment. The server offers tools for creating and retrieving HubSpot data, and includes performance features such as thread-level indexing and embedding caching.

MCP Server for Asana is a Model Context Protocol server implementation that allows interaction with the Asana API from MCP Clients like Anthropic's Claude Desktop Application. It provides tools for managing tasks, projects, workspaces, and comments in Asana, including creating, updating, and searching for tasks, managing custom fields, and working with project hierarchies.

Waldzell MCP Servers is a Turborepo-powered monorepo containing MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers for various AI assistant integrations. The monorepo includes packages for Yelp Fusion API, Google TypeScript Style Guide, Stochastic thinking, and Sequential thinking. It also provides utilities for high-performance builds, modern package management, versioning, automated workflows, and deployment to Smithery. Key features include development, building, testing, linting, and deploying packages.

MCP Think Tool Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that implements the 'think' tool to improve Claude's complex reasoning capabilities.
