Key features include a structured thinking space for breaking down complex problems, a thought history log with timestamps, statistics and analysis of thinking patterns, and an option to clear thought history for a clean slate. The server can be installed via PyPI or Docker and configured for use with Claude in Windsurf.

Coincap MCP is a server that allows you to query crypto information from Coincap's public API. It provides tools for getting the price of Bitcoin, any cryptocurrency, and listing all available crypto assets. The server can be easily integrated into Claude Desktop and does not require API keys or registration.

MCP Reddit Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for fetching and analyzing Reddit content. Main features include fetching hot threads from any subreddit, getting detailed post content including comments, and supporting different post types (text, link, gallery).
MCP 数据库工具是一个多功能的 MCP 服务，它使您的 AI 能够通过统一的连接配置安全地访问各种类型的数据库（如 SQLite、MySQL、PostgreSQL 等）进行数据分析。主要功能包括安全优先的只读操作、多数据库支持、简单配置和高级功能如表格浏览、架构分析和查询执行。

MCP server for LogSeq is designed to interact with LogSeq via its API, providing tools for listing graphs, pages, getting page content, searching, creating, updating, and deleting pages. It also includes configuration options for the LogSeq API and development instructions for building and debugging.

MCP-Discord is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to interact with the Discord platform. It provides functionalities such as logging into a Discord bot, getting server information, managing channels and messages, handling forum posts, and managing webhooks. The server supports both stdio and streamable HTTP transport methods and can be configured using environment variables or command line arguments.

MCP Server for Deep Research is a tool designed for conducting comprehensive research on complex topics. It helps you explore questions in depth, find relevant sources, and generate structured research reports. Key features include Question Elaboration, Subquestion Generation, Web Search Integration, Content Analysis, and Report Generation.

Perplexity MCP Server is an MCP server for the Perplexity API, which allows users to request chat completion with citations. It can be integrated into the Claude Desktop application and requires a Perplexity API key for use. The server has limitations related to processing time and potential timeouts.

browser-use MCP server is an AI-driven browser automation server implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for natural language browser control. Key features include MCP Integration, Browser Automation, Visual Understanding, State Persistence, and Multi-LLM Support. It supports multiple LLM providers and provides configuration options for various settings.
xtquantai 是一个基于 Model Context Protocol (MCP) 的服务器，它将迅投 (xtquant) 量化交易平台的功能与人工智能助手集成，使 AI 能够直接访问和操作量化交易数据和功能。主要功能包括基础数据查询、行情数据获取、图表和可视化等。

GCP MCP Server is a comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, enabling AI assistants to interact with and manage GCP resources through a standardized interface. Main features include querying and managing GCP resources, receiving AI-guided assistance, and support for various GCP services such as Artifact Registry, BigQuery, Cloud Build, and more.

Vantage MCP Server is an open-source tool written in Golang that allows users to interact with their cloud cost data through AI assistants and MCP clients. It provides a natural language interface to query and analyze cloud spend, cost tagging, provider integrations, and more. Key features include tools for querying costs, listing cost reports, budgets, dashboards, and detecting anomalies.

Search MCP Server is a search service implementation based on the MCP protocol, providing support for multiple search engines including Brave Search, Metaso, and Bocha. It supports asynchronous processing and high-concurrency requests, and can be seamlessly integrated with tools like Cursor and Claude Desktop. The main features include multi-search engine support, modular design, and detailed configuration options for each search engine.

Prometheus MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Prometheus, providing access to Prometheus metrics and queries through standardized MCP interfaces. Main features include executing PromQL queries, discovering and exploring metrics, authentication support, Docker containerization, and interactive tools for AI assistants.

Logfire MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables LLMs to retrieve, analyze, and query OpenTelemetry traces and metrics. It provides tools for finding exceptions, running custom SQL queries, and retrieving schema information. The server can be configured with various clients like Cursor, Claude Desktop, and Cline, and requires a Logfire read token for API access.

Package Documentation MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides LLMs with efficient access to package documentation across multiple programming languages and language server protocol (LSP) capabilities. Key features include multi-language support, smart documentation parsing, advanced search features, LSP support, and performance optimization.

SearXNG MCP Server is an implementation that integrates the SearXNG API, providing web search capabilities. Main features include Web Search, Pagination, Time Filtering, Language Selection, and Safe Search. It also includes tools for executing web searches with pagination and reading and converting content from a URL to markdown.

MCP Salesforce Connector is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Salesforce integration, enabling LLMs to interact with Salesforce data through SOQL queries and SOSL searches. Key features include executing SOQL and SOSL, retrieving metadata, managing records, and making Tooling API and Apex REST requests.

Aindreyway MCP Codex Keeper is an intelligent MCP server that serves as a guardian of development knowledge, providing AI assistants with curated access to the latest documentation and best practices. Main features include managing documentation from various sources, keeping track of the latest development best practices, providing intelligent search capabilities, automatically updating documentation, supporting tagging and categorization, and optimizing memory usage.

@enemyrr/mcp-mysql-server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides MySQL database operations, enabling AI models to interact with MySQL databases through a standardized interface. Main features include multiple connection methods, secure connection handling, prepared statement support, schema management tools, comprehensive error handling and validation, TypeScript support, and automatic workspace detection.

Azure CLI MCP Server is a tool that wraps the Azure CLI, adds a nice prompt to improve its functionality, and exposes it. It can perform various Azure CLI tasks such as listing resources, fixing configuration or security issues, and creating resources. The server can be installed and configured using Docker, Java, or through Smithery.ai. It supports integration with VS Code and Claude Desktop.

LSD MCP server is a tool that allows users to gather high-quality information directly from websites by providing a link. It uses Claude, an AI, to write, self-correct, and run LSD SQL queries connected to cloud browsers. Features include web scraping, data extraction, and integration with the Claude desktop app. The setup involves installing dependencies, configuring environment variables, and running the MCP server.

ManusMCP is an AI agent framework using Flowise to deploy AI team members with specialized capabilities. It orchestrates specialized AI agents to accomplish complex tasks, leveraging the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for effective collaboration. Key features include installation and usage instructions, support for running with Docker, and a contribution guide for improving prompts, workflows, and the MCP server.

MCP Create Server is a dynamic MCP server management service that creates, runs, and manages Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers dynamically. Key features include dynamic creation and execution of MCP server code, support for TypeScript, tool execution on child MCP servers, server code updates and restarts, and removal of unnecessary servers. The service integrates with Claude Desktop and provides tools for creating, executing, listing, and deleting servers.

Tinybird MCP server is a tool to interact with a Tinybird Workspace from any MCP client. It allows querying Tinybird Data Sources, getting results from existing Tinybird API Endpoints, and pushing Datafiles. The server supports both SSE and STDIO modes and provides various tools for interacting with the Tinybird Workspace, such as listing data sources, running select queries, and analyzing pipes.

swagger-mcp is a tool designed to scrape Swagger UI by extracting the swagger.json file and dynamically generating well-defined MCP tools at runtime. Key features include support for LLM models, configuration options for security and authentication, and integration with MCP clients. It also includes a demo flow and a flow diagram for better understanding.

Replicate MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server implementation for Replicate, allowing users to run Replicate models through a simple tool-based interface. Main features include searching and browsing models, creating and managing predictions, and handling generated images. The server requires a Replicate API token and can be integrated with Claude Desktop or other MCP clients.

ServiceNow MCP Server is a Model Completion Protocol (MCP) server implementation that allows Claude to interact with ServiceNow instances. It provides features for connecting to ServiceNow, querying and managing records, executing scripts and workflows, and more. The server supports various authentication methods, including Basic, OAuth, and API Key. It also includes tools for incident management, service catalog, change management, workflow management, script include management, changeset management, knowledge base management, user management, and UI policy management.

MCP Deep Web Research Server (v0.3.0) is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for advanced web research, featuring intelligent search queuing, enhanced content extraction, and deep research capabilities. Key features include batch search operations with rate limiting, TF-IDF based relevance scoring, keyword proximity analysis, Google search integration, and more.

mcp-svelte-docs is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a comprehensive reference guide for Svelte 5, helping LLMs provide accurate guidance when users are working with Svelte. It includes migration patterns from Svelte 4 to Svelte 5 and serves as a detailed reference for Svelte 5 features, common mistakes, and best practices.

MCP Tool Kit is a modular server implementation for building high-precision vertical AI agents. It provides a unified interface for Claude to interact with various external systems and tools, including file system operations, web search, time tools, browser automation, financial data, and more. Key features include reducing cognitive load on Claude, encapsulating domain knowledge, simplifying error handling, enabling complex workflows, and maintaining conversational flow.

Model Context Protocol server for Zotero is a python server that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for Zotero, allowing access to your Zotero library within AI assistants. Key features include searching for items in your Zotero library, retrieving detailed metadata information, and getting the full text of specific Zotero items. The server can be configured to use either the local Zotero API or the Zotero Web API.

mcp-omnisearch is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides unified access to multiple search providers and AI tools. It combines the capabilities of Tavily, Perplexity, Kagi, Jina AI, Brave, and Firecrawl to offer comprehensive search, AI responses, content processing, and enhancement features through a single interface. Key features include various search tools, AI response tools, content processing tools, and enhancement tools.

Minecraft MCP Server is a Minecraft bot powered by large language models and the Mineflayer API, using the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to enable AI models like Claude to control a Minecraft character. Key features include movement, flight, inventory management, block interaction, entity interaction, and in-game communication commands. The bot can be controlled through Claude Desktop and supports image uploads for building structures.

MCP Server for Chronulus is a tool that allows users to chat with Chronulus AI Forecasting & Prediction Agents in Claude. It provides instructions for installation, configuration, and usage of the MCP server through various methods including pip, docker, and uvx. The setup includes integration with third-party servers and detailed preferences for using tools like Filesystem and Chronulus Agents.

Spotify MCP Server is a lightweight Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to control Spotify playback and manage playlists. Main features include search, getNowPlaying, getMyPlaylists, getPlaylistTracks, getRecentlyPlayed, playMusic, pausePlayback, skipToNext, skipToPrevious, createPlaylist, addTracksToPlaylist, and addToQueue.

Ollama MCP Server is a powerful bridge between Ollama and the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling seamless integration of Ollama's local LLM capabilities into MCP-powered applications. Main features include full API coverage, OpenAI-compatible chat, model management, model execution with customizable prompts, and server control. It also supports advanced configurations and is built for developers to integrate AI models locally with full control and privacy.

SkyDeckAI Code is an MCP server that provides a comprehensive set of tools for AI-driven development workflows. Features include file system operations, code analysis using tree-sitter for multiple programming languages, code execution, web content fetching with HTML-to-markdown conversion, multi-engine web search, code content searching, and system information retrieval. It is designed to enhance AI's capability to assist in software development tasks by providing direct access to both local and remote resources.

Comprehensive WordPress MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to interact with WordPress sites through the WordPress REST API. It provides tools for managing all aspects of WordPress programmatically, including posts, users, comments, categories, tags, and custom endpoints. Features include post management, user management, comment management, taxonomy management, site information retrieval, and support for custom REST API endpoints.

AgentQL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates AgentQL's data extraction capabilities. It allows users to extract structured data from web pages using natural language prompts. Key features include web data extraction, integration with multiple IDEs such as Claude, Cursor, and Windsurf, and support for development and debugging.

Stability AI MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that integrates with Stability AI's image manipulation functionalities, such as generating, editing, and upscaling images. It provides a range of tools for image generation, background removal, outpainting, search and replace, upscaling, and more. The server is designed to be user-friendly with minimal configuration and can be used with various MCP clients, including Claude Desktop. It requires a Stability AI API key and supports both local and cloud storage for generated images.

VSCode MCP is a monorepo containing the VSCode MCP Server and its companion VSCode Extension, enabling AI agents and assistants to interact with VSCode through the Model Context Protocol. Main features include creating and showing diffs, opening files and projects, checking extension status, getting extension port, and listing available projects.

Git MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools to interact with Git repositories, enabling LLMs and AI agents to perform Git operations like clone, commit, push, pull, branch, diff, log, status, and more. It includes features such as direct Git CLI execution, comprehensive command coverage, repository interaction, working directory management, and safety features for potentially destructive operations. The server is built on the `mcp-ts-template` and provides a standardized, secure, and efficient way to expose Git functionality via the MCP standard.

Argo CD MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Argo CD, enabling AI assistants to interact with Argo CD applications through natural language. It supports both stdio and SSE transport modes, provides complete Argo CD API integration, and includes pre-configured tools for AI assistants. Key features include Application Management and Resource Management tools, and it can be integrated with Visual Studio Code, Cursor, and Claude Desktop.

ComfyUI MCP Server is a lightweight Python-based MCP server that interfaces with a local ComfyUI instance to generate images programmatically via AI agent requests. It supports flexible workflow selection, dynamic parameters (prompt, width, height, and model), and returns image URLs served by ComfyUI. The project includes setup instructions, usage examples, and a test client for sending MCP requests.

Mermaid MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that converts Mermaid diagrams to PNG images. It supports multiple diagram themes, customizable background colors, and uses Puppeteer for high-quality headless browser rendering. The server can return images directly or save them to disk, and it integrates seamlessly with AI assistants and other applications.

Bright Data MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enhances AI agents with real-time web data. It provides features such as real-time web access, bypassing geo-restrictions, web unlocker, browser control, and seamless integration with MCP-compatible AI assistants. The server allows for web scraping, content extraction, and remote browser automation, making it a powerful tool for accessing and interacting with web data.

Telegram MCP server is a bridge between the Telegram API and AI assistants, enabling capabilities such as getting account information, listing dialogs, marking dialogs as read, retrieving messages, and sending draft messages. It supports various installation methods including Homebrew, NPX, and from source, and requires authorization with the Telegram API.

Daipendency MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Daipendency, which is used to extract narrative and API documentation for a dependency of a local project. The server is implemented in TypeScript and provides JS bindings for Daipendency, which is originally implemented in Rust.

Deepseek R1 MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for the Deepseek R1 language model, optimized for reasoning tasks with an 8192 token context window. Key features include advanced text generation, configurable parameters, robust error handling, full MCP protocol support, Claude Desktop integration, and support for both DeepSeek-R1 and DeepSeek-V3 models.

library-mcp is an MCP server for interacting with Markdown knowledge bases. It allows users to retrieve and search content by tags, text, slug or URL, and date range. The tool also provides tag management and maintenance features. It is designed to work locally on a user's laptop and is particularly useful for managing and searching through large collections of Markdown files.

Vectorize MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with Vectorize for advanced vector retrieval and text extraction. Main features include document retrieval, text extraction and chunking, deep research, and support for various IDEs like VS Code, Claude, Windsurf, Cursor, and Cline.

Datadog MCP Server is a tool for interacting with the Datadog API, enabling incident management, monitoring, and other observability features. It provides a wide range of functionalities such as listing and getting incidents, fetching monitor statuses, retrieving logs, managing dashboards, querying metrics, and more. The server is designed to be extensible and can integrate with additional Datadog APIs.

Jadx MCP Plugin is a Java plugin that exposes the Jadx API over HTTP, enabling live interaction through MCP clients like Claude. It provides tools for decompiling and analyzing Android apps, including listing classes, searching for methods, and extracting code. The project includes a Python FastMCP adapter to bridge Claude and the Jadx plugin, facilitating intelligent navigation and automation of reverse engineering workflows.

xcodebuild MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that builds and tests iOS workspaces/projects, enabling a seamless workflow for working with iOS projects in Visual Studio Code. It supports tools like Cline or Roo Code and can be installed using uv or pip. The main features include building and testing iOS Xcode workspace/project, and it integrates well with Claude.app.

X(Twitter) MCP server is a tool that allows users to create, manage, and publish X/Twitter posts directly through Claude chat. It supports various actions such as tweeting, creating threads, managing drafts, and more. The setup involves installing the server via Smithery or manually, and configuring it with X/Twitter API credentials.

python_local MCP Server provides an interactive Python REPL (Read-Eval-Print Loop) environment. It includes features such as a custom `repl://` URI scheme for accessing session history, a tool to execute Python code in a persistent session, and support for both expressions and statements. The server also offers configuration options for installation, building, and publishing, as well as debugging tools like the MCP Inspector.

LanceDB MCP Server for LLMS is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables LLMs to interact directly with on-disk documents through agentic RAG and hybrid search in LanceDB. Key features include LanceDB-powered serverless vector index and document summary catalog, efficient use of LLM tokens, and local data storage for security. The server provides tools for catalog and chunk searches, allowing users to ask questions about the dataset or specific documents.

Dev.to MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server implementation that allows AI assistants to access and interact with Dev.to content. Key features include fetching the latest and trending articles, searching for articles by various criteria, getting detailed information about specific articles and users, creating and publishing new articles, updating existing articles, and using a caching mechanism to improve performance and reduce API calls.

Titan Memory MCP Server is a neural memory system for LLMs that can learn and predict sequences while maintaining state through a memory vector. Key features include neural memory architecture, memory management, MCP integration, text encoding, and memory persistence. It provides tools for initializing the model, performing forward passes, training, managing memory, and more.

Advanced Unity MCP Integration provides a seamless integration between Model Context Protocol (MCP) and the Unity Editor, allowing AI assistants to understand and interact with Unity projects in real-time. Features include browsing and manipulating project files, accessing real-time information about the Unity project, understanding the scene hierarchy and game objects, executing C# code directly in the Unity Editor, monitoring logs and errors, controlling the Editor's play mode, and waiting for code execution. The integration also includes powerful filesystem tools for file operations within the Unity project directory.

MCP Tavily is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Tavily API, providing advanced search and content extraction capabilities. Main features include multiple search tools (basic search, context-aware search, Q&A focused search), content extraction from URLs, rich configuration options, and extensive search and extract options.

Xero MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Xero, providing a bridge between the MCP protocol and Xero's API. It offers features such as Xero OAuth2 authentication, contact management, chart of accounts management, invoice creation and management, and MCP protocol compliance. The server supports various commands for retrieving and managing financial data, including accounts, contacts, invoices, and payroll information.

Perplexity Chat MCP Server is a Python-based interface to the Perplexity API, providing tools for querying responses, maintaining chat history, and managing conversations. It supports model configuration via environment variables and stores chat data locally. Key features include ask_perplexity, chat_perplexity, list_chats_perplexity, read_chat_perplexity, persistent chat history, and a web UI for easier interaction and management of chats.

Figma MCP Python is a tool that allows AI coding agents to access Figma files and prototypes directly. It provides integration with popular IDEs like Cursor and Windsurf, and can be installed and configured using pipx or an MCP configuration file. The tool supports setting up the environment and testing locally.

MCP Thinking Server is designed to extract and utilize the chain of thought from the Deepseek R1 reasoning model, which can be used in Claude Desktop or any MCP client. The server requires the installation of dependencies and setting up with a Deepseek API key. It also includes a setup script for creating the MCP config file and a testing environment.

Ollama MCP Server is a powerful bridge between Ollama and the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling seamless integration of Ollama's local LLM capabilities into MCP-powered applications. Key features include full API coverage, OpenAI-compatible chat, local LLM power, model management, model execution, and server control. It supports pulling and running models, chat completion, and creating custom models.

Rootly MCP Server is an MCP server for the Rootly API that integrates with MCP-compatible editors like Cursor, Windsurf, and Claude. It allows users to resolve production incidents in under a minute without leaving their IDE. Key features include dynamically generated MCP tools based on Rootly's OpenAPI specification, default pagination for incident endpoints, and limited API paths exposed for context size and security reasons.

JVM MCP Server is a JVM monitoring MCP server implementation based on Arthas, providing a simple and easy-to-use Python interface for monitoring and analyzing Java processes. Key features include automatic download and management of Arthas tools, support for local and remote Java process monitoring, real-time JVM thread and memory usage information, class loading information, method call monitoring, dynamic log level adjustment, and AI-driven JVM performance analysis.

Google Workspace MCP Server is a tool that integrates with Google Workspace to provide enhanced control and automation for Gmail, Calendar, and Drive. Key features include simplified attachment handling, streamlined email responses, robust attachment indexing, efficient file management, and automatic cleanup of expired attachments. It also offers tools for account management, Gmail operations, calendar event management, contact operations, and drive file and folder management.

Google Sheets MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration with Google Sheets, allowing the LLM to list all the spreadsheets of the user, create new spreadsheets, copy spreadsheets, write and edit cells, and use a fill tool for cells. It requires setting up a Google Cloud project, enabling the Google Drive API, configuring an OAuth consent screen, creating an OAuth Client ID, and using the credentials.json file for authentication.

PubMed Analysis MCP Server is a professional tool for analyzing PubMed medical literature to help researchers quickly gain insights into medical research dynamics. Main features include Literature Retrieval, Hotspot Analysis, Trend Tracking, Publication Count, and Comprehensive Reports.

mcp-memory-libsql is a high-performance, persistent memory system for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) powered by libSQL. It provides vector search capabilities and efficient knowledge storage. Key features include high-performance vector search, persistent storage of entities and relations, semantic search, knowledge graph management, and compatibility with both local and remote libSQL databases. The server also supports secure token-based authentication for remote databases.

Memory Bank MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for remote memory bank management. It provides multi-project support, remote accessibility, and core operations such as read/write/update memory bank files, list available projects, and list files within projects. The server ensures proper isolation between project memory banks and maintains consistent file structure and validation.

SQLite Explorer MCP Server provides safe, read-only access to SQLite databases through Model Context Protocol (MCP). It includes features such as query validation and sanitization, parameter binding, row limit enforcement, and detailed schema information. The server can be installed for use with Claude Desktop or the Cline VSCode plugin.

IDA Pro MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to interact with IDA Pro for reverse engineering and binary analysis tasks. Main features include executing Python scripts in IDA Pro, retrieving information about binaries, advanced binary analysis capabilities, and automating IDA Pro operations through a standardized interface.

godoc-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides efficient access to Go documentation. It helps LLMs understand Go projects by providing direct access to package documentation without needing to read entire source files. Key features include token efficiency, structured information, project navigation, integration readiness, performance optimization, and local documentation access.

The Game Asset Generator is a tool that simplifies game asset creation by leveraging AI-powered generation. It supports generating 2D and 3D game assets from text prompts, integrating with Hugging Face Spaces and the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Key features include 2D and 3D asset generation, multiple 3D model spaces, MCP integration, file management, robust input validation, multi-client support, secure remote access, and extensible backend.

Vibe Check MCP is a metacognitive oversight tool designed to prevent AI agents from overcomplicating simple tasks. It includes features such as pattern interrupts, plan simplification, and self-improving feedback loops to enhance the effectiveness of AI workflows. The main tools are vibe_check, vibe_distill, and vibe_learn, which help in breaking tunnel vision, recalibrating complex workflows, and building pattern recognition over time, respectively.

MCP Guide Server (v0.1.5) is a beginner-friendly Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that helps users understand MCP concepts, provides interactive examples, and lists available MCP servers. It includes features such as concept explanations, a server directory, interactive examples, and tutorial prompts. The server is designed to be a helpful companion for developers working with MCP.

Square Model Context Protocol Server (Beta) allows AI assistants to interact with Square's connect API, providing a streamlined set of tools for payment processing, customer and order management, and more. Features include integration with AI assistants, remote and local MCP server options, OAuth authentication, and a wide range of services such as Apple Pay, bank account management, booking, card management, and more.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial and crypto data, and can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude for financial analysis.
AutoCAD MCP 服务器是一个基于Model Context Protocol (MCP)的集成服务器，允许通过自然语言与AutoCAD进行交互。主要功能包括自然语言交互、基础绘图、图层管理、专业图纸生成、图纸分析、文本模式查询和数据库集成。

Linear MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides access to Linear's issue tracking system. It offers features such as creating and updating issues, advanced search with powerful filtering, project management, and comprehensive error handling. The server is built with TypeScript, uses Linear's official SDK, and supports type-safe operations, rate limiting, and clean data transformation.

MCPunk is a tool that allows developers to chat with their codebase without using embeddings. It intelligently searches and queries code chunks, providing context for the LLM to answer questions. Key features include intelligent code chunking, search and query capabilities, and integration with various MCP clients. It supports multiple programming languages and file types, and can be used for code review, PR reviews, and navigating multiple codebases.

Thoughtful Claude - DeepSeek R1 Reasoning Server enhances Claude's reasoning capabilities by integrating DeepSeek R1's advanced reasoning engine. Key features include advanced reasoning integration, enterprise-grade security, MCP protocol support, and a modern Python architecture. The server handles complex multi-step reasoning tasks and provides secure API key handling and streaming response handling.

Google Search MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides Google Custom Search functionality. It includes features for installation via Smithery, manual installation, and configuration with Google API key and Custom Search Engine ID. The server can be started using MCP or added to the Claude Desktop app.

McpDocServer is a development documentation server based on the MCP protocol, designed for various development frameworks. It provides multi-threaded document crawling, local document loading, keyword search, and detailed document retrieval. Key features include real-time accurate querying, context association, precise parameter matching, cross-platform compatibility marking, and example code. The server also supports custom crawling, automatic conversion to local formats, and has built-in tools for searching and retrieving document details.

Salesforce MCP Connector is a tool that allows users to interact with Salesforce data and metadata using natural language. It supports various functionalities such as getting insights, managing data, configuring the platform, creating and deleting objects and fields, and automating tasks. The connector can be used in both cloud and local environments and provides a wide range of supported Salesforce functions, including SOQL and SOSL queries, record management, and custom object and field creation.

Google News MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that provides Google News search capabilities via SerpAPI integration. Key features include flexible search options, global coverage, smart categorization, multiple result types, robust error handling, and language support. It supports multiple languages and regions, automatically categorizes news results, and offers comprehensive search capabilities such as query-based search, topic search, and publication filtering.

MCP 3D Printer Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows users to connect with and control various 3D printer management systems, including OctoPrint, Klipper, Duet, Repetier, Bambu Labs, Prusa Connect, and Creality Cloud. Key features include getting printer status, listing and uploading files, starting and canceling print jobs, setting temperatures, advanced STL file manipulation, and support for slicing and printing .3mf files on Bambu Lab printers.

Monkey - Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server is a .NET 9.0 implementation of an MCP server that facilitates interactions between components in a model-driven system. It includes core components like the MCP server, standard I/O transport, and custom tool integration. The server provides services such as fetching monkey data from an API, caching results, and exposing tools like GetMonkeys, GetMonkey, and Echo. It also supports configuration from multiple sources, dependency injection, and logging. Additionally, there is an alternative implementation using Server-Sent Events (SSE) over HTTP for web-based clients.

VS Code MCP Server is a Visual Studio Code extension that allows AI models and other MCP clients to interact with the VS Code workspace. Main features include listing and reading files, searching for symbols, creating and editing files, checking for diagnostics, and executing shell commands. The extension also provides a status bar indicator to toggle the server on and off.

Nexonco by Nexgene Research is an MCP server for accessing clinical evidence from the CIViC (Clinical Interpretation of Variants in Cancer) database. It enables fast, flexible search across variants, diseases, drugs, and phenotypes to support precision oncology. Main features include querying clinical evidence data with various filters, returning formatted reports with summary statistics, top evidence entries, sources, and citations.

Radare2 MCP Server is a tool designed for developers to integrate radare2 with AI assistants like Claude. It provides features such as direct stdin/stdout communication, basic tool capabilities, seamless binary analysis, and file exploration and inspection. The server can be installed via r2pm or Docker and configured to work with the Claude Desktop app.

mcp-difyworkflow-server is an MCP server application that implements the query and invocation of Dify workflows, supporting the on-demand operation of multiple custom Dify workflows. Key features include listing authorized workflows, executing a specified workflow with input, and configuration options for base URL, command, and API keys.

Phone MCP Plugin is a powerful tool that allows control of an Android phone through ADB commands. It provides features such as making calls, sending and receiving SMS, managing contacts, launching apps, and automating UI interactions. Key features include call functions, messaging, media control, app management, and UI automation.

Calculator MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for performing precise numerical calculations. It provides a `calculate` tool that evaluates given expressions. The server can be installed and run using `uv` or `pip`, and it integrates with MCP clients for easy configuration.

OpenStreetMap (OSM) MCP Server enhances LLM capabilities with location-based services and geospatial data. Features include geocoding, reverse geocoding, finding nearby points of interest, getting route directions, searching for places by category, suggesting optimal meeting points, exploring areas, finding schools, analyzing commutes, locating EV charging stations, performing neighborhood analysis, and finding parking facilities.

@pinkpixel/mem0-mcp MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Mem0.ai to provide persistent memory capabilities for LLMs. It allows AI agents to store and retrieve information across sessions. Key features include `add_memory` for storing text content, `search_memory` for retrieving memories based on natural language queries, and `delete_memory` for removing specific memories. The server supports both cloud storage (persistent) and local storage (non-persistent) modes, and it uses the mem0ai Node.js SDK for core functionality.

Minimax MCP Tools is an AI-powered tool that integrates with the Minimax API to provide image generation and text-to-speech functionality. Main features include high-quality image generation based on text prompts, and natural-sounding text-to-speech with various voice options, emotions, and audio formats.

MCP on AWS Bedrock is a project that demonstrates how to implement and use Anthropic's Model Context Protocol (MCP) with AWS Bedrock. It provides a client implementation that can interact with MCP-enabled tools through AWS Bedrock's runtime service. Key features include seamless integration with AWS Bedrock, tool format conversion for Bedrock compatibility, asynchronous communication handling, and structured logging for debugging.

mcp-miro MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that connects to the MIRO Whiteboard Application, allowing for board manipulation, sticky creation, bulk operations, and more. It supports OAuth key authentication and can be installed via Smithery or mcp-get. The server provides features such as creating stickies and shapes, reading board contents, and bulk creation, and it can be used with Claude Desktop.

iMessage Query MCP Server provides safe access to your iMessage database through Model Context Protocol (MCP). It allows LLMs to query and analyze iMessage conversations with features such as proper phone number validation, attachment handling, and read-only access. The server is built with the FastMCP framework and the imessagedb library.

App Store Connect MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the App Store Connect API. It provides tools for managing apps, beta testers, bundle IDs, devices, and user roles in App Store Connect. Key features include app management, beta testing, bundle ID management, device management, and user management. The server also includes proper error handling and supports installation and configuration on macOS and Windows.

Rijksmuseum MCP Server provides access to the Rijksmuseum's collection through natural language interactions. Features include searching and filtering artworks, retrieving detailed information about specific artworks, accessing high-resolution images, exploring user-created collections, and generating artist timelines. The server supports various use cases such as artwork discovery, analysis, and thematic exploration.

Frida MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for the Frida dynamic instrumentation toolkit, enabling AI systems to interact with mobile and desktop applications. Key features include process and device management, interactive JavaScript REPL, script injection, and full support for all MCP transport methods. It integrates with the official MCP Python SDK and can be used with Claude Desktop.

MCP Get Community Servers is a repository containing a collection of community-maintained Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. The main features include searching and retrieving content from LLM.txt files, making HTTP requests using a curl-like interface, and providing macOS-specific system information and operations. These servers are listed on the MCP Get registry and can be installed via CLI.

MCP Get Community Servers is a repository that contains a collection of community-maintained Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Key features include the ability to search and retrieve content from LLM.txt files, make HTTP requests using a curl-like interface, and access macOS-specific system information. The servers are listed on the MCP Get registry and can be installed via CLI.

MCP Get Community Servers is a repository that contains a collection of community-maintained Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. The available servers include LLM.txt Server for searching and retrieving content from LLM.txt files, Curl Server for making HTTP requests, and macOS Server for providing macOS-specific system information and operations. These servers can be listed, viewed, and installed via the MCP Get CLI.

MCP OpenAI Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with OpenAI's chat models, allowing seamless use of these models through Claude. Key features include direct integration with OpenAI's chat models, support for multiple models like gpt-4o, gpt-4o-mini, o1-preview, and o1-mini, a simple message passing interface, and basic error handling.

Deepseek Thinker MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) provider that offers reasoning content to MCP-enabled AI clients, such as Claude Desktop. It supports both OpenAI API and Ollama local modes, captures Deepseek's thinking process, and provides structured reasoning output. Key features include dual mode support, focused reasoning, and integration with AI clients.

Node.js Sandbox MCP Server is a tool for running arbitrary JavaScript in ephemeral Docker containers with on-the-fly npm dependency installation. Key features include starting and managing isolated Node.js sandbox containers, executing shell commands, installing npm dependencies, running ES module JavaScript snippets, and tearing down containers cleanly. It also supports detached mode for long-running servers and integrates with various clients like Claude Desktop and VS Code.

GhidraMCP is a Ghidra plugin that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for AI-assisted binary analysis. It bridges Ghidra's reverse engineering capabilities with AI assistants, providing features such as AI-Powered Binary Analysis, Natural Language Interface, Deep Code Insights, Binary Structure Analysis, Automated Security Analysis, and more. The plugin supports socket-based communication, cross-platform compatibility, and integration with various AI assistants like Claude.

CCXT MCP Server is a high-performance cryptocurrency exchange integration tool using MCP (Model Context Protocol) and CCXT. It supports 20+ cryptocurrency exchanges, various market types, and provides features like proxy configuration, optimized caching, and rate limiting. The server acts as a bridge between language models and cryptocurrency exchanges, allowing real-time market data access and trading operations through a unified API.

Travel Planner MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for interacting with Google Maps and travel planning services. It enables LLMs to perform travel-related tasks such as location search, place details lookup, and travel time calculations. Main features include tools like searchPlaces, getPlaceDetails, calculateRoute, and getTimeZone.

Obsidian MCP REST Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server implementation that provides access to Obsidian vaults through a local REST API. It allows AI assistants to interact with Obsidian notes and manage vault content. Key features include reading and writing notes, listing vault contents, search functionality, secure local REST API integration, and compatibility with Claude Desktop and other AI assistants.

Hugging Face MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides read-only access to the Hugging Face Hub APIs. It allows LLMs like Claude to interact with Hugging Face's models, datasets, spaces, papers, and collections. Key features include custom URI schemes for accessing resources, prompt templates for comparing models and summarizing papers, and various search and information retrieval tools for models, datasets, spaces, papers, and collections.

anki-mcp MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that integrates with Anki via the AnkiConnect plugin. It provides resources and tools for managing Anki decks and note models, including listing and accessing decks and models, creating and managing notes, and integrating with the AnkiConnect API. Features include listDecks, listModels, getModel, addNote, and addNotes.

Dynatrace MCP Server is a tool that allows interaction with the Dynatrace observability platform, bringing real-time observability data into the development workflow. Key features include real-time observability, fetching production-level data, fixing issues from monitored exceptions, logs, and anomalies, and querying log data using natural language. It also supports setting up notification workflows and integrating with Slack for alerts.

JSON MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for querying and manipulating JSON data. It provides tools for interacting with JSON data, including operations for array, string, numeric, date, and aggregation manipulations. Key features include support for JSONPath syntax, filtering, and various transformations.

Mesh Agent MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects to Heurist Mesh APIs, providing access to various blockchain and web3 tools. It supports cryptocurrency data, smart contract security, token metrics, and blockchain interaction. Features include connecting to the Heurist Mesh API, loading tools for Web3 use cases, supporting both SSE and stdio transports, and working with Claude in multiple interfaces. It also provides a hosted SSE endpoint and integrates with popular agents like CoinGeckoTokenInfoAgent, DexScreenerTokenInfoAgent, and more.

WebMCP is a proposal and code for websites to support client-side LLMs, allowing websites to share tools, resources, and prompts with LLMs. It includes features such as a widget for website owners to expose tools, secure token-based authentication, and a WebSocket server for communication between the MCP client, server, and web pages. The project aims to enhance the UX for users or agents by providing a unified list of tools from multiple connected websites.

Payload CMS 3.0 MCP Server is a specialized Model Context Protocol server designed to enhance the Payload CMS development experience. It provides code validation, template generation, and project scaffolding capabilities that follow best practices. Key features include code validation for collections, fields, globals, and config files, code generation for various components, and project scaffolding with validated options for consistency.
Cursor MCP 安装工具是一个专为 Cursor 用户设计的元服务器，可帮助用户一键安装和配置其他 MCP 服务器。支持从 npm 或 PyPi 安装服务器，并自动处理配置过程。主要功能包括一键安装、配置自动化以及兼容所有标准 MCP 服务器。

Code Assistant is a CLI tool built in Rust for assisting with code-related tasks. It features autonomous exploration of codebases, reading/writing files, working memory management, file summarization, interactive communication, and can run as an MCP server. It supports various LLM providers and offers multiple agent modes and tools for efficient codebase analysis and manipulation.

Model Context Protocol server for Zotero is a Python server that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for Zotero, providing access to your Zotero library within AI assistants. Key features include searching for items in your Zotero library, getting detailed metadata information about specific items, and retrieving the full text of specific items.

piapi-mcp-server is a TypeScript implementation of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with PiAPI's API. It allows users to generate media content, including images, videos, and music, using various tools like Midjourney, Flux, Kling, LumaLabs, Udio, Chrip, and Trellis. Key features include base image and video toolkits, text-to-image and text-to-video generation, music generation from video, TTS, and 3D model generation.

JIRA MCP Server integrates JIRA services with MCP, allowing you to fetch JIRA content for use with LLM. The server requires configuration of environment variables such as JIRA_API_KEY, JIRA_EMAIL, and JIRA_URL. It can be run using a simple Go command and provides an SSE service at a specified endpoint.

MCP PDF Tools Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides PDF manipulation tools. Main features include merging multiple PDF files into a single PDF, extracting specific pages from a PDF file, searching PDFs, and finding and merging related PDFs based on text extraction and regex pattern matching.

Knowledge Graph Memory Server is an implementation of persistent memory using a local knowledge graph. It allows for the creation, management, and querying of entities and their relations. Key features include entity and relation management, version tracking, and various API tools for creating, updating, and deleting entities and relations, as well as reading and searching the graph.

MCP LLMS.txt Explorer is a Model Context Protocol server for exploring websites with llms.txt files. It helps discover and analyze websites that implement the llms.txt standard. Key features include checking websites for llms.txt and llms-full.txt files, parsing and validating file contents, and accessing structured data about compliant websites. Tools provided include `check_website` and `list_websites`.

Roam Research MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides comprehensive access to Roam Research's API functionality, enabling AI assistants to interact with the Roam Research graph. Key features include environment variable handling, input validation, case-insensitive page title matching, recursive block reference resolution, markdown parsing, daily page integration, detailed debug logging, efficient batch operations, and hierarchical outline creation. The server also supports various operations such as fetching pages, creating pages and blocks, importing markdown, searching by text and tags, updating block content, and executing Datalog queries for advanced data retrieval and analysis.

Cloudflare Playwright MCP is a tool for automated browser testing and interaction, integrating with Cloudflare Workers and Browser Rendering. It supports various actions like navigating, clicking, typing, taking screenshots, and more. The project can be deployed to Cloudflare Workers and used with Cloudflare AI Playground or Claude Desktop. It also includes support for VSCode integration.

Supabase MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides comprehensive tools for interacting with Supabase databases, storage, and edge functions. It enables seamless integration between Supabase services and MCP-compatible applications. Key features include database operations, storage management, edge function invocation, user authentication, role-based access control, and robust error handling.

Azure AI Agent Service + Azure AI Search MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables Claude Desktop to search content using Azure AI services. It provides two implementations: Azure AI Agent Service (with document and web search) and direct Azure AI Search integration (Keyword, Vector, and Hybrid searches). Main features include AI-Enhanced Search, Multiple Data Sources, Source Citations, Flexible Implementation, and Seamless Claude Integration.

Binary Ninja MCP is a plugin and MCP server that provides seamless, real-time integration between Binary Ninja and MCP clients, enhancing reverse engineering workflow with AI assistance. Primary support is for Claude Desktop, but it is extensible for other integrations. Features include functions to get binary status, list classes, data items, exports, imports, methods, namespaces, segments, rename data and functions, search functions by name, decompile functions, set and get comments, and more.

Agent Care: An MCP Server for EMRs like Cerner and Epic is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides healthcare tools and prompts for interacting with FHIR data and medical resources on EMRs. Key features include EMR integration using SMART on FHIR APIs, OAuth2 authentication, Anthropic Claude Desktop integration, medical research integration (PubMed, Clinical Trials, FDA), response caching, error handling, null-safe data formatting, and comprehensive clinical analysis. The server also offers various FHIR and medical research tools.

An MCP Server for automating the PlayCanvas Editor using an LLM. It provides a variety of tools for managing entities, assets, scenes, and store operations. The server can be driven by Cursor or Claude Desktop, with detailed installation and configuration instructions provided.

The Redis MCP Server is a natural language interface for managing and searching data in Redis, designed for agentic applications. It supports full Redis data structures, including hashes, lists, sets, sorted sets, and streams, and provides features like natural language queries, seamless MCP integration, search and filtering, and high-performance data operations. The server can be integrated with various tools and platforms, such as OpenAI Agents SDK, Claude Desktop, and VS Code, and is useful for AI assistants, chatbots, data search, and event processing.

Knowledge Graph Memory Server is a tool for persistent memory using a local knowledge graph, allowing Claude to remember information about the user across chats and learn from past errors through a lesson system. It includes features like entity and relation management, observation handling, lesson creation, error pattern matching, and file management.

Cursor Rust Tools is an MCP server that allows the LLM in Cursor to access Rust Analyzer, Crate Docs, and Cargo Commands. It provides features such as getting documentation for a crate or specific symbol, hover information, references, and the output of `cargo test` and `cargo check`. The tool includes a UI for configuration and can be run with or without the UI. It also supports adding projects, installing `mcp.json`, and configuring Cursor to use the MCP server.
Jina Reader MCP Server is designed to fetch the content of a remote URL and convert it into Markdown format, making it useful for web content extraction and processing.

Excalidraw MCP Server is a comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables seamless interaction with Excalidraw diagrams and drawings. It provides LLMs with the ability to create, modify, query, and manipulate Excalidraw drawings through a structured, developer-friendly API. Key features include full Excalidraw element control, advanced element manipulation, resource management, easy integration with LLM platforms, and Docker support.

Alibaba Cloud Ops MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides seamless integration with Alibaba Cloud APIs, enabling AI assistants to manage and operate resources on Alibaba Cloud. It supports a wide range of cloud products including ECS, VPC, RDS, OSS, and CloudMonitor. Key features include running commands, starting and stopping instances, managing security groups, and monitoring resource usage.

GitHub Chat MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for analyzing and querying GitHub repositories using the GitHub Chat API. It allows users to index and analyze GitHub repositories, and then ask questions about the indexed repository. Key features include repository indexing, repository querying, and integration with tools like Claude and Cursor. The setup process involves installing dependencies, setting up environment variables, and configuring the MCP server.

Axiom MCP Server is a Zed extension for the Axiom MCP server. It requires configuration through a `config.txt` file containing your Axiom API token and integration with Zed's `settings.json` to specify the path to the configuration file.

DeepSeek-Claude MCP Server enhances Claude's reasoning capabilities by integrating DeepSeek R1's advanced reasoning engine. It supports intricate multi-step reasoning tasks and is designed for precision and efficiency in generating thoughtful responses. Key features include seamless integration, support for complex reasoning, and a complete setup guide.

OpenRouter MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides seamless integration with OpenRouter.ai's diverse model ecosystem. It offers features such as direct access to all OpenRouter.ai models, automatic model validation and capability checking, smart model information caching, automatic rate limit management, and a unified response format. The server also includes tools for chat completion, model search, model info retrieval, and model validation, along with structured error handling.

LMStudio-MCP is a Model Control Protocol (MCP) server that allows Claude to communicate with locally running LLM models via LM Studio. It enables users to check the health of the LM Studio API, list available models, get the currently loaded model, and generate completions using local models. The main features include health checks, model listing, current model identification, and chat completion generation.

TickTick MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for TickTick that enables interacting with your TickTick task management system directly through Claude and other MCP clients. Main features include viewing, creating, updating, and deleting projects and tasks, full integration with TickTick's open API, and seamless integration with MCP clients.

iOS Simulator MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides programmatic control over iOS simulators. Main features include listing available iOS simulators, booting and shutting down simulators, installing .app bundles on simulators, and launching installed apps by bundle ID.

Query MCP is an open-source MCP server that enables safe and efficient management of Supabase databases, including SQL query execution with risk assessment, automatic versioning of schema changes, and integration with Supabase Management API and Auth Admin SDK. Key features include robust transaction handling, safety controls, and support for multiple IDEs and MCP clients.

browser-use MCP server is an AI-driven browser automation server that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for natural language browser control. Key features include MCP Integration, Browser Automation, Visual Understanding, State Persistence, and Multi-LLM Support. It supports various LLM providers and provides detailed configuration options for browser and API settings.

NotionMCP Light is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that synchronizes Markdown files and Notion pages using the Notion API. It provides efficient synchronization without consuming LLM tokens. Key features include converting Markdown to Notion pages, converting Notion pages to Markdown, and providing MCP-compliant endpoints for integration with AI tools like Cursor and Cline. The project also includes installation instructions, usage examples, and JSON-RPC over stdio-based operations.

OmniMCP is a tool that provides rich UI context and interaction capabilities to AI models through Model Context Protocol (MCP) and microsoft/OmniParser. It focuses on enabling deep understanding of user interfaces through visual analysis, structured planning, and precise interaction execution. Core features include Visual Perception, LLM Planning, Agent Executor, Action Execution, CLI Interface, Auto-Deployment, and Debugging.

Bitcoin & Lightning Network MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI models to interact with Bitcoin and Lightning Network. It provides features such as key generation, address validation, transaction decoding, blockchain queries, and Lightning Network operations like invoice decoding and payment. The server can be integrated with Claude Desktop and Goose for enhanced functionality.

OpenAI WebSearch MCP Server provides access to OpenAI's websearch functionality through the Model Context Protocol, allowing AI assistants to search the web during conversations with users for up-to-date information. It supports one-click installation and configuration for Claude.app and Zed editor, and includes tools like `web_search` with required arguments such as `type`, `search_context_size`, and `user_location`. Manual installation and configuration instructions are also provided.

MCP Neo4j Server provides integration between Neo4j graph database and Claude Desktop, enabling graph database operations through natural language interactions. Main features include executing Cypher queries, creating nodes and relationships, and performing complex operations with natural language.

mcp-webcam is a tool that allows users to send live images from their webcam to Claude Desktop or other MCP Clients. It provides capture and screenshot tools, enabling the AI to take frames from the webcam or initiate taking a screenshot. The project includes an embedded Express server and is useful for building local, interactive MCP Servers.

fal.ai MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with fal.ai models and services. Key features include listing available models, searching for specific models by keywords, getting model schemas, generating content using any fal.ai model, support for both direct and queued model execution, queue management, and file upload to fal.ai CDN.

Airtable MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides tools for interacting with Airtable's API, enabling programmatic management of Airtable bases, tables, fields, and records. Key features include base and table management, field and record operations, and support for various field types and colors. It also includes system prompts and project knowledge to guide the LLM in Claude Desktop.

Terminal Controller for MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables secure terminal command execution, directory navigation, and file system operations through a standardized interface. Key features include Command Execution, Directory Management, Security Measures, Command History, Cross-Platform Support, and File Operations such as read, write, update, insert, and delete with row-level precision.

Build Agents with Needle MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows users to organize and store documents for quick retrieval, perform powerful searches via Claude’s large language model, and integrate seamlessly with the Needle ecosystem for advanced document management. Key features include Document Management, Search & Retrieval, and Easy Integration with Claude Desktop and Needle collections.

Slack Model Context Protocol Server is a connector that allows Claude Desktop (or any MCP client) to interact with your Slack workspace. It can post messages and query a list of all users. The server supports various Slack permission scopes, including app configurations, user management, message posting, and more.

Multi-Model Advisor is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that queries multiple Ollama models and combines their responses to provide diverse AI perspectives on a single question. It offers features like querying multiple models, assigning different roles/personas to each model, viewing available Ollama models, customizing system prompts, and integrating with Claude for Desktop.

CCXT MCP Server is a high-performance cryptocurrency exchange integration tool using MCP (Model Context Protocol) and CCXT. It supports over 20 cryptocurrency exchanges, multiple market types, and provides features like proxy configuration, optimized caching, and rate limiting. The server allows for real-time market data access and trading operations through a unified API, making it a powerful tool for developers and traders in the cryptocurrency space.

Xcode MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for building and testing Xcode projects directly from LLM applications. It provides features such as building Xcode projects with custom schemes and configurations, running unit tests with granular control, generating code coverage reports, streaming build and test logs in real-time, and accessing detailed build and test reports. The server also supports JSON-formatted output and automatic log persistence.

Chotu Robo Server is an MCP server for Arduino that integrates AI with hardware components like LEDs, motors, and sensors. It supports both wired (Arduino Nano 368) and wireless (NodeMCU ESP32) modes, allowing real-time control via REST API or WebSocket. The system uses the Johnny-Five library and MCP framework to handle AI-based commands, enabling features such as LED control, motor control, and sensor readings. The project can be extended with more advanced AI models, additional sensors, and a mobile or web interface.

mcp_mysql_server is a tool for MySQL database management and analysis. It supports CRUD operations, SQL execution plan analysis, table lock analysis, database health status, and more. Features include support for multiple SQL execution, Chinese field to pinyin conversion, permission control with three roles (readonly, writer, admin), and various tools for database analysis and management.
dify-server MCP 服务器是一个基于 TypeScript 的 Model Context Protocol 服务器，通过集成 Dify AI API 提供 Ant Design 业务组件的代码生成能力。主要功能包括聊天完成、支持文本和图片输入、流式响应处理等。

Cursor MCP - Claude Desktop Integration is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation that enables seamless integration between Claude AI and desktop applications through Cursor IDE. It provides real-time AI assistance, context-aware code suggestions and completions, and Windows automation for enhanced productivity. The tool supports both global and local installation, and includes features such as real-time AI assistance, context-aware code suggestions, and seamless integration with Cursor IDE.

HoudiniMCP is an integration that connects Houdini to Claude AI through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling prompt-assisted 3D modeling, scene creation, simulation setup, and rendering. This tool is useful for artists and 3D modelers who want to leverage AI for their creative processes.

MCP Task Manager is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for AI task management. It helps AI assistants handle multi-step tasks in a structured way, with features including task planning, progress tracking, user approval of completed tasks, project completion approval, task details visualization, and enhanced CLI for task inspection and management. The tool supports multiple LLM providers and provides a robust workflow for managing and approving tasks.

Facebook Ads MCP Server is a tool that provides an interface to Facebook Ads, enabling programmatic access to data and management features. It includes tools for account and object read, fetching collections, insights and performance data, and activity/change history. The server can be set up with easy one-click installers and supports integration with MCP-compatible clients.

Feishu/Lark OpenAPI MCP is a tool designed to help users quickly connect to the Feishu/Lark platform and enable efficient collaboration between AI Agents and Feishu/Lark. It encapsulates Feishu/Lark Open Platform API interfaces, allowing AI assistants to call these APIs for various automation scenarios such as document processing, conversation management, and calendar scheduling. Key features include complete API toolkit, dual authentication support, flexible communication protocols, and multiple configuration methods.

Bing Search MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Microsoft Bing Search API integration, allowing AI assistants to perform web, news, and image searches. Main features include web search for general information, news search for recent events and timely information, image search for visual content, rate limiting to prevent API abuse, and comprehensive error handling.

PocketBase MCP Server is a tool for interacting with PocketBase databases, providing advanced database operations, schema management, and data manipulation. Features include collection management, record operations (CRUD), user management, and database backup. It supports creating and managing collections, performing CRUD operations on records, handling user authentication and account management, and backing up the database.

MCP Server for Drupal is a TypeScript-based companion server that works with the STDIO transport for the Drupal MCP module. It supports web functionalities such as installation via Docker, compiled binary, and JSR package, authentication via environment variables, and exposes resources and tools defined by the Drupal API. The project is built with Deno and includes debugging and verification capabilities.

Rember MCP is a tool that allows users to create flashcards for spaced repetition learning. It integrates with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and can generate flashcards from chats and PDFs. Key features include creating flashcards from user inputs, support for Claude Desktop, and detailed best practices for building MCP servers.

The TikTok MCP integrates TikTok access into Claude AI and other apps via TikNeuron. It allows users to analyze TikTok videos for virality factors, get content from TikTok videos, and chat with TikTok videos. Key features include looking up available subtitles, getting subtitles in different languages, and retrieving detailed post information such as description, creator username, hashtags, and engagement metrics.

MCP Azure DevOps Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to interact with Azure DevOps services. Key features include work item management, project management, and team management. It provides functionalities such as querying, creating, updating, and managing work items, projects, and teams, and integrates with the Azure DevOps REST API.

MCP Tree-sitter Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides code analysis capabilities using tree-sitter. It offers features such as flexible exploration, context management, support for multiple programming languages, structure-aware analysis, searchable patterns, caching, symbol extraction, dependency analysis, and state persistence. The server is designed to give AI assistants intelligent access to codebases with appropriate context management.

DuckDuckGo MCP Server is a Node.js server that implements Model Context Protocol (MCP) for DuckDuckGo web search. The main feature is the ability to perform web searches using DuckDuckGo, with an API that accepts a query and returns an array of results.

MCP Server: Scalable OpenAPI Endpoint Discovery and API Request Tool is a powerful tool for discovering and making requests to OpenAPI endpoints. It supports remote OpenAPI JSON files, semantic search using optimized MiniLM-L3 model, FastAPI-based server with async support, and in-memory FAISS vector search for instant endpoint discovery. Key features include the ability to use remote openapi json file as source, no local file system access, and multi-instance configuration for multiple sets of APIs.

Alpha Vantage MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides real-time access to financial market data through the Alpha Vantage API. It offers features such as real-time stock quotes, detailed company information, real-time cryptocurrency exchange rates, and historical time series data for both stocks and cryptocurrencies. The server also includes built-in error handling and rate limit management.

Official Alpha Vantage MCP Server is a tool for accessing stock market data via the Alphavantage API. It includes configuration instructions, usage with Claude Desktop, and a demo video. Main features include easy setup, integration with the Alphavantage API, and community contributions.
The provided content is too brief to determine a specific category or main features. It only contains a title 'mcp' without any additional details.

Advanced PocketBase MCP Server is a comprehensive tool for interacting with PocketBase databases, providing advanced database operations, schema management, and data manipulation. Key features include collection management, record operations, user management, and database operations such as backup, restore, and migration. It also supports real-time event subscriptions and includes TypeScript type definitions for better development experience.

Zotero MCP Connector is a Model Control Protocol (MCP) connector that integrates your local Zotero with Claude, enabling direct read access to your local Zotero library through Claude's Desktop interface. It provides functions to list collections, get collection items, get item details, search the library, and get recently added papers.

Metoro MCP Server is a tool that allows interaction with a Kubernetes cluster via the Claude Desktop App. It leverages the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to enable seamless integration between LLM applications and external data sources. The server exposes APIs from the Metoro observability platform, which uses eBPF based instrumentation to generate deep telemetry for microservices running in Kubernetes. Key features include integration with the Claude Desktop App, Golang-based build, and support for both live and demo clusters.

Ollama MCP Database Assistant is an interactive chat interface that combines Ollama's LLM capabilities with PostgreSQL database access through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It allows users to ask questions about their data in natural language and get AI-powered responses backed by real SQL queries. Main features include a natural language interface to the PostgreSQL database, automatic SQL query generation, schema-aware responses, an interactive chat interface, and secure, read-only database access.

MCP LLM is an MCP server that provides access to LLMs using the LlamaIndexTS library. Main features include generating code based on a description, writing code directly to a file, generating documentation for code, and asking questions to the LLM.

shadcn-ui MCP Server is a TypeScript-based MCP server that provides reference information for shadcn/ui components. It helps AI assistants access component documentation and examples, including features like listing all available components, getting detailed information and usage examples, and searching for components by keyword. The server scrapes and caches information from the official shadcn/ui documentation site and GitHub repository, providing structured data such as component descriptions, installation instructions, usage examples, props, variants, and code samples.

mcp-excel-server is a project based on the Spring AI MCP framework that allows large language models (LLMs) to read from and write to local Excel files. Key features include reading Excel files (supporting .xlsx and .xls formats) and returning content in JSON format, writing JSON data to specified Excel files, and integration with MCP-compatible LLM clients like Claude, Cursor, and Cherry Studio.

Shopify MCP Server is a tool for interacting with Shopify store data through the GraphQL API. It provides features for managing products, customers, and orders, including search and retrieval of product information, customer data management, advanced order querying, and comprehensive error handling. The server also integrates directly with Shopify's GraphQL Admin API.

The Heroku Platform MCP Server is a specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation designed to facilitate seamless interaction between large language models (LLMs) and the Heroku Platform. Key features include direct interaction with Heroku Platform resources, secure and authenticated access to Heroku Platform APIs, and a natural language interface for Heroku Platform interactions. The server provides tools for application management, process and dyno management, add-on management, maintenance and logs, pipeline management, team and space management, and PostgreSQL database management.

Contentful MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with Contentful's Content Management API, providing comprehensive content management capabilities. Main features include full CRUD operations for entries and assets, space and environment management, content type management, localization, publishing control, bulk operations, and smart pagination.
