The server also includes development tools like MCP Inspector for debugging and testing, and supports various configuration options including app identity for authentication.

Vercel MCP Integration is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration for Vercel's REST API, providing programmatic access to Vercel deployment management. Key features include deployment monitoring and management, environment variable retrieval, project deployment status tracking, and CI/CD pipeline integration. Tools provided include listing deployments, retrieving specific deployment details, creating new deployments, managing projects, and handling environment variables.

omniparser-autogui-mcp is an MCP server that uses OmniParser to analyze the screen and automatically operate the GUI. Key features include automatic GUI operations, support for different languages, and configuration options for specifying the target window, backend load, and server communication.

Backlog MCP Server is an implementation that integrates the Backlog API, providing tools for project, issue, and wiki management. Main features include executing projects and issues get with pagination and filtering, adding, updating, and deleting issues, and managing wikis. The server can be configured with environment variables and used with Claude Desktop via NPX or Docker.

MCP REST API Tester is a TypeScript-based MCP server that enables testing of REST APIs through Cline. It allows you to test and interact with any REST API endpoints directly from your development environment. Key features include support for GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE methods, detailed response information, custom headers, request body handling, response size management, SSL certificate verification, and multiple authentication methods.

Hilanet MCP is a satirical project that provides HR-related tools for a corporate dystopia, including features like requesting a salary increase, filing complaints about managers, scheduling meetings during lunch, and more. It is designed for entertainment purposes and should not be used to sabotage a real workplace.

Azure Data Explorer MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Azure Data Explorer/Eventhouse in Microsoft Fabric. It provides access to Azure Data Explorer clusters and databases through standardized MCP interfaces, allowing AI assistants to execute KQL queries and explore data. Key features include executing KQL queries, discovering and exploring database resources, authentication support, Docker containerization, and interactive tools for AI assistants.

agentek is an extensible TypeScript toolkit that simplifies complex EVM blockchain interactions into composable, intent-based tools. It provides a unified, type-safe interface for both on-chain actions and off-chain data services, enabling developers to programmatically execute any blockchain operation across multiple EVM networks. The toolkit includes packages for the main tools, AI SDK integration, and an MCP server. Features include a wide range of tools for EVM operations, such as resolving ENS, getting token balances, executing transactions, and more.

Grasp is an open-source and self-hosted agentic browser that can integrate with other AI apps or agents. Key features include an isolated browser environment, human-like automation, and natural language control. It can be easily hosted on your machine or in the cloud, and it supports MCP and A2A integrations.

Rhino MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Rhino 3D, allowing AI assistants like Claude to create and manipulate 3D objects. The system consists of Python components that implement the MCP server and C# components that integrate with Rhino. Key features include 3D object creation and manipulation, multiple server implementations (combined, socket-based, standalone), and an improved logging system for centralized log management.

MCP Server Reddit is a Model Context Protocol server that provides access to Reddit's public API, enabling LLMs to interact with Reddit's content. It includes features such as browsing frontpage posts, accessing subreddit information, and reading post comments. The server uses redditwarp to interact with Reddit's public API and exposes the functionality through MCP protocol. Available tools include getting hot, new, top, and rising posts, as well as detailed post content and comments.

Speech MCP is a Goose MCP extension for voice interaction with modern audio visualization. It includes real-time audio processing for speech recognition, local speech-to-text using faster-whisper, high-quality text-to-speech with multiple voice options, and a modern PyQt-based UI with audio visualization. Key features include multi-speaker narration, single-voice narration, audio/video transcription, and robust error handling.

Meta Ads MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Meta Ads API, enabling AI models to access, analyze, and manage Meta advertising campaigns. Key features include AI-Powered Campaign Analysis, Strategic Recommendations, Automated Monitoring, Budget Optimization, Creative Improvement, Campaign Management, Cross-Platform Integration, Universal LLM Support, Simple Authentication, and Cross-Platform Support.

Iceberg MCP is a server for Apache Iceberg catalogs, supporting various catalog types such as Rest Catalogs, AWS Glue, Hive Metastore, and S3 Table. It provides tools for managing namespaces, tables, table schemas, and table properties. The server can be installed via a pre-built binary or built from source using Rust. It also includes client configuration and debugging instructions for integration with Claude Desktop.

Storm MCP Server with Sionic AI serverless RAG is a tool that facilitates the integration between LLM applications and RAG data sources and tools. It implements Anthropic's Model Context Protocol to enable seamless interaction, provides a standardized way to define and call tools, and offers file management and API integration features. The project structure includes main.py for initializing the MCP server, core/file_manager.py for file system operations, and various other components for handling different functionalities.

MCP Server Trello is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with Trello boards. It enables seamless integration with Trello's API, handling rate limiting, type safety, and error handling automatically. Main features include full Trello board integration, built-in rate limiting, type-safe implementation, input validation, and error handling.

human-mcp is an MCP server that allows AI assistants to leverage human capabilities. It accepts tool execution requests from MCP clients, writes instructions to an SQLite database, and uses a Streamlit application to display these instructions to humans. Human responses are then sent back to the AI assistant. Main features include various human tools such as human_eye_tool, human_hand_tool, human_mouth_tool, and more.

Bankless Onchain MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with on-chain data via the Bankless API. It provides features such as reading contract state, getting proxy and ABI, fetching event logs, and retrieving transaction history and details. The server supports various blockchain networks and can be integrated with AI models that support MCP.

DICOM MCP Server for Medical Imaging Systems enables AI assistants to query, read, and move data on DICOM servers (PACS, VNA, etc.). Core capabilities include querying metadata, reading DICOM reports (PDF), sending DICOM images, and utility functions. The server is designed for use with locally hosted open-weight LLMs for complete data privacy and is not intended for clinical use.

CrewAI Enterprise MCP Server is an implementation that provides deployed CrewAI workflows. It allows users to kick off their deployed crew and inspect the status, giving the results of the crew. The main tools include kickoff_crew and get_crew_status, and it can be used with Claude Desktop for managing and monitoring workflows.

DeepSRT MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides YouTube video summarization functionality. It supports generating summaries in both narrative and bullet-point modes, multi-language support, and seamless integration with MCP-enabled environments. Key features include content caching, efficient summary retrieval from CDN edge locations, and pre-cached content handling.

Gmail MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides Gmail integration capabilities to MCP clients like Claude Desktop. Main features include viewing recent emails, searching emails using Gmail's search syntax, and secure OAuth2 authentication with the Gmail API. The server also supports resource access to recent emails, tool support for email search, and automatic token refresh.

MiniMax MCP JS is a JavaScript/TypeScript implementation of MiniMax MCP, providing features such as image generation, video generation, text-to-speech, and voice cloning. It supports multiple transport modes (stdio, REST, SSE) and can be integrated with MCP-compatible clients like Claude AI and Cursor. The main features include Text-to-Speech (TTS), Image Generation, Video Generation, Voice Cloning, and dynamic configuration options.

MCP Prompts Server is a tool for managing prompts and templates with project orchestration capabilities. It provides features like storing and retrieving prompts, creating and using templates with variables, listing prompts with filtering by tags, applying variables to templates, multiple storage backends (file system, PostgreSQL, and MDC format), and easy integration with Claude and other AI assistants. The server also supports health check endpoints and can be deployed using Docker.

mcp-server-apache-airflow is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Apache Airflow, enabling seamless integration with MCP clients. It provides a standardized way to interact with Apache Airflow through the Model Context Protocol. The project includes features such as DAG management, DAG runs, task management, variables, connections, pools, XComs, datasets, monitoring, and more.

Academic Paper Search MCP Server is a tool that enables searching and retrieving academic paper information from multiple sources. It provides real-time academic paper search, access to paper metadata and abstracts, and the ability to retrieve full-text content when available. The server offers features such as `search_papers`, `fetch_paper_details`, and `search_by_topic` for comprehensive academic research.

Unichat MCP Server in Python is a tool for sending requests to various AI models using the MCP protocol. It supports predefined prompts such as code review, document code, explain code, and code rework. The server requires vendor API keys and can be installed via Smithery or set up manually. It also includes instructions for building, publishing, and debugging the package.

CircleCI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for CircleCI, allowing developers to use natural language to interact with CircleCI. Key features include retrieving build failure logs, finding flaky tests, getting the latest pipeline status, retrieving job test results, validating CircleCI configurations, creating prompt templates, generating test cases for prompt templates, and running pipelines. It supports integration with various IDEs and tools like Cursor, VS Code, Claude Desktop, Claude Code, and Windsurf.
飞书 MCP 服务器为 Cursor、Windsurf、Cline 等 AI 驱动的编码工具提供访问飞书文档的能力。主要功能包括文档管理（创建飞书文档）、文档内容操作（获取文档信息、编辑文档内容等）以及计划中的高级内容插入功能（表格、图表、流程图、公式等）。该服务器通过简化和转换飞书 API 的响应，确保只向模型提供最相关的文档信息。

MCP PowerShell Exec Server is a lightweight server that accepts and executes PowerShell scripts, returning the output in real-time. It enables AI assistants to understand and work with PowerShell. Key features include accepting PowerShell scripts via string input, secure execution in an MCP Server environment, and real-time results. The server can be integrated with GitHub Copilot in VSCode Insiders for enhanced functionality.

MCP Server To Markdown is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that leverages Cloudflare AI services to convert various file formats into Markdown descriptions. Key features include seamless integration with Cloudflare AI services, efficient Markdown description generation, comprehensive file format support, native Cloudflare tomarkdown API integration, user-friendly MCP interface, and cross-platform compatibility. Supported file formats include documents, images, web content, data, and spreadsheets.

WeCom Bot MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) compliant server implementation for WeCom (WeChat Work) bot. It supports multiple message types including text, markdown, image, and file messages, @mention support, message history tracking, configurable logging system, full type annotations, and Pydantic-based data validation.

Shell MCP Server is a Node.js implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that provides secure shell command execution capabilities. It allows AI models to execute shell commands in a controlled environment with built-in security measures. Key features include secure command execution with blacklist protection, command existence validation, standard I/O based transport, and comprehensive error handling. The server also integrates with Claude Desktop for connecting Claude with your shell.

AutoCAD LT AutoLISP MCP Server enables natural language control of AutoCAD LT 2024/2025 through AutoLISP code generation and execution. Key features include generating and executing AutoLISP code, creating basic shapes, handling block insertion with attribute management, connecting blocks, arranging multiple blocks, layer creation and management, creating hatches and dimensions, entity rotation and manipulation, and direct custom AutoLISP code execution.

mcp-langchain-ts-client is a LangChain.js client for Model Context Protocol, providing a port of rectalogic/langchain-mcp to the JS/TS LangChain and MCP APIs. It allows developers to initialize a toolkit, extract LangChain.js compatible tools, and use them with LLMs like ChatAnthropic.

CCXT MCP Server is a server that allows AI models to interact with cryptocurrency exchange APIs through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It uses the CCXT library to provide access to more than 100 cryptocurrency exchanges and their trading capabilities. Key features include market information retrieval, trading functions, trading analysis, position management, and risk management.

OpenTelemetry Collector MCP Server is an implementation for configuring OpenTelemetry Collectors. It provides features such as dynamic OpenTelemetry configuration, component management (add, remove, and configure receivers, processors, and exporters), and tools to update resources with the latest component information from GitHub. The server also lists available receivers, processors, and exporters, and retrieves configuration schemas for specific components.

PostHog MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with PostHog. It allows users to list projects, create annotations, and manage projects directly through Claude Desktop. Key features include listing available PostHog projects, creating annotations with optional timestamps, and searching for insights. The setup involves installing the necessary dependencies, configuring the environment, and setting up Claude Desktop.

OpenRPC MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides JSON-RPC functionality. Key features include the ability to call arbitrary JSON-RPC methods, discover available JSON-RPC methods, and integrate with Claude Desktop. The server can be built and run using npm, and debugging tools are available via the MCP Inspector.

MCP Tool Chainer is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that chains calls to other MCP tools, reducing token usage by allowing sequential tool execution with result passing. Key features include chaining multiple MCP tools together, passing results between tools, filtering and extracting specific data using JsonPath, automatic tool discovery, and minimal token usage compared to individual tool calls. It supports complex data processing workflows and improved performance.

Financial Datasets MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to stock market data. It allows AI assistants to retrieve income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news directly through the MCP interface. The server offers tools for getting financial statements, current and historical stock prices, company news, and crypto currency data.

Vertex AI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with Google Cloud's Vertex AI Gemini models, focusing on coding assistance and general query answering. Features include web search grounding, direct knowledge answering, configurable model settings, streaming API, retry logic, and a wide range of tools for query generation, research, analysis, and filesystem operations.

Superset MCP Integration is a tool that enables AI agents to connect to and control an Apache Superset instance programmatically. It provides features for managing dashboards, charts, databases, datasets, SQL queries, user information, and more. Key functionalities include creating, updating, and deleting dashboards and charts, executing and formatting SQL queries, listing and managing databases and datasets, and handling user roles and recent activity.

MCP Stripe Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that integrates with Stripe for handling payments, customers, and refunds. It provides a structured API to manage financial transactions securely, including features like secure payments, audit logging, error handling, and MCP integration. The server supports customer management, payment operations, and refund operations.

MCP Code Analyzer is a comprehensive code analysis and management tool that integrates with Claude Desktop. It analyzes code at both project and file levels, providing insights for needed changes and project understanding. Key features include Project Analysis, Code Analysis, File Operations, and Code Modify. The tool is currently in active development and has some known issues.

MCP DuckDB Knowledge Graph Memory Server is a forked version of the official Knowledge Graph Memory Server, using DuckDB as the backend to enhance performance, scalability, and query flexibility. It provides a relational database structure for storing and retrieving knowledge graph components, including entities, observations, and relations. Key features include fast query processing, SQL interface, transaction support, and indexing capabilities. The server also supports fuzzy search implementation using Fuse.js for flexible entity searching.

Salesforce MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server implementation for interacting with Salesforce through its REST API using jsforce. It provides features such as executing SOQL queries, retrieving object metadata, creating, updating, and deleting records, secure authentication handling, and real-time data access.

MCP-AppleMusic is a FastMCP server implementation for controlling Apple Music (formerly iTunes) on macOS through AppleScript commands. It provides various commands such as playback control, searching, and playlist management, making it a useful tool for managing and interacting with the Apple Music library.

Code Research MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides tools for searching and accessing programming resources across multiple platforms. It integrates with popular developer platforms such as Stack Overflow, MDN Web Docs, GitHub, npm, and PyPI to help LLMs find relevant code examples, documentation, and packages. Features include search functions for each platform, caching, and robust error handling.

Chess.com MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to Chess.com player data, game records, and other public information through standardized MCP interfaces. Main features include access to player profiles, stats, and game records, searching games by date and player, checking player online status, getting information about clubs and titled players, and Docker containerization support.

NS Travel Information MCP Server provides real-time train information, journey planning, service updates, pricing details, and station information for Nederlandse Spoorwegen (NS) trains. Features include real-time departures and arrivals, optimal travel routes, ticket prices, group pricing, station facilities, and multi-language support.
飞书MCP服务器是一个基于Model Context Protocol的服务，提供飞书API集成，使AI模型能够轻松与飞书服务交互。主要功能包括文档服务、机器人服务、聊天服务和多维表格操作等。支持多种通信模式（STDIO和HTTP），并提供详细的API文档和开发指南。

Steel MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables LLMs like Claude to navigate the web through Puppeteer-based tools and Steel. It provides browser automation capabilities such as navigation, clicking, typing, scrolling, and taking screenshots. Key features include web interaction, visual element identification, and support for both local and cloud modes.

tavily-search MCP server is a project that uses the Tavily API to perform searches based on specified queries. It returns search results in text format, including AI responses, URIs, and titles of the search results. The server can be installed via Smithery, integrated with Claude Desktop, and also supports local environment setup using Docker Compose. Key features include search functionality, optional search depth (basic or advanced), and support for various operating systems.

interactive-mcp is a Node.js/TypeScript MCP server that facilitates interactive communication between LLMs and users. It provides tools for requesting user input, sending notifications, and managing command-line chat sessions. Key features include `request_user_input`, `message_complete_notification`, `start_intensive_chat`, `ask_intensive_chat`, and `stop_intensive_chat`. The server is designed to run locally and is ideal for scenarios requiring direct user interaction, such as interactive setup, gathering feedback, and confirming actions.

MCP-scala is a Model Context Protocol server written in Scala 3, currently in ALPHA state. It supports automatic derivation of JSON Schema, defining custom tools, and stdio transport. The server can be used to generate random numbers, create sequences, and calculate sums. It also provides an example of how to implement and use these tools.

Perplexity MCP Zerver is a research-level Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides AI-powered research capabilities by interacting with the Perplexity website. Key features include web search integration, persistent chat history, tools for documentation retrieval, API finding, code analysis, and browser automation using Puppeteer. No API key is required as it relies on web interaction.

kagi-server MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that integrates the Kagi Search API. It provides tools for performing web searches and other operations using Kagi's API. The main implemented tool is `kagi_search`, which performs web searches with a query string and optional limit, returning search results from Kagi's API. Planned tools include summarization, quick responses, and enriched news results, but these are not yet implemented.

Coinmarket MCP Server is a tool for accessing and interacting with the Coinmarket API. It provides functionalities such as getting the latest currency listings and fetching quotes for tokens. The server requires a Coinmarket API key for configuration and can be integrated into development environments like Claude Desktop.

Things MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows you to use Claude Desktop to interact with your task management data in the Things app. It provides features such as access to all major Things lists, project and area management, tag operations, advanced search capabilities, recent items tracking, and support for nested data. The server leverages the Things.py library and the Things URL Scheme.

content_name: roo code memory bank mcp server
description: Roo Code Memory Bank MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI assistants to maintain project context across sessions by interacting with a file-based memory bank. Key features include initializing the memory bank, checking its status, reading and appending entries to memory bank files, and ensuring context persistence.

SEO Tools MCP Server is a comprehensive stdio MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for SEO APIs. It allows LLMs to interact with DataForSEO API functions and other SEO tools, enabling SEO analysis, keyword research, backlink analysis, and more. Features include comprehensive coverage of DataForSEO API endpoints, optional integration with third-party SEO tools, stdio transport for easy integration, authentication handling, detailed error reporting, and type-safe tool definitions with Zod schemas.

Dify as MCP Server is a Dify plugin that exposes Dify workflows as a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server to AI clients like Claude. Key features include support for MCP standard JSON-RPC interface, automatic tool discovery and registration, compatibility with Claude Desktop/Cursor, secure SSE connection, server-side session management, and adherence to the latest MCP Streamable HTTP specifications. The project supports stateless server mode, making it suitable for Dify's environment.

MCP Rust Documentation Server fetches and returns documentation for Rust crates, providing essential context for LLMs when working with Rust code. Key features include fetching documentation from docs.rs, formatting content for readability, limiting response size, and using the latest MCP SDK. The server can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude Desktop to look up and display Rust crate documentation.

The bonk-mcp server implements Solana blockchain functionality for the LetsBonk launchpad. Main features include token launching and trading, configuration with environment variables, and support for development, building, publishing, and debugging.

Web Browser MCP Server is a tool that enables AI assistants to browse and extract content from the web through a simple MCP interface. It provides features such as smart content extraction with CSS selectors, fast performance, rich metadata capture, robust error handling, and cross-platform support. The server can be installed via Smithery or manually, and it includes a powerful web browsing tool for extracting specific content from web pages.

Summarization Functions is an MCP server that provides intelligent text summarization capabilities, designed to enhance the performance and reliability of AI agents. Key features include Command Output Summarization, File Content Analysis, Directory Structure Understanding, Flexible Model Support, and AI Agent Context Optimization. It helps in managing context window overflow, improving response quality, and enhancing efficiency by providing concise, relevant summaries and storing full content for reference when needed.

Linear MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides access to Linear's issue tracking system. It offers features such as creating and updating issues, retrieving project information, advanced search capabilities, and comprehensive error handling. The server supports type-safe operations, rate limiting, and self-assignment of issues, making it a powerful tool for developers managing projects and issues in the Linear platform.

This MCP server provides Claude with access to Snowflake databases, enabling it to execute SQL queries, manage database connections, and handle query results and errors. Key features include secure Snowflake database access, robust error handling, automatic connection management, and query execution and result processing.

mcp-clj is a Clojure implementation of the Model-Channel Protocol (MCP) defined by Anthropic, providing both client and server components for MCP communication. It focuses on exposing Clojure REPL functionality over an SSE transport. The project aims to maintain compatibility with Anthropic's MCP specification while offering a simple and reliable implementation. Key features include adding mcp-clj as a dependency, starting the server, and configuring it with Claude Desktop using mcp-proxy.

yt-dlp-mcp is an MCP server implementation that integrates with yt-dlp to provide video and audio content download capabilities from platforms like YouTube, Facebook, and Tiktok. Main features include downloading subtitles in SRT format, video and audio downloads with resolution control, privacy-focused direct downloads, and integration with MCP-compatible LLMs.

TMDB MCP Server integrates with The Movie Database (TMDB) API to provide movie information, search capabilities, and recommendations. Key features include searching for movies by title or keywords, getting movie recommendations based on a movie ID, and retrieving trending movies. The server also provides comprehensive movie details such as title, release date, rating, overview, genres, poster URL, cast information, and director. It includes error handling for various issues and can be integrated with Claude Desktop.

Last9 MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that enables AI agents to bring real-time production context, including logs, metrics, and traces, into the local environment for faster code auto-fixing. It supports tools like get_exceptions, get_service_graph, get_logs, get_drop_rules, and add_drop_rule. The server can be integrated with IDEs such as Claude, Cursor, Windsurf, and VSCode, and it provides detailed configuration and installation instructions.

Memory Bank MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for remote memory bank management. It provides features such as multi-project support, remote accessibility, and core operations like read/write/update memory bank files, project listing, and file listing. The server ensures consistent file structure, validation, and proper isolation between project memory banks.

Comprehensive WordPress MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to interact with WordPress sites through the WordPress REST API. It provides tools for managing posts, users, comments, categories, tags, and custom endpoints. Features include post management, user management, comment management, taxonomy management, site information retrieval, and support for custom REST API endpoints.

MCP Communicator (Telegram) is an MCP server that enables communication with users through Telegram. It provides tools to interact with users via a Telegram bot, including asking questions, sending notifications, sharing files, and creating project archives. Key features include secure chat ID validation, error handling, and logging.

1Panel MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for automated website deployment to 1Panel. It automates the process of deploying websites, creating new sites if they don't exist, and uploading static website files. The server is fully compatible with the MCP standard protocol and can be configured in Cursor IDE. Key features include automating website deployment, creating new websites, and uploading static files with detailed upload statistics.

VeyraX MCP is a tool that allows users to access all their tools in any MCP-compatible environment with a single authentication. It supports integration with various IDEs and AI assistants like Cursor, Claude, Windserf, and VS Code. Key features include single authentication, instant access to all connected tools, and a quick 5-minute setup process.

Baseline MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides the support status of Web Platform APIs. It uses the Web Platform Dashboard API to fetch and return information about web features, including their baseline status (widely, newly, limited, no_data), browser implementation details, usage data, and more. The server can be used with various AI models and supports integration with MCP clients like Claude Desktop and Visual Studio Code.

mcp-email-server is an MCP server that provides IMAP and SMTP functionality. It can be installed using various methods including pip, uv, and Docker. The tool supports configuration through a UI and can be integrated with clients like Claude Desktop. It also includes detailed instructions for development and releasing new versions.

The Enterprise MCP Server (mcp-ectors) is an enterprise-ready, high-performance, and secure MCP server designed for seamless integration and interaction between large language models (LLMs) and various tools, resources, and workflow prompts. Key features include Wasm Wasix MCP Router, Wasm support, high performance with Rust and actors, reusable connections, and multiple routers. It is optimized for performance, security, and scalability, making it suitable for enterprise environments.

exa-mcp is an MCP server for Exa Search API, which is sponsored by ChatWise. It provides a way to integrate and use the Exa Search API through a command-line interface or a JSON configuration. The main features include setting up the server via stdio or SSE, and configuring it with environment variables or a JSON config file.

WolframAlpha LLM MCP Server provides access to WolframAlpha's LLM API, allowing users to query natural language questions, answer complicated mathematical questions, and get facts about science, physics, history, geography, and more. It supports structured responses optimized for LLM consumption, simplified answers, and detailed responses with sections. The available tools include `ask_llm`, `get_simple_answer`, and `validate_key`.

Raindrop.io MCP Server (Go) is an integration that allows LLMs to interact with Raindrop.io bookmarks. Main features include creating bookmarks, searching bookmarks, and filtering by tags. It requires Go 1.20 or higher and a Raindrop.io account with an API token. The server can be used with Claude for Desktop and provides tools for creating and searching bookmarks.

Jotai MCP Server is a tool for developers that requires Deno to be installed. It provides configuration details and resources such as the readme file from the official repository and a collection of tips available to sponsors.

MarkItDown MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that converts various file formats to Markdown. Supported formats include PDF, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Images (EXIF metadata and OCR), Audio (EXIF metadata and speech transcription), HTML, Text-based formats (CSV, JSON, XML), and ZIP files. The server can be integrated with any MCP client and supports commands for converting files to Markdown.

Linkup Python MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides web search capabilities through Linkup's advanced search API. It enables AI assistants and development tools to perform intelligent web searches with natural language queries. Key features include advanced web search, natural language queries, real-time information, comprehensive results, and easy integration with any MCP-compatible client.

Iceberg MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Apache Iceberg catalogs, supporting various catalog types such as Rest Catalogs, AWS Glue, Hive Metastore, and S3 Table. It provides tools for managing namespaces, tables, table schemas, and table properties. The server can be installed via a pre-built binary or built from source using Rust. It also includes client configuration and debugging instructions for integration with Claude Desktop.

NASA MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a standardized interface for AI models to interact with NASA's vast array of data sources. It includes access to over 20 NASA data sources, standardized data formats, automatic parameter validation and error handling, rate limit management, comprehensive documentation, and support for various NASA imagery formats. The server also includes security best practices, logging, and testing tools.

Hacker News MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that fetches and parses stories from Hacker News, providing structured data for different types of stories (top, new, ask, show, jobs). Features include fetching structured data with titles, URLs, points, authors, timestamps, and comment counts, configurable limits on the number of stories returned, and clean error handling and validation.

Readwise MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for accessing and interacting with your Readwise library. Key features include accessing highlights, searching for highlights using natural language queries, getting books and documents from the library, seamless integration with Claude and other MCP-compatible assistants, enhanced prompt capabilities for highlight analysis, transport-aware logging system, robust error handling, and MCP protocol compliance.

Hacker News MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for fetching information from Hacker News. Main features include fetching top, new, ask_hn, and show_hn stories, fetching comments associated with a story, searching for stories by query, and fetching user info.

SonarQube MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with SonarQube to provide AI assistants with access to code quality metrics, issues, and analysis results. Main features include retrieving code metrics and analysis results, accessing and filtering issues, checking quality status, and analyzing project quality over time. It supports both SonarQube and SonarCloud, provides comprehensive parameter validation using Zod schemas, and offers full TypeScript support.

This repository demonstrates a simple implementation of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Solana development. It provides basic RPC methods for Solana, such as getBalance, getAccountInfo, and getTransaction, along with helpful prompts for Solana development. The project includes ideas for extending the MCP server, such as adding a priority fee estimator, Solana verify debugger, security.txt inspector, and more.

Deep-research is an AI-powered research assistant that conducts deep, iterative research using search engines, web scraping, and Gemini LLMs. Key features include MCP integration, iterative deep dive, Gemini-powered queries, depth and breadth control, smart follow-up questions, comprehensive Markdown reports, and concurrent processing for speed. The tool uses Firecrawl for web data extraction and Gemini for advanced language understanding and report generation.

MCP-timeserver is a simple MCP server that provides datetime information to agentic systems and chat REPLs. It implements a datetime:// URI scheme for accessing the current date/time in a given timezone and exposes a tool to get the current local time in the system timezone.

AniList MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that interfaces with the AniList API, allowing LLM clients to access and interact with anime, manga, character, staff, and user data from AniList. Main features include searching for anime, manga, characters, and staff, getting detailed information about specific media, accessing user profiles and lists, and supporting advanced filtering options.

MCP Python Interpreter is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows LLMs to interact with Python environments, execute code, manage packages, and perform file operations. Key features include environment management, code execution, package management, and comprehensive file handling capabilities. It integrates with Claude Desktop and provides tools for common Python tasks like function creation and debugging.

Nostr MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI models to interact with the Nostr protocol, allowing them to post notes and interact with the freedom of speech protocol. Key features include posting notes to the Nostr network, connecting to multiple relays, MCP-compliant API for AI integration, and support for real-time communication via Server-Sent Events (SSE).

swagger-mcp is a tool designed to scrape Swagger UI by extracting the swagger.json file and dynamically generating well-defined MCP tools at runtime. It supports LLM models, requires an MCP client, and can be run in SSE mode. The tool provides various configuration options for API security and authentication, and it integrates with mcphost for further tool selection.

Telegram MCP Server is a tool that allows Claude to access your Telegram account to read and send messages. Main functions include getting a list of chats, sending messages, getting unread messages, marking messages as read, and getting conversation context. The setup involves obtaining Telegram API credentials, setting up a Python environment, exporting necessary environment variables, running authentication, and configuring Claude Desktop.

Reaper MCP Server is a tool that connects a Reaper project to an MCP client like Claude Desktop, enabling you to ask questions about the project. It includes tools for finding and parsing Reaper projects, and allows you to configure and use these tools through Claude Desktop.

Browser Control MCP is an MCP server paired with a browser extension that enables AI agents to manage the user's local browser, interact with open tabs, and use the browser for research and information retrieval. Key features include tab management, browser history search, and browsing and research capabilities. The MCP server supports actions like opening or closing tabs, reordering tabs, reading and searching browser history, and reading webpage content. It also allows users to select and load the contents of browser tabs into the MCP client. The extension is designed for Firefox and can be configured to limit the actions the MCP server can perform.

@flexpa/mcp-fhir is a TypeScript-based MCP server that connects to a FHIR server, providing core MCP functionality for interacting with FHIR resources. Main features include accessing FHIR resources via URIs, providing search capabilities for FHIR resources, and tools like `search_fhir` and `read_fhir` for searching and reading FHIR resources. The server also requires configuration with environment variables for the FHIR base URL and access token.

mcp-server-flomo is a TypeScript-based MCP server designed to help users write notes to Flomo. The main feature is the `write_note` tool, which allows writing text notes to Flomo by taking content as required parameters. It also includes development and installation instructions for setting up the server with Claude Desktop.

Algorand MCP Implementation is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for Algorand blockchain interactions. It includes a server package for blockchain interactions and a client package for wallet management and transaction signing. Key features include complete Algorand documentation integration, comprehensive blockchain interaction capabilities, extensive wallet management, and rich blockchain state querying. The project also provides built-in security features and supports Claude Desktop and Cursor integration.

OpenSCAD MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables users to generate 3D models from text descriptions or images, with a focus on creating parametric 3D models using multi-view reconstruction and OpenSCAD. Key features include AI Image Generation, Multi-View Image Generation, Image Approval Workflow, 3D Reconstruction, Remote Processing, OpenSCAD Integration, Parametric Export, and 3D Printer Discovery.

Voice Call MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants like Claude to initiate and manage voice calls using Twilio and OpenAI's GPT-4o Realtime model. Key features include making outbound phone calls, real-time audio processing, real-time language switching, pre-built prompts for common calling scenarios, automatic public URL tunneling with ngrok, and secure handling of credentials.

Memory Bank MCP Server is a tool designed to help developers build a structured documentation system for context preservation in AI assistant environments. It provides features such as getting detailed information about the Memory Bank structure, generating templates for Memory Bank files, and analyzing project summaries to provide suggestions for Memory Bank content. The server can be run using various methods including UVX, Smithery, Docker, or manually.

anki-mcp MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that integrates with Anki via the AnkiConnect plugin. It provides resources for Anki decks and note models, tools for creating and managing Anki notes, and integration with the AnkiConnect API. Key features include listing and accessing Anki decks and note models, adding single or multiple notes, and JSON representation of Anki objects.

Chroma MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides vector database capabilities through Chroma. It enables semantic document search, metadata filtering, and document management with persistent storage. Key features include semantic search, metadata and content filtering, persistent storage, and comprehensive error handling.

Modes MCP Server is an MCP server for managing Roo's custom operational modes, providing programmatic control over mode configuration and management. Main features include full CRUD operations for custom modes, schema validation with Zod, file system watching for config changes, error handling with standard MCP error codes, and atomic file operations. The server supports various operational modes such as Planning, Analytics, Research, Implementation, Troubleshooting, Quality Control, Integration, Documentation, and Session Management.

Votars MCP is a tool that supports multiple language implementations of the Votars MCP server, designed for seamless integration with the Votars AI platform. It provides features such as voice recording, transcription, real-time translation, intelligent error correction, AI summarization, and smart content generation. The tool supports two interaction modes: `sse` (Server-Sent Events) and `stdio` (Standard Input/Output).

MCP SSH Server is a powerful SSH server implementation for Model Context Protocol (MCP). It enables secure remote command execution and file operations through the SSH protocol, supporting both password and key-based authentication. Main features include secure SSH connection management, remote command execution, file operations (upload/download), progress tracking for file transfers, permission management, directory operations, bulk file transfers, and detailed logging.

ms-365-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Microsoft 365 services through the Graph API. It provides features such as authentication via MSAL, Excel file operations, calendar event management, mail operations, OneDrive file management, OneNote notebooks and pages, To Do tasks and task lists, Planner plans and tasks, Outlook contacts, user management, and dynamic tools powered by Microsoft Graph OpenAPI spec.

GitHub MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for LLM agents to interact with GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, and other GitHub resources. Key features include Repository Management, Issue Management, Pull Request Management, Branch Management, Commit Management, and Content Management. The server supports both GitHub.com and GitHub Enterprise instances and can be used with MCP clients like Claude Desktop and DevoxxGenie.

Salesforce MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server implementation that integrates Claude with Salesforce, enabling natural language interactions with Salesforce data and metadata. Key features include Object and Field Management, Smart Object Search, Detailed Schema Information, Flexible Data Queries, Data Manipulation, Cross-Object Search, and Intuitive Error Handling. It supports both Username/Password and OAuth2 authentication methods.

flstudio MCP is a server that connects Claude to FL Studio, allowing users to control and interact with FL Studio through MIDI and an MCP server. Key features include setting up virtual MIDI ports, configuring MIDI controllers, downloading necessary packages, and using the MCP to send melodies, chords, drums, etc. The project aims to enhance the integration of AI and music production.

Financial Datasets MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial data for both companies and cryptocurrencies, and integrates with Claude and other AI assistants.

MATLAB MCP Server is a powerful tool that integrates MATLAB with AI, allowing users to execute MATLAB code, generate MATLAB scripts from natural language descriptions, and access MATLAB documentation. Key features include executing and saving MATLAB code, generating MATLAB code from natural language, and accessing MATLAB documentation via URI.

Model Context Protocol Server for Apache OpenDAL is an MCP server implementation that provides access to various storage services. Key features include seamless access to multiple storage services (S3, Azure Blob Storage, Google Cloud Storage, etc.), listing files and directories, reading file contents with automatic text/binary detection, and environment variable-based configuration.

MCP Simple OpenAI Assistant is a server for interacting with OpenAI assistants, allowing tools like Claude Desktop to create and interact with these assistants. Main features include creating and manipulating OpenAI assistants, starting conversation threads, sending messages, and receiving responses. The server also implements a two-stage approach to handle long processing times.

MCP Coding Assistant is a powerful Python tool for software development tasks, supporting multiple LLM providers and Model Context Protocol (MCP) server capabilities. Key features include multi-provider support, real-time visualization, cost management, comprehensive tool suite, enhanced UI, context optimization, and agent coordination. It can be used in CLI mode, as an MCP server, or as an MCP client, and supports multi-agent synchronization for complex problem solving.

MCP Server for Prometheus is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to retrieve and analyze data from Prometheus databases. Salesforce CLI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides Salesforce CLI functionality to LLM tools like Claude Desktop. mentor-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides LLM Agents with second opinions and actionable insights via AI-powered Deepseek-Reasoning.
