CrateDocs MCP is a server that provides tools for Rust crate documentation lookup, allowing LLMs to look up documentation for Rust crates. Main features include looking up crate documentation, searching for crates on crates.io based on keywords, and looking up item documentation within a crate. The server includes a caching mechanism and interfaces with docs.rs and crates.io.

kospi-kosdaq-stock-server is an MCP server that provides KOSPI/KOSDAQ stock data. Main features include: lookup of ticker symbols and names, retrieval of OHLCV data, market capitalization, fundamental data (PER/PBR/Dividend Yield), and trading volume by investor type for specific stocks.

GitHub Actions MCP Server is a tool that enables AI assistants to manage and operate GitHub Actions workflows. It provides features such as complete workflow management, workflow run analysis, comprehensive error handling, flexible type validation, and security-focused design. The server is compatible with multiple AI coding assistants including Claude Desktop, Codeium, and Windsurf.

MCP Server is a Dify endpoint plugin that transforms a Dify app into an MCP server. It allows for the creation of a simple workflow app in Dify, adding an endpoint to the app, and using the endpoint URL with an MCP client like Cherry Studio. The plugin supports both the newest Streamable HTTP protocol and the legacy SSE protocol, and includes features such as input schema definition for chat apps and secure data handling within a private network.

REAPER MCP Server is a comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI agents to create fully mixed and mastered tracks in REAPER with both MIDI and audio capabilities. Main features include complete project management, track operations, MIDI composition and editing, audio recording and importing, virtual instrument and effect management, mixing and automation, mastering tools, and audio analysis and feedback.

Railway MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for integrating with the Railway.app platform. It allows users to manage their Railway infrastructure through natural language, including project management, deployment management, service management, variable management, and more. Key features include authentication with Railway API tokens, project and deployment management, service creation from GitHub or Docker, and full support for all templates.

cryptopanic-mcp-server provides the latest cryptocurrency news to AI agents, powered by CryptoPanic. The main feature is the get_crypto_news function, which fetches news, analysis, or videos based on the specified content type and number of pages. Configuration requires a CryptoPanic API key.

Google Calendar MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Google Calendar, built with TypeScript. It features seamless Google Calendar integration with OAuth 2.0 authentication, persistent token storage, comprehensive event operations (create, read, update, delete), and real-time updates via Server-Sent Events (SSE). The server can be easily integrated with Claude and other MCP-compatible AI assistants.

Vibe-Eyes is an MCP server that enables LLMs to 'see' what's happening in browser-based games and applications through vectorized canvas visualization and debug information. Key capabilities include capturing and vectorizing canvas elements, collecting console logs and errors in real-time, catching unhandled exceptions with full stack traces, and making the visual and debug information available to LLMs via MCP. The system uses a client-server architecture with a lightweight browser client and a Node.js server, and it supports WebSocket communication to avoid CORS issues.

Branch Thinking is an MCP server that implements branch-based thought navigation, supporting multiple branches of thought, branch navigation, cross-references between related thoughts, insight generation from key points, and branch priority tracking. Key features include Branch Management, Cross References, Insights, and Priority Tracking. It can be used to enhance step-by-step thinking and generate more structured and insightful responses.

Monday.com MCP server is a tool that enables MCP clients to interact with Monday.com boards, items, updates, and documents. It provides a variety of tools for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting items, boards, and groups in Monday.com. The server supports operations such as listing boards, creating new items, moving items between groups, and managing documents. It can be set up using personal API tokens and workspace names, and can be installed and run using various methods including Docker, Smithery, and Claude Desktop.

LLDB-MCP is a tool that integrates the LLDB debugger with Claude's Model Context Protocol (MCP). It enables AI-assisted debugging workflows, allowing users to start, manage, and interact with LLDB debugging sessions. Features include session management, program loading, execution control, breakpoints and watchpoints, inspection, and thread management. The tool provides a comprehensive set of commands for working with LLDB, making it a powerful tool for developers.
azure-devops-mcp-server is an MCP server designed for Azure DevOps, providing integration and support for development and operations tasks within the Azure DevOps environment.

Flightradar24 MCP Server is a Claude Desktop MCP server that helps you track flights in real-time using Flightradar24 data. It is perfect for aviation enthusiasts, travel planners, or anyone curious about flights overhead. Main features include tracking any flight in real-time, getting arrival and departure times for specific flights, viewing the status of flights at an airport, and monitoring emergency flights.

Unstructured API MCP Server is a tool for interacting with the Unstructured API, providing features to manage sources, destinations, and workflows. It supports various connectors like S3, Azure, Google Drive, and more, and includes tools for listing, creating, updating, and deleting connectors and workflows. The server also integrates with Firecrawl for web crawling and LLM-optimized text generation.

Semantic Scholar MCP Server is a FastMCP server implementation for the Semantic Scholar API, providing comprehensive access to academic paper data, author information, and citation networks. Main features include full-text search with advanced filtering, citation network exploration, author search and profile details, complex search with multiple ranking strategies, customizable field selection, efficient batch operations, rate limiting compliance, and support for both authenticated and unauthenticated access.

LinkedIn Browser MCP Server is a FastMCP-based server for LinkedIn automation and data extraction using browser automation. It provides tools for interacting with LinkedIn programmatically while respecting LinkedIn's terms of service and rate limits. Main features include secure authentication, profile operations, post interactions, encrypted cookie storage, rate limiting protection, and session persistence.

blender-open-mcp is an open source project that integrates Blender with local AI models (via Ollama) using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It allows users to control Blender using natural language prompts, enabling 3D modeling tasks such as creating and modifying objects, applying materials, and rendering images. Features include MCP integration, Ollama support, a Blender add-on for user interface, and optional PolyHaven integration for asset downloads.

shell-command-mcp is an MCP server for executing shell commands. It can be configured manually or via a JSON config. The project allows users to specify allowed commands using the `ALLOWED_COMMANDS` environment variable, ensuring security and control over the commands that can be executed.

Security Audit Tool is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) Server that audits npm package dependencies for security vulnerabilities. It provides real-time security vulnerability scanning, remote npm registry integration, detailed vulnerability reports with severity levels, support for multiple package managers, automatic fix recommendations, CVSS scoring, and CVE references.

MCP Database Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides database access capabilities to Claude, supporting SQLite, SQL Server, and PostgreSQL databases. It includes features such as direct usage with NPM package, local development setup, and various database tools like read_query, write_query, create_table, alter_table, drop_table, list_tables, describe_table, export_query, append_insight, and list_insights.

Video Editor MCP Server is a powerful video editing tool that leverages FFmpeg to perform various video editing operations through natural language commands. Main features include trimming, merging, converting formats, adjusting speed, adding audio tracks, extracting audio, adding subtitles, and applying basic filters. The server also provides real-time progress tracking, error handling, and security considerations.

Multi-Database MCP Server by Legion AI is a tool that helps people access and query data in multiple databases using the Legion Query Runner with integration of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) Python SDK. Key features include a unified multi-database interface, AI-ready integration, zero-configuration schema discovery, secure credential management, and support for various deployment options. It supports multiple databases like PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Server, and more.

Aider MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to offload AI coding tasks to Aider, enhancing development efficiency and flexibility. It provides functionalities such as offloading AI coding tasks, listing available models, and integrates with various AI models like Gemini, GPT-4, and more. The server is structured into layers for handling MCP protocol communication, core functional components, and utility functions, and is thoroughly tested for reliability.

mcp-jinaai-reader is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for integrating Jina.ai's Reader API with LLMs, providing efficient and comprehensive web content extraction capabilities. Main features include advanced web content extraction, fast and efficient content retrieval, complete text extraction with preserved structure, clean format optimized for LLMs, support for various content types including documentation, and built on the Model Context Protocol.

MCP-wolfram-alpha is a MCP server that connects to the Wolfram Alpha API, allowing users to query and retrieve information from Wolfram Alpha. It includes prompts and tools for querying the API and requires setting up the WOLFRAM_API_KEY environment variable.

Wealthy MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server designed to assist users with trading platform features. It provides functionalities such as retrieving market prices, viewing portfolio holdings and positions, placing orders, and receiving trading suggestions. The server integrates with MCP clients like Claude and Cursor, allowing users to interact with the trading platform through natural language queries.

ZoomEye MCP Server provides network asset information based on query conditions, allowing Large Language Models (LLMs) to search for and analyze internet-connected devices, services, and vulnerabilities. Key features include querying ZoomEye for network asset information using dorks, caching mechanism, automatic retry for failed API requests, and comprehensive error handling and logging.

mcp-server-datahub is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for DataHub, enabling AI agents to query DataHub for metadata and context about the data ecosystem. Key features include searching across all entity types with arbitrary filters, fetching metadata for any entity, traversing the lineage graph, and listing SQL queries associated with a dataset.

Bear MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to Bear Notes, which are stored in an SQLite database. Main features include reading notes, searching notes by text, and listing all tags. The server can be installed and run using Docker or NPM, and it requires Node.js and the Bear note application on macOS.

Nostr MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides Nostr capabilities to LLMs like Claude. Key features include fetching user profiles, text notes, long-form content, zaps, and NIPs search. It supports both hex public keys and npub format, with user-friendly display of Nostr identifiers. The server also includes advanced functionalities such as anonymous zapping, custom relay support, and comprehensive testing with an in-memory Nostr relay.

Replicate Flux MCP is an advanced Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that empowers AI assistants to generate high-quality images and vector graphics. It leverages the Flux Schnell model for raster images and the Recraft V3 SVG model for vector graphics via the Replicate API. Key features include high-quality image generation, vector graphics support, AI assistant integration, advanced customization, universal MCP compatibility, secure local processing, comprehensive history management, batch processing, variant exploration, and prompt engineering.

Log Analyzer with MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides AI assistants access to AWS CloudWatch Logs for analysis, searching, and correlation. Main features include browsing and searching CloudWatch Log Groups, searching logs using CloudWatch Logs Insights query syntax, generating log summaries, identifying error patterns, and correlating logs across multiple AWS services.

gbox is an open-source project that provides a self-hostable sandbox for Agents to execute commands, read/write files, browse the web, and operate iOS/Android. Key features include terminal command execution, file management, browser operations, and integration with MCP clients like Claude Desktop/Cursor. It also supports SDKs for Python and TypeScript and can be used as a CLI tool for managing sandbox containers.

Strapi MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for interacting with Strapi CMS. It enables AI assistants to interact with your Strapi instance through a standardized interface, supporting content types and REST API operations. Key features include schema introspection, REST API support with validation, media upload handling, JWT authentication, content type management, image processing, multiple server support, automatic schema validation, write protection policy, integrated documentation, and version compatibility management.

Google Drive MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides seamless integration with Google Drive, allowing AI models to search, list, and read files. Main features include full-text search capabilities, file content reading, automatic file format handling, and secure OAuth 2.0 authentication.

Fused MCP Agents: Setting up MCP Servers for Data is a repository that provides a step-by-step notebook workflow to set up MCP Servers with Claude's Desktop App, all in Python. It allows users to pass any Python code directly to their local Claude app. Main features include integration with MCP Servers, Fused User Defined Functions (UDFs), and support for both the Claude Desktop app and a local Claude client.

gotoHuman MCP Server facilitates adding human approvals to AI agents and workflows. It provides a fully-managed async human-in-the-loop workflow with customizable approval UI, built-in auth, webhooks, notifications, team features, and an evolving training dataset. Key tools include `list-forms`, `get-form-schema`, and `request-human-review-with-form` for managing and requesting human reviews.

iFlytek Workflow MCP Server is a tool for building and executing intelligent workflows. It supports 14 types of workflow nodes, multiple execution modes (sequential, parallel, loop, nested), and various development paradigms. Key features include robust node support, advanced orchestration modes, and multi-model support. The system also provides real-time processing through a hook mechanism and streaming output.

MCP Containerd is an MCP server implemented using the RMCP (Rust Model Context Protocol) library for operating Containerd's CRI interfaces. It supports all Containerd CRI interface operations, provides Runtime Service and Image Service interfaces, and can be used with a simple-chat-client for interacting with the service. Main features include container and image management, runtime operations, and CRI version information.

Databricks MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects to Databricks API, allowing LLMs to run SQL queries, list jobs, and get job status. Main features include running SQL queries on Databricks SQL warehouses, listing all Databricks jobs, getting the status of specific Databricks jobs, and obtaining detailed information about Databricks jobs.

Freqtrade-MCP is an MCP server that integrates with the Freqtrade cryptocurrency trading bot via its REST API, enabling seamless AI agent interaction for automated trading operations. Main features include fetching market data, bot status, profit, balance, performance, whitelist, blacklist, trades, config, locks, placing trades, starting and stopping the bot, reloading config, adding and deleting blacklisted pairs, and deleting trade locks.

GitHub Project Manager MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides GitHub Projects functionality through standardized tools and resources. It enables LLM clients to manage GitHub Projects programmatically, including project management, issues and milestones, sprint planning, custom fields, and more. Key features include full MCP specification compliance, GitHub GraphQL API integration, intelligent rate limit handling, and comprehensive error handling.

Atlan Agent Toolkit is a repository containing tools and protocols for interacting with Atlan services for AI agents. The main component, Model Context Protocol (MCP), enables interaction with Atlan services through function calling, providing tools for asset search and retrieval using pyatlan.

Puppeteer MCP Server provides browser automation capabilities through Puppeteer, allowing interaction with both new browser instances and existing Chrome windows. Main features include navigating web pages, taking screenshots, clicking elements, filling forms, selecting options, hovering elements, executing JavaScript, and smart Chrome tab management.

Serper Search MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides Google search capabilities through the Serper API, along with an AI-powered Deep Research tool. Key features include powerful Google search integration, rich search response data, AI-powered deep research, configurable search parameters, secure API key handling, rate limiting, caching support, and TypeScript support.

Gitee MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Gitee, providing tools to interact with Gitee's API. It allows AI assistants to manage repositories, issues, pull requests, and more. Key features include interacting with Gitee repositories, issues, pull requests, and notifications, configurable API base URL, command-line flags for easy configuration, and support for personal, organization, and enterprise operations.

RAG Documentation MCP Server is a tool for retrieving and processing documentation through vector search, enabling AI assistants to augment their responses with relevant documentation context. Key features include vector-based documentation search and retrieval, support for multiple documentation sources, semantic search capabilities, automated documentation processing, and real-time context augmentation for LLMs. It also provides tools for listing, extracting, and managing documentation sources and URLs.

Chrome Debug MCP Playwright is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for browser automation using Playwright. It provides core browser features like launch and management, multi-tab support, page navigation, and screenshot capture. It also supports the Greasemonkey API for CSS injection, data storage, and cross-origin requests. Additional features include network request interception, detailed logging, and debugging capabilities.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial and crypto data, and can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude for financial analysis.

Claude MCP Server Collection is a set of Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers designed to enhance Claude's desktop application capabilities. The collection includes servers for screen capture, computer control, FastAPI integration, HTTP requests, and large-scale data analysis with DuckDB. Key features include real-time screen capture, mouse and keyboard automation, efficient data processing, and robust API endpoints.

Crypto Price & Market Analysis MCP Server provides comprehensive cryptocurrency analysis using the CoinCap API. It offers real-time price data, market analysis, and historical trends through an easy-to-use interface. Key features include current price and 24h stats, detailed market analysis, and historical price data analysis with customizable time intervals.

MCP Local Dev is a local development environment manager that lets LLMs configure and manage dev environments for you. It automates environment setup, dependency management, and testing. Key features include support for multiple test runners, runtime support for Python, Node.js, and Bun, automatic runtime detection, smart package manager selection, sandboxed environments, and zero configuration needed. The project aims to reduce cognitive overhead and allow developers to focus on architecture and design.

The TikTok MCP integrates TikTok access into Claude AI and other apps via TikNeuron. It allows users to analyze TikTok videos for virality factors, extract content from TikTok videos, and chat with TikTok videos. Key features include getting available subtitles, fetching specific subtitles in different languages, and retrieving detailed post information such as description, creator username, hashtags, and engagement metrics.

Redmine MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Redmine, integrating with Redmine's REST API to provide ticket and project information to LLMs. Main features include support for Issues, Projects, Users, and Time Entries, with functionalities such as search, create, update, and delete operations. It also includes configuration options, environment variables, and setup instructions for use with Claude. The server supports unit testing and inspector testing, and some features require administrator privileges.

AIStor MCP server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with AIStor object stores. It provides features for read, write, delete, and admin operations, including listing buckets, objects, and metadata, creating and deleting buckets and objects, and getting cluster info. The server also supports AI operations like describing the object's contents using the `ask-object` function.

MCP XMind Server is a Model Context Protocol server for analyzing and querying XMind mind maps. It provides features such as smart fuzzy search, task management, hierarchical content navigation, link and reference extraction, multi-file analysis, label and tag support, directory scanning, and secure directory access.

MCP WordPress Remote is a package that acts as a bridge between local MCP clients and remote WordPress MCP servers. It simplifies the setup process by leveraging npx. The package requires environment variables for WordPress API and WooCommerce credentials, and it supports configuration in MCP clients like Claude Desktop and Cursor. Key features include improved efficiency, security through WordPress API passwords and WooCommerce REST API consumer key and secret, and easy setup.

MCP Headless Gmail Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides functionalities to get and send Gmails without local credential or token setup. Key features include headless and remote operation, decoupled architecture, focused functionality, Docker-ready, and reliable dependencies. It supports getting recent emails, full email body content in chunks, sending emails, and automatic token refreshing.

BNBChain MCP is a Model Context Protocol implementation that enables seamless interaction with blockchain networks, including BNB Chain and other EVM-compatible networks, through AI-powered interfaces. It provides tools for blockchain development, smart contract interaction, and network management. Key features include block and transaction management, smart contract interaction, NFT and token operations, wallet management, and Greenfield file management. The toolkit supports integration with various clients and offers a wide range of prompts and tools for blockchain analysis and operations.

Atom of Thoughts (AoT) is a decomposition-based reasoning framework implemented as a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server. It provides tools for deep analysis and complex problem solving, including a full version and a lightweight version (AoT-light). Key features include a decomposition-contraction mechanism, automatic termination, confidence evaluation, and verification processes. The tool is suitable for highly complex problems, scenarios requiring high accuracy, and reasoning with complex dependency relationships.

LangGraph Coding Agent Team with MCP is a project that implements a small team of coding agents using LangGraph and the Model Context Protocol (MCP). The system consists of an MCP Gateway Server, MCP Servers, and Coding Agents. The main features include managing multiple MCP server processes, providing a unified API for accessing tools, handling communication with MCP servers, and exposing tools through a simple HTTP interface. The coding agents collaborate to gather context, create plans, and implement code on separate GitHub branches.

esa-mcp-server is a server that allows the use of esa.io's API through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides functionalities such as searching for articles, retrieving article details (single or multiple), creating, updating, and deleting articles.

@davewind/mysql-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides read-only access to MySQL databases. Key features include read-only database access, schema discovery, SQL query execution, MCP compliance, and simple configuration. The server ensures security by enforcing read-only operations and validating SQL queries.

Embedding MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation powered by txtai, providing semantic search, knowledge graph capabilities, and AI-driven text processing. Key features include a unified vector database, semantic search, knowledge graph integration, portable knowledge bases, extensible pipeline system, and local-first architecture. The project includes a knowledge base builder tool and an MCP server, offering advanced features like automatic graph construction, causal boosting, and extensive configuration options.

MCPMC (Minecraft Model Context Protocol) is a server for interacting with Minecraft via Mineflayer, enabling AI agents to control Minecraft bots through a standardized JSON-RPC interface. Main features include full MCP compatibility, reliable Minecraft interaction, support for navigation, block manipulation, inventory management, real-time game state monitoring, and type-safe API with TypeScript support.

Redis MCP Server is an implementation for interacting with Redis databases, enabling LLMs to interact with Redis key-value stores through a set of standardized tools. Main features include setting and getting key-value pairs, deleting keys, and listing keys matching a pattern. It supports installation via Smithery, manual installation, and Docker usage. The server can be configured to work with the Claude Desktop app and includes detailed instructions for development and building from source.

Stata MCP Extension for VS Code and Cursor is a tool that provides Stata integration for Visual Studio Code and Cursor IDE using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It allows users to run Stata commands, execute .do files, view real-time output, and get AI assistant integration. Key features include syntax highlighting, cross-platform support, automatic Stata detection, and real-time output.

The content describes a demo of a simple Figma MCP, including the need for a Figma personal access token and a test command, but does not provide enough information to clearly fit into one of the specified categories.

nREPL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed for MCP clients like Claude Desktop or CLine in VSCode. It allows interaction with a running Clojure nREPL instance, enabling the evaluation of Clojure code, namespace inspection, and other utilities via MCP. Key features include connecting to a running nREPL server, evaluating Clojure code, listing project namespaces, retrieving nREPL connection status, and inspecting public vars in any Clojure namespace.

Splunk MCP (Model Context Protocol) Tool is a FastMCP-based tool for interacting with Splunk Enterprise/Cloud through natural language. It provides capabilities for searching Splunk data, managing KV stores, and accessing Splunk resources. Key features include Splunk Search, Index Management, User Management, KV Store Operations, Async Support, Detailed Logging, SSL Configuration, Enhanced Debugging, Comprehensive Testing, and Error Handling. The tool operates in three modes: SSE Mode, API Mode, and STDIO Mode.

lark-tools-mcp is an MCP server that provides Feishu (飞书) related operations to AI encoding agents such as reading documents, sending messages, contract approval, and data processing. Key features include creating a custom application, running the service with necessary environment configurations, and integrating with cursor to enable AI to read and organize content from Feishu document links.

Coin MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides access to CoinMarketCap's cryptocurrency data. It enables AI-powered applications to retrieve cryptocurrency listings, quotes, and detailed information about various coins. Features include fetching a paginated list of cryptocurrencies, retrieving detailed information about specific cryptocurrencies, and fetching the latest market quotes for one or more cryptocurrencies. The server requires a CoinMarketCap API key to function and can be installed via Smithery or built from the repository.

mcp-flowise is a Python package implementing a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with the Flowise API. It provides a standardized and flexible way to list chatflows, create predictions, and dynamically register tools for Flowise chatflows or assistants. Key features include dynamic tool exposure, simpler configuration, flexible filtering, and MCP integration. It supports two operation modes: LowLevel Mode and FastMCP Mode.

@davewind/mysql-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides read-only access to MySQL databases. Key features include read-only database access, schema discovery, SQL query execution, MCP compliance, and simple configuration. The server ensures security by validating SQL queries to allow only SELECT statements and executing all queries within READ ONLY transactions.

Solana MCP Server is a Model-Context-Protocol server for interacting with the Solana blockchain. It provides simple RPC endpoints for common Solana operations such as getting the current slot number, checking account balances, getting detailed account information, displaying keypair information, and transferring SOL between accounts. The server connects to Solana's mainnet by default, but can be configured to use other networks like devnet or testnet.

Directus Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server allows AI tools to connect to and use your Directus API. Key features include reading items from any Directus collection, getting information about the current user, and discovering available collections and fields in the system.

ffmpeg-mcp is a Model Context Protocol Server designed to enable llms (likely referring to language models or other machine learning models) to decode, encode, transcode, mux, demux, stream, filter, and play a wide variety of media formats. This server facilitates handling various file operations related to multimedia content.

Gin-MCP is a zero-configuration library that automatically exposes existing Gin endpoints as Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools, making them instantly usable by MCP-compatible clients. Key features include effortless integration, automatic discovery of routes, schema inference, direct Gin integration, parameter preservation, customizable schemas, selective exposure, and flexible deployment.

Scrapling Fetch MCP is an MCP server that helps AI assistants access text content from websites that implement bot detection. It is optimized for low-volume retrieval of documentation and reference materials (text/HTML only). Main features include retrieving complete web pages with pagination support, extracting content matching regex patterns with surrounding context, and providing different protection levels for accessing content.

Markdown Downloader MCP Server is a powerful tool that allows you to download webpages as markdown files with ease. It leverages the r.jina.ai service to convert web content into markdown format. Main features include downloading webpages as markdown, configurable download directory, automatic generation of date-stamped filenames, listing downloaded markdown files, and persistent configuration.

Codebase MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides tools to retrieve and analyze entire codebases using RepoMix. It allows AI agents like Cursor's Composer Agent to automatically read and understand entire codebases, making it easier for developers to work with large codebases. Main features include Codebase Retrieval, Remote Repository Support, File Saving, and Customizable Options.

@enemyrr/mcp-mysql-server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides MySQL database operations. It enables AI models to interact with MySQL databases through a standardized interface. Key features include multiple connection methods, secure connection handling, prepared statement support, schema management tools, comprehensive error handling and validation, TypeScript support, and automatic workspace detection.

Grok2 Image MCP Server is a service based on the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that allows chat assistants to generate images using the Grok-2 model. It includes installation instructions, environment variable configurations, and an optional method to use Cloudflare Workers for image URL proxying.

Meme MCP Server is a simple Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for generating memes using the ImgFlip API. It enables AI models and tools to generate meme images from user prompts. The main features include a `generateMeme` tool that accepts parameters like `templateNumericId`, `text0`, and `text1`. The server can be configured using the `meme-mcp` NPM package, and it requires an ImgFlip account for authentication.

Crypto Indicators MCP Server provides a range of cryptocurrency technical analysis indicators and strategies, enabling AI trading agents to analyze market trends and develop quantitative trading strategies. Features include over 50 technical indicators, trading strategies, flexible data sources, and modular design.

Chrome Tools MCP Server is an MCP server that provides tools for interacting with Chrome through its DevTools Protocol. It enables remote control of Chrome tabs, including executing JavaScript, capturing screenshots, monitoring network traffic, and more. Key features include listing Chrome tabs, executing JavaScript in tabs, capturing screenshots, monitoring network traffic, navigating tabs to URLs, querying DOM elements, and clicking elements with console output capture.

Tripadvisor MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the Tripadvisor Content API, providing access to Tripadvisor location data, reviews, and photos. Key features include searching for locations, retrieving detailed information, reviews, and photos, and supporting nearby location searches based on coordinates. It also supports API key authentication and Docker containerization.

Notion API MCP is a Python-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides advanced todo list management and content organization capabilities through Notion's API. Key features include Todo Management, Database Operations, Content Organization, and Real-time Integration. It allows for creating, updating, and tracking tasks, managing Notion databases, structuring and formatting content, and direct interaction with Notion's workspace, pages, and databases.

Ancestry MCP Server is a Python server implementing Model Context Protocol (MCP) for interacting with .ged files (GEDCOM files, commonly seen on Ancestry.com). Main features include reading and parsing .ged files, renaming .ged files, and searching within .ged files for certain individuals or family. It also provides tools for listing, renaming, and viewing the contents of .ged files.

ScrapeGraph MCP Server is a production-ready Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides seamless integration with the ScapeGraph AI API. It enables advanced AI-powered web scraping capabilities with enterprise-grade reliability. Key features include transforming webpages into markdown, smart scraping with AI, and AI-powered web searches. The server also includes robust error handling and supports various integrations like Smithery and Cursor.

Smart-Thinking is a sophisticated Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a multi-dimensional, adaptive, and self-verifying reasoning framework for AI assistants. Key features include advanced cognitive architecture with a thought graph, robust verification system, cross-platform compatibility, persistent memory, and advanced visualizations. It supports various clients like Claude Desktop, Cline, Windsurf, and more.

StarRocks MCP Server is a Model Control Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with StarRocks databases. It provides a standardized interface for AI models to query and manipulate StarRocks databases. Main features include executing SELECT queries, listing available tables, describing table schemas, creating new tables, and performing write operations like INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE. The server can be run in read-only mode or with full write capabilities.

Google Calendar MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides integration with Google Calendar, allowing LLMs to read, create, and manage calendar events. Main features include listing available calendars, listing events from a calendar, creating new calendar events, updating existing events, deleting events, and processing events from screenshots and images. The server supports both automatic and manual authentication flows and includes OAuth 2.0 credentials for secure access.

LSP MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for interacting with LSP (Language Server Protocol) interface. It acts as a bridge that allows LLMs to query LSP Hover and Completion providers, enabling more accurate code suggestions. Key features include tools for getting hover information, completions, code actions, diagnostics, and managing LSP server lifecycle. The server also provides comprehensive logging, colorized console output, and support for language-specific extensions.

AKShare MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides financial data analysis capabilities using the AKShare library. It offers access to Chinese and global financial market data, integration with Claude Desktop via MCP protocol, and support for various financial data queries and analysis. Features include stock, fund, bond, futures, forex, and macroeconomic data queries.

finance-tools-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to provide comprehensive financial insights and analysis capabilities. It offers tools for ticker data, fear & greed index, calculations, macro data, and time series data processing. Key features include getting ticker data, options, price history, financial statements, institutional holders, earnings history, insider trades, and more. The server also provides CNN Fear & Greed Index data, mathematical expression evaluation, and FRED series data. Time series data is processed and optimized for LLMs with technical indicators, risk metrics, and smart sampling.

frontend-review-mcp is an MCP server that performs a visual review of a UI edit request. It takes screenshots before and after the edit, and then reviews the changes to ensure they visually satisfy the edit request. The tool uses AI models for the review process and can be integrated with various IDEs like Cursor and Windsurf. Main features include screenshot taking, visual review, and detailed feedback on UI edits.

MCP Notes Server is a simple note-taking application built on top of the MCP protocol. It allows users to record and view complex notes and tasks using AI models. The application includes a Node.js server for AI-driven note management and a web server for a user-friendly interface. Key features include AI-Powered Note Taking, Comprehensive Note Management, Reliable Storage with AWS DynamoDB, and Flexible Authentication. The project also supports integration with various tools like Claude Desktop, Cody, and Cline.

Alibaba Cloud RDS OpenAPI MCP Server is a tool for managing and interacting with Alibaba Cloud RDS (Relational Database Service) via OpenAPI. It provides a range of functionalities including creating and querying RDS instances, managing instance attributes, performance data, error logs, network configurations, and more. The server can be set up using various methods such as cherry-studio, Cline, or Claude, and requires Alibaba Cloud credentials for access.

ESA MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) server, designed to facilitate communication between AI models and Edge Security Acceleration (ESA) services. It acts as a bridge, allowing models to leverage ESA features through a standardized protocol. Main features include implementing Model Context Protocol for tool execution, providing access to ESA OpenAPI services, and running as a server via stdio for seamless integration with model runners. The server provides tools for routine management, deployment, route management, and record management.

MCP Server for iOS Simulator is a tool that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for iOS simulators, built on top of appium-ios-simulator and utilizing the MCP TypeScript SDK. It provides a bridge between iOS simulators and the MCP protocol, enabling programmatic control of iOS simulators. Key features include starting, stopping, and managing iOS simulator instances, booting and shutting down simulators, installing and launching applications, taking screenshots, and performing taps on coordinates. The server also supports multiple concurrent simulator sessions and comprehensive file-based logging.

JIRA MCP Server is an MCP server that enables Large Language Models (LLMs) to interact with JIRA. It provides capabilities for searching issues using JQL and retrieving detailed issue information. Key features include JQL Search with pagination support, Issue Details retrieval, and integration with Claude Desktop.

Perplexity Advanced MCP is an advanced integration package that leverages the OpenRouter and Perplexity APIs to provide enhanced query processing capabilities. It supports both simple and complex queries, file attachment support, and robust retry mechanisms. The package includes a unified API client, a command-line interface, and customizable logging. It is designed to integrate with AI assistants and code editors for seamless and efficient search and query processing.

Databricks MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Databricks. It provides functionalities such as listing catalogs, schemas, and tables, executing SQL statements, and listing SQL warehouses. The server can be installed and run in various environments including VS Code, and it supports Databricks unified authentication.

MCP Email Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides email functionality, enabling LLMs to compose and send emails, as well as search for attachments within specified directories. Main features include sending emails with multiple recipients, support for email attachments, searching for files in directories based on pattern matching, and secure email transmission using SMTP.

metabase-server MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that integrates with the Metabase API, allowing AI assistants to interact with Metabase. It provides access to dashboards, questions/cards, and databases as resources. Key features include tools for listing and executing Metabase queries, and the ability to view and interact with Metabase data.
七牛云存储 MCP 服务用于上传文件到七牛云存储。主要功能包括配置环境变量、启动服务、调用上传接口等。通过该服务，用户可以轻松地将文件上传到七牛云存储并获取公开访问URL。

MCP Nomad Go is a Golang-based MCP server that connects to Nomad for job, deployment, namespace, node, allocation, variable, volume, ACL, Sentinel policy, and cluster management. It provides extensive features for managing and interacting with Nomad, including job execution, deployment, and resource management, making it a powerful tool for operations.

Comfy MCP Server is a server using the FastMCP framework to generate images based on prompts via a remote Comfy server. Excel MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that reads and writes MS Excel data. It supports various features such as reading and writing text values and formulas, creating new sheets, live editing, and capturing screen images from sheets. It also includes tools for describing sheets, reading and writing to sheets, taking screenshots, creating tables, and copying sheets. The server supports multiple file formats including xlsx, xlsm, xltx, and xltm.

MCP Crew AI Server is a lightweight Python-based server designed to run, manage, and create CrewAI workflows. It leverages the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to communicate with Large Language Models (LLMs) and tools like Claude Desktop or Cursor IDE. Key features include automatic configuration from YAML files, command line flexibility, seamless workflow execution, and local development support.

mcp-google-server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides web search capabilities using Google Custom Search API and webpage content extraction functionality. Main features include performing web searches, controlling the number of results, getting structured results with title, link, and snippet, and extracting and cleaning webpage content.

YouTube MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that allows you to download subtitles from YouTube and connect them to a LLM. Main features include downloading transcripts from YouTube videos, support for both video IDs and full YouTube URLs, and inclusion of timestamps in the transcript.

AI Agent Marketplace Index Search MCP Server is a tool that allows AI assistants to search for available AI agents by keywords or categories. It provides features such as searching AI Agents, monitoring web traffic performance, and listing AI agents in the marketplace. The server also supports comprehensive error handling and integrates with tools like Claude Desktop and Microsoft Bing Search API.

Hologres MCP Server serves as a universal interface between AI Agents and Hologres databases, enabling seamless communication for retrieving metadata and executing SQL operations. Features include tools for executing SELECT, DML, and DDL queries, gathering table statistics, obtaining query and execution plans, invoking procedures, and creating foreign tables. It also provides built-in resources and resource templates to list schemas, tables, partitions, and get DDL and statistics.

IoTDB MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides database interaction and business intelligence capabilities through IoTDB. It enables running SQL queries, including metadata and data queries, and supports both Tree and Table models for different types of SQL dialects. The server also integrates with Claude Desktop for development and configuration.

MCP Excel Reader is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for reading Excel files with automatic chunking and pagination support. It supports reading .xlsx and .xls files, automatic chunking for large datasets, sheet selection, row pagination, proper date handling, and error handling. Built with SheetJS and TypeScript, it is optimized for handling large files efficiently.

Anti-Bullshit MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for analyzing claims, validating sources, and detecting manipulation using multiple epistemological frameworks. Main features include tools for claim analysis, source validation, and manipulation detection, with support for empirical, responsible, harmonic, and pluralistic frameworks.

CodeAlive MCP is a Model Context Protocol server that enhances AI clients like Claude Desktop, Cursor, VS Code (GitHub Copilot), and others by providing deep context from your project's codebase. It enables more intelligent and efficient interactions, helping to find relevant code faster, understand the bigger picture, and reduce costs and time. Key features include semantic code search, codebase interaction, and integration with various IDEs and AI clients.

JIRA MCP Server is an MCP server that enables Large Language Models (LLMs) to interact with JIRA through standardized tools and context. It provides capabilities for searching issues using JQL and retrieving detailed issue information. Key features include JQL Search, Issue Details, and integration with Claude Desktop.

SystemPrompt MCP Notion Server is a high-performance Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates Notion into AI workflows. It allows AI agents to interact with Notion pages and databases. Key features include comprehensive content management, developer-friendly tools, and integration with Notion for read, update, insert, and search functionalities.

MCP Mistral OCR is an MCP server that provides OCR capabilities using Mistral AI's OCR API. It can process local files and URLs, supporting images and PDFs. Key features include processing of multiple file formats, results saved as JSON files with timestamps, Docker containerization, and UV package management.

PubMed MCP is a server that enables the search and retrieval of articles from PubMed, a database containing over 35 million citations for biomedical literature from MEDLINE, life science journals, and online books. It uses the pubmedclient Python package to perform these operations.

GCP MCP Server is a comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, enabling AI assistants to interact with and manage GCP resources through a standardized interface. Key features include querying and managing GCP resources, receiving AI-guided assistance, and support for various GCP services such as Artifact Registry, BigQuery, Cloud Build, Compute Engine, Monitoring, Cloud Run, and Cloud Storage.

Israeli Bank MCP is a project for managing Israeli bank accounts and transactions using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Main features include listing available Israeli banks and credit card companies, fetching transactions, secure credential handling, flexible transaction date ranges, and two-factor authentication support. The server supports all major Israeli banks and credit card companies.

AbletonMCP is an integration that connects Ableton Live to Claude AI through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling prompt-assisted music production, track creation, and session manipulation. Key features include two-way communication, track manipulation, instrument and effect selection, clip creation, and session control.
The provided content is too brief to determine a specific category or main features. It only contains a title '# mcp' without any additional information.

RabbitMQ MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for RabbitMQ, enabling MCP clients to interact with queues and topics hosted in a RabbitMQ instance. It supports running locally with the Claude desktop app, manual installation, and includes features like read/write operations, admin API tools, pika SDK tools, and future support for Streamable HTTP and OAuth 2.1.

EvolveMCP is a tool that enables Claude Desktop to build, install, and use its own tools, expanding its capabilities. It allows users to create specialized tools and enhance Claude's functionalities. Key features include the ability to write and execute Python code, create custom tools, and use natural language for commands. The system is designed for developers and advanced users, with a focus on extending AI capabilities.
This tool integrates with the Serper API to enable web searches and webpage content extraction, supporting research, content aggregation, and data mining tasks.

Todoist MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Todoist, enabling advanced task and project management via Claude Desktop and other MCP-compatible clients. Main features include managing tasks, projects, sections, labels, comments, and collaborators with various operations such as list, create, update, and delete.

Swift MCP GUI Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows controlling Mac OS X through SwiftAutoGUI. It provides tools for programmatically controlling the mouse and keyboard, including mouse movement, mouse clicks, keyboard input, and scrolling. The server requires macOS 15.0 or later, Swift 6.0 or later, and Xcode 16.0 or later. Security considerations include ensuring that only trusted MCP clients are connected, as the server has full control over the mouse and keyboard.

Tmux MCP Server is a proof of concept implementation that provides programmatic control over tmux sessions, allowing users to run arbitrary tmux commands. This tool is useful for developers who need to manage and automate tmux sessions.

Gemini Context MCP Server is a powerful MCP (Model Context Protocol) server implementation that leverages Gemini's capabilities for context management and caching. It supports up to 2M token context window, session-based conversations, smart context tracking, semantic search, and automatic context cleanup. The server also provides efficient caching of large prompts, cost optimization, TTL management, and automatic cache cleanup. It can be integrated with various MCP-compatible clients such as Claude Desktop, Cursor, and VS Code.

Portainer MCP is a tool that connects AI assistants to Portainer environments, allowing for management of containerized infrastructure. It supports operations like managing users, environments, and executing Docker or Kubernetes commands. Features include read-only mode, tool customization, and support for specific Portainer versions. The tool is designed to work with a Portainer administrator API token and can be installed on Linux and macOS.

Quickchat AI MCP server allows users to integrate their Quickchat AI Agent into various AI applications such as Claude Desktop, Cursor, VS Code, and Windsurf. It provides a streamlined setup process, including creating an account, setting up the AI's knowledge base, and activating the MCP. Key features include easy integration, real-time updates, and the ability to control and view all conversations from the Quickchat AI dashboard.

ramp-mcp is a Model Context Protocol server for retrieving and analyzing financial data or running tasks for Ramp using the Developer API. It includes an ETL pipeline and an ephemeral SQLite database in memory for analysis. The server provides tools for setting up, processing, querying, and deleting the database, as well as fetching and loading various types of financial data such as transactions, reimbursements, bills, and more. It is designed to work with large datasets and integrates with Claude Desktop for configuration.

Wikipedia MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that retrieves information from Wikipedia to provide context to Large Language Models (LLMs). It allows LLMs to access factual information from Wikipedia, enhancing their responses with reliable sources. Main features include searching Wikipedia, retrieving article content, getting article summaries, section extraction, link discovery, related topics, and multi-language support.

Stata MCP Extension for VS Code and Cursor provides Stata integration for Visual Studio Code and Cursor IDE using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Key features include running Stata commands directly from the editor, syntax highlighting, AI assistant integration, cross-platform support, automatic Stata detection, and real-time output. The extension also includes detailed setup, configuration, and troubleshooting guides.

SingleStore MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with SingleStore, enabling seamless interaction with the database using natural language. Key features include executing SQL operations, managing workspaces, creating and managing virtual workspaces, listing and creating notebooks, and scheduling jobs. The server supports various tools for retrieving and managing data, such as workspace_groups_info, workspaces_info, organization_info, list_of_regions, execute_sql, list_virtual_workspaces, create_virtual_workspace, execute_sql_on_virtual_workspace, list_notebook_samples, create_notebook, list_personal_files, create_scheduled_job, get_job_details, and list_job_executions.

PowerPoint Automation MCP Server for Claude Desktop is a tool that allows users to automate tasks in Microsoft PowerPoint via the Model Control Protocol (MCP). Features include creating, opening, saving, and closing presentations, adding and modifying slides, and more. It requires Windows with Microsoft PowerPoint installed, Python 3.7+, Claude Desktop client, and specific Python packages.

Starwind UI MCP Server is a TypeScript implementation of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Starwind UI, providing tools to help developers work with Starwind UI components. Main features include a tool-based architecture, Starwind UI documentation tool, package manager detection, LLM data fetcher, TypeScript implementation, and standard I/O transport. It also offers various tools such as `init_project`, `install_component`, `update_component`, `get_documentation`, `fetch_llm_data`, and `get_package_manager`.

command-executor MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for executing pre-approved commands securely. Main features include secure command execution with a pre-approved command list, configurable allowed commands through environment variables, built with TypeScript and MCP SDK, communication via stdio, error handling and security validations, and real-time command output streaming.

This content describes how to host an MCP SSE server on Google Cloud Run, providing a secure way to allow clients to access a custom MCP server over the internet. It includes detailed steps for deployment, setting up the proxy, and configuring the MCP client in Cursor. Key features include secure authentication using Google Cloud IAM, local proxy setup, and integration with Cursor.

AI-Cursor-Scraping-Assistant is a powerful tool that leverages Cursor AI and MCP (Model Context Protocol) to easily generate web scrapers for various types of websites. It includes Cursor Rules for teaching Cursor AI how to analyze websites and create different types of Scrapy spiders, and MCP Tools that enhance Cursor's capabilities for web scraping tasks. The project supports e-commerce PLP and PDP scrapers, and includes Camoufox integration for stealth scraping. Future enhancements include proxy integration, improved XPath generation, and support for more scraper types.

MCP Think Tool Server is an MCP server that implements Anthropic's 'think' tool to improve Claude's complex reasoning capabilities. It provides a dedicated space for structured thinking during problem-solving tasks, enhancing performance in complex tasks requiring policy adherence and reasoning in long chains of tool calls. Key features include custom instructions for optimal use, key use cases such as complex tool chains, policy adherence, sequential decision making, and multi-step analysis, and available tools like think, get_thoughts, clear_thoughts, and get_thought_stats.

Trino MCP Server in Go is a high-performance Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Trino, enabling AI assistants to interact with Trino's distributed SQL query engine. Key features include MCP server implementation in Go, Trino SQL query execution, catalog, schema, and table discovery, Docker container support, STDIO and HTTP transports, and SSE support. It can be integrated with various AI applications like Cursor, Claude Desktop, Windsurf, and ChatWise.

PostgreSQL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides access to PostgreSQL databases. It enables LLMs to interact with databases to inspect schemas, execute queries, and perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on database entries. Key features include creating tables, inserting entries, updating entries, deleting entries, and dropping tables. The server also provides schema information for each table in the database.

YDB MCP is a Model Context Protocol server for YDB that allows AI-powered database operations and natural language interactions with YDB instances. It provides tools for running SQL queries, listing directory contents, getting detailed information about YDB paths, and more. The project includes various installation and configuration methods, as well as a comprehensive Makefile for development tasks.

Claude Document MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows Claude Desktop to perform document operations on Microsoft Word, Excel, and PDF files. Main features include creating, editing, and converting documents in these formats. It supports operations such as creating new documents, editing existing ones, and converting between different file types.

Pushover MCP is a Model Context Protocol implementation for sending notifications via Pushover.net. It enables AI agents to send notifications, with features including message, title, priority, sound, URL, and device targeting. The tool can be integrated with various IDEs like Cursor and Roo Code, and supports both global and project-specific configurations.

pyATS MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that wraps Cisco pyATS and Genie functionality, enabling structured, model-driven interaction with network devices over STDIO using the JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol. Key features include connecting to Cisco IOS/NX-OS devices, safe execution of CLI commands, controlled configuration changes, structured or raw output, and support for Docker and LangGraph integration. It also includes security features like input validation, blocking unsafe commands, and preventing pipe/redirect abuse.

The Model Context Protocol - Gemini Thinking Server is a specialized MCP server that leverages Google's Gemini model to provide analytical thinking capabilities. It can break down complex problems into steps, plan and design with room for revision, and analyze problems that might need course correction. Key features include Gemini-Powered Thinking, Meta-Commentary, Confidence Levels, Alternative Paths, Branching Thoughts, Revision Capability, and Session Persistence.

raindrop-mcp is an MCP server for Raindrop.io, which allows users to search, create, and manage bookmarks. It supports various server configurations including stdio, SSE, and HTTP, and requires an access token from Raindrop.io for authentication.

MCP Database Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for connecting to and working with various database systems, including SQLite, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, and MongoDB. It supports SSE and STDIO modes, and can be integrated with Claude Desktop. The server provides tools for connecting to, disconnecting from, executing queries, and updating databases, as well as resources for exploring the database schema and tables.

Logseq MCP Tools is a set of Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools that enable AI agents to interact with a local Logseq instance. Key features include the ability to get, create, and delete pages and blocks, as well as search and manipulate content within the Logseq graph. The tools are available under the `logseq` namespace and can be integrated with Cursor and Claude for enhanced functionality.

MCP Database Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides database access capabilities to Claude, supporting SQLite, SQL Server, and PostgreSQL databases. It includes features such as direct usage with NPM package, local development setup, and various database tools like read_query, write_query, create_table, alter_table, drop_table, list_tables, describe_table, export_query, append_insight, and list_insights.

glif-mcp-server is an MCP server for running AI workflows from glif.app, which provides tools for running glifs, managing bots, and accessing glif metadata. Key features include running glifs with inputs, getting detailed information about glifs, runs, and users, and accessing glif metadata through URI-based resources. It also offers a variety of tools for general glif management, bot management, and user-specific functionalities, as well as the ability to turn glifs into custom tools.

greptimedb-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for GreptimeDB, providing AI assistants with a secure and structured way to explore and analyze databases. It enables listing tables, reading data, and executing SQL queries through a controlled interface. Key features include `list_resources`, `read_resource`, `list_tools`, `call_tool` for SQL execution, `list_prompts`, and `get_prompt`. The server can be configured via environment variables or command-line arguments and integrates with Claude Desktop.

MCP LSP Go is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI assistants to interact with Go's Language Server Protocol (LSP) for advanced Go code analysis. Main features include LSP integration, code navigation, code quality checks, and advanced information such as hover details and completion suggestions. The project uses the mark3labs/mcp-go library and communicates with gopls, the official language server for Go.

Excalidraw MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Excalidraw, providing API functionality for operating on Excalidraw drawings. Main features include creating, reading, updating, and deleting Excalidraw drawings, exporting drawings to SVG, PNG, and JSON formats, and a simple file-based storage system.

YouTube Transcript MCP Server is a tool that retrieves transcripts for given YouTube video URLs. It provides the `get_transcript` function to fetch the transcript of a specified YouTube video, with options to specify the desired language. The server can be installed and configured for use with Goose CLI, Goose Desktop, and Claude Desktop, and it supports the use of proxy servers in restricted environments.

WhatsApp MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for WhatsApp, built with TypeScript and using the @whiskeysockets/baileys library. It allows you to connect your personal WhatsApp account to an AI agent, enabling it to search messages, list recent chats, retrieve message history, and send messages. Key features include search_contacts, list_messages, list_chats, get_chat, get_message_context, and send_message.

swagger-mcp is a tool designed to scrape Swagger UI by extracting the swagger.json file and dynamically generating well-defined MCP tools at runtime. It supports LLM models, can run in SSE mode, and integrates with MCP clients for further tool selection. Key features include support for various API security types, basic and bearer authentication, and API key management.

Qwen Max MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for the Qwen Max language model. It provides text generation capabilities, configurable parameters, error handling, and support for multiple Qwen models (Max, Plus, Turbo). The server integrates with Claude Desktop and supports extensive token context windows. Key features include text generation, configurable parameters, error handling, MCP protocol support, and Claude Desktop integration.
Linear Remote MCP server allows developers to grant access to Linear using a regular OAuth 2.0 flow, enabling them to create, update, and list issues directly from their MCP client.

The Spring AI Apps Project demonstrates the integration of AI capabilities within a Spring Boot application using the Spring AI framework. It includes examples of MCP (Model Context Protocol) client/server implementation, and provides guidance on how to run the application and connect it with an AI model such as OpenAI.

Model Context Protocol Server for NebulaGraph is an MCP server implementation that provides access to NebulaGraph. It offers seamless access to NebulaGraph 3.x, enabling graph exploration with features like Schema, Query, and shortcut algorithms. The server follows the Model Context Protocol, making it ready to integrate with LLM tooling systems. It also includes a simple command-line interface with support for configuration via environment variables and .env files.

MCP Web Browser Server is an advanced web browsing server for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) powered by Playwright, enabling headless browser interactions through a flexible, secure API. Main features include Headless Web Browsing, Full Page Content Extraction, Multi-Tab Support, Advanced Web Interaction Tools, Resource Management, and Enhanced Page Information.

Smart Photo Journal MCP Server is designed to help you search and analyze your photo library with powerful, intuitive tools. Main features include Location Search, Label Search, People Search, Photo Analysis, and Fuzzy Matching. It allows you to find photos from specific places, by keywords or labels, featuring specific people, and discover insights about your photo-taking habits.

MCP Figma to React Converter is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that converts Figma designs to React components. It fetches Figma designs, extracts components, generates React components with TypeScript, applies Tailwind CSS classes, and enhances components with accessibility features. It supports both stdio and SSE transports and includes tools for fetching and extracting Figma components and generating React components.

This repository provides multiple examples of setting up MCP (Model Context Protocol) Servers, which allow AI models to store data, run tools, and use prompts for specific tasks. The examples include setting up the server locally with and without Docker, as well as deploying it on Google Cloud Platform. The main features include running terminal commands, executing predefined templates, and integrating with Claude for testing.

Postgres MCP Pro is an open-source Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to support the entire development process for PostgreSQL databases. Key features include Database Health checks, Index Tuning, Query Plan Analysis, Schema Intelligence, and Safe SQL Execution. It provides tools for understanding and improving database performance, such as analyzing slow queries, generating index recommendations, and performing comprehensive health checks. The server supports both Standard Input/Output (stdio) and Server-Sent Events (SSE) transports, and can be installed using Docker or Python.

MCP-OSM provides OpenStreetMap integration for MCP, allowing users to query and visualize map data through an MCP interface. Key features include a web-based map viewer using Leaflet and OpenStreetMap, server-to-client communication via Server-Sent Events (SSE), MCP tools for map control (adding markers, polygons, setting view, getting view), and a PostgreSQL/PostGIS query interface for OpenStreetMap data.

MCP-Typescribe is an MCP Server that provides LLMs with API information, particularly TypeScript definitions. It aims to solve the problem of LLMs not being able to use new or internal APIs effectively by parsing and serving API documentation in a machine-readable format. Key features include TypeDoc integration, comprehensive query capabilities, and adherence to the Model Context Protocol for seamless integration with AI agents.

MCP Server for ZenML is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that interacts with the ZenML API, providing access to core read functionality and the ability to trigger new pipeline runs. Key features include access to users, stacks, pipelines, pipeline runs, steps, services, stack components, flavors, run templates, schedules, artifacts, service connectors, step code, and step logs. The server is useful for developers working with ML and AI pipelines.

Browser Use Server is a Model Context Protocol server for browser automation using Python scripts. It supports various browser operations such as taking screenshots, retrieving HTML content, executing JavaScript, and getting console logs. The server also includes features like multi-step browser automation, authentication handling, and DOM manipulation. It integrates with multiple LLM providers and can be configured to use Xvfb for headless browser automation.

Bluesky MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects to Bluesky and provides tools to interact with the ATProtocol. It allows users to interact with common Bluesky features via natural language, fetch and analyze feeds, lists of followers, and more. Features include getting recent posts, analyzing feeds, fetching user profiles, following and unfollowing users, liking posts, creating posts, and searching for posts, people, and feeds. The server can be installed via Smithery or manually and requires an app password for authentication.

MCP Chain of Draft Server is a powerful AI-driven tool that helps developers make better decisions through systematic, iterative refinement of thoughts and designs. It integrates seamlessly with popular AI agents and provides a structured approach to reasoning, API design, architecture decisions, code reviews, and implementation planning. Key features include Iterative Reasoning, Thought History, Branching Support, TypeScript Support, Error Handling, and Real-time Logging.

MCP Google Map Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides comprehensive Google Maps API integration with LLM processing capabilities. Main features include location search, geocoding services, distance and directions, and elevation data. The server offers tools for searching nearby places, getting place details, geocoding, reverse geocoding, calculating distances and travel times, and retrieving elevation data.

Databutton MCP is a tool for building and deploying frontends and backends in React and Python APIs/MCPs, aimed at creating complex business applications. It includes a planning mode for generating an initial plan for your app and provides a good starting point for app development. The MCP server can be installed and configured for use with Claude Desktop, and it supports debugging through the MCP Inspector.

X MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for X (Twitter) integration, providing tools for reading your timeline and engaging with tweets. It includes features such as getting tweets from the home timeline, creating new tweets, replying to tweets, built-in rate limit handling, and TypeScript implementation with full type safety. The server is designed for use with Claude desktop and requires a Twitter Developer Account.

GitHub Mapper MCP Server is a tool for mapping and analyzing GitHub repositories. It allows users to set a GitHub Personal Access Token and retrieve detailed information about a specified repository, including its structure and summary statistics. Features include setting a GitHub token, mapping repository structure, and retrieving repository summary information.

Imagen3-MCP is an image generation tool based on Google's Imagen 3.0, providing services through MCP (Model Control Protocol). It can generate photorealistic and high-tech images, such as a running Jack Russell Terrier and a high-tech apple. The tool requires a valid Google Gemini API key and can be configured in Cherry Studio or Cursor with various optional environment variables for advanced settings.
语雀 MCP 服务器是一个用于与语雀 API 集成的 Model-Context-Protocol (MCP) 服务器，提供了与语雀知识库平台交互的工具。主要功能包括获取用户和文档信息、创建、读取、更新和删除文档、搜索内容、获取知识库信息以及统计数据和分析信息。

Readwise MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for accessing and interacting with your Readwise library. It provides features such as accessing highlights, searching for highlights using natural language queries, getting books and documents, seamless integration with Claude and other MCP-compatible assistants, enhanced prompt capabilities for highlight analysis, and more. The server also includes robust error handling, transport-aware logging, and health check endpoints.

Infisical Model Context Protocol server allows integration with Infisical APIs through function calling. It supports various tools for interacting with Infisical, including creating, deleting, and updating secrets, listing secrets, and managing projects, environments, and folders. The setup involves setting environment variables for authentication and running the server using npx. Debugging can be done using the MCP Inspector.

Financial Datasets MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial and crypto data, and can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude for financial analysis.

MCP Fetch is a Model Context Protocol server for fetching web content and processing images. It allows Claude Desktop (or any MCP client) to fetch and format web content as markdown, extract article titles, and process images with various optimizations. Features include Web Content Extraction, Article Title Extraction, Image Processing, Pagination Support, JPEG Optimization, and GIF Support.

Dune Analytics MCP Server is a tool that bridges Dune Analytics data to AI agents. It provides features such as fetching the latest results of a Dune query by ID and executing a Dune query by ID to retrieve results, with all results returned as CSV-formatted strings for easy processing. The server requires Python 3.10+ and a valid Dune Analytics API key.

Rust Docs MCP Server is a tool designed to provide up-to-date and accurate documentation for specific Rust crates, improving the accuracy of AI-powered coding assistants. Key features include targeted documentation, feature support, semantic search, LLM summarization, caching, and MCP integration. The server fetches and parses crate documentation, generates embeddings, and provides a tool to answer questions based on the current documentation context.
