MCP Playwright CDP is a Model Context Protocol server that provides browser automation capabilities using Playwright with Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP) support. Key features include connecting to existing Chrome instances via CDP, full browser automation, screenshot capture, comprehensive web interactions, console log monitoring, JavaScript execution in the browser context, and HTTP API testing support.

@lishenxydlgzs/aws-athena-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for running AWS Athena queries. It allows AI assistants to execute SQL queries against AWS Athena databases and retrieve results. Key features include executing, checking the status, and retrieving results of SQL queries, listing and running saved queries, and providing detailed configuration options for AWS credentials and query parameters.

Safe Local Python Executor is an MCP server that wraps Hugging Face's LocalPythonExecutor to provide a safer execution environment for Python code generated by LLMs. It offers features such as exposing a `run_python` tool, safer execution compared to direct use of Python `eval()`, running in a Python venv with restricted file I/O and imports, and can be integrated with LLM apps like Claude Desktop. It aims to balance ease of setup with security.

Outlook Calendar MCP Tool is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows Claude to access and manage your local Microsoft Outlook calendar on Windows. Main features include viewing and managing calendar events, finding free time slots, and supporting multiple calendars. It also provides tools for creating, updating, and checking attendee status for events.

NEAR MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) compatible server for interacting with the NEAR blockchain. It provides a way for LLMs and AI agents to securely access and interact with NEAR accounts and blockchain functionality. Main features include managing NEAR accounts, checking account balances, signing and sending transactions, creating new accounts, managing access keys, and inspecting and executing smart contracts.

SeaTunnel MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with SeaTunnel through LLM interfaces like Claude. It provides features such as job management (submit, stop, monitor), system monitoring and information retrieval, REST API interaction with SeaTunnel services, built-in logging and monitoring tools, dynamic connection configuration, and comprehensive job information and statistics.

Octomind MCP server is a tool for creating, executing, and managing end-to-end (e2e) tests. It provides features such as test creation, execution, environment management, and test report retrieval. The server integrates with various development environments and offers tools like search, getTestCase, executeTests, and more.

Letta MCP Server is a server that provides tools for agent management, memory operations, and integration with the Letta system. It includes features such as creating, listing, and managing agents, memory blocks, and tools. The server can be run using Node.js or Docker, and it supports various operations like model management, archive management, and import/export functionalities.

Pinecone Assistant MCP Server is an implementation for retrieving information from Pinecone Assistant. It supports multiple results retrieval with a configurable number of results and can be run using Docker or built from source. The server requires a Pinecone API key and optionally a Pinecone Assistant API host.

OracleDB MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides configured Oracle Database Table/Columns as context to LLMs. It enables LLMs to interact with Oracle Database, generate SQL statements, and return results using LLM prompts. Key features include installation via pip, environment configuration, and support for white-listed tables and columns.

Redis Cloud API MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows you to manage Redis Cloud resources using natural language. Main features include account management, subscription management, database capabilities, cloud provider management, and task management. It supports integration with Claude Desktop and Cursor IDE, and can be run in a Docker container.

Kite MCP Server is a tool for integrating with the Kite Connect API, which provides various financial services. The main features include User & Account Methods (e.g., GetUserProfile, GetUserMargins), Orders & Trades Methods (e.g., GetOrders, PlaceOrder), GTT Orders (e.g., GetGTTs, PlaceGTT), and Market Data Methods (e.g., GetQuote, GetHistoricalData). It supports both stdio and SSE modes and can be self-hosted or used via a hosted version.

OBS MCP Server is a tool that allows control of OBS Studio via the OBS WebSocket protocol. It provides features for general operations, scene management, source control, scene item manipulation, streaming and recording, and transitions. The server can be installed and run using Node.js, and it requires OBS Studio with the WebSocket server enabled.

Scrapeless MCP Server is a tool that integrates real-time Google SERP results into LLM applications, acting as a bridge between LLMs and Scrapeless's Google SERP. It enables dynamic context retrieval for AI workflows, chatbots, and research tools, with features including web search, country and language parameters, and seamless integration with LLMs like ChatGPT and Claude.

MCP GDB Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides GDB debugging functionality for use with Claude or other AI assistants. Main features include starting and managing GDB debugging sessions, loading programs and core dumps for analysis, setting breakpoints, stepping through code, examining memory, viewing call stacks, variables, and registers, and executing arbitrary GDB commands.

Unreasonable Thinking Server is a TypeScript-based MCP server that implements an unreasonable thinking system. It helps generate unconventional solutions to problems by generating thoughts that challenge conventional wisdom, creating branches of thinking in different directions, and tracking and organizing thoughts in a session. Key features include generating new unconventional thoughts, creating new branches of thinking, and listing all thoughts in the session with filtering and relationship visualization.

Todoist MCP Server is an implementation that integrates Claude with Todoist, enabling natural language task management. Key features include Natural Language Task Management, Smart Task Search, Flexible Filtering, Rich Task Details, and Intuitive Error Handling. It supports creating, updating, completing, and deleting tasks using everyday language.

React MCP (Model Context Protocol) is a powerful server implementation that enables Claude AI to interact with React applications. It provides features such as React project management, file operations, process management, command execution, and comprehensive logging. This tool allows for the creation of new React applications, running development servers, managing files and directories, installing npm packages, executing terminal commands, and tracking long-running processes.

Redash MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates Redash with AI assistants like Claude. It provides features to connect to Redash instances, list and manage queries and dashboards, execute queries, and retrieve results. Main functionalities include query management, query execution, and dashboard management.

A2A Client MCP Server is a tool that allows LLMs to interact with A2A agents through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Key features include connecting to any A2A-compatible agent, sending and receiving messages, tracking and managing tasks, support for streaming responses, and querying agent capabilities and metadata. The server also provides tools for task management and agent information retrieval.

MCP WebSocket Server is a project that implements an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server with WebSocket enhancements for real-time data updates. It allows clients to make standard MCP requests and subscribe to real-time updates via WebSockets. Key features include handling standard MCP requests, WebSocket-based subscriptions, push notifications, and an async architecture using `asyncio` for efficient non-blocking operations.

MCP-Hub-MCP Server is a hub server that connects to and manages other MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers. Key features include automatic connection to other MCP servers via configuration file, listing available tools on connected servers, and calling tools on connected servers and returning results. It is especially useful for bypassing Cursor’s 40-tool MCP limit and reducing AI mistakes by hiding infrequently used tools.

scrapbox-cosense-mcp is a MCP server for cosense/scrapbox, providing functionalities such as getting page content, listing pages, full-text search across all pages, and creating new pages. Main features include get_page, list_pages, search_pages, and create_pages, with support for basic, AND, OR, and NOT searches.

gyazo-mcp-server is a TypeScript-based MCP server for Gyazo image integration. It allows AI assistants to access and interact with Gyazo images through the Model Context Protocol. Main features include resources representing Gyazo images with URIs and metadata, tools for searching, fetching, and uploading images, and access to image content and metadata via the Gyazo API.

MCP Trino Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides seamless integration with Trino and Iceberg, enabling advanced data exploration, querying, and table maintenance capabilities. Key features include interactive data exploration and analysis in Trino, automated Iceberg table maintenance and optimization, building AI-powered tools that interact with Trino databases, and executing and managing SQL queries with proper result formatting.

DataWorks MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for AI to interact with the DataWorks Open API through a standardized interface. It allows AI agents to manage and interact with DataWorks resources, enabling seamless cloud resource operations. Key features include interacting with DataWorks Open API, managing DataWorks resources, and providing a standardized interface for AI agents.

MCP Server Obsidian Omnisearch is a FastMCP-based server that provides Obsidian vault search functionality through a REST API interface. Key features include searching through Obsidian vault notes, REST API integration, returning absolute paths to matching notes, and easy integration with FastMCP tools.

ast-grep MCP is an experimental implementation using the ast-grep CLI for codebase searching. It requires installing ast-grep, uv, and an MCP client (preferably Cursor). The main feature is the ability to search through your codebase using the configured MCP server.

Kubernetes MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for managing Kubernetes resources through large language models (LLMs) like Claude. It provides a bridge between LLMs and Kubernetes clusters, enabling users to interact with their Kubernetes resources through natural language. Key features include Cluster Management, Resource Operations, Pod Management, Deployment Management, Service Operations, YAML Support, and Custom Resource Support.

Volatility MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates the Volatility 3 memory forensics framework with Claude and other MCP-compatible LLMs. It allows investigators to analyze memory dumps using natural language, reducing the technical expertise needed for memory forensics. Key features include natural language memory forensics, process analysis, network forensics, malware detection, DLL analysis, file object scanning, custom plugins, and memory dump discovery.

ESXi MCP Server is a VMware ESXi/vCenter management server based on MCP (Model Control Protocol) that provides simple REST API interfaces for virtual machine management. Key features include support for ESXi and vCenter Server connections, real-time communication via SSE, RESTful API with JSON-RPC, API key authentication, complete VM lifecycle management, and real-time performance monitoring.

Todoist MCP Server Extended is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server implementation that integrates Claude or any MCP compatible LLM with Todoist, enabling natural language task management. Key features include Task Management, Label Management, Project Management, Section Organization, Smart Search, Flexible Filtering, Rich Task Details, and Batch Operations.
Code Merge MCP 是一个基于 Model Context Protocol (MCP) 的服务器实现，专为代码文件内容提取、合并和分析而设计。核心功能包括文件树生成、代码合并、代码分析和智能过滤。它提供了一套强大的工具，帮助大语言模型（如GPT、Claude）更有效地处理和分析代码库。

Sentry MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Sentry, providing tools to interact with the Sentry API. It allows AI assistants to retrieve and analyze error data, manage projects, and monitor application performance. Key features include listing and managing Sentry projects, resolving short IDs, retrieving and analyzing specific Sentry events, creating new projects, listing project issues, and handling comprehensive error management.

Dappier MCP Server enables fast, free real-time web search and access to premium data from trusted media brands, including news, financial markets, sports, entertainment, weather, and more. It provides features like Real-Time Web Search, Stock Market Insights, and AI-Powered Content Recommendations, making it ideal for building live, interactive tools powered by the latest web data and financial information.

GitHub Enterprise MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for integration with GitHub Enterprise API. It provides an MCP interface to easily access repository information, issues, PRs, and more from GitHub Enterprise in Cursor. Key features include retrieving repository lists, managing repositories, branches, files, issues, pull requests, GitHub Actions, and user management. The server supports both English and Korean languages and can be set up using Docker, local development, or as a global command.

MCP Server for Things3 provides integration with Things3, allowing you to create and manage tasks and projects through the MCP protocol. Key features include creating new projects and to-dos in Things3, synchronizing projects between Agenda and Things3, listing current tasks and projects, and AppleScript integration for data retrieval.

delve-mcp is a TypeScript-based MCP server that provides a complete interface to the Delve debugger for Go programs. It supports various debugging, tracing, and analysis features, including debug commands, core dump analysis, program tracing, replay debugging, DAP server support, breakpoint management, execution control, variable inspection, backend selection, and logging configuration. The server requires Go with Delve, Mozilla rr (for replay functionality), and Node.js with npm.

FEGIS is a framework for creating structured, capable interactions with language models using model context protocol. It enables the creation of interactive agents that can produce context-rich outputs and supports various configurations for different use cases. Key components include Model Context Protocol, Agent Archetypes, Tools, Processes, Frames, and Knowledge Store. FEGIS provides a config-driven approach for designing and iterating on effective, interactive agents.

R MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides advanced econometric modeling and data analysis capabilities through R. It enables AI assistants to perform sophisticated econometric and statistical analyses, including linear regression, panel data analysis, instrumental variables, and diagnostic tests. The server supports features like robust standard errors, fixed and random effects models, and various diagnostic tests for heteroskedasticity, autocorrelation, and model misspecification.

mcp-osint OSINT Server is a tool for performing open source intelligence (OSINT) investigations. It supports various network reconnaissance tasks such as WHOIS lookups, Nmap scans, DNS reconnaissance, DNSTwist lookups, dig lookups, and host lookups. The server also offers a consolidated tool to run all these functions in parallel for a comprehensive OSINT report.

This MCP supports simple project builds with logging and automatic issue fixing based on logs for esp-idf build command. It is a proof of concept that can be extended for use with embedded devices, home assistants, or documentation. The setup involves cloning the repository and configuring it in your chatbot.

VibeShift Web tester is an AI-powered tool designed to streamline web testing workflows, particularly for developers using AI coding assistants. It integrates with MCP (Machine Command Protocol) and supports features like AI-Assisted Test Recording, Deterministic Test Execution, AI-Powered Test Discovery, Regression Testing, Automated Feedback Loop, Self Healing, UI tests, and Visual Regression Testing.

Gradle MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI tools to interact with Gradle projects programmatically. It provides features for inspecting project details, executing tasks, and running tests hierarchically. Key functionalities include retrieving detailed project information, running specific Gradle tasks, and executing test tasks with structured JSON output. The server can be installed via command-line or manual download and configured for use with MCP clients like VSCode extensions or the Claude Desktop app.

SQLite MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides database interaction and business intelligence capabilities through SQLite. It enables running SQL queries, analyzing business data, and automatically generating business insight memos. Key features include query tools for reading and writing data, schema tools for managing tables, and analysis tools for appending insights to a continuously updated memo.

Cursor DB MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for accessing Cursor IDE's SQLite databases. It allows AI assistants to explore and interact with Cursor's project data, chat history, and composer information. Key features include web scraping, crawling, and discovery, search and content extraction, deep research and batch scraping, automatic retries and rate limiting, cloud and self-hosted support, and SSE support.

n8n Workflow Builder MCP Server is a tool for programmatically creating and managing n8n workflows. Key features include the ability to create workflows with nodes and connections, validate workflow specifications, export complete workflow configurations, and interact via a REST API interface through MCP.

MCP Flux Studio is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates Flux's advanced image generation capabilities into AI coding assistants like Cursor and Windsurf. Key features include text-to-image generation, image manipulation, inpainting, and advanced controls such as edge-based and depth-aware generation. It also supports multiple models and customizable aspect ratios.

SearXNG MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with SearXNG, providing privacy-focused meta search capabilities. Key features include combining results from multiple search engines, no tracking or user profiling, support for various categories like general, news, science, files, images, and videos, language support, time range filtering, safe search levels, and fallback support for reliability.

Whale Tracker MCP Server is a Python-based implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that integrates with the Whale Alert API to track and analyze large cryptocurrency transactions. Main features include fetching recent whale transactions, retrieving detailed transaction information, analyzing whale activity, asynchronous API calls, and environment variable support for secure API key management.

The claude-code-mcp project is an MCP server for Claude Code, designed to help developers with various code-related tasks such as explaining, reviewing, fixing, editing, and testing code. It provides tools like `explain_code`, `review_code`, `fix_code`, `edit_code`, `test_code`, `simulate_command`, and `your_own_query`. The server is implemented using Node.js and the MCP SDK, and it processes requests in JSON format, encoding input, generating and executing commands, and returning results in JSON format. The project includes enhanced security features and supports multiple installation and configuration methods.

Mailgun MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for Mailgun, enabling MCP-compatible AI clients like Claude Desktop to interact with the service. Key features include sending emails and fetching email delivery statistics.

This project is a MySQL query server based on the MCP framework, supporting real-time database operations via SSE protocol. It features comprehensive security, logging, configuration, and sensitive information protection mechanisms, suitable for secure MySQL data access in development, testing, and production environments. Key features include high-performance async, connection pool for high concurrency, SSE real-time push support, rich MySQL metadata & schema query APIs, automatic transaction management & rollback, multi-level SQL risk control & injection protection, flexible environment variable configuration, robust logging & error handling, and Docker support for quick deployment.

Frame0 MCP Server is a tool for creating and modifying wireframes in Frame0 by prompting. It allows users to create and modify UI elements such as login screens, home screens, and other UI components. The server supports various tools for creating, updating, and managing shapes, icons, images, and pages within the wireframe.

shannon-thinking is an MCP server that demonstrates Claude Shannon's systematic problem-solving methodology. It helps break down complex problems into structured thoughts, following a defined approach of problem definition, constraints, mathematical modeling, and practical implementation. Key features include iterative problem-solving, flexible validation, dependency tracking, assumption management, confidence levels, and rich feedback.

Dataset Viewer MCP Server is a tool for interacting with the Hugging Face Dataset Viewer API, providing capabilities to browse and analyze datasets hosted on the Hugging Face Hub. Key features include using `dataset://` URI scheme, supporting dataset configurations and splits, paginated access, authentication for private datasets, searching and filtering, dataset statistics, and analysis. The server provides tools like validate, get_info, get_rows, get_first_rows, get_statistics, search_dataset, filter, and get_parquet.

mcp-sentry is a Model Context Protocol server for retrieving and analyzing issues from Sentry.io. It provides tools to inspect error reports, stacktraces, and other debugging information from your Sentry account. Main features include retrieving and analyzing Sentry issues by ID or URL, retrieving and analyzing issues by project slug, and providing detailed issue information such as title, status, level, timestamps, and event count.

react-analyzer-mcp is a tool that analyzes React component files (JSX/TSX) and extracts information about components and their props. It can generate documentation for all React components in a project folder and list all projects under the root folder. The main features include analyzing a single React component, generating documentation for all React components, and listing all projects.

MCP Server: Mermaid Validator is a Model Context Protocol server that validates and renders Mermaid diagrams. It uses the Mermaid CLI to validate and render diagrams, returning the results as text and a base64-encoded PNG image if valid. The server integrates with MCP-compatible clients and provides detailed error messages for invalid diagrams. Key features include validation, rendering, and error handling.

mcp-llms-txt is an MCP server for Awesome-llms-txt, which allows adding documentation directly into conversations via MCP resources. It provides installation instructions for both Smithery and manual setup, as well as testing and contribution guidelines.

MySQL Schema MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides compressed schema information for MySQL databases. It is useful for large database schemas where the schema dump file does not fit in the context size. The main features include listing all table information and displaying detailed information for specific tables, with parameters for specifying the database name and table names.
Mail MCP 工具是一个基于MCP (Model Context Protocol) 的邮件工具，它能让AI模型通过标准化接口访问电子邮件服务。主要功能包括邮件发送、接收与查询、邮件管理、附件管理、联系人管理等。该工具支持多种邮件格式、高级搜索、智能联系人管理和安全可靠的数据处理。

Wireshark-MCP Integration Toolkit is a powerful integration between Wireshark and MCP (Machine Control Protocol) that enables natural language interaction with network analysis through Claude Desktop. The toolkit includes a Python MCP Server for managing communication and providing a CLI interface, and a Lua Wireshark Extension for real-time packet dissection and analysis.

YouTube Transcript MCP Server is a tool that retrieves transcripts for given YouTube video URLs. It provides the `get_transcript` tool to fetch the transcript of a specified YouTube video, with options to specify the desired language. The server can be installed and configured for use with Goose CLI, Goose Desktop, and Claude Desktop, and it supports the use of proxy servers in restricted environments.

Prolog MCP is a tool for executing Prolog, querying it, and searching existing predicates. It can be installed via Smithery or manually by building it to an executable and adding the full path to the MCP config.

lightdash-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to Lightdash's API, allowing AI assistants to interact with Lightdash data. Key features include listing and getting details of projects, spaces, charts, dashboards, and custom metrics, as well as retrieving catalog and code representations of charts and dashboards.

EdgeOne Pages MCP: Geo Location Service is a project that demonstrates how to use EdgeOne Pages Functions to retrieve user geolocation information and integrate it with large language models through MCP (Model Context Protocol). The main components include an EdgeOne Pages Function for geolocation data retrieval and an MCP server integration for AI model access to this data. Features include geolocation data in JSON format, MCP server interface, and `get_geolocation` tool for AI models.

Tana MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects to Tana's Input API, allowing Large Language Models (LLMs) and other MCP clients to create and manipulate data in Tana workspaces. It fully implements all capabilities of the Tana Input API.

MATLAB MCP Server provides integration with MATLAB, allowing you to create and execute MATLAB scripts and functions through Claude or other MCP clients. Key features include creating and executing MATLAB scripts and functions, returning output text, generated figures, and workspace variables, and managing script storage in the `matlab_scripts` directory.

This guide explains how to set up and run an MCP server to interact with a PostgreSQL database using Claude Desktop. It also supports MySQL, MariaDB, and SQLite. The main features include setting up environment variables, installing and running Claude Desktop, launching a PostgreSQL database with dummy data, installing `uv`, configuring the MCP server, and interacting with the database seamlessly through Claude Desktop.

MCP Neurolora is an intelligent MCP server that provides tools for code analysis using OpenAI API, code collection, and documentation generation. Key features include code analysis with OpenAI, structured feedback, best practices recommendations, GitHub issues generation, code collection with syntax highlighting and navigation, and base server management with automatic installation and configuration handling.

mcp-toolbox is a comprehensive toolkit for enhancing LLM capabilities through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides a collection of tools that allow LLMs to interact with external services and APIs, extending their functionality beyond text generation. Main features include Command Line Execution, Figma Integration, Extensible Architecture, MCP Protocol Support, and Comprehensive Testing. The toolbox also includes various tools for file operations, Figma, audio, memory, Markdown conversion, web content, and image generation.

Slack Model Context Protocol Server is a connector that allows Claude Desktop (or any MCP client) to interact with your Slack workspace. It enables posting messages and querying a list of all users, and includes a wide range of permissions for various Slack functionalities such as message posting, user management, file handling, and more.

Semantic Scholar API MCP server is a tool that allows integration with the Semantic Scholar API for research purposes. It provides features such as setting up and running the server, configuring the API key for higher rate limits, and includes a suggested agent system prompt for pre-research. The server can be used to enhance research capabilities by leveraging the Semantic Scholar API.

EMQX MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides interaction with the EMQX MQTT broker. It enables MCP clients to manage and interact with MQTT clusters, whether on EMQX Cloud or self-hosted. Key features include MQTT client management, message publishing with QoS control, and various tools for listing, getting, and disconnecting MQTT clients.

Whois MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for WHOIS lookups, allowing AI agents to perform domain, IP, and autonomous system number (ASN) lookups. It provides detailed information such as domain name, registrar, registrant details, registration and expiry dates, name servers, and domain status. The tool can be integrated with various IDEs like Cursor and Roo Code, and it supports both global and project-specific installations.

Babashka MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for interacting with Babashka, a native Clojure interpreter for scripting. Main features include executing Babashka code through MCP tools, caching recent command results, accessing command history, and configurable command timeouts. The server can be configured through environment variables and supports various installation methods on different operating systems. It also provides useful resources and development tools for Babashka.

Chrome MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides fine-grained control over a Chrome browser instance through the Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP). It offers tools for navigation, clicking, typing, and retrieving page information. The server can be used with Roo Code for browser automation and control.

MCP Ethical Hacking is a repository intended for educational purposes to demonstrate potential security risks in MCP implementations and how to recognize and prevent security issues. It includes tools for analyzing content from social media platforms like Reddit and LinkedIn, and highlights important security considerations such as code execution, obfuscation techniques, and data access. Best practices for using MCP tools are also provided.

Twitter MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server implementation for Twitter API integration. It provides a wide range of functionalities including tweet operations, search and analytics, user operations, engagement, and list management. Features include posting tweets, searching for tweets, getting user information, liking and retweeting, and managing lists.

mcp-server-esignatures is an MCP server for eSignatures, providing tools to create, query, withdraw, delete, and list contracts, as well as manage templates and collaborators. It supports creating and sending contracts, updating templates, and inviting collaborators to edit templates. The server integrates with eSignatures API and requires an eSignatures account for use.

Fibery MCP Server provides integration between Fibery and any LLM provider supporting the MCP protocol, allowing interaction with your Fibery workspace using natural language. Key features include querying Fibery entities, getting information about databases and fields, creating and updating entities, and tools for listing and describing databases, as well as querying, creating, and updating entities.

mcp-pyautogui-server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides automated GUI testing and control capabilities through PyAutoGUI. Main features include mouse and keyboard control, screen operations, and cross-platform support for Windows, macOS, and Linux.

Higress OPS MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for comprehensive configuration and management of Higress. It includes an MCP client built on LangGraph and LangChain MCP Adapters, facilitating interaction through a well-designed agent flow architecture. Key features include environment configuration, starting the MCP client and server, adding new tools, and managing sensitive operations that require human confirmation.

ServeMyAPI is a personal MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for securely storing and accessing API keys across projects using the macOS Keychain. It provides secure storage of API keys, simple MCP tools for managing keys, a convenient CLI interface, and support for both stdio and HTTP/SSE transports. It also integrates with LLMs like Claude and offers features such as storing, retrieving, listing, and deleting keys.

Financial Datasets MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial and crypto data, and can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude for financial analysis.

Spiral MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for the Spiral API using Python. It provides a standardized interface for interacting with Spiral's language models. Key features include robust error handling, article extraction from web pages, flexible input sources (text, files, URLs), asynchronous operations, type safety, and detailed logging.

Android ADB MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to interact with Android devices through the Android Debug Bridge (ADB). It bridges the gap between AI capabilities and Android device management, allowing for seamless automation of Android development and testing operations. Main features include connecting and managing multiple Android devices, executing shell commands, installing and uninstalling applications, pushing and pulling files, launching applications, taking screenshots, and smart device selection.

mcp-server-ledger is a Model Context Protocol server for interacting with Ledger CLI, a double-entry accounting system. It allows Large Language Models to query and analyze financial data. Key features include showing account balances, transaction registers, listing accounts and payees, budget analysis, and more. The server provides tools that map to Ledger CLI commands, making it easy for AI assistants to help with financial reporting, budget analysis, and accounting tasks.

mcp-server-prometheus is a TypeScript-based MCP server that interacts with Prometheus metrics and data, providing a bridge between Claude and your Prometheus server. Key features include listing and accessing Prometheus metric schema, detailed metadata, statistical information, and support for basic authentication for secured Prometheus instances.

Free USDC Transfer MCP Server is an implementation that enables free USDC transfers on the Base network using Coinbase CDP MPC Wallet integration. Key features include free USDC transfers, support for ENS and BaseName domains, and the ability to create and manage a Coinbase MPC wallet. The server also provides functions to transfer USDC and create a new Coinbase MPC wallet.

GeoServer MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that connects Large Language Models (LLMs) to the GeoServer REST API, enabling AI assistants to interact with geospatial data and services. Main features include querying and manipulating GeoServer workspaces, layers, and styles, executing spatial queries on vector data, generating map visualizations, and accessing OGC-compliant web services (WMS, WFS).

Trino MCP Server is a Model-Control-Protocol server that allows you to list and query tables via Trino using Python. It provides a list of Trino tables as MCP resources, the ability to read table contents through MCP, and a tool for executing arbitrary SQL queries against Trino. The server uses Trino's Python client (trino.dbapi) to connect to a Trino host, catalog, and schema.

Hyperliquid MCP Server is an implementation that integrates the Hyperliquid SDK, providing tools for financial data retrieval such as getting mid prices for all coins, historical candlestick data, and L2 order book access. The server can be used with Claude Desktop and is licensed under the MIT License.

Moondream MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that brings advanced image analysis capabilities to your applications using the Moondream vision model. Key features include Image Captioning, Object Detection, Visual Question Answering, high performance with quantized 8-bit models, and automatic setup. Use cases include content analysis, accessibility, data extraction, object verification, and scene understanding.

Nile MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for the Nile database platform, allowing LLM applications to interact with the Nile platform through a standardized interface. Key features include Database Management, Credential Management, Region Management, SQL Query Support, MCP Protocol Support, Type Safety, Error Handling, Test Coverage, Environment Management, and Input Validation.

PulseMCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for discovering and exploring MCP servers and integrations through the PulseMCP API. Main features include listing available MCP servers with filtering and pagination, searching for specific MCP servers by name or functionality, filtering servers by integration types, and listing all available integrations. The server also includes full TypeScript support and robust error handling.

ChuckNorris MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that provides specialized enhancement prompts to various LLMs. It uses jailbreak prompts and a dynamic schema approach for more effective delivery. The tool is designed for security research and evaluation purposes to help identify vulnerabilities in LLM systems. Key features include a two-phase approach to bypass jailbreak detection, dynamic schema modification, and integration with elder-plinius' L1B3RT4S project.

Todo List MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a comprehensive API for managing todo items. Main features include creating, updating, completing, and deleting todos, as well as searching and summarizing them. It also serves as an educational resource for understanding MCP implementation.

MCP Video Digest is a video content processing service that can extract audio from videos on platforms like YouTube, Bilibili, TikTok, and Twitter, and convert it to text. It supports multiple transcription service providers including Deepgram, Gladia, Speechmatics, and AssemblyAI, and can flexibly choose services based on available API keys. Features include support for over 1000 websites, asynchronous processing, comprehensive error handling, and speaker separation.

KDebug is a Kubernetes debugging tool that allows you to interact with your Kubernetes clusters through Claude AI. It uses the Model Control Protocol (MCP) to enable Claude to execute Kubernetes commands on your behalf. Main features include inspecting Kubernetes resources, viewing pod logs, checking node status, monitoring events, and more, all through conversational AI.

AI Humanize MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that refines AI-generated content to sound more natural and human-like. Key features include AI Detection, Natural Language Enhancement, Grammar Perfection, Readability Optimization, Length Control, and Term Preservation. It is built with advanced AI detection and text enhancement capabilities and requires Node.js and Claude Desktop for installation and usage.

Datomic MCP Server is a server built with Modex that provides Datomic API support. Key features include concurrent queries, various Datomic API functions like `datomic.api/q`, `datomic.api/datoms`, `datomic.api/with`, `datomic.api/pull`, and more. It also includes future plans for features such as transaction support, better cursor-based pagination, and stable database basis.

PDF Reader MCP Server is a tool that allows AI agents to securely read and extract information (text, metadata, page count) from PDF files. Key features include reading full text content, specific pages, metadata, and total page count, processing multiple PDF sources in a single request, and providing structured JSON output. It is available via npm and Docker Hub, and prioritizes security, efficiency, and easy integration into AI agent workflows.

StockFlow MCP Server provides real-time stock data and options analysis through Yahoo Finance. It enables LLMs to access market data, analyze stocks, and evaluate options strategies. Main features include real-time stock prices and key metrics, historical price data, company fundamentals, options chain data, Greeks, and options strategy analysis.

MCP Server for Vertex AI Search is a solution that uses Gemini with Vertex AI grounding to search documents using private data. Key features include integration with one or multiple Vertex AI data stores, improved search result quality through grounding, support for Docker and local development, and configuration via a YAML file. The server supports SSE and stdio transports and can be tested with the `mcp-vertexai-search search` command.

Twitter MCP Client is a tool that allows interaction with the Twitter API through RapidAPI. It requires setting up an API key and configuring the client to run with the necessary environment variables.

PyMOL-MCP is a tool that integrates PyMOL with Claude AI through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling conversational structural biology, molecular visualization, and analysis. Key features include two-way communication, intelligent command parsing, molecular visualization control, structural analysis, and code execution.

mcp-k8s-eye is a tool for managing and diagnosing Kubernetes clusters. It supports core Kubernetes operations such as connecting to a cluster, managing various resources (Pods, Deployments, Services, etc.), and performing diagnostics on different Kubernetes components. The tool also includes advanced features like support for multiple transport protocols (Stdio, SSE) and multiple AI clients.

godoc-mcp-server is a tool that allows users to search for Golang packages and their documentation from pkg.go.dev. It provides this information to an LLM as an MCP server. Key features include local caching, searching for package imports, and retrieving package information. The tool aims to improve the development experience by providing detailed and configurable descriptions for parameters, making it easier to use one tool's output as another tool's input.

Confluence MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Confluence, enabling AI assistants to interact with Confluence content through a standardized interface. Key features include authentication using a personal API token, retrieving and searching Confluence pages and spaces, creating and updating content, adding comments and attachments, and handling API communication with error handling and data transformation. The server also includes basic rate limiting to prevent API abuse.

TouchDesigner MCP is an implementation of an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for TouchDesigner, enabling AI agents to control and operate TouchDesigner projects. Key features include creating, modifying, and deleting nodes, querying node properties and project structure, and programmatically controlling TouchDesigner via Python scripts. The setup involves installing the touchdesigner-mcp-server package, connecting to TouchDesigner, and configuring the AI agent to connect to the MCP server.

Confluence Cloud MCP Server provides tools for interacting with Confluence Cloud, enabling AI assistants to manage Confluence spaces, pages, and content. Main features include Space Management, Page Operations, and Search & Labels, with capabilities such as listing spaces, creating, reading, and updating pages, and managing page labels.

AdsPower LocalAPI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that enables LLMs to interact with the AdsPower browser. It supports various operations such as starting, creating, updating, and deleting browsers, managing browser groups, and configuring browser fingerprints and proxies. The server can be used with Claude Desktop and other IDEs like Cursor.

Grasshopper MCP Bridge is a bridging server that connects Grasshopper and Claude Desktop using the Model Context Protocol (MCP) standard. It provides intuitive tool functions for creating and connecting Grasshopper components, supports high-level intent recognition, includes a component knowledge base, and provides component guidance resources to help Claude Desktop correctly connect components.

Atla MCP Server is an implementation providing a standardized interface for LLMs to interact with the Atla API for state-of-the-art LLM evaluation. Key features include evaluating LLM responses using given criteria and evaluating responses across multiple criteria. The server can be run manually, and it integrates with various tools and platforms such as OpenAI Agents SDK, Claude Desktop, and Cursor.

TaskWarrior MCP Server is a Node.js server implementing Model Context Protocol (MCP) for TaskWarrior operations. It allows users to view pending tasks, filter tasks by project and tags, add new tasks with descriptions, due dates, priorities, projects, and tags, and mark tasks as complete. The server integrates with TaskWarrior and can be used with Claude Desktop.

notion-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Notion's API to manage a personal todo list. Main features include showing all tasks, adding new tasks, and updating existing tasks. It requires Python 3.11 or higher, a Notion account with API access, and a Notion integration token. The setup involves cloning the repository, setting up the Python environment, creating a Notion integration, and configuring the `.env` file.

PolyMarket MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to prediction market data through the PolyMarket API. It offers real-time prediction market data, detailed market information, historical price and volume data, built-in error handling, and rate limit management. The server implements four tools: get-market-info, list-markets, get-market-prices, and get-market-history.

MCP FFmpeg Video Processor is a Node.js server that uses FFmpeg to manipulate video files. It provides APIs to resize videos to different resolutions and extract audio from videos in various formats. The server can be integrated with Claude Desktop to process videos through natural language requests.

say-mcp-server is an MCP server that provides text-to-speech functionality using macOS's built-in `say` command. It offers extensive customization options for voice, rate, and other parameters, and can be integrated with various tools and services for reading text aloud.

Bitcoin SV MCP Server is a collection of tools for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) framework, providing wallet, ordinals, and utility functions for BSV blockchain interaction. Features include wallet operations, BSV blockchain tools, ordinals (NFTs) tools, utility functions, and MNEE token tools. The server can be connected to various MCP-compatible clients, and it supports natural language interaction with Bitcoin SV through AI assistants.

This Model Context Protocol (MCP) server provides access to organizational Sharepoint, enabling operations such as user management, site and subsite management, drive and folder management, list management, and calendar event management. It also includes prompts for document summary, finding relevant documents, and exploring folders. The server can be used with Claude Desktop and supports Docker for easy deployment.

MCP Notify Server is a tool that sends desktop notifications with sound effects when agent tasks are completed. It supports cross-platform (Windows, macOS, Linux) and integrates with various LLM clients. Key features include system desktop notifications, alert sounds, and integration with standard MCP protocol.

DocsFetcher MCP Server is a tool that fetches package documentation from multiple language ecosystems for LLMs like Claude without requiring API keys. It supports multiple programming languages, fetches documentation by name or URL, crawls documentation sites, extracts comprehensive information, and provides structured data for LLM summarization. It includes specialized prompts for documentation analysis and can be integrated with Claude Desktop and Cursor IDE.

Puzzlebox is an MCP Server implementation that hosts finite state machines as dynamic resources, enabling coordination and collaboration among multiple agents. It supports multiple client connections, manages puzzle instances, and exposes tools for adding puzzles, getting snapshots, performing actions, and more. This system is particularly useful for managing complex, long-horizon projects by providing a structured way to coordinate different phases and teams.

DiffuGen is an advanced local image generator with MCP integration, designed to generate, iterate, and perfect visual concepts using cutting-edge Flux and Stable Diffusion models. It seamlessly integrates with IDEs like Cursor, Windsurf, and others, and provides features such as multiple model support, parameter control, CUDA acceleration, and natural language interface for image generation.

OSSInsight MCP Server is a tool that provides data analysis for GitHub individuals, organizations, and repositories, as well as in-depth insights into the open source ecosystem. Main features include Repository Analysis, Developer Analysis, Organization Analysis, Project Comparison, Project Collections, and Natural Language Queries. It uses both the OSSInsight Public API and web page scraping to retrieve data.

MCP PDF Server is a PDF file reading server that supports PDF text extraction, OCR recognition, and image extraction via the MCP protocol. It includes features such as read_pdf_text for extracting normal text, read_by_ocr for recognizing text from scanned or image-based PDFs, and read_pdf_images for extracting images from specified PDF pages. The server also provides a built-in web debugger for easy testing and debugging.

MCP Server for Ticketmaster is a Model Context Protocol server that provides tools for discovering events, venues, and attractions through the Ticketmaster Discovery API. Key features include flexible filtering (keyword search, date range, location, venue-specific, and attraction-specific searches), output in structured JSON or human-readable text, and comprehensive data including names, IDs, dates, times, price ranges, URLs, images, and locations.

Java Filesystem & Web MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides filesystem operations and web access tools for Large Language Model (LLM) agents. It enables AI assistants to interact with both the local filesystem and web resources. Main features include reading, writing, editing, searching, and listing files, creating directories, executing bash commands, fetching web pages, and extracting HTML content.

Mozilla Readability Parser MCP Server is a tool that extracts and transforms webpage content into clean, LLM-optimized Markdown. It removes ads, navigation, footers, and other non-essential content, converts clean HTML into well-formatted Markdown, and returns article metadata such as title, excerpt, byline, and site name. The server uses Mozilla's Readability algorithm to ensure only relevant content is extracted, reducing token usage and providing consistent Markdown formatting for better LLM processing.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial and crypto data, and can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude for financial analysis.

fewsats-mcp is an MCP server that integrates with Fewsats, enabling AI agents to securely purchase items. Key features include retrieving wallet balance, managing payment methods, processing payments, and fetching payment details.

Gemini MCP Server is an implementation that enables Claude Desktop to interact with Google's Gemini 2.5 Pro Experimental AI model. Key features include full MCP protocol support, secure API key handling, optional Google Search integration, token usage reporting, and TypeScript implementation. It provides tools for generating content with the Gemini model and getting model information.

MoLing-MineCraft is an AI agent MCP server for the Minecraft game, featuring intelligent building, architecture, and game control capabilities. Through natural language interaction, it helps players realize complex constructions, redstone circuit designs, and other creative ideas, enhancing the gaming experience. Main features include building various structures, railways, redstone circuits, and more.

Nautobot MCP is an app that integrates the MCP (Model Context Protocol) server with Nautobot, providing AI-ready tools and interfaces for network automation and management. Key features include integration with Nautobot, a standardized protocol for AI interaction with network data, custom tool creation, and deployment options such as manual start and systemd service for production.

Gmail MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides Gmail integration capabilities, including viewing recent emails, searching emails using Gmail's search syntax, and secure OAuth2 authentication with the Gmail API. It supports resource access to recent emails, tool support for email search, and a secure OAuth2 authentication flow with automatic token refresh.

LinkedIn MCP Server allows users to post text and media updates to LinkedIn directly from Claude Desktop. It supports attaching images and videos, controlling post visibility, OAuth2 authentication, and secure token storage. The tool includes commands for authentication and creating posts with optional media attachments.

PubMed MCP Server enables AI assistants to search, access, and analyze PubMed articles through a simple MCP interface. Core features include paper search, efficient retrieval of metadata, research support, paper access, deep analysis, and specialized research prompts.

Xero MCP Server is a tool that allows clients to interact with Xero Accounting Software. It provides functionalities such as authentication, creating bank transactions and contacts, retrieving balance sheets, listing accounts, bank transactions, contacts, invoices, journals, organizations, payments, and quotes. The server supports OAuth 2.0 for secure access and can be used to visualize financial positions and track spendings.

Webflow MCP Server enables Claude to interact with Webflow's APIs. Main features include retrieving a list of all Webflow sites and detailed information about a specific site, handling various error scenarios, and providing security considerations. The server requires Node.js, Claude Desktop App, a Webflow account, and a Webflow API Token.

MCP Webhook Server is an implementation that integrates with webhooks, providing message sending capabilities. Key features include generic webhook support, custom username and avatar support, and MCP integration with Dive and other MCP-compatible LLMs. It allows users to send messages to any webhook endpoint and customize the display name and avatar for the messages.

Kollektiv MCP is a tool that enables users to build a personal LLM knowledge base quickly and use it from their favorite editor or client. It supports all major MCP clients, including Cursor, Windsurf, Claude Desktop, VSCode, and Cline. Key features include easy setup, data upload, and integration with various editors. The platform also provides tools for querying and listing documents, and includes security measures such as OAuth 2.1 and HTTPS.

Local Code Indexing for Cursor is an experimental Python-based server that locally indexes codebases using ChromaDB and provides a semantic search tool via an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server. It allows developers to perform semantic code search within the Cursor IDE, enhancing the ability to find and understand code.

Meeting BaaS MCP Server provides tools for managing meeting data, including transcripts, recordings, calendar events, and search functionality. Key features include inviting meeting bots, querying meeting data, managing calendar events, and accessing recording information. The server integrates with calendars, supports OAuth, and allows for scheduling, canceling, and resyncing meetings. It also includes tools for generating QR codes and sharing meeting links.

Gemini Docs MCP Server is an MCP server that enables access to documentation for various technologies using the Gemini API. It provides a curated knowledge base, overcomes context window limitations, and offers tailored responses. Features include support for multiple tools for querying the documentation, such as can_x_be_done, hints_for_problem, is_this_good_practice, and how_to_do_x. The server also includes a logging system for debugging.

Apache Doris MCP Server is an MCP server for Apache Doris, a high-performance, real-time analytical database. It provides integration and usage instructions for setting up and running the MCP server with Apache Doris, including environment setup, running the MCP Inspector, and publishing the server.

TranscriptionTools MCP Server provides intelligent transcript processing capabilities, including natural formatting, contextual repair, and smart summarization. Key features include repairing transcription errors, formatting timestamped transcripts, generating intelligent summaries, and retrieving detailed repair logs. The server uses Deep Thinking LLMs for high-confidence corrections and supports multiple constraint types for summarization.

Daytona MCP Interpreter is a Model Context Protocol server that provides Python code execution capabilities in ephemeral Daytona sandboxes. It enables AI assistants to execute Python code and shell commands, manage files, clone Git repositories, and generate web previews in secure, isolated environments.

mcp-server-unitycatalog is a Model Context Protocol server for Unity Catalog, providing Unity Catalog Functions as MCP tools. It includes features such as listing, getting, creating, and deleting functions within a Unity Catalog, with support for Docker and integration with Claude Desktop or VSCode Cline.

Zig MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides Zig language tooling, code analysis, and documentation access. It enhances AI capabilities with Zig-specific functionality including code optimization, compute unit estimation, code generation, and best practices recommendations. Features include tools for code optimization, compute units estimation, code generation, and code recommendations, as well as resources like the Zig language reference, standard library documentation, and popular repositories.

Test Runner MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for running and parsing test results from multiple testing frameworks. It supports Bats, Pytest, Flutter Tests, Jest, Go Tests, Rust Tests, and Generic commands. Key features include unified interface for executing tests, processing outputs, security features to prevent harmful commands, and detailed output processing for various frameworks.

MCP Filesystem Python is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides secure, read-only access to files in a specified directory. Key features include exposing files as MCP resources using the file:// URI scheme, providing file search capabilities, respecting .gitignore patterns, and including security features such as path traversal protection and MIME type detection.

RunPod MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables interaction with the RunPod REST API through Claude or other MCP-compatible clients. It provides tools for managing pods, endpoints, templates, network volumes, and container registry authentications. Features include creating, listing, getting details, updating, starting, stopping, and deleting various resources. The server can be set up and run using Node.js and requires a RunPod API key for authentication.

MCP Server Memos is a Python package that allows LLM models to interact with the Memos server through the MCP (Model Context Protocol) interface. It provides features such as searching memos with keywords, creating new memos with customizable visibility, retrieving memo content by ID, listing and managing memo tags, and secure authentication using access tokens.

Code Analysis MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI models to understand and analyze codebases through natural language conversations. Key features include Natural Code Exploration, Deep Code Understanding, and Dynamic Analysis. It is a cost-effective and simple setup solution for high-level code understanding and exploration, though it may lack the advanced capabilities of more specialized tools.
MCP Code Analyzer is a Model Context Protocol server that analyzes Python code for structure, complexity, and dependencies.

MCP File Preview Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides HTML file preview and analysis capabilities. It captures full-page screenshots of local HTML files with proper CSS styling, analyzes the HTML structure (headings, paragraphs, images, links), supports local file paths and resources, and manages screenshots by saving them to a dedicated directory.

Jewish Library MCP Server provides powerful search capabilities for Jewish texts and literature. It supports full-text search, advanced query syntax including field-specific search, boolean operators, required/excluded terms, phrase search, and wildcards. The server also offers relevance-based scoring and rich search results with references, topics, and highlighted excerpts.

Branch Thinking is an MCP server that implements branch-based thought navigation. It supports multiple branches of thought, branch navigation (list, focus, history), cross-references between related thoughts, insight generation from key points, and branch priority tracking. Key features include Branch Management, Cross References, Insights, and Priority Tracking.

Retrieval-Augmented Thinking MCP Server is an implementation that enhances AI model capabilities with structured, retrieval-augmented thinking processes. Key features include Adaptive Thought Chains, Iterative Hypothesis Generation, Context Coherence, Dynamic Scope Adjustment, Quality Assessment, Branch Management, and Revision Tracking. The server also provides advanced analytics and pattern recognition for thought chain quality and reasoning structures.

The Azure MCP Server is a tool that creates a seamless connection between AI agents and key Azure services like Azure Storage, Cosmos DB, and more. It allows users to interact with Azure resources through natural language commands, providing features such as exploring Azure resources, querying and analyzing data, managing configurations, and performing advanced Azure operations. The server supports various Azure services and integrates with VS Code and GitHub Copilot for enhanced developer productivity.

MCP FFmpeg Helper is a lightweight server that exposes the powerful features of FFmpeg to AI assistants via the MCP protocol. It supports various video processing operations such as getting video file details, converting video formats, extracting audio from videos, creating videos from image sequences, cropping videos, adding watermarks to videos, trimming audio files, and extracting frames from videos. The tool is designed to be used with MCP-compatible applications like Windsurf and can be installed and configured on both Windows and macOS.

Garmin Connect MCP Server is a project that provides a server for interacting with the Garmin Connect API, allowing users to manage their Garmin data, including workouts and health metrics. It requires Python 3.x, specific Python packages, and a Garmin Connect account. The server can be set up using environment variables and can be registered in Claude Desktop.

Alpaca MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Alpaca, enabling LLMs like Claude to interact with the Alpaca trading API. It allows for trading stocks, checking positions, fetching market data, and managing your account through natural language. Key features include Market Data, Account Information, Position Management, Order Placement, and Order Management.

Claude Text Editor MCP Server is an open-source implementation of the Claude built-in text editor tool as a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server. It provides the same functionality as Claude's built-in text editor, allowing you to view, edit, and create text files through a standardized API. Features include file operations like viewing, creating, replacing, inserting, and undoing edits.

BLAH is an open-source ecosystem for managing, distributing, and executing AI agent tools using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides a decentralized registry for MCP servers that promotes transparency, security, and community-driven development. Key features include a comprehensive CLI for tool management, support for various tool types, and robust security measures.

Oura MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to the Oura API, allowing language models to query sleep, readiness, and resilience data. It includes features such as date range queries, today's data queries, and human-readable error handling.

Cinema4D MCP Server connects Cinema 4D to Claude, enabling prompt-assisted 3D manipulation. Main features include a C4D Plugin and an MCP Server, with support for various 3D manipulation commands such as scene management, object creation and modification, camera and animation, lighting and materials, MoGraph and fields, dynamics and physics, and rendering and preview.

Beanquery MCP is an experimental implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) designed to interface with Beancount ledger files. It enables seamless querying and analysis of financial data stored in Beancount format, using the Beancount Query Language (BQL) and the beanquery tool. The server facilitates standardized communication between AI assistants and Beancount ledgers, enhancing the accessibility and utility of financial data. Features include setting the Beancount ledger file, running BQL queries, and accessing tables and accounts in the loaded Beancount file.

MCP Outline Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to interact with Outline document services. It provides features such as Document Search, Collection Management, Document Reading, Comment Management, Document Creation, Document Editing, and Backlink Management. The server acts as a bridge between natural language interactions and Outline's document management capabilities.

NetContextServer is a tool that enhances AI coding assistants by providing deep .NET codebase understanding. Key features include semantic code search, intelligent navigation, built-in security, VS Code integration, package analysis, test coverage analysis, and fast indexing. It also supports structured thinking and policy compliance, making it a powerful tool for developers working with .NET projects.

MCP DateTime is a TypeScript implementation of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides datetime and timezone information to AI agents and chat interfaces. Main features include getting the current time in the local system timezone, getting the current time in any valid timezone, listing all available timezones, and accessing timezone information through URI resources. It also supports Server-Sent Events (SSE) mode for HTTP server integration.

Expose is a tool for building and self-hosting MCP tools that can be invoked with MCP clients like the Claude desktop app. It provides a unified gateway, flexible configuration, and easy deployment. Key features include self-hosting, generating a single HTTP endpoint, and the ability to define and customize tools such as subscription management.

airflow-mcp-server is an MCP server designed for controlling Airflow via Airflow APIs. It supports two operation modes: Safe Mode (read-only operations) and Unsafe Mode (all operations including modifications). The server integrates with Airflow 3.0, supports JWT authentication, and allows for configuration of page limits. It is useful for managing and automating workflows in Airflow.

BioMCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to enhance large language models with protein structure analysis capabilities. It provides tools for analyzing protein active sites and searching for disease-related proteins by interfacing with established protein databases. Key features include Active Site Analysis, Disease-Protein Search, and Integrated Data Access to the RCSB Protein Data Bank.

Compiler Explorer MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects LLMs to the Compiler Explorer API, enabling them to compile code, explore compiler features, and analyze optimizations across different compilers and languages. Main features include Compiler Feature Exploration, Optimization Analysis, Language Feature Support, Assembly Deep Dives, Cross-Language Comparison, and Performance Investigation.

The Coding Assistant Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that enhances the capabilities of the Cline coding agent. It provides intelligent code suggestions, reduces hallucinations, and documents the knowledge base by leveraging your project's documentation and detecting the technologies used in your codebase. Key features include context-aware code suggestions, documentation integration, technology detection, automatic documentation retrieval, and project path automation.

File Context Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides file system context to Large Language Models (LLMs). It enables LLMs to read, search, and analyze code files with advanced caching and real-time file watching capabilities. Key features include file operations, code analysis, smart caching, and advanced search.

DaVinci Resolve MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI assistants like Claude to interact with and control DaVinci Resolve. Key features include two-way communication, project management, timeline manipulation, media management, Fusion integration, scene inspection, and code execution.

Sequential Story MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Sequential Thinking and Sequential Story, which are mnemonic techniques for problem-solving. It offers two complementary MCP tools: Sequential Story, a narrative-based approach to sequential thinking, and Sequential Thinking, a pure Python port of the JavaScript implementation. Features include building problem solutions as narrative sequences, revising and branching story elements, tracking characters, settings, tones, and plot points, and structured problem-solving with thought sequences.

Meta MCP Server is a tool for creating customized MCP servers. It features dynamic server generation, automated file management, MCP tool integration, robust error handling, and debugging support. The server is intended for development purposes and lacks advanced security measures, making it suitable for secure, controlled environments.

Freshdesk MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with Freshdesk, enabling AI models to interact with Freshdesk modules and perform various support operations. Key features include Freshdesk Integration, AI Model Support, Automated Ticket Management, and tools for creating, updating, deleting, and searching tickets.

Memory MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides knowledge graph functionality for managing entities, relations, and observations in memory. It includes strict validation rules to maintain data consistency. Key features include entity and relation management, observation handling, and search capabilities with natural language queries. The server also supports operations like creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting entities and relations, and provides detailed error handling.

MCP Evolution API is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Claude that integrates with the Evolution API to enable WhatsApp automation. Key features include managing WhatsApp instances, sending various types of messages, working with contacts and groups, and configuring webhooks and settings. The project structure includes tools, utilities, and configuration files for local and Docker-based deployments.

MCP Server Replicate is a FastMCP server implementation for the Replicate API, providing resource-based access to AI model inference with a focus on image generation. Main features include resource-based image generation and management, real-time updates through subscriptions, template-driven parameter configuration, comprehensive model discovery and selection, webhook integration, quality and style presets, progress tracking, and secure API key management.

MCP-Think is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that implements a 'Think Tool' for LLMs, allowing them to record and retrieve their thinking processes during reasoning. Main features include recording thoughts and reasoning steps, retrieving all previously recorded thoughts, clearing all recorded thoughts, and getting statistics about recorded thoughts.

mcp-server-python is an Inkeep MCP Server powered by your docs and product content. It requires an Inkeep account for RAG management, and uses the `uv` Python project manager. The setup involves cloning the repository, installing dependencies, and obtaining an API key from the Inkeep Dashboard. The server is configured in the `claude_desktop_config.json` file to enable retrieval of product documentation through a conversational search interface.

Knowledge Base MCP Server is a tool for listing and retrieving content from different knowledge bases. It uses Hugging Face Inference API to generate embeddings and FAISS index for similarity search. Main features include listing available knowledge bases, retrieving similar chunks based on a query, automatic indexing, and support for semantic search.

TickTick MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for TickTick that enables interacting with your TickTick task management system. It allows you to view, create, update, and delete projects and tasks through natural language. Features include full integration with TickTick's open API, seamless integration with Claude and other MCP clients, and OAuth2 authentication for secure access.

Security Copilot and Sentinel MCP Server is a Python-based MCP server that integrates with Microsoft Security Copilot and Microsoft Sentinel using Azure Identity Authentication. Key features include running KQL queries against Microsoft Sentinel, managing Security Copilot skillsets/plugins, and supporting multiple authentication methods. The server acts as a bridge for testing, deployment, and execution of skills and plugins, and uses SSE as the transport layer.

LeetCode MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides seamless integration with LeetCode APIs, enabling advanced automation and intelligent interaction with LeetCode's programming problems, contests, solutions, and user data. Key features include multi-site support, problem data retrieval, user data access, private data access, advanced search capabilities, and daily challenge access.

Bear MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Bear note-taking software. It supports various actions such as opening notes, creating new notes, adding tags, and searching. The server can be integrated with Goose CLI, Goose Desktop, and Claude Desktop, and it requires a BEAR_API_TOKEN for authentication.

Second Opinion MCP Server is an AI-powered tool that assists with coding problems by combining insights from Google's Gemini AI, Stack Overflow accepted answers, and Perplexity AI analysis. Main features include detailed solutions for coding problems, automatic language detection, code snippet extraction and formatting, markdown report generation, and Git-aware file context gathering.

MCP Screenshot is an MCP server that captures screenshots and performs OCR text recognition. It supports screenshot capture in different regions (left half, right half, full screen), OCR text recognition in Japanese and English, and multiple output formats (JSON, Markdown, vertical, horizontal). The server uses two OCR engines: yomitoku for high-accuracy Japanese text recognition and Tesseract.js as a fallback.

mcp-kibela is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that enables AI assistants to search and reference Kibela content. Key features include Note Search, My Notes, Note Content, Note by Path, Create Note, and Update Note Content. It integrates with various MCP clients like Claude Desktop, Cursor, and VSCode, and requires a Kibela Access Token for secure access.

Uniswap Trader MCP is an MCP server for AI agents to automate token swaps on Uniswap DEX across multiple blockchains. Main features include real-time price quotes, swap execution with configurable slippage tolerance and deadlines, trading suggestions based on liquidity, fees, and optimal paths, and multi-chain support for Ethereum, Optimism, Polygon, Arbitrum, Celo, BNB Chain, Avalanche, and Base.

mcp-server-cex-bn is an MCP Server that provides comprehensive integration with Binance's spot and futures trading operations. Features include executing spot and futures trading operations, managing orders, monitoring account balances, setting leverage, tracking funding rates, and more. The server also includes tools for API configuration, error handling, and security considerations.

Lunchmoney MCP Server is a tool that allows you to interact with your Lunchmoney financial data through AI assistants like Claude. It provides features such as viewing recent transactions, searching transactions by keyword, analyzing spending in specific categories, and getting detailed budget summaries. The server ensures privacy and security by keeping your API token local and requiring user approval for each request.
