Dify Workflows MCP 服务器是一个用 TypeScript 实现的 Model Context Protocol (MCP) 服务器，它将 Dify 工作流作为工具暴露出来。主要特性包括：将 Dify 应用程序转换为 MCP 工具、支持从 Dify 工作流流式响应（待实现）、通过命令行参数进行配置、使用 TypeScript 编写以确保类型安全。

DBT CLI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that wraps the dbt CLI tool, enabling AI coding agents to interact with dbt projects. Main features include executing dbt commands through MCP tools, support for all major dbt operations, command-line interface for direct interaction, environment variable management, and flexible configuration options.

ServiceNow MCP Server is a Model Completion Protocol (MCP) server implementation that allows Claude to interact with ServiceNow instances. It provides features for connecting to ServiceNow using various authentication methods, querying and managing records, executing scripts and workflows, and more. Key features include incident management, service catalog management, change management, workflow management, changeset management, knowledge base management, user management, and UI policy tools. The server supports both stdio and Server-Sent Events (SSE) communication.

PowerPlatform MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides intelligent access to PowerPlatform/Dataverse entities and records. Key features include rich entity metadata exploration, advanced OData query support, comprehensive relationship mapping and visualization, AI-assisted query building and data modeling, and full access to entity attributes, relationships, and global option sets.

TaskMaster: Todoist MCP for Cursor AI is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that integrates Todoist with Cursor AI, allowing users to manage and interact with their Todoist tasks directly from their coding environment. Key features include flexible task filtering, rich task formatting, and seamless Cursor AI integration.

PostgreSQL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides PostgreSQL database management capabilities. It includes features for database analysis and setup, schema management, data migration, monitoring, functions, row-level security (RLS), and triggers. The server assists with analyzing existing PostgreSQL setups, providing implementation guidance, debugging database issues, managing schemas, migrating data, and monitoring database performance.

aps-mcp-server is an experimental Model Context Protocol (MCP) server built with Node.js, providing access to Autodesk Platform Services (APS) API. It includes fine-grained access control using the new Secure Service Accounts feature. Main features include integration with APS, setup with service account credentials, and usage with tools like MCP Inspector and Claude Desktop for accessing and managing ACC projects and data.

Pinecone Developer MCP Server is a tool that allows coding assistants and other AI tools to interact with Pinecone projects and documentation. It enables searching Pinecone documentation, configuring indexes, generating code, and managing data in indexes. The server provides various tools for AI assistants, such as searching and listing indexes, upserting and searching records, and more. It is designed to improve the experience of developers working with Pinecone.

MCPollinations Multimodal MCP Server is a tool that enables AI assistants to generate images, text, and audio through the Pollinations APIs. Key features include generating image URLs from text prompts, generating images and saving them as base64-encoded data, generating text and audio responses, listing available models, and no authentication required. It is compatible with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and supports various customization options for image generation.

Cloudflare Playwright MCP is a tool for automated browser testing and interaction, integrating with Cloudflare Workers and Browser Rendering. It supports various actions like navigating, clicking, typing, taking screenshots, and more. The project can be deployed to Cloudflare Workers and used with Cloudflare AI Playground or Claude Desktop. It also provides multiple modes for interactions, including Snapshot Mode and Vision Mode, and includes tools for tab management, navigation, keyboard, console, and file handling.

Lighthouse MCP Server is a tool that wraps around Google's Lighthouse to measure various performance metrics for web pages. Key features include running comprehensive Lighthouse audits, getting performance scores and metrics, configuring device emulation, controlling network throttling, and selecting specific audit categories.

pure.md MCP server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows scripts, APIs, apps, and agents to access web content in markdown format. It provides features such as unblocking web content, converting HTML, PDFs, and images into markdown, and caching responses globally. The server includes tools for extracting markdown from web pages and searching the web, and it integrates with MCP clients like Cursor, Windsurf, and Claude Desktop.

Binance MCP Server is an implementation for Binance market data with WebSocket support, providing real-time market data streaming, support for both spot and futures markets, automatic reconnection, type-safe message handling, and comprehensive error handling. It supports various stream types such as trade, ticker, bookTicker, kline, markPrice, and fundingRate.

Airtable MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides tools for interacting with Airtable's API, enabling programmatic management of Airtable bases, tables, fields, and records. Key features include base and table management, field and record operations, and support for various field types and colors. The server also includes system prompts and project knowledge to guide the LLM in Claude Desktop.

Surf MCP Server is an MCP server designed for fetching tide information for any location using latitude and longitude. It supports date-specific tide queries, provides detailed tide data including high/low tides and station information, and handles automatic time zone handling (UTC). The service is useful for determining the optimal surfing times and includes robust error handling for various issues such as API request failures, invalid coordinates, and network timeouts.

A2A MCP Server is a simple MCP server that provides Claude Desktop access to A2A protocol agents. It is designed for developer use and includes tools for registering A2A servers, listing registered agents, and calling agents with prompts. The server is intended for local testing and extending Claude's capabilities through the MCP tools interface.

GraphRAG MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for querying a hybrid graph and vector database system, combining Neo4j (graph database) and Qdrant (vector database) for powerful semantic and graph-based document retrieval. Main features include semantic search, graph-based context expansion, hybrid search, and full integration with LLMs through MCP.

Crawl4AI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that integrates Crawl4AI with Cursor AI, providing web scraping and crawling capabilities as tools for LLMs in Cursor Composer's agent mode. Main features include single page scraping, website crawling, and the ability to scrape content and metadata from webpages and crawl websites up to a specified depth and page limit.

Scrapybara MCP is a Model Context Protocol server that enables MCP clients to interact with virtual Ubuntu desktops, allowing actions such as browsing the web and running code. Key features include starting and stopping instances, running bash commands, and taking actions through an agent.

Framer Plugin MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables the creation and management of Framer plugins with web3 capabilities. It provides tools for creating, building, and managing Framer plugins with integrated web3 features such as wallet connections, smart contract interactions, and NFT displays. Main features include creating new Framer plugins with web3 capabilities, building plugins for production, and integrated web3 features like wallet connect integration, smart contract interactions, and NFT display components.

cal2prompt is a command-line tool that fetches your schedule from Google Calendar and converts it into a custom prompt or text snippet via a template engine. It can output directly to your stdout, or run as an experimental MCP (Model Context Protocol) server. Main features include Google Calendar Integration, Flexible LLM Prompt Customization with a Template Engine, high-speed processing, and an experimental MCP Mode.

Sefaria Jewish Library MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides access to Jewish texts from the Sefaria library. It enables Large Language Models to retrieve and reference Jewish texts through a standardized interface. Main features include retrieving Jewish texts by reference and retrieving commentaries on a given text.

pg-mcp is a static documentation site for pg-mcp-server, which is related to PostgreSQL and database management. The repository provides links to the source code for both the server and client components.

MCP Server Semgrep is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) compliant server that integrates the powerful Semgrep static analysis tool with AI assistants like Anthropic Claude. It enables advanced code analysis, security vulnerability detection, and code quality improvements directly through a conversational interface. Key features include holistic source code analysis, proactive error detection, continuous code quality improvement, stylistic consistency, automated code verification for known vulnerabilities, customized security rules, and team education. The project also provides extensive documentation, cross-platform compatibility, and flexible Semgrep installation management.

Torobjo MCP Server is a production-grade Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that combines Torob product search with Instagram content analysis. Key features include full MCP protocol support, dual-mode operation for both Torob.com API integration and Instagram content processing, Claude-optimized design, and enterprise-grade reliability with automatic retries, error handling, and rate limiting. The server is built on FastMCP for high-performance and offers modular tool design, a unified JSON API interface, and scalability. Core endpoints include product search with Persian language optimization and Instagram caption extraction with headless browser automation.

Telegram MCP Server is a tool that allows AI assistants to interact with your Telegram account using the user client API. Key features include listing and searching channels, retrieving channel messages, and integrating with MCP clients like Claude Desktop. It requires Node.js, an active Telegram account with 2FA enabled, and Telegram API credentials.

Think MCP is an implementation of an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides a 'think' tool for structured reasoning in agentic AI workflows. It allows an AI agent to pause and record explicit thoughts during complex reasoning or multi-step tool use, which is useful for tool output analysis, policy-heavy environments, and sequential decision making. Features include minimal, standards-based MCP server using mcp[cli], ready for integration with Claude or other agentic LLMs, and additional tools like criticize, plan, and search in advanced mode.

Spotify MCP is a FastMCP tool for controlling Spotify through natural language commands. It allows users to interact with their Spotify player, including playing, pausing, and resuming songs, managing playlists, searching for artists and tracks, and more. Features include showing playlists, playing specific playlists, pausing and resuming playback, getting song and artist information, adding and managing queue, and recommending similar tracks.

YaraFlux MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for YARA scanning, providing AI assistants with capabilities to analyze files using YARA rules. Key features include modular architecture, MCP integration, YARA scanning, rule management, file analysis, and security features such as JWT authentication and secure storage.

Backlog MCP Server is an implementation that integrates the Backlog API, providing tools for project, issue, and wiki management. Features include getting, adding, updating, and deleting projects, issues, and wikis. It also includes configuration instructions for setting up the API key and environment variables, and usage examples with Claude Desktop via NPX and Docker.

Outlook MCP Server provides access to Microsoft Outlook email functionality, allowing LLMs and other MCP clients to read, search, and manage emails through a standardized interface. Main features include Folder Management, Email Listing, Email Search, Email Details, Email Composition, and Email Replies.

MCP Server Runner is a WebSocket server implementation for running Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. It enables MCP servers to be accessed via WebSocket connections, facilitating integration with web applications and other network-enabled clients. Key features include WebSocket server implementation with single-client support, process management for MCP server instances, bidirectional message passing between client and server, graceful shutdown handling, comprehensive error logging, and cross-platform support.

xml.Revit.MCP Tools is a comprehensive library for integrating with Autodesk Revit through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It enables powerful automation and programmatic interaction with building models. Key features include basic operations, element management, and creation tools, as well as integration with AI assistants like Claude, Cursor, and Cline. The library supports a wide range of Revit versions and requires Python 3.10 or newer and the UV Package Manager for installation.

Ultimate Google Docs MCP Server is a tool that allows AI assistants like Claude to interact with Google Docs programmatically. It provides features for reading, writing, formatting, and structuring Google Documents, including text and paragraph formatting, table creation, and more. The server uses the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and the `fastmcp` library, and it supports secure OAuth 2.0 authentication.

Zerodha MCP Integration is a project that integrates Zerodha's trading platform with Claude AI using the Multi-Cloud Plugin (MCP) framework, allowing users to interact with their Zerodha trading account directly through Claude. Brave Search MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Brave Search, allowing integration with AI assistants like Claude. AIO-MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation with integrations for GitLab, Jira, Confluence, YouTube, and more. It provides AI-powered search capabilities and various utility tools for development workflows. Features include web scraping, crawling, and discovery, search and content extraction, deep research and batch scraping, automatic retries and rate limiting, cloud and self-hosted support, and SSE support. The server supports multiple modes of operation, including Stdio Mode and SSE Mode, and offers a wide range of tools for calendar management, Confluence, Google Calendar, Gmail, Jira, GitLab, RAG memory, command line script execution, web search, and more.

Atlan Agent Toolkit is a repository that contains tools and protocols for interacting with Atlan services for AI agents. The main feature is the Model Context Protocol (MCP) server, which enables interaction with Atlan services through function calling, providing tools for asset search and retrieval using pyatlan.

Agent Construct is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that standardizes how AI applications access tools and context. Beyond MCP Server is an extensible Model Context Protocol server that provides standardized access to social platform data and onchain data. MSSQL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for connecting to Microsoft SQL Server databases. It provides tools for executing SQL queries and managing database connections, with features including query execution, connection management, and security safeguards.

Simple Document Processing MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server providing comprehensive document processing capabilities. HeyBeauty MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that implements virtual try-on functionality using the HeyBeauty API. MCP server for Apache Gravitino(incubating) provides Gravitino API integration with FastMCP, easy-to-use interface for metadata management, and support for catalog/schema/table metadata, tag, and user-role information. Code Analysis MCP Plugin is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) plugin that enables AI assistants to perform sophisticated code analysis and answer questions about codebases. Dodo Payments Node API Library provides convenient access to the Dodo Payments REST API from server-side TypeScript or JavaScript. MCP DevTools is a collection of packages that enable AI assistants to interact with external tools and services through the Model Context Protocol. Math-MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides basic mathematical and statistical functions to Large Language Models (LLMs). Things MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with the Things app for task management. SendGrid MCP Server provides access to SendGrid's Marketing API for email marketing and contact management. Grumpy Senior Developer as MCP server is a tool designed to provide code reviews with a sarcastic and cynical tone, typical of a grumpy senior developer. Goal Story MCP Server is a tool that helps users manage their goals through a process called 'Goal Storying.' OpenAI Image Generation MCP Server is a tool for generating and editing images using OpenAI's gpt-image-1 model. New Relic MCP Server is a tool for querying New Relic logs and metrics using NRQL. The server supports basic and advanced NRQL queries, and includes comprehensive setup, usage, and troubleshooting instructions.

bioRxiv MCP Server enables AI assistants to search and access bioRxiv papers through a simple MCP interface. Deno 2 Playwright Model Context Protocol Server Example is a server that provides browser automation capabilities using Playwright. openpyxl_mcp_server is a tool that allows MCP clients like Claude to fetch and interact with data from Excel files. Mac Apps Launcher MCP Server is a tool for launching and managing macOS applications. It allows users to list all applications installed in the /Applications folder, launch applications by name, and open files with specific applications.

Crypto Sentiment MCP Server delivers cryptocurrency sentiment analysis to AI agents, using Santiment's aggregated social media and news data. Token Minter MCP is a server that provides tools for AI agents to mint ERC-20 tokens, supporting 21 blockchains. Key features include deploying new ERC-20 tokens with customizable parameters, querying token metadata, initiating token transfers, retrieving transaction details, checking native token balance, and accessing token metadata via URI. The server also includes interactive prompts for deployment guidance.

kuzu-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides access to Kuzu databases. It enables LLMs to inspect database schemas and execute queries on the provided Kuzu database. Main features include fetching the full schema, running Cypher queries, and generating Cypher queries from natural language questions. MCP server for kintone is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows you to explore and manipulate kintone data using AI tools such as Claude Desktop. It provides the ability to configure the MCP client, set up environment variables, and interact with kintone data through natural language commands.

Obsidian MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server designed for LLMs to interact with Obsidian vaults. It provides features such as file operations, full-text search, property management, and security & performance optimizations. Key features include atomic file/directory operations, full-text search with advanced queries, YAML frontmatter parsing, API key authentication, and rate limiting.

Think Tool MCP Server is an official implementation of Anthropic's 'think' tool as an MCP server, designed to dramatically improve Claude's reasoning capabilities with structured thinking. Key features include a dedicated space for structured reasoning, proven performance benefits in complex tasks, and integration with various clients like Claude Desktop and Cursor. The tool enhances Claude's ability to follow complex policies, make sequential decisions, and process web search results, among other things.

MCP Video Generation with Veo2 is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes Google's Veo2 video generation capabilities. It allows clients to generate videos from text prompts or images and access the generated videos through MCP resources. Virtual Traveling bot environment for MCP is a tool that creates an environment for an avatar to virtually travel on Google Maps. Meilisearch Hybrid Search MCP Server is a tool for performing hybrid searches on a Meilisearch index, combining keyword-based search with semantic vector search. GitLab MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for GitLab integration, enabling AI assistants to interact with GitLab resources. National Parks MCP Server provides real-time information about U.S. National Parks, including park details, alerts, and activities. DexScreener MCP Server is an implementation for accessing the DexScreener API, providing real-time access to DEX pair data, token information, and market statistics across multiple blockchains. Toolhouse MCP Server is a server that allows MCP clients to connect with Toolhouse's tools, built on top of Toolhouse and Groq's API for fast inference. MCP Server for Paddle Billing is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with the Paddle API. Qiniu MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Qiniu Cloud services, providing access to storage, intelligent multimedia, and CDN functionalities. Ragie Model Context Protocol Server is an MCP server that provides access to Ragie's knowledge base retrieval capabilities. Image Generator MCP Server is an MCP server that uses Replicate to generate images and allows users to save them. OpenCTI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides seamless integration with the OpenCTI platform, enabling querying and retrieving threat intelligence data. mcp-sequentialthinking-tools is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that combines sequential thinking with intelligent tool suggestions. Ableton-copilot-mcp is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server built on ableton-js for real-time interaction and control with Ableton Live, aimed at assisting music producers in their music production. YepCode MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that enables AI platforms to interact with YepCode's infrastructure. Key features include secure execution, multiple shell support, timeout control, cross-platform compatibility, and built-in directory and shell validation for security.

k8s_pilot is a lightweight, centralized control plane server for managing multiple Kubernetes clusters at once. It supports multi-cluster context switching, CRUD operations on common Kubernetes resources, and is powered by MCP for Claude AI and beyond. Key features include multi-cluster management, resource control, namespace operations, and node management.

content_name: mcp chain of draft prompt tool
description: The MCP Chain of Draft (CoD) Prompt Tool is a Model Context Protocol tool that enhances LLM reasoning by transforming standard prompts into Chain of Draft (CoD) or Chain of Thought (CoT) format. It supports various LLMs, including Anthropic Claude, OpenAI GPT models, and local models. Key features include input transformation, enhanced reasoning, result transformation, BYOLLM support, performance analytics, adaptive word limits, comprehensive example database, format enforcement, hybrid reasoning approaches, and OpenAI API compatibility. The tool is available in both Python and JavaScript/TypeScript implementations and can be integrated with tools like Dive GUI and MCP Inspector for testing and debugging.

File Operations MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides enhanced file operation capabilities. It supports basic and directory operations, file watching, change tracking, streaming, and resource access. Features include copy, read, write, move, delete files, create, remove, and copy directories, monitor for changes, track file operation history, handle large files with streaming, and provide real-time progress updates. The server also includes rate limiting, enhanced security, and robust error handling.

npm-search MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that allows you to search for npm packages by calling the `npm search` command. Main features include searching for npm packages, configuration for different IDEs like Claude and Zed, and support for various installation methods including Smithery, NPM, and uv. It also provides debugging tools and examples of how to interact with the server.

Bucket is a B2B feature flagging tool with a built-in feedback loop that allows you to roll out features based on customer satisfaction. It provides SDKs for React, Browser, and Node.js, as well as a CLI and OpenFeature providers for both browser and Node.js environments. The tool also includes versioning and publishing workflows.

Earthdata MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides tools to interact with NASA Earth Data. It enables efficient dataset discovery and retrieval for Geospatial analysis. Key features include searching for datasets and data granules on NASA Earthdata, temporal and bounding box filtering, and integration with Jupyter for further analysis.

Code Knowledge Tool is a knowledge management tool for code repositories using vector embeddings. It helps maintain and query knowledge about your codebase with advanced embedding techniques. Key features include local vector storage, efficient embedding generation, support for multiple file types, context-aware code understanding, integration with RooCode and Cline via MCP, RAG-based context augmentation, and persistent knowledge storage.

MCP Memory Server with Qdrant Persistence is a knowledge graph implementation with semantic search capabilities powered by the Qdrant vector database. Key features include graph-based knowledge representation, file-based persistence, semantic search, OpenAI embeddings for semantic similarity, HTTPS support, and Docker support for easy deployment. The server maintains two forms of persistence: file-based (memory.json) and Qdrant Vector DB, enabling fast access to the full graph and semantic similarity search.

Canvas MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Canvas API, allowing management of courses, assignments, enrollments, and grades. Key features include creating and updating courses and assignments, enrolling users, submitting grades, type safety, error handling, and environment variable management.

File Merger MCP Server is a simple utility to combine multiple files into one. It is fast, secure, and easy to use. Main features include merging any number of files with a single command, efficient file combination, security by only accessing allowed directories, and providing detailed reports on file sizes and merge summary.

Placid.app MCP Server is an implementation for integrating with Placid.app's API, providing tools for listing templates and generating images and videos. Key features include listing available Placid templates with filtering options, generating images and videos using templates and dynamic content, secure API token management, error handling, and type-safe implementation.

Vibe Coder MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server designed to supercharge AI assistants with powerful tools for software development. It provides features such as Semantic Request Routing, Tool Registry Architecture, Direct LLM Calls, Workflow Execution, Code Refactoring, Git Integration, Research & Planning, Project Scaffolding, Asynchronous Execution, Session State Management, and Standardized Error Handling. The server integrates with popular IDEs and supports various development tasks like generating starter projects, refactoring code, and creating planning documents.

Firebase MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a unified interface to interact with various Firebase services, including Authentication, Firestore, and Storage. It allows operations such as getting user by ID or email, adding/updating/deleting documents, listing collections/documents, listing files in a directory, and getting file metadata and download URLs.

Postman Tool Generation MCP Server is a tool that generates AI agent tools from Postman collections and requests. It integrates with the Postman API to convert API endpoints into type-safe code for various AI frameworks. Key features include generating TypeScript/JavaScript code, support for multiple AI frameworks, type-safe code generation, error handling, and response validation.

ntfy-me-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for sending real-time notifications via the ntfy service. It supports public and self-hosted ntfy instances with token authentication, rich notifications, automatic URL detection, intelligent markdown formatting, and secure token handling. Key features include quick setup, real-time notifications, rich notification content, and support for various deployment methods such as NPM, Docker, and VS Code.

mcp-server-mariadb is an MCP server implementation for retrieving data from MariaDB. It exposes the schema list in the database and provides a tool to execute read-only operations against MariaDB. The content also includes detailed installation instructions for setting up MariaDB and configuring the MCP server with Claude Desktop.

RagDocs MCP Server provides RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) capabilities using Qdrant vector database and Ollama/OpenAI embeddings. It enables semantic search and management of documentation through vector similarity. Main features include adding, searching, listing, and deleting documents, support for both free and paid embedding providers, automatic text chunking, and vector storage with Qdrant.

Heygen MCP server enables MCP clients like Claude Desktop or Agents to use the HeyGen API for generating avatars and videos. Main features include retrieving remaining credits, getting available voices, retrieving avatar groups, generating avatar videos, and checking video status. The server is in early development and requires a Heygen API key.

attio-mcp-server is an MCP server for Attio, an AI-native CRM. It enables mcp clients to connect to the Attio API and perform actions such as reading and writing company records and notes. The setup requires an API key, and the development environment setup includes forking the repository, cloning it, setting up environment variables, and running the development server.

MCP Music Analysis is a Model Context Provider (MCP) that uses MCP and librosa for audio analysis on local, YouTube, or audio link sources. It provides features such as beat analysis, duration calculation, MFCC computation, spectral centroid values, and onset time detection. The tool can be installed via Smithery or manually, and it integrates with Claude Desktop.

SQL Server MCP Server for Windsurf IDE is a standalone MCP server written in C# that provides SQL Server integration capabilities. Main features include SQL Server connectivity, database schema exploration, table and view inspection, column metadata retrieval, stored procedure enumeration, SQL query execution, stored procedure execution, debug mode for troubleshooting, and configurable logging path.

MCP-ORTools is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation using Google OR-Tools for constraint solving. It enables AI models to submit and validate constraint models, set model parameters, solve constraint satisfaction and optimization problems, and retrieve and analyze solutions. Features include full OR-Tools CP-SAT solver support, JSON-based model specification, support for integer and boolean variables, linear constraints, linear optimization objectives, and various types of problems like portfolio selection and knapsack problems.

UIThub MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the uithub API, which provides a convenient way to fetch GitHub repository contents. It allows Claude to retrieve and analyze code from GitHub repositories, making it a powerful tool for understanding and discussing code. Main features include retrieving repository contents with smart filtering options, specifying file extensions to include or exclude, and integrating with Claude Desktop for natural language exploration of repositories.

Zoom MCP Server is a tool that allows users to manage Zoom meetings with AI assistance. Main features include listing, creating, deleting, and retrieving details of meetings. It can be used within VS Code and requires configuration with Zoom Client ID, Zoom Client Secret, and Account ID.

Task Manager MCP Server is an AI-driven tool designed to integrate with AI code editors like Cursor. It maximizes Cursor's agentic capabilities and Gemini 2.5's architecting capabilities, providing features such as complex feature planning, integrated UI server, unlimited context window, conversation history, clarification workflow, task CRUD, code review, and automatic review. The server also includes a Svelte UI for viewing task lists, progress, and manual adjustments.

Perplexity MCP Server provides intelligent code analysis and debugging capabilities using Perplexity AI's API. Main features include Intelligent Error Analysis, Pattern Detection, Comprehensive Solutions, Best Practices, and Python Support. It offers detailed breakdowns of coding errors, step-by-step fixes, and alternative implementation approaches.

Code Index MCP is a Model Context Protocol server for code indexing, searching, and analysis. It enables Large Language Models to interact with code repositories, offering real-time insights and navigation through complex codebases. Key features include Project Indexing, Code Search, File Analysis, Smart Filtering, and Persistent Storage. It supports multiple programming languages and file types.

Laravel Helpers MCP is a collection of Laravel helper tools designed for integration with Cursor IDE, enhancing development workflow and debugging capabilities. Available tools include viewing recent log entries, searching for specific error patterns, executing artisan commands, and displaying model information directly in the editor.

Okta MCP Server enables Claude to interact with Okta's user management system, providing comprehensive user and group management capabilities along with onboarding automation. Features include user and group management, onboarding automation, and robust error handling. The server also includes TypeScript interfaces for Okta user and group data and supports CSV import for bulk operations.

HubSpot MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for seamless HubSpot CRM integration, enabling AI assistants to interact with your HubSpot data. Main features include creating and managing contacts and companies, retrieving detailed company activity history, accessing recent engagement data, and performing CRM operations through natural language commands. The server also supports secure authentication and is easily extensible.

Console and Network Logs Playwright MCP Server uses Playwright to open a browser, monitor console logs, and track network requests. Key features include opening a browser at a specified URL, monitoring and retrieving console logs, tracking and retrieving network requests, and closing the browser when done. The server captures console messages and network activity using Playwright's event listeners and returns this information in a structured format for LLMs.

MCP Lambda SAM is a serverless implementation of the Model Context Protocol using AWS Lambda and SAM. It provides two distinct interfaces: System Configuration for administrators to manage MCP tools, resources, and permissions, and System Usage for clients to establish SSE connections and send commands. The project includes deployment, permission management, and usage guides, as well as multiple installation and deployment methods.

MCP Node Fetch is an MCP server that enables fetching web content using the Node.js undici library. It supports various HTTP methods, headers, and request bodies, and can return content in different formats such as text, JSON, binary, and HTML fragments. The server also provides tools for fetching URLs, extracting specific HTML content, and checking URL accessibility.

MCP Ripgrep Server provides ripgrep (rg) search capabilities to MCP-compatible clients, enabling high-performance text searches across files on your system. It includes basic and advanced search, counting matches, listing files, and listing file types. The server can be used with Claude for Desktop and requires Node.js and ripgrep to be installed.

Raygun MCP Server provides comprehensive access to Raygun's API V3 endpoints for interacting with Crash Reporting and Real User Monitoring applications. Features include application management, error management, deployment management, user and session management, performance monitoring, source maps, and team management. The server can be configured with environment variables and used with Claude Desktop.

MongoDB Atlas MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for managing MongoDB Atlas projects. It provides tools for creating and managing MongoDB Atlas clusters, users, and network access through the MCP interface. Key features include creating a new MongoDB Atlas cluster, configuring network access, creating database users, retrieving connection strings, listing Atlas projects, and listing clusters in a specific project.

DeepLucid3D UCPF Server is an implementation of the Unified Cognitive Processing Framework (UCPF) as an MCP server. It provides advanced cognitive analysis, creative problem-solving, and structured thinking. Key features include Cognitive State Assessment, Knowledge Dimension Mapping, Recursive Self-Questioning, Creative Perspective Generation, and Problem Decomposition. The server also supports optional state management for ongoing analysis.

AACT Clinical Trials MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides access to the AACT (Aggregate Analysis of ClinicalTrials.gov) database. It allows AI assistants to directly query clinical trial data from the ClinicalTrials.gov database. Main features include listing and describing tables, executing SQL queries, and recording insights. The server is built using FastMCP, Python psycopg2, and the AACT database.

Supabase MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides comprehensive tools for interacting with Supabase databases, storage, and edge functions. It enables seamless integration between Supabase services and MCP-compatible applications. Key features include database operations, storage management, edge function invocation, user authentication and management, role-based access control, and extensive configuration options.

SiYuan Note MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with the SiYuan Note system, enabling AI models to access and manipulate note data. Key features include Notebook Management, Document Operations, Block Control, File and Asset Management, SQL Query Support, Attribute Management, Export and Conversion, and System Functions. It supports various commands for managing notes, documents, files, and more.

Kafka MCP Server is a Message Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Apache Kafka to provide publish and consume functionalities for LLM and Agentic applications. It supports publishing messages to Kafka topics and consuming messages from Kafka topics, with options for different transport methods like stdio and SSE. The server can be integrated with Claude Desktop and requires Python 3.8+ and an Apache Kafka instance.

This tool connects AI systems to a Directus headless CMS, enabling content management operations such as retrieving, creating, updating, and deleting items from collections through a TypeScript-based API bridge.

MCP Chat Analysis Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables semantic analysis of chat conversations through vector embeddings and knowledge graphs. Key features include Semantic Search, Knowledge Graph, Conversation Analytics, Flexible Import, and MCP Integration. It supports various chat export formats and integrates with Claude and other MCP-compatible systems.

Google Workspace MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with Gmail and Calendar APIs. It enables you to manage your emails and calendar events programmatically through the MCP interface. Features include listing and searching emails, sending and modifying emails, and managing calendar events such as creating, updating, and deleting them.

YFinance Trader MCP Tool for Claude Desktop is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) tool that provides stock market data and trading capabilities using the yfinance library, specifically adapted for Claude Desktop. Main features include real-time stock quotes, company information and financial metrics, historical price data, symbol search functionality, analyst recommendations, and insider transaction tracking.

MCP Memory Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Claude Desktop that provides structured memory management across chat sessions, specifically designed for project-based work. Key features include storing memories as structured markdown files, indexing memories using Lunr.js for efficient retrieval, tagging and categorizing memories, creating relationships between memories, and searching memories by content, tags, or type. The server helps maintain context and knowledge within project directories, making it ideal for long-term projects such as software development, research, writing, or any collaborative work with Claude.

Terraform Cloud MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates AI assistants with the Terraform Cloud API, allowing you to manage your infrastructure through natural conversation. Key features include account management, workspace management, project management, run management, plan management, apply management, and organization management. It supports various MCP-compatible platforms like Claude, Cursor, and Copilot Studio.

CoinMarketCap MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for the CoinMarketCap API, providing a standardized interface for accessing cryptocurrency market data, exchange information, and other blockchain-related metrics. Features include complete coverage of the CoinMarketCap API, fetching data on the latest crypto trends, market movements, and global market metrics, access to detailed OHLCV data, and type-safe parameter validation with Zod.

HubSpot MCP Server is a tool that enables interaction with the HubSpot CRM for sales analysis and insights. It provides various functionalities such as searching, creating, and updating contacts, deals, and companies, as well as retrieving sales analytics, deal history, and engagement activities. The server also supports sales performance metrics, pipeline analytics, and forecasted sales data.

Notion MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects AI assistants like Claude to your Notion workspace. It allows AI assistants to view and search Notion databases, create and update pages, manage content blocks, and more. The setup involves obtaining a Notion API key, downloading or cloning the repository, installing dependencies, and configuring the Claude Desktop app. The server provides various tools for interacting with Notion, such as listing databases, querying databases, creating and updating pages, and searching content.

Binance Cryptocurrency MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) service for accessing Binance cryptocurrency market data. It allows AI agents to execute Binance API calls and obtain real-time data such as prices, candlestick charts, order books, and more. The available tools include get_price, get_order_book, get_recent_trades, get_historical_trades, get_klines, and others. This service is useful for obtaining current price information, order book data, candlestick chart data, 24-hour price changes, trading history, and price statistics.

YouTube MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that allows you to download subtitles from YouTube and connect them to a LLM. Main features include downloading transcripts from YouTube videos, support for both video IDs and full YouTube URLs, and timestamps included in the transcript.
Obsidian MCP (Model Context Protocol) 服务器实现了一个 Model Context Protocol (MCP) 服务器，用于连接 AI 模型与 Obsidian 知识库。主要功能包括与 Obsidian 知识库的无缝集成、支持笔记的读取、创建、更新和删除、支持文件夹的创建、重命名、移动和删除以及全文搜索功能。

Zotero MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows MCP clients to interact with a local Zotero repository. It enables programmatic access to the Zotero library, allowing users to search papers, manage notes, and more. Key features include searching papers by tags, getting paper details and attached notes, adding notes to papers, and requesting paper summaries.

GitHub Projects MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI agents to create and manage Agile Sprint-based projects using GitHub Projects. Main features include full support for GitHub's GraphQL Projects v2 API, creating, reading, and updating GitHub issues, fetching repository details, and built with TypeScript for maximum type safety.

Pinterest MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Pinterest image search and information retrieval. Main features include searching for images by keywords, retrieving detailed information about Pinterest images, seamless integration with Cursor IDE, support for headless browser mode, and options to limit and download search results. The server also supports various configuration options via command line and environment variables.

SearXNG Model Context Protocol Server is a tool that allows language models to perform web searches through SearXNG using the Model Context Protocol standard. It provides a clean interface for sending search queries and receiving formatted results. Key features include support for Node.js, configuration via environment variables, Docker deployment, and various search parameters such as query, categories, pageno, time_range, and raw_json.

Chess.com MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Chess.com's Published Data API, providing access to player data, game records, and other public information. Features include searching games by date and player, checking player online status, getting information about clubs and titled players, and Docker containerization support. The server also provides interactive tools for AI assistants.

Emacs MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Emacs, enabling the generation and execution of elisp code in a running Emacs process. It provides tools to generate and execute elisp code, and can be integrated with Claude Desktop after configuration.
MCPify is a monorepo that contains the core package for converting OpenAPI specifications into MCP tools, aimed at developers to streamline the process of creating and managing API-related tasks.

mcp-server-dify is a Model Context Protocol Server for Dify AI, enabling LLMs to interact with Dify AI's chat completion capabilities. Main features include integration with Dify AI chat completion API, a restaurant recommendation tool (meshi-doko), support for conversation context, streaming response support, and TypeScript implementation.

content_name: sqlite literature management fastmcp mcp server
description: The Universal Source Management System is a flexible system for managing various types of sources (papers, books, webpages, etc.) and integrating them with knowledge graphs. Core features include universal source identification with internal UUID system, support for multiple source types, multiple identifier support per source, structured note-taking, and status tracking. It also integrates with a memory graph and supports entity linking and relationship tracking.

Wikidata MCP Server is a server implementation for the Wikidata API using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides tools to interact with Wikidata, including searching for identifiers (entity and property), extracting metadata (label and description), and executing SPARQL queries. The server includes tools such as search_entity, search_property, get_properties, execute_sparql, and get_metadata.

The MongoDB MCP Server for LLMS is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables LLMs to interact directly with MongoDB databases. Key features include collection schema inspection, document querying and filtering, index management, document operations (insert, update, delete), secure database access through connection strings, and comprehensive error handling and validation. It supports integration with MCP clients like Claude Desktop and Cursor.ai.
Figma MCP 服务器是一个基于模型上下文协议(MCP)的工具，允许用户将Figma设计文件与AI编码工具（如Cursor、Windsurf等）无缝集成。主要功能包括将Figma设计数据转换为易于理解的格式、获取布局和样式信息、下载图片和图标资源等，从而提高AI生成代码的准确性和相关性。

ZIP MCP Server is a compression server based on fastMCP and zip.js, implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides fully parameter-controlled ZIP compression, decompression, and query compression package information functions. Main features include support for compression and decompression of files and data, multi-file packaging compression, compression level control, password protection and encryption strength settings, and a query function for compressed package metadata.

Documentation Crawler & MCP Server is a toolset for crawling websites, generating Markdown documentation, and making that documentation searchable via a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server. Key features include web crawling, configurable crawl depth, content filtering, HTML cleaning, Markdown generation, and semantic search over document chunks using vector embeddings. The project integrates with tools like Cursor for querying the crawled content.

ffmpeg-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that facilitates the ability to decode, encode, transcode, mux, demux, stream, filter, and play various types of media files. It supports a wide range of multimedia operations, making it a versatile tool for handling audio and video content.

NYTimes Article Search MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that allows searching for New York Times articles from the last 30 days based on a keyword. It provides tools for searching articles and integrates with the New York Times API. The main feature is the `search_articles` tool, which takes a keyword as a required parameter and returns a list of articles with title, abstract, URL, published date, and author.

Elasticsearch MCP Server is a tool that connects to your Elasticsearch cluster directly from any MCP Client, allowing you to interact with your Elasticsearch indices through natural language conversations. Key features include cluster management, index operations, mapping management, search and data operations, and template management.

MCP Advanced Reasoning Server for Cursor AI is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides advanced reasoning capabilities. It includes features such as Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS), Beam Search, R1 Transformer, Hybrid Reasoning, and Auto-Iterative Reasoning. The server can be integrated with Cursor AI to enhance problem-solving and decision-making in various contexts.

mcp-serverman is a command-line tool for managing Claude MCP servers configuration with version control and profiling. It allows users to initialize, list, enable, disable, remove, save, change, and manage presets of MCP servers. The tool also supports multiple client configurations and includes a companion MCP server for LLM management. Features include server management, version control, profile management, and support for multiple clients.

BlueSky MCP Server provides access to BlueSky social network data through its official API, allowing for retrieval of user profiles and social graph information. Main features include fetching detailed user profile information, retrieving user following lists with pagination, built-in authentication handling and session management, and comprehensive error handling.

Speckle MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Speckle, the collaborative data hub that connects with AEC tools. It provides features such as listing and searching Speckle projects, retrieving detailed project information, accessing model versions within projects, and querying objects and their properties from specific versions.
博查是一个给AI用的搜索引擎，能够从近百亿网页和生态内容源中获取高质量的世界知识，涵盖天气、新闻、百科、医疗、火车票、图片等多种领域。主要工具包括Bocha Web Search和Bocha AI Search，提供全网通用搜索能力和基于语义识别的垂直领域内容结构化模态卡。

MCP Human Loop Server is a Model Context Protocol server that manages human-agent collaboration through a sequential scoring system. It evaluates requests based on multiple dimensions such as complexity, permission, risk, emotional intelligence, and confidence to determine if human intervention is necessary. The system aims to improve efficiency, scalability, and transparency in human-AI collaboration, with future improvements including dynamic threshold adjustment, machine learning integration, and real-time threshold adjustment.

AWS Resources MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that allows running generated Python code to query and manage AWS resources using boto3. It provides a Docker-based solution for easy setup and execution, supports various AWS services, and includes safety features like AST-based code analysis and restricted execution environment. The server is designed to be used with Claude Desktop and can be installed via Smithery or Docker.

App SEO AI is an application for SEO automation and AI-powered optimization with Google Ads Keyword Planner integration. Main features include keyword research, SERP analysis, competitor analysis, SEO recommendations, and MCP (Model Context Protocol) integration for AI assistants. The tool supports various functionalities like researching keywords, analyzing SERPs, and analyzing competitors.

Gel Database MCP Server is a TypeScript-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to streamline Gel database operations with EdgeQL queries. It provides tools for LLM Agents to automate learning about your schema, writing, validating, and executing database queries. Key features include describe-schema, validate-query, execute-edgeql, search-gel-docs, and execute-typescript.

MCP Chrome Google Search Tool is a tool for Google search and webpage content extraction using the Chrome browser. It works with Claude to enable Google search and content fetching capabilities. Key features include free Google search, use of your Chrome window to avoid being blocked, and access to authenticated content. The tool supports macOS and requires Google Chrome and Node.js 20 or higher.

zkMCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for zero-knowledge proofs using circom. It provides tools for building circuits, performing trusted setup, generating proofs, and verifying proofs. The repository includes an example of age verification that demonstrates how to verify a person's age without revealing their birth date.

Code Review Server is a custom MCP server that performs code reviews using Repomix and Large Language Models (LLMs). Main features include flattening codebases, analyzing code with LLMs, providing structured code reviews with specific issues and recommendations, support for multiple LLM providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini), and handling chunking for large codebases. The server can be used as an MCP server or via a CLI tool, and it provides detailed and actionable feedback on code quality, security, performance, and maintainability.

OpenBudget MCP Server provides access to the OpenBudget API, allowing you to query and search various budget-related datasets. Key features include full access to Israel's governmental budget data, real-time integration with the OpenBudget API, comprehensive search capabilities, historical budget tracking and analysis, and contract and support payment information retrieval. The server also offers an easy-to-use MCP interface for client applications.

Claude Server MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides sophisticated context management capabilities for Claude, enabling persistent context across sessions, project-specific context organization, and conversation continuity. Key features include Project Context Management, Conversation Continuity, and Efficient Storage. The server is in early development and not yet ready for production use.

docling-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server that uses the Docling software created by IBM to parse and convert documents, currently supporting only conversion to Markdown. It can be used by adding specific configuration to the Claude config file.

Supabase MCP Server is a feature-rich MCP server that enables Cursor and Windsurf to safely interact with Supabase databases. It provides tools for database management, SQL query execution, and Supabase Management API access with built-in safety controls. Key features include read-only and read-write modes, robust transaction handling, Supabase Management API access, and Auth Admin methods via Python SDK.

Descope MCP Server provides an interface to interact with Descope's Management APIs, enabling the search and retrieval of project-related information. Main features include tools for searching audits and users, creating and inviting users, and integration with Claude Desktop. The server can be installed and configured manually or via Smithery, and it supports both stdio and SSE modes.

Hetzner Cloud MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Hetzner Cloud API. It allows language models to manage Hetzner Cloud resources through structured functions. Key features include managing servers, volumes, firewall rules, and SSH keys, as well as viewing available images, server types, and locations. The server supports both stdio and SSE transport modes and integrates with Claude Code for managing Hetzner resources directly.

systemprompt-agent-server is a specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables the creation, management, and extension of AI agents through a powerful prompt and tool management system. Key features include agent management, extensible tool system, prompt management, type-safe integration, real-time processing, and voice-powered interface. It integrates with systemprompt.io and supports advanced clients for a complete voice-powered AI workflow solution.

OKX MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides real-time cryptocurrency price data from the OKX exchange. It includes features such as retrieving historical candlestick (OHLCV) data and fetching the latest price and 24-hour market data for any instrument on OKX. The server also provides comprehensive error handling, request logging, and rate limiting via OKX's API.

MCP Server: Terragrunt Docs Provider is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server built with Deno and TypeScript, designed to provide contextual information related to Terragrunt. It offers tools and resources for AI agents or other MCP clients to query information about Terragrunt documentation and development, such as GitHub issues. Key features include listing documentation categories, retrieving all docs in a specific category, reading specific documents, merging all docs in a category, and getting all open issues from the Terragrunt GitHub repo.

FalkorDB MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI models to query and interact with graph databases. It translates and routes MCP requests to FalkorDB and formats the responses according to the MCP standard. Key features include API endpoints for metadata, context execution, health checks, and graph management, as well as support for both development and production environments.

Drawing MCP Server is an MCP server that provides drawing capabilities for AI assistants. Main features include creating a canvas with specified dimensions, drawing filled rectangles with custom colors, exporting the canvas as a PNG image, and getting raw canvas data as JSON.

FOCUS DATA MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables artificial intelligence assistants to directly query data results from DataFocus using natural language. Key features include registering and importing data tables, natural language data acquisition, and various tools for table list retrieval, dialogue initialization, and data querying.

Sleep MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a simple sleep/wait tool. It is useful for adding delays between operations, such as waiting between API calls or testing eventually consistent systems. The main feature is the `sleep` tool, which allows you to wait for a specified duration in milliseconds.

Solana MCP Server is a tool for interacting with the Solana blockchain using your own private key. It provides features such as getting the latest slot, wallet address, wallet balance, and transferring SOL. The server can be installed via Smithery or set up manually, and it integrates with Cursor for easy use.

mcp-server-oracle is a Model Context Protocol server designed to access Oracle databases. It requires Python 3.12+, UV (package manager), and Claude Desktop. The server can be configured in the Claude Desktop application, and it supports adding environment variables for the Oracle connection string.

Linear Regression MCP is a project that demonstrates an end-to-end machine learning workflow using Claude and the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It allows users to train a Linear Regression model by uploading a CSV file, handling data preprocessing, training, and evaluation (RMSE calculation). The project includes tools for uploading files, getting column information, checking for categorical columns, label encoding, and training the model.

QA Sphere MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the QA Sphere test management system. It enables Large Language Models (LLMs) to interact directly with QA Sphere test cases, allowing you to discover, summarize, and chat about test cases. The integration supports popular IDEs like Claude Desktop, Cursor, and 5ire, and requires a QA Sphere account with API access.

MCP Claude Spotify is an integration that allows Claude Desktop to interact with Spotify using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Main features include Spotify authentication, search for tracks, albums, artists, and playlists, playback control, creating and managing playlists, getting personalized recommendations, and accessing user's top played tracks over different time periods.

Instagram DM MCP Server is an MCP (Model-Consumer Protocol) server for Instagram direct messaging functionality, enabling AI assistants to read and send Instagram direct messages. Features include reading recent direct messages with comprehensive thread information, sending direct messages, a simple greeting resource, a health check endpoint, proper logging, and support for various authentication methods.

Semantic Scholar MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Semantic Scholar API. It provides tools for searching papers, retrieving paper and author details, and fetching citations and references. Key features include searching for papers, retrieving detailed information about specific papers, getting author details, and fetching citations and references for a paper.

Microsoft Office MCP Servers is a repository containing Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers for interacting with Microsoft Office applications (PowerPoint and Excel) through AI assistance. It provides comprehensive APIs for creating, modifying, and managing presentations and spreadsheets, including advanced formatting, financial charts, and data integration. Features include presentation and worksheet management, element and cell operations, financial tools, and template management. The servers use `pywin32` for COM automation and require Windows and Microsoft Office to be installed.
카카오 API MCP 서버는 카카오맵 API 및 Daum 검색 API를 활용할 수 있는 서버로, 주요 기능은 장소 검색, 좌표-주소 변환, 길찾기, 웹 문서 검색, 이미지 검색, 블로그 검색, 카페 검색 등이 포함되어 있습니다. 이 서버는 AI 모델이 다양한 검색 및 지도 관련 기능을 활용할 수 있도록 지원합니다.

Osmosis Agent Toolkit is a collection of packages designed to enable Large Language Models (LLMs) to interact with the Osmosis protocol. It includes core functionality, an AI SDK implementation, and a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server. The toolkit supports integration with Claude Desktop or Cursor and provides tools for registry data, query clients, and transaction signing and broadcasting.

Bonsai-mcp is a Blender Model Context Protocol Integration for IFC through IfcOpenShell, extending the original BlenderMCP with dedicated support for IFC models. Key features include IFC-specific functionality, five powerful IFC tools (inspect project info, list entities, examine properties, explore spatial structure, and analyze relationships), sequential thinking for structured problem solving, and the ability to execute Python code in Blender. The integration is aimed at connecting Claude or any LLM to Blender for executing IfcOpenShell commands.

MCP Gmail is a Model Context Protocol server for Gmail integration, allowing Claude Desktop or any MCP client to interact with your Gmail account through Google Apps Script. Main features include searching for emails, getting the full content and details of specific emails, and downloading attachments. The setup involves deploying a Google Apps Script and configuring Claude Desktop with the deployment URL and an API key.

PubDev MCP is a tool that provides functionality for searching pub.dev packages using natural language queries and performing basic arithmetic calculations. It uses LLM integration to enable intuitive package discovery through conversational interactions. Key features include natural language package search, intelligent package recommendations, and better understanding of search intent.

MCP Log Reader is a specialized MCP server designed to help analyze and debug Model Context Protocol logs. It provides features such as multi-platform support, smart filtering, paginated browsing, size management, and seamless integration with Claude Desktop. The tool is useful for troubleshooting MCP integrations and understanding how Claude interacts with your tools.

exia-scenario-generator MCP Server is a tool designed to create scenario files for the novel game engine exia. It generates 'Kotonoha Sisters Explanation' style scenarios and displays them using exia. Key features include generating scenarios based on given topics, converting generated scenarios into JSON format for exia, setting up exia from GitHub, and displaying the generated scenarios in exia. The server also provides tools for generating, setting up, saving, and running scenarios.

Confluence Communication Server MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that provides tools to interact with Confluence. It includes features for executing CQL queries to search pages and retrieving the content of Confluence pages. The server can be installed and configured for use with Claude Desktop, and it supports debugging via the MCP Inspector.

memos-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Memos, which provides tools to search and create memos. Main features include the ability to search memos with a keyword and create new memos.

MCP Documentation Server is a smart documentation server that provides AI-assisted code improvement and documentation management through Claude Desktop integration. Main features include AI Documentation Guide, AI Code Assistant, support for multiple frameworks (React.js, Next.js, Python, Vue.js, Angular, Node.js), Brave Search Integration, and a learning system that improves suggestions over time.

UltimateCoder MCP is a local-first automation server for developers and engineers, enabling them to automate terminal commands, edit files, and power up AI tools. Key features include terminal execution, process management, file operations, precise line/block replacement, unified diff patching, mass code search, JSON and Python linting, static Python analysis, and AI-enhanced workflows. It is built on fastmcp and runs 100% locally, ensuring no data leaves the machine.

ConsultingAgents MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows Claude Code to consult with additional AI agents for code and problem analysis. It provides access to multiple expert consultants, including Darren (OpenAI), Sonny (Anthropic), Sergey (OpenAI with web search), and Gemma (Google Gemini with repository analysis). Features include high reasoning capabilities, enhanced thinking, web search, and comprehensive repository analysis. The server integrates seamlessly with Claude Code via the MCP protocol and supports multiple transport options.

Nuanced MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides call graph analysis capabilities to LLMs. It allows AI assistants to initialize call graphs for Python repos, explore function call relationships, analyze dependencies between functions, and provide more contextually aware code assistance. The server includes tools for initializing graphs, switching repositories, listing repositories, getting function call graphs, analyzing dependencies, and analyzing the impact of changes. It also provides resources and prompts for detailed function and dependency analysis.

starknet-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Starknet, providing various RPC methods to interact with the Starknet blockchain. It supports methods like starknet_getBlockWithTxHashes, starknet_getBlockWithTxs, starknet_getStateUpdate, and more. The server can be used to query the state of the chain, and it integrates with Claude Desktop for easy access to these methods.

Mcp-Confluence is a confluence context server that provides integration with Zed through slash commands. It allows users to interact with Confluence pages and blog posts, and requires setting up environment variables for API key, domain name, and email. The server can be installed via npm and used with the MCP Inspector for further interaction.

Stealth Browser MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides stealth browser capabilities using Playwright with anti-detection techniques. Key features include Stealth Mode to bypass bot detections, Screenshot Tool for taking full-page or element-specific screenshots, and MCP Integration to expose browser capabilities via Model Context Protocol.

pumpfun-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Pump.fun platform on Solana. It enables AI assistants to create, buy, and sell tokens on the Pump.fun platform. Key features include token creation, buying, selling, and account management. The project also includes standalone scripts for various token and account operations.

code2prompt-mcp is an MCP server that generates contextual prompts from codebases, making it easier for AI assistants to understand and work with your code repositories. It leverages the high-performance Rust library code2prompt-rs to analyze codebases and produce structured summaries, bridging the gap between your code and language models.

MCP Server: Ollama Deep Researcher is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides deep research capabilities using local LLMs via Ollama. It generates web search queries, gathers and summarizes results, and iteratively improves the summary through multiple research cycles. The server integrates with LangSmith for tracing and monitoring, and supports configuration options for research parameters such as the number of iterations, LLM model, and search API.

MCP Server ODBC via SQLAlchemy is a lightweight MCP server for ODBC built with FastAPI, pyodbc, and SQLAlchemy. It provides features such as fetching schemas, retrieving table information, describing table structures, searching tables, executing stored procedures, and executing SQL queries in various formats (JSONL, Markdown). It supports multiple DBMS backends including Virtuoso, PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQLite.
This tool integrates with Google Docs to enable viewing, editing, and commenting on documents through Google OAuth authentication, supporting collaborative content creation and review workflows.

Zonos MCP Integration is a Model Context Protocol integration for Zonos TTS, allowing Claude to generate speech directly. Main features include text-to-speech, multiple emotions support, multi-language support, and proper audio playback through PulseAudio. It requires Node.js, PulseAudio setup, a running instance of Zonos API, and a working audio output device.

Telegram MCP server is a bridge between the Telegram API and AI assistants, allowing for capabilities such as getting current account information, listing dialogs, marking dialogs as read, retrieving messages, and sending draft messages. It also supports message management, organization, and communication through AI prompts.

MCP Firebird is a server that implements Anthropic's Model Context Protocol (MCP) for Firebird SQL databases. It allows Large Language Models (LLMs) to access, analyze, and manipulate data in Firebird databases securely and in a controlled manner. Key features include executing SQL queries, schema analysis, database management, performance analysis, multiple transports (STDIO and SSE), Claude integration, VSCode integration, and security options.

OpenTK Model Context Protocol Server provides access to Dutch parliamentary data through a standardized interface, allowing AI assistants to search, retrieve, and analyze parliamentary documents, debates, and member information. Key features include sophisticated search functionality with support for keyword, exact phrase, exclusion, and boolean operators, as well as robust error handling and detailed error messages.

YouTube to Google Sheets MCP Server is a tool that allows users to search for YouTube videos using the YouTube Data API v3 and automatically save the results to Google Sheets. Key features include configurable search parameters, automatic saving of video details such as title, URL, channel name, and publish date, and integration with AI assistants like Claude.

Rust MCP Filesystem is a high-performance, asynchronous, and lightweight MCP (Model Context Protocol) server designed for efficient handling of various filesystem operations. Key features include high performance, read-only by default, advanced glob search, nested directories support, and a lightweight standalone binary with no external dependencies.

Pinner MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that helps pin 3rd party dependencies to immutable digests, ensuring security and consistency. Supported dependency types include Docker base images and GitHub Actions. It can be run as a container with `stdio` transport and integrates with Cursor IDE. Features include pinning specific commit hashes, updating pinned versions, and automatic updates for the MCP server.

MCP GitHub Issue Server is a tool that allows LLMs to fetch and use GitHub issue details as task descriptions. Key features include fetching GitHub issue details from public repositories, no authentication required for public repositories, returning structured task data including title, description, and source URL, and compatibility with the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

The image-generator MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that generates images based on given prompts using OPENAI's DALL-E-3 model. Key features include the ability to generate an image for a given prompt, save the generated image in a specified directory, and support for development with auto-rebuild. The server can be integrated with Claude Desktop and requires an OPENAI API key for operation.

HubSpot MCP Server enables interaction with the HubSpot CRM for sales analysis and insights. It provides tools for managing contacts, deals, and companies, as well as sales analytics and performance metrics. Key features include searching and creating contacts, listing and updating deals, and generating sales reports and forecasts.

Memex for Model Context Protocol is a tool that allows you to analyze web content and add it to your knowledge base. It requires API keys for services like Claude, FireCrawl, and Voyage. The knowledge base is stored as Markdown files and can be viewed with any Markdown viewer, though Obsidian is recommended. Main features include web content analysis, knowledge base creation, and the ability to ask questions about the analyzed content.

workers-mcp-clerk is a Cloudflare Worker that can be used to proxy Clerk-protected API routes or server actions, allowing for communication with authenticated users. It enables impersonation of Clerk users and can return user JWTs, which can be used to access protected resources.
mcp-tavily-search is an MCP server that enables clients to perform internet searches. It requires configuration in the MCP config file and the TAVILY_API_KEY in the .env file.

mcp-wsl-exec is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for executing commands in Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) environments. It provides secure command execution with built-in safety features and validation, including dangerous command detection, command confirmation system, path traversal prevention, and command sanitization. It also includes working directory support, command timeout functionality, detailed command output formatting, error handling, and protection against shell injection.

Chain of Draft (CoD) MCP Server implements the Chain of Draft reasoning approach, which allows LLMs to generate minimalistic yet informative intermediate reasoning outputs. Key benefits include reduced token usage, faster responses, cost savings, and maintained accuracy. Features include core CoD implementation, performance analytics, adaptive word limits, a comprehensive example database, format enforcement, hybrid reasoning approaches, and OpenAI API compatibility. The server is available in both Python and JavaScript implementations.

Storacha MCP Storage Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Storacha hot storage, allowing AI applications to store and retrieve files through a standardized interface. It supports trustless, decentralized data exchange using IPFS and CIDs, ensuring data sovereignty, verifiability, and seamless integration with agent frameworks & AI systems. Key features include document storage and analysis, long-term structured data storage, data sharing between agents and systems, application integration, AI model development support, LLM integration, web application backups, and machine learning dataset management.
