The server offers various tools for operations such as getting products, updating product prices, tagging customers, creating discounts, and managing webhooks.

Typesense MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides AI models with access to Typesense search capabilities. Key features include listing and accessing collections, searching for documents with powerful filtering, retrieving specific documents by ID, getting collection statistics, analyzing collection structure, and providing search suggestions.

Zerodha MCP Server is a tool written in Golang that allows Claude AI to access Zerodha trading account information directly. It provides features such as getting user profile and margin information, portfolio and positions, market data, and mutual fund details. The server supports read operations and requires API credentials from the Kite Connect developer portal.

MCP Server: SSH Rails Runner is a tool that enables secure remote execution of Rails console commands via SSH. It provides features for remote Rails console execution, safe read-only operations, dry-run capability for mutations, and execution of approved mutations. The server also includes resource management for code snippets and integrates with Cursor and Claude Desktop for enhanced functionality.

Think MCP is an implementation of Anthropic's 'think' tool using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It uses OpenAI's o3-mini model to provide deep thinking capabilities through a standardized MCP interface. Main features include MCP protocol implementation for 'think' capability, use of OpenAI's o3-mini model, stdio transport for seamless integration, and comprehensive error handling and logging.

Fetch Browser is a powerful headless browser MCP server that enables AI agents to fetch web content and perform Google searches without requiring any API keys. Main features include No API Keys Required, Smart Google Search, Universal Content Fetching, Format Conversion, and various tools like Google Search Tool and URL Fetcher Tool. It supports multiple output formats (HTML, JSON, Text, Markdown) and includes security features such as response size limits, request timeouts, and rate limiting protection.

Binance Cryptocurrency MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) service for accessing Binance cryptocurrency market data. It allows AI agents to execute Binance API calls and obtain real-time data such as prices, candlestick charts, order books, and more. The service provides tools like `get_price`, `get_order_book`, `get_klines`, and others to fetch various types of market data.

mcp-vscode-template is a MCP server template for VS Code Agent, providing a setup guide for initializing and configuring a project. The template includes instructions for setting up the environment, installing dependencies, and modifying the VS Code settings to run the MCP server. It also highlights the use of `@mcp.tool()` in the `external-recon.py` file.

MCP Apple Notes is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables semantic search and RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) over your Apple Notes. Key features include semantic search using on-device embeddings, full-text search capabilities, vector storage with LanceDB, MCP-compatible server for AI assistant integration, native Apple Notes integration via JXA, and fully local execution without the need for API keys.

MCP Notes Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server implementation that manages markdown notes in a given directory. It provides functionality to create, read, and update markdown notes using the stdio transport. Key features include automatic file management, proper error handling and logging, timestamp tracking, and JSON Schema validation for all operations.

OptionsFlow MCP Server provides advanced options analysis and strategy evaluation through Yahoo Finance. It enables LLMs to analyze options chains, calculate Greeks, and evaluate basic options strategies with comprehensive risk metrics. Features include complete options chain data processing, Greeks calculation, implied volatility analysis, probability calculations, risk/reward metrics, and various strategy analyses such as Credit Call Spreads, Put Credit Spreads, Cash Secured Puts, and Covered Calls.

dify-retriever-mcp is a knowledge retrieval tool that allows users to search and retrieve information from a specified dataset. It can be installed via Go or by downloading a binary file, and it requires setting up environment variables for the dataset API key, endpoint, dataset ID, and dataset name.

File Converter MCP Server provides multiple file conversion tools for converting various document and image formats. Key features include DOCX to PDF, PDF to DOCX, Image Format Conversion, Excel to CSV, HTML to PDF, Markdown to PDF, and a Generic Conversion tool. The server supports both path-based and content-based input methods, and includes robust file handling and error handling mechanisms.

Coolify MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides integration with the Coolify API, enabling interaction with Coolify instances through MCP tools. Key features include teams management, server management, service and application lifecycle management, deployment tracking, private key management, and version and health checks.

Financial Data - MCP Server is an MCP server that provides access to the Alpha Vantage API, allowing stock data retrieval for use as context in LLMs. Key features include getting the current stock quote and retrieving historical stock data with options for different time intervals and output sizes.

@xiaok/etherscan-mcp is a dynamic MCP server for interacting with Etherscan's API and services. It allows users to interact with the Etherscan API, supports multiple blockchain chains, and provides tools for testing and debugging the server using `mcp-cli` and `MCP Inspector`. The server can be configured to work with Claude Desktop and requires an Etherscan API key for operation.

mcp-micromanage is a tool designed to control and manage coding agents, ensuring they stay on track. It addresses challenges such as making unintended modifications, requesting user feedback, and visualizing work plans. Key features include commit and PR-based work plans, forced frequent feedback, and a visualization dashboard for real-time progress tracking.

MCP Server for MySQL based on NodeJS is a Model Context Protocol server that provides access to MySQL databases, enabling LLMs to inspect database schemas and execute SQL queries. Key features include multi-IDE support, comprehensive database information, security features like SQL injection prevention, performance optimizations, and advanced configuration options. It supports various installation methods, including Smithery, MCP Get, NPM/PNPM, and manual setup.

MCP Personal Assistant Agent is a versatile personal assistant AI agent built with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that helps with calendar, tasks, emails, and more. Main features include managing calendar events, tracking tasks and to-dos, reading and sending emails, searching the web, and controlling smart home devices.

neon-mcp is a lightweight Model Control Protocol (MCP) server that allows agents to interface with the Neon REST API. It is bootstrapped with create-mcp and deployed on Cloudflare Workers. Key features include automated installation, local development setup, and deployment of changes. The server is still under development and more tools will be added as needed.

Video Still Capture MCP is a Python implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that provides AI assistants with the ability to access and control webcams and video sources through OpenCV. Main features include Quick Image Capture, Connection Management, Video Properties, Image Processing, and tools for managing camera connections and settings.

RhinoMCP is a tool that connects Rhino3D to Claude AI via the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling AI-assisted 3D modeling, analysis, and design workflows. Key features include socket-based bidirectional communication between Python and Rhino, support for NURBS curve creation, and compatibility with both Claude Desktop and Windsurf as clients.

Computer Control MCP is a server that provides computer control capabilities, such as mouse and keyboard control, OCR, and screen management using PyAutoGUI, RapidOCR, and ONNXRuntime. Features include controlling mouse movements and clicks, typing text, taking screenshots, extracting text from images, listing and activating windows, and performing drag and drop operations.

Room MCP is a command-line tool for using MCP (Model Context Protocol) with the Room protocol, allowing the creation of virtual rooms in a p2p space for agents to accomplish a goal. Main features include Room Protocol Integration, MCP Support, Invitation Management, and Transcript Storage.

Aiven MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Aiven, providing access to Aiven for PostgreSQL, Kafka, ClickHouse, Valkey, and OpenSearch services. Key features include listing projects, listing services, and getting service details. The server can be configured for use with Claude Desktop and Cursor, and developers are responsible for managing the deployment, security, and maintenance of the MCP server.

MCP Chess is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides chess functionality for Claude AI Assistant. Main features include generating chess board images from FEN strings, suggesting the next move in a chess game, and checking if a move is legal. The server can be installed and configured to work with Claude Desktop, allowing users to perform various chess-related tasks.

AlibabaCloud DMS MCP Server is an AI-powered unified data management gateway that supports connection to over 30+ data sources, serving as a multi-cloud universal data MCP Server. It provides a unified data access layer and metadata access layer, solving issues related to data source fragmentation, protocol compatibility, and security. Key features include NL2SQL, Code Generation, Data Retrieval, and Security with fine-grained access control and auditability.

This project demonstrates how to use Cloudflare Browser Rendering to extract web content for LLM context. It includes experiments with the REST API and Workers Binding API, as well as an MCP server implementation that can be used to provide web context to LLMs. Key features include fetching and processing web pages, searching documentation, extracting structured content, and summarizing content.

MCP Replicate FLUX is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that generates images using Replicate's FLUX model and stores them in Cloudflare R2. Key features include image generation, storage in Cloudflare R2, returning accessible image URLs, and support for custom prompts and filenames.

Couchbase MCP Server for LLMs is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables LLMs to interact directly with Couchbase databases on Capella clusters. It supports querying buckets, performing CRUD operations, executing N1QL queries, and managing data seamlessly through natural language. Key features include basic operations like N1QL queries and listing buckets, scope and collection management, document operations, and index management.

Glean is an MCP server implementation that integrates the Glean API, providing Search and Chat functions. The main features include a list of search results given a query and Q&A with a chatbot. It can be used with Claude Desktop by building a Docker image and configuring the `claude_desktop_config.json` file.

mcp-editor is a TypeScript MCP server that ports Anthropic's filesystem editing tools. It is designed for developers to use in their projects, with features including direct file system editing capabilities and integration with the Claude desktop app and MCP Installer. The server comes with warnings about the lack of access controls and the need for careful use.

Google Tasks MCP Server provides a bridge between Claude and Google Tasks, allowing you to manage your task lists and tasks directly through Claude. Main features include Task List Management (list, get, create, update, delete task lists) and Task Management (list, get, create, update, delete, complete, move, clear completed tasks).

Canvas MCP is a set of tools that allows AI agents to interact with Canvas LMS and Gradescope. Key features include the ability to find relevant resources, query upcoming assignments, get courses and assignments from Gradescope, fetch submission status, and more. It supports natural language queries and integrates with various IDEs and platforms.

Doc Scraper MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides documentation scraping functionality. It scrapes documentation from any web URL, converts HTML documentation to markdown format, and saves the converted documentation to a specified output path. The server integrates with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and can be installed via Smithery or manually.

Spline MCP Server is an MCP server for working with the Spline 3D design tool API. It provides a convenient interface for interacting with Spline's features, including exporting scenes to various formats, importing 3D models, creating and managing animations, and handling basic operations like listing and getting details about scenes.

Maven Dependencies MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides tools for checking Maven dependency versions. It enables LLMs to verify Maven dependencies and retrieve their latest versions from the Maven Central Repository. Main features include querying the latest version of any Maven dependency, verifying if a Maven dependency exists, checking if a specific version of a dependency exists, support for full Maven coordinates, real-time access to Maven Central Repository data, and compatibility with multiple build tool formats (Maven, Gradle, SBT, Mill).
FS MCP is a file system Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables seamless file reading capabilities. It supports command-line API key configuration and can be run directly using npx.

MCP Read Images is an MCP server for analyzing images using OpenRouter vision models. It provides a simple interface to analyze images with features like automatic image resizing and optimization, configurable model selection, support for custom questions about images, detailed error messages, and automatic JPEG conversion and quality optimization. The server also handles various error cases and provides descriptive error messages.

Gerrit Review MCP Server provides integration with the Gerrit code review system, allowing AI assistants to review code changes and their details through a simple interface. Main features include fetching change details, comparing patchset differences, and secure authentication using HTTP digest auth. The server uses Gerrit REST API for fast and reliable change information retrieval.

The image-mcp-server is an MCP server that receives image URLs or local file paths and analyzes the image content using the GPT-4o-mini model. Key features include detailed image analysis, high-precision image recognition, image URL validity checking, and support for local files and Base64 encoding. It requires an OpenAI API key for operation and can be integrated with tools like Cline and Claude Desktop App.

This project provides a Google Chat integration for MCP (Model Control Protocol) servers written in Python with FastMCP, allowing interaction with Google Chat spaces and messages. Main features include OAuth2 authentication with Google Chat API, listing available Google Chat spaces, retrieving messages from specific spaces with date filtering, and a local authentication server for easy setup.

DexPaprika MCP Server provides on-demand access to cryptocurrency and DEX data API, enabling AI assistants to fetch real-time token, pool, and DEX data. Key features include Token Analysis Tools, DEX Comparisons, Liquidity Pool Analytics, Market Analysis, Portfolio Trackers, and Technical Analysis. The server supports various network, pool, and token operations and is designed for zero-configuration use.

mcp-server-coingecko is a Model Context Protocol server for querying cryptocurrency data. It provides tools to interact with the CoinGecko API, allowing users to fetch current and historical prices, market information, and details of specific cryptocurrencies. Key features include getting the current time, fetching the current price of a cryptocurrency, retrieving historical price data, obtaining detailed information about a coin, and listing trending coins within 24 hours.

MCP Ethers Wallet is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides Ethereum wallet functionality using ethers.js v6. It offers tools for network information and management, wallet creation and management, transaction creation and sending, contract interaction (ERC20, ERC721, ERC1155), ENS resolution, unit conversion, gas estimation, and transaction history. The server is compatible with any MCP client and supports multiple Ethereum and EVM-compatible networks.

DARPEngine is a search engine for MCP servers that provides smart search capabilities. It includes features such as a simple CLI, API access to search, and an MCP tool to retrieve search results. The engine also offers a routing MCP tool to answer questions using the tools found for the user's request. Additional features include support for .well-known/mcp.json, a crawler, a nice frontend, and a hosted version. The project is designed to store metadata for MCP servers hosted online and provide intelligent search functionality.

Morphik MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for the Morphik multi-modal database. It allows AI assistants to interact with the Morphik database system, enabling document ingestion, retrieval, querying, and management. Key features include document ingestion (text and files), document retrieval by relevance, document querying with LLM-powered completions, document management (listing, getting, deleting), and file system navigation and file ingestion from paths.

DeepResearch MCP is a powerful research assistant that conducts intelligent, iterative research on any topic through web searches, analysis, and comprehensive report generation. Key features include Intelligent Topic Exploration, Comprehensive Content Extraction, Structured Knowledge Processing, Scholarly Report Generation, Complete Bibliography, Adaptive Content Management, and Error Resilience.

Apple MCP tools is a collection of Apple-native tools for the MCP protocol, providing features such as sending and reading messages, managing notes, contacts, emails, reminders, calendar events, web search, and map functionalities. It allows users to create workflows by daisy-chaining commands and supports integration with popular IDEs like Claude Desktop and Cursor.

Sensei MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides expert guidance for Dojo and Cairo development on Starknet. It offers specialized knowledge and assistance for building onchain worlds using the Dojo Entity Component System (ECS) framework. Key features include Expert Cairo Guidance, Dojo ECS Architecture, Smart Contract Development, and access to specialized tools for models, systems, testing, and more.

ClickHouse MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for ClickHouse. It provides AI assistants with a secure and structured way to explore and analyze databases, enabling them to list tables, read data, and execute SQL queries through a controlled interface. The server can be configured using environment variables or command-line arguments and is designed to ensure responsible database access.

Joplin MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Joplin that enables note access and management. Main features include full-text search across all notes, reading, creating, updating, and deleting notes, importing markdown files as notes, and seamless integration with AI assistants like Claude.

MyMCP is a Python application that enables parallel execution of multiple AI coding tasks using the Aider tool. It provides a framework for running multiple coding prompts simultaneously, improving efficiency and reducing execution time. Key features include parallel and sequential execution, detailed reporting, MCP integration, and performance metrics.

content_name: remote mcp server authless scrape and analyze website
description: This example allows you to deploy a remote MCP server on Cloudflare Workers without requiring authentication. The server includes tools for website analysis and content extraction using Cloudflare's Browser Rendering and AI capabilities. Main features include website analysis, content scraping, and answering specific questions about the website content.

RDF Explorer v1.0.0 is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a conversational interface for the exploration and analysis of RDF (Turtle) based Knowledge Graphs in Local File mode or SPARQL Endpoint mode. It facilitates communication between AI applications and RDF data, making graph exploration and analysis through SPARQL queries. Key features include executing SPARQL queries, full-text search, graph statistics, and health checks. The tool is useful for knowledge graph research and AI data preparation.

Personal MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for personal health and well-being tracking. It provides tools and resources for tracking workouts, nutrition, and daily journal entries, with AI-assisted analysis through Claude integration. Key features include workout tracking, nutrition management, and a journal system for mood and energy tracking.

Baidu Search MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides web search capabilities through Baidu. It includes features such as advanced rate limiting, result formatting, content fetching and parsing, comprehensive error handling, and LLM-friendly output. The server also offers tools for performing web searches and fetching and parsing webpage content.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial and crypto data, and can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude for financial analysis.

Dify MCP Server (TypeScript) is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that converts Dify applications into MCP tools. It supports streaming responses from Dify workflows, is configurable via a YAML configuration file, and is written in TypeScript for type safety. Key features include converting Dify applications into MCP tools, supporting streaming responses, and being configurable via a YAML file.

Redis MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to Redis database operations. It includes a variety of tools for hash, key, string, and sorted set commands, such as HMSET, HGET, HGETALL, SCAN, SET, GET, DEL, ZADD, ZRANGE, ZRANGEBYSCORE, and ZREM. The server can be configured in an MCP client and supports command line arguments for Redis host and port. It also provides a structured project layout and guidelines for adding new Redis tools.

keep-mcp is an MCP server for Google Keep, allowing users to search, create, update, and delete notes. The main features include searching for notes based on a query string, creating new notes, updating existing notes, and deleting notes. It integrates with Google Keep and requires user credentials for authentication.

Data Gouv MCP Server is designed for interacting with Datagouv APIs, specifically the API Recherche Entreprises. It allows users to search for up-to-date information about companies listed in France, including details such as name, address, list of directors, and sector. The server uses HTTP+SSE transport and can be run locally with Node 22 and pnpm 10.

PostgreSQL MCP Server (Enhanced) is a Model Context Protocol server that provides both read and write access to PostgreSQL databases. It enables LLMs to inspect database schemas, execute queries, modify data, and create/modify database schema objects. Main features include Data Query, Data Modification, and Schema Management tools such as query, execute, insert, update, delete, createTable, createFunction, createTrigger, createIndex, and alterTable.

DALL-E MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for generating, editing, and creating variations of images using OpenAI's DALL-E API. Main features include generating images with DALL-E 2 or DALL-E 3, editing existing images, creating variations, and validating the OpenAI API key. The server can be integrated with Cline for seamless image generation and display in the workspace.

Linear MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Linear, written in Go. It provides tools for interacting with the Linear API through the MCP protocol. Main features include creating, updating, and searching Linear issues, getting issues assigned to a user, adding comments to issues, retrieving team information, and rate-limited API requests to respect Linear's API limits.

git-commit-aider MCP Server is a TypeScript-based tool that allows AI to make git commits in a codebase, appending '(aider)' to the committer's name. Features include committing staged changes with a specific message, optional working directory specification, and automatic retrieval of committer information from environment variables or git configuration. It can be integrated into code editors and used to track AI contributions in the codebase.

Azure Resource Graph MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to Azure Resource Graph queries, allowing users to retrieve information about Azure resources across their subscriptions. Main features include querying Azure resources using Resource Graph queries, default and custom query support, and robust error handling. It supports integration with Cursor IDE and Visual Studio Code.

box-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for integrating with Box. It supports JSON Web Token (JWT) and Developer Token authorization. Key capabilities include searching and reading files, particularly PDF and Word documents. The setup involves creating and configuring a Box application, setting up environment variables, and running the server in a development environment.

MCP Browser Automation is a demo project that uses the Model Context Protocol to automate web browsing with Playwright. It interacts with a Claude Desktop client to accept user prompts and control the browser. Key features include browser automation, integration with Playwright, and support for Node.js.

ArXiv MCP Server enables AI assistants to search and access arXiv papers through a simple MCP interface. Core features include Paper Search, Paper Access, Paper Listing, Local Storage, and a set of Research Prompts. It provides tools for searching, downloading, listing, and reading papers.

Backstage MCP is a tool that integrates Backstage with MCP via Quarkus Backstage. It allows users to list available Backstage templates and instantiate a template from the command line. The project uses dependencies for implementing an MCP server and communicating with the Backstage API. It also provides instructions for setting up Goose, a local AI agent, to use this MCP server.

Postgres MCP Pro is an open-source Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to support the entire development process, from coding to production tuning and maintenance. Key features include Database Health checks, Index Tuning, Query Plans, Schema Intelligence, and Safe SQL Execution. It supports both Standard Input/Output (stdio) and Server-Sent Events (SSE) transports, and provides tools for comprehensive database management and optimization.

Tavily MCP Server is an AI-powered search server that provides comprehensive web search capabilities using the Tavily API. Key features include AI-powered search, support for basic and advanced search depths, rich search results with titles, URLs, and content snippets, AI-generated summaries, result scoring, response time tracking, and persistent storage with caching. The server can be configured with various MCP clients and supports both tools and resources for flexible data access.

MCP Memory is a robust, Elasticsearch-backed knowledge graph system that provides persistent memory for AI conversations. It allows AI models to remember important information across multiple sessions, creating more coherent and personalized interactions. Key features include persistent memory, smart search, contextual recall, relational understanding, long-term/short-term memory, and memory zones. The system is designed to work seamlessly with Claude Desktop and includes admin tools for maintaining the knowledge graph.

SQLite MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation using TypeScript for interacting with an SQLite database. It provides an interactive interface for executing SQL queries, managing database schemas, and synthesizing business insights. Key features include listing all tables in the SQLite database and executing SELECT queries.

Markmap MCP Server is a tool that converts Markdown text to interactive mind maps. It supports multi-format export (PNG, JPG, SVG), interactive operations (zooming, expanding/collapsing nodes), and automatic browser preview. The server can be installed via Smithery or manually, and it integrates with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for seamless use.

Schwab Model Context Protocol Server is a server that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for the Schwab API. It provides features such as getting account information, retrieving stock quotes and price history, accessing market information and movers, fetching option chains, and managing orders and transactions. The server also includes tools for modifying account state, which require special permissions.

Pokemon TCG Card Search MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows Claude to search and display Pokemon Trading Card Game cards. Key features include searching by name, type, subtype, legality, and more, viewing high-resolution card images, and filtering by various card attributes such as HP, retreat cost, and legalities. The MCP uses the Pokemon TCG API to fetch card data and supports a wide range of query syntax for precise searches.

PBIXRay MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Power BI (.pbix) files. It provides features such as loading and analyzing PBIX files, data model exploration, query language access, and data structure analysis. The server supports various tools for listing tables, retrieving metadata, viewing Power Query (M) code, accessing DAX measures, and more. It also includes options for filtering, pagination, and security settings.

Backlog MCP Server is an implementation that integrates the Backlog API, providing tools for project, issue, and wiki management. Features include getting, adding, updating, and deleting projects, issues, and wikis. It also supports configuration with environment variables and can be used with Claude Desktop via NPX or Docker.

Deep Research MCP Server is an agent-based tool that provides web search and advanced research capabilities. It leverages HuggingFace's smolagents and is implemented as an MCP server. Key features include web search and information gathering, PDF and document analysis, image analysis and description, YouTube transcript retrieval, and archive site search.

Untappd MCP Server using Azure Functions is a server implementation that uses Azure Functions and Server Sent Events (SSE) to provide web-based functionalities. It requires configuration for Claude Desktop and setup of local settings, including AzureWebJobsStorage, Untappd Client ID, and Client Secret.

MCP Accessibility Scanner is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides automated web accessibility scanning using Playwright and Axe-core. It enables LLMs to perform WCAG compliance checks, capture annotated screenshots, and generate detailed accessibility reports. Key features include full WCAG 2.1/2.2 compliance checking, automatic screenshot capture with violation highlighting, and detailed JSON reports with remediation guidance.

MCP OpenAPI Schema Explorer is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides token-efficient access to OpenAPI (v3.0) and Swagger (v2.0) specifications via MCP Resources. It allows MCP clients to explore the structure and details of large OpenAPI specifications without loading the entire file into an LLM's context window. Key features include support for both local and remote files, automatic conversion of Swagger v2.0 to OpenAPI v3.0, multiple output formats (JSON, YAML, minified JSON), and dynamic server name based on the loaded spec.

Kaggle-MCP is a tool that integrates Claude AI with the Kaggle API through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling competition, dataset, and kernel operations. Key features include secure authentication, browsing and searching for competitions, datasets, and kernels, and accessing pre-trained models. It supports use cases such as competition research, dataset discovery, learning resources, and model discovery.

MCP Browser Tabs is a Model Context Protocol server for retrieving and managing Chrome browser tabs information. It allows Claude Desktop or any MCP client to fetch and control currently open Chrome tabs. Key features include getting all open tabs with their titles and URLs, and closing specific tabs using window and tab indices. The tool requires Node.js, macOS, Google Chrome, and Claude Desktop, and it depends on AppleScript for interaction with Chrome.

Productboard MCP Server integrates the Productboard API into agentic workflows, providing tools for accessing and managing various aspects of Productboard data, including companies, components, features, notes, and products. It supports usage with Claude Desktop and is licensed under the MIT License.

Azure DevOps MCP (Model Context Protocol) is a reference server implementation that integrates with Azure DevOps, enabling AI assistants to interact with Azure DevOps resources and perform operations programmatically. Main features include Azure DevOps integration using the official Node.js SDK, support for Model Context Protocol (MCP), project management operations, work item management, repository operations, and code search capabilities.

VRChat MCP OSC provides a bridge between AI assistants and VRChat using the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling AI-driven avatar control and interactions in virtual reality environments. Key features include Avatar Control, Movement Control, Communication, Menu Access, and Avatar Information, with seamless VRChat integration.

Strapi MCP is an MCP server for Strapi CMS, providing access to content types and entries through the Model Context Protocol. Main features include: Access to Strapi content types as resources, Tools to create and update content types in Strapi, Tools to manage content entries (create, read, update, delete), Support for Strapi in development mode, and advanced features like filtering, pagination, and sorting.

Comfy MCP Pipeline is a pipeline wrapper for comfy-mcp-server designed for use with Open WebUI. It allows for the integration of ComfyUI workflows into the Open WebUI environment, enabling image generation based on user prompts. Key features include the ability to export and upload ComfyUI workflows, set up configuration for Comfy UI server URLs, and generate images through a chat interface.

Perplexity AI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to the Perplexity AI API. It allows users to interact with Perplexity AI through various tools, including chatting and searching. The server simplifies the integration of Perplexity AI into MCP-based systems and provides a convenient and standardized way to access its capabilities. Key features include setup instructions, usage through MCP system, and error handling for API failures.

content_name: multi llm cross check mcp server
description: Multi LLM Cross-Check MCP Server is a Model Control Protocol (MCP) server that allows cross-checking responses from multiple LLM providers simultaneously. It supports querying multiple LLM providers in parallel, including OpenAI (ChatGPT), Anthropic (Claude), Perplexity AI, and Google (Gemini). Features include asynchronous parallel processing for faster responses and easy integration with Claude Desktop.

Apollo.io MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for seamless Apollo.io API integration, enabling AI assistants to interact with Apollo.io data. Main features include data enrichment for people and organizations, search capabilities, job postings, real-time data access, secure authentication, and extensible design.

Onyx MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for seamless integration with Onyx AI knowledge bases. It allows users to search and retrieve relevant context from their documents, providing enhanced semantic search, context window retrieval, full document retrieval, and chat integration. The server supports configurable document set filtering and can be used with various MCP clients.

MCP Video Recognition Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for image, audio, and video recognition using Google's Gemini AI. Main features include Image Recognition, Audio Recognition, and Video Recognition, with support for custom prompts and specific Gemini models. The server can be integrated with various MCP clients and supports different transport types.

iMessage MCP Server is a tool that uses AppleScript to send iMessages and manage contacts. It allows users to view and search contacts, send iMessages, and get confirmation when messages are sent. Features include contact access, contact details viewing, and message sending through the local Messages app. The server is built with TypeScript and requires macOS, Node.js 18 or higher, Claude Desktop, and an active iMessage account.

nuclei-server MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that implements a simple notes system. It provides resources for text notes with URIs and metadata, tools for creating new notes, and prompts for generating summaries of notes. Features include listing and accessing notes via `note://` URIs, creating new text notes, and generating summaries of all stored notes.

mem0 MCP Server for Project Management is a tool that bridges MCP Host applications and the mem0 cloud service, enabling structured project memory management and semantic search for project-related information. Key features include project memory storage and retrieval, semantic search, structured project management data handling, and flexible logging. The server also supports TOML-based templates for better data extraction and management, and provides tools for adding, retrieving, updating, and deleting project memories.

AWS Service Reference MCP Server is a tool for interacting with the AWS Programmatic Service Reference, enabling users to list available AWS services, get API actions, condition keys, and resource types. It includes installation instructions, usage with Claude Desktop, and provides four main tools: list_aws_services, get_service_actions, get_action_condition_keys, and get_action_resource_types.

mcp-server-bluesky is an MCP server for Bluesky, providing various tools for interacting with the Bluesky social network. Features include getting and managing profiles, following and unfollowing users, searching and posting content, and managing likes and reposts.

Nash MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables seamless execution of commands, Python code, web content fetching, and reusable task management. Key features include command and Python code execution with error handling, secure credentials management, web content access, and task repository for saving and organizing reusable workflows and scripts.

Render MCP Server allows AI assistants to interact with the Render API, enabling deployment and management of services on Render.com. Main features include listing all services, getting service details, deploying services, creating new services, deleting services, managing environment variables, and managing custom domains. It supports integration with various AI assistants like Claude, Windsurf, and Cursor.

Revit MCP Integration is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration for Autodesk Revit 2024.3, enabling AI assistants to interact directly with Revit models through natural language. Key features include querying information from Revit models, creating and modifying elements, performing complex operations, and using a standardized interface. The integration supports Python 3.13, PyRevit, and MCP Python SDK, and provides a test interface for querying and modifying Revit model data.

n8n Assistant is a Multi-Channel Platform (MCP) server used to create an assistant integrated with n8n. The assistant can search for n8n documentation, example workflows, and community forums. Key features include web search, HTML content fetching using BeautifulSoup, and asynchronous processing for faster response times.

MCP Replicate FLUX is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that generates images using Replicate's FLUX model and stores them in Cloudflare R2. Main features include generating images with custom prompts, storing generated images in Cloudflare R2, returning accessible image URLs, and supporting custom filenames.

PayPal MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides integration with PayPal's APIs, enabling seamless interaction with payment processing, invoicing, and business management features. Key features include payment processing, business operations, user management, and comprehensive error handling.
A utility to retrieve the current UTC time using Node.js.

Poke-MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides Pokémon information through a standardized interface. It connects to the PokeAPI to fetch Pokémon data and exposes it through MCP tools. Features include getting information about specific Pokémon, discovering random Pokémon, finding Pokémon from specific regions or types, and a natural language query interface for Pokémon information.

OpenAPI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides configured REST APIs as context to LLMs, enabling them to interact with and perform REST API calls. It supports HTTP API calls (GET/PUT/POST/PATCH) and includes features such as environment variable configuration, debugging, and proxy settings.

ERPNext MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that provides integration with ERPNext/Frappe API, enabling AI assistants to interact with ERPNext data and functionality. Key features include authentication, document access, creation, and management, running reports, and getting doctype fields.

Revit MCP Server is a TypeScript-based Model Context Protocol server that provides seamless communication between Claude AI and Autodesk Revit. It enables real-time access to Revit model information, element querying and filtering, view and level management, and robust error handling with fallback mock data. Key features include WebSocket-based communication, real-time model data access, configurable connection settings, and integration with Claude Desktop.

ResearchMCP is a Model Completion Protocol (MCP) service for internet research using Perplexity AI. It provides features such as internet research through Perplexity AI, integration with MCP protocol for tool discovery and invocation, graceful error handling, configurable environment variables, and structured logging.

Mem0 MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates AI assistants with Mem0.ai's persistent memory system. It allows AI models to store and retrieve memories, search memories with semantic similarity, manage different memory types (episodic, semantic, procedural), utilize short-term memory for conversation context, apply selective memory patterns, and create knowledge graphs from memories. The server supports advanced features such as custom categories, memory instructions, graph relations, and a feedback mechanism.

Agentforce MCP Server provides tools to interact with the Salesforce Agentforce API, allowing authentication, session creation, and message exchange with Agentforce agents. Key features include: authentication, session management, message sending, and integration with Claude for Desktop. The server also includes a setup script for easy configuration and a test script for verifying the setup.

Scraper.is MCP is a powerful web scraping tool for AI assistants, allowing them to extract content from any website. Features include Web Scraping, Screenshots, Multiple Formats (markdown, HTML, JSON), Progress Updates, and MCP Integration. It requires a Scraper.is API key and can be integrated with AI assistants that support the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

This MCP server allows for browsing and interacting with an entire Notion workspace, converting Notion pages into markdown format. Key features include searching and retrieving relevant pages based on graph distance, summarizing notes, suggesting refactors, fixes, and enhancements. It also provides tools for managing and accessing Notion-based notes efficiently.

MCP DingDing Bot is an MCP server for the DingDing Bot API, enabling message notifications and interactions. Main features include sending various types of messages (text and markdown) to a DingDing group, with options to @ all members. The setup involves creating a DingDing group chat bot, setting up the webhook URL and secret, and using Docker or NPX for deployment.

Git MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides enhanced Git operations through a standardized interface. It integrates with the MCP ecosystem to provide Git functionality to AI assistants. Main features include Core Git Operations, Branch Management, Tag Operations, Remote Management, Stash Operations, Bulk Actions, GitHub Integration, Path Resolution, Error Handling, Repository Caching, and Performance Monitoring.

Heimdall is a lightweight service to manage local MCP Servers. It can be installed with a single `npx` command and allows specific MCP server tools to be authorized for your MCP clients. Key features include configuration management, authorized tool management, and support for multiple MCP clients. The setup script manages the configuration and controls JSON files, and it provides troubleshooting and logging capabilities.

Playwright MCP Server is a server that provides Playwright web page content retrieval functionality using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Main features include page navigation, full and visible content retrieval, interactive elements detection, mouse operation simulation, and various other tools for testing and interaction. It also supports error handling, configuration flexibility, and proper HTML parsing.

MCPet is a virtual pet experience for the AI age, allowing users to adopt, nurture, and play with a digital companion. Features include choosing from four pet types (Cat, Dog, Dragon, Alien), managing five key stats (Hunger, Happiness, Health, Energy, Cleanliness), and interacting with the pet through various activities like feeding, playing, cleaning, and putting to bed. The server also provides dynamic ASCII art animations for each pet type and activity.

Simple Memory Extension MCP Server is designed to extend the context window or memory of agents. It's useful for storing and recalling progress, key moments, or any information worth remembering during coding sessions. The server provides tools for context item management, namespace management, and semantic search, allowing users to store, retrieve, and manage their data effectively. The semantic search feature uses the E5 embedding model from Hugging Face to find items based on their meaning, enhancing the ability to recall relevant information.

Skrape MCP Server is a tool that converts any webpage into clean, LLM-ready Markdown. It provides features such as clean and structured output, noise reduction, consistent formatting, JavaScript support, and LLM-optimized content. The server can be installed via Smithery or manually, and it integrates seamlessly with LLMs like Claude and GPT.

slidespeak-mcp is an MCP Server that allows you to create PowerPoint presentations. It is powered by SlideSpeak and can be used to automate the creation of reports, presentations, and other slide decks. The tool requires Docker for usage and can be integrated with Claude Desktop. Features include creating presentations, automating slide deck generation, and support for local development and Docker containerization.

Together AI Image Server is an MCP server for generating images using Together AI's image generation models. It supports the latest FLUX.1.1-pro model, automatically resizes images if dimensions are below 256 pixels, maintains aspect ratio during resizing, and provides high-quality JPEG output. The server also creates output directories recursively and returns detailed metadata including image dimensions.

MCP Local File Reader is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI models to securely access the local file system. Key features include listing and accessing files, supporting various file types, automatic MIME type detection, and providing tools like read_file, list_files, and get_file_info. It can be used as a command-line tool or integrated with MCP-compatible AI applications like Windsurf, Cursor, and VSCode with Cline.

Claude Outlook MCP Tool is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) tool that allows Claude to interact with Microsoft Outlook for macOS. It provides features for managing emails, calendar events, and contacts. Key features include reading and searching emails, sending HTML-formatted emails with attachments, viewing and creating calendar events, and listing and searching contacts.

mcp-server-diff-python is an MCP server designed for obtaining text differences between two strings. It uses Python's standard library `difflib` to generate and provide differences in Unified diff format, which is useful for text comparison and version control. The main feature is the `get-unified-diff` tool, which takes two required arguments, `string_a` and `string_b`, and returns a string containing the differences in Unified diff format.

supabase-nextjs-server MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that implements a simple notes system for NextJS. It provides features such as resources representing text notes with URIs and metadata, tools for creating new notes, and prompts for generating summaries of notes. The server requires environment variables for Supabase configuration and supports operations like listing and accessing notes, creating new notes, and summarizing all stored notes.

Smartsheet MCP Server provides seamless integration with Smartsheet, enabling automated operations on Smartsheet documents through a standardized interface. It offers key features such as intelligent integration, data integrity, formula management, flexible configuration, and error resilience. The server is particularly useful for healthcare analytics, including clinical research, hospital operations, and specialized analysis capabilities for clinical and research data. It supports batch processing, custom scoring, and real-time monitoring, making it a powerful tool for both healthcare and operational workflows.

HTTP-4-MCP Middleware Server is a powerful tool that transforms regular HTTP interfaces into MCP (Model Control Protocol) interfaces. Key features include one-click conversion of HTTP APIs to MCP, JSON and visual configuration, SSE support, hot reload, complete monitoring, and secure & reliable operation with built-in error handling and parameter validation.

MCP Nutanix is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Nutanix Prism Central APIs through Large Language Models (LLMs). It allows LLMs to connect to a Prism Central instance, list various resources (VMs, Clusters, Hosts, etc.), and retrieve specific resource details via URI-based access. The implementation uses the Prism Go Client and MCP Go library. Main features include resource listing, resource access, and code generation utilities.

Trusted GMail MCP Server is a secure implementation of an MCP server for Gmail, running inside an AWS Nitro enclave. It provides enhanced security features and integrates with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) using SSE transport. Key features include app-specific password usage, secure deployment in a hardware-attested environment, and detailed instructions for verification and self-hosting.

Vectara MCP Server provides access to fast, reliable RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) with reduced hallucination, powered by Vectara's Trusted RAG platform. Key features include the ability to run RAG queries and semantic search queries using Vectara, with options to customize the context and search parameters. The server is compatible with Claude Desktop and other MCP clients, and can be easily integrated and configured for use.

Apple Books MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Apple Books, which allows users to interact with their book collections. Main features include summarizing recent highlights, organizing books by genre, recommending similar books based on reading history, comparing notes from different books, and various search functionalities such as searching for annotations, highlights, and notes.

Plex MCP Server is a powerful Model-Controller-Protocol server for interacting with Plex Media Server, providing a standardized JSON-based interface for automation, scripting, and integration with other tools. It offers features such as standardized JSON responses, multiple transport methods (stdio and SSE), rich command set for managing libraries, collections, playlists, media, users, and more, error handling, and easy integration with automation platforms and custom scripts.

JIRA MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates JIRA directly into any editor or application supporting MCP. Key features include viewing assigned issues, getting detailed information on specific issues, and converting JIRA issues into local tasks. The project uses TypeScript, Bun, and Biome for code formatting and linting, and it provides tools for JIRA integration such as `jira_get_assigned_issues`, `jira_get_issue`, and `jira_create_task`.

pubmed_search MCP server is designed to search PubMed via the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It includes a simple note storage system, a prompt for summarizing stored notes, and a tool for adding new notes. The server can be configured and run on both development and production environments, with detailed instructions for building, publishing, and debugging.

WebScraping.AI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for web data extraction. It offers features such as question answering about web page content, structured data extraction, HTML content retrieval with JavaScript rendering, plain text extraction, CSS selector-based content extraction, multiple proxy types, JavaScript rendering using headless Chrome/Chromium, concurrent request management with rate limiting, custom JavaScript execution on target pages, and device emulation. The server also provides robust error handling and can be integrated with LLMs.

Nexus MCP Bridge for VSCode is a lightweight bridge extension that allows Claude Desktop to connect to your VSCode workspace via Model Context Protocol (MCP). Key features include minimal memory footprint, automatic startup, status bar integration, file system access, directory management, and security controls. It helps reduce memory usage, stay within VSCode, and protect your system by controlling accessible directories.

MCP Grpcurl is an MCP server designed to interact with gRPC services using the `grpcurl` tool. It allows users to invoke gRPC methods, list available gRPC services, and describe service details. Key features include invoking gRPC methods with custom headers and JSON payloads, listing all available gRPC services, and describing gRPC services or message types.

Reader MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Readwise Reader, enabling MCP-compatible clients like Claude and VS Code to interact with your Reader library. It provides capabilities for document listing, retrieval, and updates, serving as a bridge between MCP clients and your personal knowledge repository in Readwise Reader.

MCP-MongoDB-MySQL-Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides MySQL and MongoDB database operations. It enables AI models to interact with both MySQL and MongoDB databases through a standardized interface. Key features include multiple connection methods, support for both MySQL and MongoDB, secure connection handling, prepared statement support for MySQL, schema management tools, comprehensive error handling, TypeScript support, and automatic workspace detection.

MCP Blockchain Server & DApp is a secure system enabling AI assistants to interact with blockchain smart contracts while ensuring users maintain complete control over their private keys and transaction signing. Key features include Blockchain Data Access, Transaction Preparation, Multi-Chain Support, Smart Contract Interaction, Wallet Integration, Transaction Review, and Security-First Design. The system includes an MCP Server, a Web DApp, a PostgreSQL database, and Redis for caching.

Ethereum Tools for Claude MCP is a comprehensive toolkit for Ethereum blockchain analysis directly within Claude AI using Model Context Protocol (MCP). Main features include Smart Contract Audit, Wallet Analysis, Profitability Tracking, Blockchain Data, Token Analysis, and Twitter Search.

Ethereum RPC MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Ethereum blockchain. It provides tools to query Ethereum blockchain data through standard JSON-RPC methods, including eth_getCode, eth_gasPrice, and eth_getBalance. The server can be integrated with various MCP-compatible clients such as Claude Desktop, Cursor, and Cline, enabling AI assistants and applications to interact with the Ethereum blockchain through a standardized protocol.

QRCode_MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for generating simple QR codes with custom styles. It supports easy generation of QR codes with various parameters such as text, size, colors, and error correction levels. The tool can be installed via Smithery or manually, and it provides a straightforward configuration and usage process.

Bazel MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with Bazel projects. It includes features such as building targets, finding dependencies, reverse dependencies, source files, and running tests. The server is designed to be used with applications like the Claude Desktop app.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It also supports crypto currency data. The server can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude for financial data retrieval and analysis.

Google Forms MCP Server with CamelAIOrg Agents Integration is a project that allows the creation and management of Google Forms through natural language requests. It includes an MCP Server for handling Google Forms API operations and CamelAIOrg Agents for processing natural language instructions. Key features include creating forms, adding different types of questions, retrieving form responses, and visualizing the request flow. The system is containerized with Docker for easy deployment and provides a dark-themed UI with animations.

The content describes the setup and usage of a tool (Claude Desktop) that integrates with Adfin MCP servers, enabling financial operations such as credit control status checks, creating invoices, and uploading multiple invoices. The primary focus is on financial management and automation.

MCP Iceberg Catalog is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for interacting with Apache Iceberg. It provides a SQL interface for querying and managing Iceberg tables through Claude desktop. Key features include MCP Protocol Handler, Query Processor, and Iceberg Integration. The server supports various SQL operations like LIST TABLES, DESCRIBE TABLE, SELECT, and INSERT. It also integrates with PyIceberg for table and data operations, and uses PyArrow for efficient data handling. Future enhancements include support for more complex query operations, data types, performance improvements, security features, monitoring, and error handling.

Perplexity MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the Perplexity API, enabling AI assistants like Claude and Cursor to access Perplexity's powerful search and reasoning capabilities. Key features include real-time web search, complex reasoning tasks, seamless integration with AI assistants, and customizable model configurations.

Telegram MCP Server is a tool that allows Claude to access and interact with your Telegram account. It provides functions such as getting a list of chats, sending messages, reading messages, marking messages as read, and getting conversation context. The setup involves obtaining Telegram API credentials, setting up a Python environment, and configuring the Claude Desktop application.

UnrealMCP Plugin is an unofficial Unreal Engine plugin designed to control Unreal Engine with AI tools. It implements a Machine Control Protocol (MCP) within Unreal Engine, allowing external AI systems to interact with and manipulate the Unreal environment programmatically. Key features include TCP server implementation for remote control, JSON-based command protocol, editor UI integration, and comprehensive scene manipulation capabilities. The plugin also includes Python companion scripts for client-side interaction.

Everything Search MCP Server is an MCP server that provides integration with Everything Search Engine, allowing powerful file search capabilities. Features include full text search across files and directories, advanced search options (case sensitive, whole word matching, regular expressions, path search), sorting options (by name, path, size, date modified), and result formatting (human-readable file sizes, formatted dates, full file paths).

Stock Market MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server for fetching stock market data. It uses the Alpha Vantage API to provide real-time stock market information and company financial data. Key features include generating US market reports, financial statements, getting ticker prices, and providing company overviews. The server supports various tools such as get_ticker_price, get_market_report, get_financial_statement, and get_company_overview. It also includes development environment setup, installation instructions, and debugging tips.

AI Meta MCP Server is a dynamic MCP server that allows AI models to create and execute their own custom tools through a meta-function architecture. Key features include Dynamic Tool Creation, Multiple Runtime Environments (JavaScript, Python, Shell), Sandboxed Security, Persistence, Flexible Tool Registry, and Human Approval Flow. It also includes security considerations such as sandboxed environments, human-in-the-loop approval, and audit logging.

MCP Server for FTP Access is a tool that provides functionalities for interacting with FTP servers, including listing directory contents, downloading and uploading files, creating directories, and deleting files/directories. It integrates with Claude.app and supports natural language commands for FTP operations.

Memory Box MCP Server is a tool for interacting with a Memory Box instance, allowing you to save, search, and format memories with semantic understanding. Key features include saving and searching memories, retrieving memories from specific buckets, finding semantically related memories, checking memory processing status, and viewing usage statistics. It integrates with Cline and Claude Desktop and supports semantic search and vector embeddings for enhanced memory retrieval.

This repository illustrates the difference between LLM function calling and the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It includes two examples: a CLI app using OpenAI's function calling to control Home Assistant lights, and a Node.js MCP server exposing a `control_lights` function. The repository also provides setup instructions for the MCP server, including environment configuration and integration with LLM apps.

Perplexity Search MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a `search` tool for AI assistants to perform web searches using Perplexity's chat completions API with the sonar or sonar-pro models. Features include a search query parameter and an optional recency filter, and it returns search results content and citations.

Atlassian Confluence MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that bridges AI assistants with Atlassian Confluence. It allows secure and real-time access to Confluence spaces and pages, providing features such as complete knowledge base access, rich content formatting, secure local authentication, and intuitive Markdown responses. The server supports various tools for listing, getting, and searching Confluence spaces and pages, and can be configured using either a config file or environment variables.

Axiom MCP Server is a Zed extension for the Axiom MCP server, which requires configuration through a `config.txt` file and integration with Zed `settings.json` to specify the API token and other settings.

Lead Generation Server is a production-grade system for lead generation and data enrichment. It uses MCP Python SDK, Crawl4AI, and AsyncIO for high-concurrency operations. Key features include lead generation, data enrichment, LinkedIn scraping, caching, and monitoring. The system supports multi-source data aggregation, smart caching strategies, and enterprise-grade error handling.

Mathematica Documentation MCP server is a tool that provides access to Mathematica documentation and functions. It supports commands like get_docs for retrieving documentation for specific functions, including those from add-ons and packages, and list_package_symbols for listing all symbols/functions in a package. The server requires the installation of the mcp-python-sdk and either Mathematica or wolframscript. It is useful for developers and researchers working with Mathematica and its extensive library of mathematical and scientific functions.

Radarr and Sonarr MCP Server is a Python-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides AI assistants with access to your movie and TV show collection via Radarr and Sonarr APIs. Key features include native MCP implementation, Radarr and Sonarr integration, rich filtering options, compatibility with Claude Desktop, easy setup, and comprehensive testing.

MCP ChatGPT Server allows you to access OpenAI's ChatGPT API directly from Claude Desktop. Main features include calling the ChatGPT API with customizable parameters, enabling conversations between Claude and ChatGPT, configuring model versions and other parameters, using web search for up-to-date information, and automatic conversation state management via OpenAI's Responses API.

mcp-say is a TTS (text-to-speech) MCP Server that adds text-to-speech functionality to tools like Claude Desktop and Cursor IDE. It registers two tools: `say` which uses the macOS `say` binary, and `elevenlabs` which uses the ElevenLabs text-to-speech API. The tool can be installed and configured to work with the MCP protocol, providing a way to convert text into spoken words.

mcp-flux-schnell MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that implements a text-to-image generation tool using the Flux Schnell model. It integrates with Cloudflare's Flux Schnell worker API to provide image generation capabilities through MCP. Main features include generating images from text descriptions, configurable environment variables, and easy installation via Smithery or manual configuration.

JSON Canvas MCP Server is a tool for working with JSON Canvas files, enabling the creation, modification, and validation of infinite canvas data structures. It supports various node types (text, file, link, group) and edge connections with styling and labels. The server provides resources like schema, examples, and templates, and offers tools for node and edge operations, as well as canvas validation and export to different formats.
