UE-Editor-MCPServer is a project that encapsulates the UE Editor as an MCP Server for use by agents to achieve automated iteration. It is currently developed based on version 5.5 and is stable on Windows. The setup involves cloning the project into the plugin directory of the project or engine and compiling it. The MCPServer will start automatically when the engine starts. Users can add functionality by modifying the MCPServer.py file.

Clay MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Clay, which provides features such as Contact Search, Interaction Search, Contact Statistics, Detailed Contact Info, Add New Contact, Add Contact Note, Retrieve Groups, Create New Group, Update Group, Retrieve Notes, and Retrieve Events. It is useful for searching and managing contact information and interactions.

Crypto_MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for encrypting, decrypting, and hashing. It supports AES and DES encryption/decryption with various modes and padding options, MD5, SHA1, SHA256, SHA384, SHA512, and SHA224 hashing, as well as Base64 and Hex encoding/decoding. The tool is useful for developers working on cryptographic functions and data security.

Higress AI-Search MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides an AI search tool to enhance AI model responses with real-time search results from various search engines. Main features include Internet Search (Google, Bing, Quark), Academic Search (Arxiv), and Internal Knowledge Search. The server can be configured using environment variables and supports both local and remote deployment options.

MPC Tally API Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Tally API, allowing AI agents to fetch information about DAOs, including their governance data, proposals, and metadata. Key features include listing DAOs, fetching comprehensive DAO metadata, pagination support, and built with TypeScript and GraphQL.

GitHub MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with the GitHub API. It allows LLM agents to manage GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, branches, files, and releases through a standardized interface. Key features include GitHub API integration, comprehensive GitHub feature management, atomic feature architecture, input validation, error handling, and rate limiting.

nostrdb-mcp is a Model Context Protocol server for nostrdb, enabling LLMs to use the `ndb` nostrdb command line tool to make local nostr queries. It uses your Notedeck nostrdb directory to search notes and integrates with goose for configuration and temporary session creation.
飞书 MCP 服务器为 Cursor、Windsurf、Cline 等 AI 驱动的编码工具提供访问飞书文档的能力。主要功能包括创建和管理飞书文档、获取和编辑文档内容、支持多种文本和代码块操作等。该服务器通过 Model Context Protocol 实现，简化和转换飞书 API 的响应，确保向模型提供最相关的文档信息。

DeBanK MCP Server is a stateless Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the DeBanK API to retrieve blockchain and DeFi data. Main features include Stateless Architecture, Comprehensive DeFi Data Tools, Pagination Support, and Robust Error Handling. It provides tools for querying blockchain data, including chains, protocols, tokens, pools, and user assets.

MCP Server for Design System is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides information about component properties and design tokens. It includes features like `getComponentProps` and `getTokens` for retrieving component properties and design token information. The design tokens are stored as JSON files and processed using Style Dictionary to generate CSS variables, JavaScript modules, and TypeScript declarations.

MCP Terminal Server is a secure command-line interface server for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that enables AI models to interact with your terminal while maintaining security and control. Key features include secure command execution with configurable permissions, file system operations within allowed paths, environment variable management, cross-platform support, and remote system connections via command execution. The project also includes detailed instructions for usage, development, and publishing.

OpenStack MCP Server is a lightweight and extensible service that enables AI assistants to securely execute OpenStack CLI commands via the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It integrates with Claude Desktop, allowing interaction with OpenStack resources. Key features include support for Java 21, Maven 3.8+, Spring Boot 3.4.4, and Spring AI 1.0.0-M6. The project requires OpenStack CLI and configuration of OpenStack credentials in the `application.yml` file. Integration with Claude Desktop is achieved through the `claude-desktop.json` file.

Netlify MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools and resources for interacting with Netlify through their CLI. It enables deploying sites, managing environment variables, builds, and more, compatible with Netlify CLI v19.1.5. Key features include site and deployment management, environment variable management, and serverless function logs.

systemprompt-mcp-gmail is a specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables users to search, read, delete, and send emails from their Gmail account using an AI Agent. Key features include MCP Protocol Integration, Voice-Powered Interface, Real-Time Processing, Type-Safe Implementation, Advanced Sampling Capabilities, Real-time Notification System, API Key Management, User Status and Billing Information Tracking, Subscription Management, and Usage Monitoring and Analytics.

Two Truths and a Twist is an interactive trivia game that leverages the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to provide a fun, interactive experience. The game involves AI generating three statements (two truths and one twist) about a topic, and players must identify the twist. Main features include game mechanics for creating rounds, submitting guesses, revealing twists, and retrieving game statistics. The game can be installed via Smithery or PyPI and requires Python 3.13 or higher and an MCP-compatible LLM.

Blowback is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with front-end development servers, such as Vite, to support various browser automation and log management features. Key features include integration of FE development server with MCP server, browser console log capture and transmission via MCP, checkpoint-based log management, and a variety of tools for HMR events, browser operations, and log retrieval.

MCP Intercom Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to Intercom conversations and chats. It allows LLMs to query and analyze Intercom conversations with various filtering options, including date range, customer ID, and conversation state. The server ensures secure access using the Intercom API key and provides rich conversation data such as basic details, contact information, statistics, and state information.

Web Search MCP Server is an MCP server that provides Google search capabilities and web content viewing with advanced bot detection avoidance. Key features include Google Custom Search with advanced filtering, web content viewing with markdown conversion, rate limiting and caching, browser instance pooling, and bot detection avoidance using rebrowser-puppeteer.

MCP Server is a project built on FastAPI and MCP (Model Context Protocol) that enables standardized context interaction between AI models and development environments. It simplifies model deployment, provides efficient API endpoints, and ensures consistency in model input and output. Key features include JSON-RPC 2.0, SSE connection support, modular design, asynchronous processing, and a complete client implementation.

WhatsApp Web MCP is a bridge between WhatsApp Web and AI models using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It enables AI models to interact with WhatsApp through a standardized interface, providing features like WhatsApp API server, MCP server in standalone or API client modes, REST API endpoints for contacts, messages, and group management, and integration with Claude Desktop. The project includes flexible deployment options, authentication methods, and a robust logging system.

MCP Web Search Tool is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server providing real-time web search capabilities through pluggable search providers. It integrates with the Brave Search API and offers features such as Real-Time Information Access, Pluggable Search Providers, Structured Output Format, and Smart Query Handling. The tool is designed to enhance AI assistants by allowing them to retrieve up-to-date information from the web.

MCP Server (Jina Reader API) is a Model Context Protocol server that provides web content searching and fetching capabilities. It includes tools for reading and fetching content from a URL, as well as searching the web and getting search engine results pages (SERP).

MCP Prompt Server is a server based on Model Context Protocol (MCP) that provides preset prompt templates for various tasks such as code review, API documentation generation, and code refactoring. It supports dynamic parameter replacement, allows developers to add and modify prompt templates, and provides tool APIs for reloading and querying available prompts. The server is optimized for integration with editors like Cursor and Windsurf.

Git MCP Server (Go) is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Git repository interaction and automation, written in Go. It provides tools to read, search, and manipulate Git repositories via Large Language Models. Main features include git operations like status, diff, commit, add, reset, log, create branch, checkout, show, init, push, and list repositories. The server supports multi-repository management, multiple modes (shell and go-git), and write access for remote operations.

Coding Standards MCP Server provides tools for accessing coding style guidelines and best practices for various technologies including Java, Python, and React. It offers language-specific style guides and best practices, and can be installed and run in a development environment with the MCP package. The server also includes an API reference for accessing these guidelines and practices.

Kokoro TTS MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides text-to-speech capabilities using the Kokoro TTS engine. It allows for customizable voices, adjustable speech speed, and supports saving audio to files or direct playback. The server is cross-platform and can be easily integrated into applications.

Unofficial dubco-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for creating, updating, and deleting short links via the Dub.co API. Main features include creating custom short links, updating existing links, deleting links, and seamless integration with AI assistants through MCP. It also provides detailed installation, configuration, and usage instructions.

GitHub PR MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server built with TypeScript for analyzing GitHub Pull Requests. It includes features such as installation via Smithery, manual installation steps, and a project structure with TypeScript source code, compiled JavaScript files, and configuration files. The server is useful for developers working with GitHub Pull Requests.

PubMedSearch MCP Server is a Model Content Protocol server that provides tools to search and retrieve academic papers from the PubMed database. Key features include searching PubMed by keywords in title/abstract or author names, and retrieving detailed information such as title, authors, journal, abstract, DOI, and more.

go-mcp-postgres is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Postgres databases. It provides tools for CRUD operations, read-only mode, and query plan checking. Key features include support for multiple languages, schema and data management tools, and optional flags for read-only mode and query plan checks.

Ant Design Components Model Context Protocol Server is a tool that exposes Ant Design component documentation to Large Language Models (LLMs) like Claude. It allows LLMs to explore and understand Ant Design components through a set of specialized tools, including listing all available components, getting detailed component documentation, viewing component props and API definitions, browsing code examples, and searching for components by name or functionality.

Headless IDA MCP Server is a project that uses IDA Pro's headless mode to analyze binary files and provides a suite of tools via MCP to manage and manipulate functions, variables, and more. It includes features such as running the server as a CLI app, integrating with IDA Pro, and configuring environment variables for setup.

Claude MCP Trello is an MCP server that provides tools for interacting with Trello boards, enabling seamless integration with Trello's API. Key features include full Trello board integration, built-in rate limiting, type-safe implementation, input validation, and error handling. Available tools allow for retrieving, adding, updating, and archiving cards and lists, as well as searching across all boards.

SCMCP is an MCP server designed for scRNA-Seq analysis using natural language. It offers a range of functionalities including IO operations, preprocessing, tool modules for clustering and differential expression, and plotting capabilities. It is suitable for researchers and developers working with scRNA-Seq data and can be integrated into various AI clients, plugins, and agent frameworks.

Advanced Hasura GraphQL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides an advanced interface for AI agents to interact with a Hasura GraphQL endpoint. It enables agents to discover the API structure, execute read-only queries and mutations, preview data, perform aggregations, and check service health. Key features include Hasura GraphQL Schema, run_graphql_query, run_graphql_mutation, list_tables, describe_table, list_root_fields, describe_graphql_type, preview_table_data, aggregate_data, and health_check.

Metabase MCP Server is a TypeScript-based Model Context Protocol server that integrates AI assistants with the Metabase analytics platform. It provides features such as resource access via `metabase://` URIs, two authentication methods (session-based and API key), structured data access, comprehensive logging, and robust error handling. The server exposes tools for listing dashboards, cards, databases, executing saved questions, extracting dashboard cards, and running custom SQL queries.

Instructa AI - MCP Prompts API is a repository that contains a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for managing and serving AI prompts. The project is built using TypeScript and follows a monorepo structure using pnpm workspaces. Key features include MCP implementation, TypeScript-based architecture, and environment-based configuration.
LiteLLM MCP Server is an MCP server that integrates LiteLLM to handle text completions using OpenAI models. It provides a way to easily install and use the package for text completion tasks.

AI MCP Server is an MCP server implementation supporting OpenAI and Mistral using the Vercel AI SDK. It provides support for various models from both providers, including features like structured output, system prompts, and safe prompts. The server requires Node.js 18 or higher, and API keys for OpenAI and Mistral.

Unsplash MCP Server is a server for integrating with the Unsplash API, allowing for the retrieval and use of images. It is rewritten using the mark3labs/mcp-go library and can be integrated into the Cursor editor with the necessary configuration in the mcp.json file.

MCP SQLite Server is a Node.js implementation of the Model Context Protocol SQLite server, providing an npx-based alternative for environments where Python's UVX runner is not available. It supports integration with Claude Desktop and includes features such as installation via Smithery, manual configuration, and testing with MCP Inspector and Claude Desktop.

ENS MCP Server is a tool for interacting with the Ethereum Name Service (ENS) system, providing functionalities such as resolving names to Ethereum addresses, checking name availability, retrieving text records, and more. It includes tools like resolve-name, reverse-lookup, get-text-record, check-availability, get-all-records, get-subdomains, get-name-history, and get-registration-price. The server also supports robust error handling and can be set up with Node.js and npm.

Python Apple MCP (Model Context Protocol) is a Python implementation that allows interaction with macOS native applications such as Contacts, Notes, Mail, Messages, Reminders, Calendar, and Maps using FastMCP. Key features include asynchronous operations, comprehensive error handling, type-safe interfaces, extensive test coverage, and modular design. The supported applications provide functionalities like contact management, note creation, email sending, message scheduling, reminder setting, event creation, and map directions.

MySQL MCP Server is a Spring Boot server implementing Model Context Protocol (MCP) for MySQL database operations. Main features include executing SELECT queries, listing all tables in the database, and getting table schema information. The server supports API tools for query execution, listing table names, and retrieving table schema details.

Anthropic MCP Code Analyzer is a tool that helps analyze open source projects and integrate them with your existing codebase. It uses Claude to analyze code patterns, architecture, and documentation to provide intelligent merge strategies. Key features include repository analysis and code pattern detection, documentation extraction and processing, intelligent merge strategy generation, AST-based code analysis, dependency tracking, and architecture pattern detection.

MSSQL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for connecting to Microsoft SQL Server databases. It provides tools for executing SQL queries and managing database connections, with features including query execution, connection management, and security safeguards against harmful SQL operations.

KubeSphere MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides integration with KubeSphere APIs, enabling the retrieval of resources from KubeSphere. It includes four tool modules: Workspace Management, Cluster Management, User and Roles, and Extensions Center. The server requires a KubeSphere cluster and provides detailed installation and configuration instructions for use with AI agents like Claude Desktop and Cursor.

Google Patents MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows searching Google Patents information via the SerpApi Google Patents API. Key features include searching patents, using SerpApi as the backend, and providing an MCP tool `search_patents` with detailed input schema for various search parameters such as query, pagination, sorting, date filters, inventor, assignee, country, language, status, and type.

The Divide and Conquer MCP Server is designed to break down complex tasks into manageable pieces using a structured JSON format. Key features include task tracking, context preservation, progress monitoring, task ordering, and metadata tracking. It provides tools for initializing, updating, and managing tasks, making it useful for complex software development, project planning, and research.

sentry-issue-mcp is a tool for interacting with Sentry issues, allowing users to fetch and analyze individual or multiple events. Key features include getting detailed information about a single event or a list of events, with options for different levels of detail (tiny or huge). It supports integration with LLMs for analysis and provides a straightforward configuration for setting up the MCP server.

PostgreSQL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with a PostgreSQL database. It enables AI assistants to execute SQL queries, create tables, and list database tables through the MCP protocol. Main features include read_query, write_query, create_table, list_tables, and explain_query.

MySQL MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with MySQL databases, providing secure database access capabilities for LLMs. Main features include read and write operations, security measures, and integration with Dive Desktop. It supports executing SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE queries, listing tables, showing table structures, and viewing schema information.
This tool integrates with Excel using XLwings to enable automated data manipulation, analysis, and reporting for business workflows.
DenoKV MCP Server is a server that integrates with Deno and provides key-value storage capabilities, useful for applications needing a simple and efficient way to store and retrieve data.

mcp-host-use is a Node.js-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) host application designed to connect and manage multiple MCP servers. It provides a unified HTTP API interface for clients to interact with multiple MCP servers, allowing them to access and invoke tools or resources. Key features include support for connecting multiple MCP servers via a JSON file, support for STDIO and SSE transmission methods, and a unified HTTP API for managing server connections and resources.
This tool integrates with Rayon Design CAD interface using browser automation to enable shape creation and drawing method searches, supporting AI-assisted design workflows.

MCP DigitalOcean Server is a Model Context Protocol implementation that integrates with DigitalOcean for server management. Main features include MCP Protocol implementation, DigitalOcean integration for server management, and a FastAPI-based HTTP server.

Project Content Server is an MCP server that provides access to project files and their contents. It allows users to get all files and their contents from a project directory. The server can be configured using environment variables and includes error handling for common issues such as invalid project paths, permission denied errors, and file system errors.

@enemyrr/mcp-mysql-server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides MySQL database operations, enabling AI models to interact with MySQL databases through a standardized interface. Key features include multiple connection methods, secure connection handling, prepared statement support, schema management tools, comprehensive error handling, and TypeScript support.

Azure MCP Server is an implementation of a Model Context Protocol server for interacting with Azure services, including Azure Blob Storage and Azure Cosmos DB (NoSQL API). It supports various operations such as creating, listing, and deleting containers and items, uploading and reading blobs, and managing key-values in Azure App Configuration. All operations are automatically logged and accessible via the `audit://azure-operations` resource endpoint.

SQLite MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides SQLite database operations through a standardized interface. Main features include in-memory SQLite database, SQL operations (SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE), table management (CREATE, LIST, DESCRIBE), business insights memo tracking, and Docker support for easy deployment. It also includes tools for executing queries, creating tables, listing tables, and describing tables.

mcp-memory-libsql is a high-performance, persistent memory system for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) powered by libSQL. It provides vector search capabilities and efficient knowledge storage. Key features include high-performance vector search, persistent storage of entities and relations, semantic search, knowledge graph management, compatibility with local and remote libSQL databases, and secure token-based authentication for remote databases.

Metricool MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Metricool API. It allows AI agents to access and analyze social media metrics, campaign data, and schedule posts to your Metricool account. The server provides tools to get and manage various types of social media content and campaigns, including Instagram Reels, TikTok videos, Facebook posts, and more, as well as analytics and best times to post.

Google Tasks MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for managing Google Tasks. It allows users to create, list, delete, update, and toggle the completion status of tasks. The server provides structured tool definitions and easy integration with Large Language Models (LLMs) or other applications via MCP. Features include Default Task List, Task Details, JSON Mime Type, and various task management tools like create_task, list_tasks, delete_task, update_task, and complete_task.

DuckDB MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that enables AI assistants to interact with DuckDB, a high-performance analytical database. Key features include SQL query execution, support for multiple data sources (local files, S3, SQLite), auto-connection management, smart credential handling, and built-in documentation resources. It allows for powerful data analysis and insights generation.

MCP Minecraft Remote is a tool that allows users to connect to and control a Minecraft player via an AI assistant. It provides features such as navigation, mining, building, interacting with the world, chatting with other players, checking inventory, and more. The tool supports advanced movement controls, entity interactions, container usage, item crafting, and villager trading.

mcp-turso is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to Turso-hosted LibSQL databases. It offers functionalities such as retrieving a list of tables, getting the database schema, describing table schemas, and performing SELECT queries. The server can be configured with Claude Desktop or Cursor, and includes a custom logger for debugging.

The LibSQL Model Context Protocol Server is a server application designed to interface with LibSQL databases, providing schema information and enabling table queries. It supports both authenticated and unauthenticated access to LibSQL databases, ensuring flexibility and security. The project is ideal for developers looking to integrate LibSQL database functionalities into their applications seamlessly.

EverArt Forge MCP for Cline is an advanced Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with EverArt's AI models to generate both vector and raster images. It provides powerful image generation capabilities, including vector graphics and raster images in various formats, with flexible storage options and format conversion. Key features include Vector Graphics Generation, Raster Image Generation, and Flexible Storage.

mcp-server-restart is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to restart the Claude Desktop application for Mac. It provides a status resource to check the current status of Claude Desktop and a tool to safely restart the application, including terminating the existing process and launching a new instance. The package can be installed by editing the Claude Desktop config file and adding the necessary configurations.

Gitee MCP Server is a tool that allows AI to operate Gitee repositories, issues, and pull requests. It supports various operations such as creating, forking, and managing repositories, branches, files, issues, and pull requests. The server can be installed and run via Smithery, NPX, or Docker, and it includes configuration options and debugging tools.

open-docs-mcp is an open-source MCP implementation providing document management functionality. Key features include crawling and indexing documentation from various sources, support for multiple document formats, full-text search capabilities, and tools for managing and searching documents. It also aims to replicate Cursor's @Docs functionality with features like automatic re-indexing and integration with the MCP protocol for AI context.

OpenRouter Agents MCP Server is a sophisticated research agent that provides AI-powered research capabilities. It features multi-agent orchestration, vector embedding database, round-robin load balancing, and adaptive fallback systems. Key features include multi-stage planning, parallel execution, context-aware refinement, semantic knowledge base, and adaptive synthesis. The server integrates with Cline in VS Code and the Claude Desktop App, offering enterprise-grade research capabilities.

Pacman MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides package index querying capabilities, allowing LLMs to search and retrieve information from package repositories like PyPI, npm, crates.io, Docker Hub, and Terraform Registry. Main features include searching for packages, getting detailed package information, and searching for Docker images and Terraform modules.

Weibo MCP Server is a server based on the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for scraping Weibo user information, posts, and search functionality. It helps in fetching detailed user information, post content, and performing user searches. The main features include searching for Weibo users, getting user profiles, and retrieving user feeds.

mcp-server-llmling is a server for the Machine Chat Protocol (MCP) that provides a YAML-based configuration system for LLM applications. Key features include resource management, tool system, prompt management, and multiple transport options. It supports static declaration, MCP protocol, and various types of resources and tools.

MindBridge MCP Server is an AI command hub that unifies, organizes, and supercharges LLM workflows. It supports multi-LLM, smart routing, second opinion tool, OpenAI-compatible API layer, auto-detection of providers, and flexible configuration. It is perfect for agent builders, multi-model workflows, AI orchestration engines, reasoning-heavy tasks, and building smarter AI dev environments.

Powerdrill MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools to interact with Powerdrill datasets. It allows users to authenticate, list and manage datasets, create and run jobs on datasets using natural language questions, and integrate with various MCP-compatible clients like Claude Desktop and Cursor. Key features include dataset management, job creation, session management, and data source handling.

SQLite MCP Server is a Python-based MCP server that connects to a SQLite database, exposing table schemas as resources and providing a read-only SQL query tool. It offers prompt templates for common data analysis tasks and communicates via the STDIO protocol. Features include resource exposure, read-only SQL queries, prompt templates, and logging.

Word Tools MCP Server is an AI-powered tool for Word document manipulation. It provides capabilities such as creating, editing, and managing Word documents through natural language interactions. Key features include Word document creation and management, rich text content manipulation, table creation and formatting, document layout control, metadata management, and real-time document state monitoring.

putio-mcp-server is an MCP server for interacting with put.io, a file hosting and downloading service. Main features include listing active transfers, adding new transfers via URL or magnet link, canceling existing transfers, and getting browser links for completed transfers. It requires Claude Desktop, Python 3.x, uvx, and a Put.io account with an API token.

Playwright MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides browser automation capabilities using Playwright. It enables LLMs to interact with web pages, take screenshots, generate test code, web scrape, and execute JavaScript in a real browser environment. Features include installation via npm, mcp-get, or Smithery, and integration with VS Code and Claude Desktop.

Gemini Image Generator MCP Server is a tool that generates and transforms high-quality images from text prompts using Google's Gemini model. Key features include text-to-image generation, image-to-image transformation, support for file-based and base64-encoded images, automatic intelligent filename generation, automatic translation of non-English prompts, local image storage, and high-resolution image output. The server provides MCP tools such as `generate_image_from_text`, `transform_image_from_encoded`, and `transform_image_from_file` to create and modify images based on text descriptions.

Filesystem MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides file system operations, analysis, and manipulation capabilities through a standardized tool interface. Main features include directory and file operations, text analysis, file hashing, duplicate detection, and ZIP archive creation and extraction.

MCP Server for Intercom is an MCP-compliant server that enables AI assistants to access and analyze customer support data from Intercom. Main features include searching conversations and tickets with advanced filtering, filtering by customer, status, date range, and keywords, and seamless integration with MCP-compliant AI assistants.

Teamwork MCP is a server that connects to the Teamwork API, providing a simplified interface for interacting with Teamwork projects and tasks. It includes features such as connecting to the Teamwork API, retrieving and managing projects and tasks, RESTful API endpoints, error handling, and logging. It also supports integration with Cursor and other applications, and provides various tools for project, task, people, reporting, and time management.

Web Accessibility-Testing MCP Server (A11y MCP) is an MCP server that provides web accessibility testing APIs. It uses Deque Axe-core API and Puppeteer to analyze web content for WCAG compliance and identify accessibility issues. Features include testing web pages and HTML snippets, WCAG compliance testing, customizable tests, rule exploration, color contrast analysis, ARIA validation, and orientation lock detection.

Root Signals MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes Root Signals evaluators as tools for AI assistants and agents. It provides features such as exposing evaluators, supporting standard and RAG evaluations, implementing SSE for network deployment, and compatibility with various MCP clients. The server includes tools for listing evaluators, running evaluations, and evaluating coding policy adherence.

Linear MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Linear, allowing AI assistants to fetch data from Linear. The main feature is to get a user's todo tickets by user ID or email address. It supports installation, development, and production builds, and can be used with any MCP client, including Claude Code.

PRD Creator MCP Server is a specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) server dedicated to creating Product Requirements Documents. It enables AI systems to generate detailed, well-structured PRDs through a standardized protocol interface. Key features include PRD Generator, AI-Driven Generation, Multi-Provider Support, Provider Configuration, Fallback Mechanism, PRD Validator, Template Resources, and MCP Protocol Support.

mcp-data-extractor MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that extracts embedded data (such as i18n translations or key/value configurations) from TypeScript/JavaScript source code into structured JSON configuration files. Key features include data extraction, SVG extraction, and support for various patterns in TypeScript/JavaScript applications. It also provides options to replace the source file content with a migration message and supports customizing the extraction process.

TailorKit MCP is a powerful product customization framework for e-commerce, enabling merchants to create interactive personalization experiences. It features template management, layer control, and Shopify integration. The MCP server connects AI assistants to the TailorKit API, allowing them to manage customizable product templates through natural language conversations. Key tools include getting a list of templates, retrieving detailed template information, creating new templates, and managing layers within templates.

mcp-data-wrangler is a Model Context Protocol server for Data Wrangling, providing a standardized interface for data preprocessing, transformation, and analysis tasks. It enables seamless integration of data wrangling operations into the MCP ecosystem. Key features include data aggregation and descriptive statistics.

docbase-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Docbase, providing features such as searching posts, getting post details, and creating new posts. It integrates with the Docbase API and requires configuration with the appropriate domain and API token.

MCP Terminal Server is a secure command-line interface server for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that enables AI models to interact with your terminal while maintaining security and control. Main features include secure command execution with configurable permissions, file system operations within allowed paths, environment variable management, cross-platform support, and remote system connections support via command execution.

Autumn MCP Server is an unofficial MCP server for Autumn, providing an easy interface to access the Autumn pricing API to manage customers. Key features include creating and managing customers, handling invoices, generating billing portal links, and accessing customer entitlements. It also supports integration with various AI applications and IDEs.

mcp-sns-server is a TypeScript-based MCP server that provides tools to interact with decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs) on the Internet Computer. Main features include listing proposals, listing votable neurons, getting system parameters, accessing wallet information, and voting on proposals.

Excel Reader Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for reading Excel (xlsx) files. Main features include reading content from all sheets, specific sheets by name or index, returning data in JSON format, handling empty cells and data type conversions, and providing clear error messages for common issues.

cargo doc MCP Server is a tool for managing Rust documentation through cargo doc commands. It provides features such as getting a crate's main documentation page, listing all symbols in a crate's documentation, and searching within a crate's documentation. The server also includes a cache system to improve performance and is built to be used with Node.js and Rust.

The Microsoft Dynamics 365 MCP Server is a tool that provides integration with Microsoft Dynamics 365, allowing users to perform various operations such as retrieving user information, fetching accounts, getting associated opportunities, creating and updating accounts. It uses the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and integrates with Dynamics 365 APIs for data operations.

Trino MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for Trino, providing AI models with structured access to Trino's distributed SQL query engine. Key features include exposing Trino resources through MCP protocol, enabling AI tools to query and analyze data in Trino, providing transport options (STDIO and SSE), and offering both Docker container and standalone Python API server options. The server also includes tools for generating and loading test data, running complex queries, and integrating with LLMs.

GitHub Kanban MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that manages GitHub issues in a Kanban board format, enhancing LLM task management. Key features include managing GitHub issues as Kanban boards, automatic task management by LLMs, project progress visualization, full integration with GitHub, and the ability to add comments to tasks.
weather_service MCP サーバーは、シンプルなノート保存システムを実装しており、カスタム note:// URIスキームで個別のノートにアクセスできます。主な機能には、ノートの追加、ノートの要約作成、および開発とデバッグツールが含まれます。

MySQL MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with MySQL databases, providing secure database access capabilities for LLMs. Main features include read and write operations, security measures, and integration with Dive Desktop. It supports executing SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE queries, listing tables, showing table structures, and more.

MCP Task Manager Server is a local Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides backend tools for client-driven project and task management using a SQLite database. Key features include project-based task organization, SQLite persistence, client-driven tools, MCP compliance, and various task management functionalities such as creating projects, adding tasks, listing/showing tasks, updating status, expanding tasks into subtasks, and identifying the next actionable task. It also supports importing and exporting project data to and from JSON.

Obsidian Index MCP server provides a semantic search over an Obsidian vault and exposes recent notes as resources. The main features include exposing recently modified notes, performing semantic search over indexed notes, and options to reindex and watch for changes in the vault.
dify-server MCP 服务器是一个基于 TypeScript 的 Model Context Protocol 服务器，通过集成 Dify AI API 提供 Ant Design 业务组件的代码生成能力。主要功能包括聊天完成功能、支持文本和图片输入、流式响应处理等。开发指南中提供了安装依赖、开发模式、构建服务器以及在 Continue 和 Cline 中集成的详细步骤。

Memory MCP Server is a long-term memory storage system for LLMs using the Model Context Protocol (MCP) standard. It helps LLMs remember the context of work done over the entire history of a project, even across multiple sessions. Key features include project-based memory organization, semantic search using Ollama embeddings, multiple memory types (conversations, code, decisions, references), rich metadata storage, tagging system, and relationship tracking between memories.

DaVinci Resolve MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants like Claude to interact with and control DaVinci Resolve and Fusion. Key features include two-way communication, project management, timeline manipulation, media management, Fusion integration, scene inspection, and code execution.

PDF to PNG MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides PDF to PNG conversion capabilities. It allows users to convert PDF documents into PNG images with a simple MCP tool call. Key features include easy installation, configuration, and usage, with support for Windows, macOS, and Linux. The server requires Python 3.10 or higher, the uv package manager, and poppler for pdf2image conversion.

Puppeteer MCP Server (Python Implementation) is a Model Context Protocol server that provides browser automation capabilities using Playwright. Key features include full browser automation, page navigation, screenshot capture, form interaction, JavaScript execution, console log monitoring, configurable timeouts, detailed error handling, and comprehensive logging.

This MCP (Machine Communication Protocol) service provides access to the BangumiTV API, allowing interaction with BangumiTV's data and retrieval of information about anime, manga, music, games, and more. Features include daily broadcasts, search and browse subjects, get subject details, related persons and characters, episodes, and more.

Cline MCP Server implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for Cline, providing core services for knowledge base integration and retrieval. It serves as the MCP backend for Cline, provides knowledge base access and retrieval capabilities, manages MCP server connections and tool integrations, and enables OpenWebUI integration through MCP.

Eunomia MCP Server is an extension of the Eunomia framework that connects Eunomia instruments with MCP servers. It provides a way to enforce data governance policies (like PII detection or user access control) and orchestrate multiple servers in the MCP ecosystem. Key features include enforcing data governance on LLM or other text-based pipelines, orchestrating multiple servers, and integrating with external server processes in the MCP ecosystem.

Database Explorer MCP Tool is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) tool for exploring and managing different types of databases, including PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Firestore. Main features include multiple database support, database operations such as connecting to databases, listing tables, viewing triggers, listing functions, executing SQL queries, exporting table schemas, and exporting table data.

MCP Reddit Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for fetching and analyzing Reddit content. Main features include fetching hot threads from any subreddit, getting detailed post content including comments, and supporting different post types (text, link, gallery).

Docs Fetch MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for fetching web content with recursive exploration capabilities. It enables LLMs to autonomously explore web pages and documentation to learn about specific topics. Key features include content extraction, link analysis, recursive exploration, parallel processing, robust error handling, dual-strategy approach, and timeout prevention.

@davewind/mysql-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides read-only access to MySQL databases. Key features include read-only database access, schema discovery, SQL query execution, MCP compliance, and simple configuration. It enforces read-only operations, automatically identifies and exposes database table structures, and executes SELECT statements within READ ONLY transactions. The server is designed to integrate seamlessly with LLMs that support the MCP specification.

PDF Extraction MCP server is a tool designed to extract contents from a PDF file. It supports both regular PDF file reading and OCR, and allows for the extraction of specific pages by specifying page numbers. The server can be configured and run on both MacOS and Windows.

mcp-server-openmetadata is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for OpenMetadata, enabling seamless integration with MCP clients. It provides a standardized way to interact with OpenMetadata through the Model Context Protocol, supporting features such as data assets management, search, teams and users, lineage, and glossaries.

MCP Docs Provider is a documentation context provider for LLMs via MCP. It enables AI models to seamlessly access and query local markdown technical documentation. Key features include easy installation via Smithery, configuration with Cursor, and automatic usage of documentation context without explicit mentions.

Twilio MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants like Claude to send SMS and MMS messages using Twilio. Main features include sending SMS messages, pre-built prompts for common messaging scenarios, and secure handling of Twilio credentials. The server requires Node.js and specific environment variables for configuration.

cosense-mcp-server MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for cosense. It provides features such as getting a page, and it can be used with Claude Desktop. The server supports installation, development, and debugging with tools like MCP Inspector.

ZenMemory MCP Server is a decentralized AI memory infrastructure powered by MCP and Solana Agent Kit. It includes features such as a full MCP server using the `@modelcontextprotocol/typescript-sdk`, Solana on-chain memory context via `@solana/agent-kit`, an Express HTTP API for memory operations, and in-memory or pluggable DB/IPFS storage.
ZEN大学シラバスMCPサーバー実装は、ZEN大学のシラバスコンテンツを活用するためのMCPサーバーです。主な機能には、科目の検索と推薦、履修要件に基づいた細かな履修相談が含まれます。また、Node.js環境での設定とインストール方法、VSCodeおよびClaude Desktopとの統合についても詳細に説明されています。

Azure TableStore MCP Server is a TypeScript-based MCP server that enables interaction with Azure Table Storage. It allows you to query and manage data in Azure Storage Tables, with features including OData filter support, getting table schemas, listing all tables, detailed error handling, and simple configuration through a connection string.

webdev-mcp is an MCP server that provides useful web development tools, including the ability to take screenshots and list screens. It can be installed in a project or globally and is compatible with Cursor and Windsurf IDEs.

vercel-mcp is an MCP server that connects to the Vercel API, providing tools for interacting with Vercel's deployments, DNS, domains, projects, and environment variables. It can be installed in a project or globally and supports Cursor and Windsurf IDEs.
MCP代码索引器是一个专为AI大语言模型设计的智能代码检索工具，通过向量化索引和语义理解，帮助AI更好地理解和分析代码库。主要特性包括智能代码检索、代码分析能力、优化的上下文处理和完整MCP协议支持。应用场景包括增强代码理解、智能代码导航、代码质量改进、项目依赖管理、文档生成辅助等。

This tool provides a robust bridge to the Plaid financial API, enabling secure access to bank account data, transactions, and authentication flows for financial analysis and personal finance tracking.

Container-MCP is a secure, container-based implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for executing tools on behalf of large language models. It provides a sandboxed environment for safely executing code, running commands, accessing files, and performing web operations. Key features include multi-layered security, MCP protocol implementation, domain-specific managers for bash, Python, file, and web operations, and extensive configuration options.

QuickBooks Time MCP Server (V2 Update) is a combined MCP server that provides access to all QuickBooks Time API functionality through a single interface. It includes tools for job codes, reports, timesheets, users, and project management. Main features include advanced filtering options, real-time data retrieval, and comprehensive reporting capabilities.

Code Context Provider MCP is a server that provides code context and analysis for AI assistants. It extracts directory structure and code symbols using WebAssembly Tree-sitter parsers with zero native dependencies. Main features include generating directory tree structure, analyzing JavaScript/TypeScript and Python files, extracting code symbols (functions, variables, classes, imports, exports), and compatibility with the MCP protocol for seamless integration with AI assistants.

RetellAI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for RetellAI, allowing AI assistants to interact with RetellAI's voice services. Main features include Call Management, Agent Management, Phone Number Management, and Voice Management. It provides tools for creating and managing phone calls, web calls, voice agents, and phone numbers, as well as accessing different voice options.

This MCP server for Azure Cosmos DB using the Go SDK allows interaction with Azure Cosmos DB, including listing databases and containers, reading container metadata, creating containers, adding items, reading items, and executing SQL queries. It uses the mcp-go implementation and can be configured with VS Code or other MCP tools. The project also emphasizes the importance of validating results and queries due to the non-deterministic nature of Large Language Models (LLMs).

Sonic Pi MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI assistants to interact with Sonic Pi through OSC messages, enabling the creation and control of music programmatically. Main features include playing individual notes with customizable synth parameters, executing arbitrary Sonic Pi code, and integration with MCP-compatible clients like Claude Desktop and Cursor.

MCP server for TinyPNG is a tool designed to compress both local and remote image files. It provides functionalities such as compressing local images by specifying the absolute path, and compressing remote images by providing the URL. The server can be run using `bun` or `node`, and it requires an API key for TinyPNG. Installation can also be done via Smithery for automatic setup with Claude Desktop.

Notion MCP Server is a tool that enables interaction with Notion workspaces through the Notion API. It provides functionalities such as appending, retrieving, and deleting blocks, creating and querying databases, and updating page properties. The main features include notion_append_block_children, notion_retrieve_block, notion_retrieve_block_children, notion_delete_block, notion_retrieve_page, notion_update_page_properties, notion_create_database, notion_query_database, notion_retrieve_database, notion_update_database, and notion_create_database_item.

solana-docs-server MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that implements a simple notes system, demonstrating core MCP concepts. It provides resources for text notes with URIs and metadata, tools for creating new notes, and prompts for generating summaries of notes. Features include listing and accessing notes via `note://` URIs, creating new text notes, and generating summaries of all stored notes.

MCP Chat Logger is a simple yet powerful tool for saving chat history in Markdown format, making it easy to view and share. Key features include support for large model calls, automatic timestamping of messages, customizable save directories, and session ID support for different conversations.
mcp-wikipedia is an MCP server that provides the ability to access Wikipedia pages, allowing for search and retrieval of information from the Wikipedia database.
This tool leverages pandas, numpy, and matplotlib to enable powerful data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization for data-driven projects.

MCP Website Downloader is a simple MCP server for downloading documentation websites and preparing them for RAG indexing. Key features include downloading complete documentation sites, maintaining link structure and navigation, organizing assets (CSS, JS, images), creating a clean index for RAG systems, and providing a single-purpose MCP interface. The tool also includes robust error handling and follows design principles such as single responsibility and clean structure.

Baidu Search MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that allows AI assistants to perform intelligent searches using the Baidu Wenxin API. Key features include support for multiple models, providing search results and references, and supporting deep search and recency filtering.

GitHub Projects V2 MCP Server is a tool for managing GitHub Projects V2 through Claude and other MCP clients. It uses the GitHub GraphQL API to list and view projects, get project fields and items, create and add issues, update project item field values, and delete items from projects. The server can be used with any MCP client and provides detailed configuration options for both published packages and source code.

Discourse MCP Server is a Node.js server that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for searching posts on a Discourse forum. The main feature is the ability to search posts using the MCP protocol, and it can be used with Claude Desktop via Docker or NPX.

Mozisu MCP Server is a tool that counts the number of characters in a text, including support for multi-byte characters like Japanese and emojis. It can be used as an MCP server, a command-line tool, or a web interface. The main features include character counting (including spaces and non-space characters), support for multi-byte characters, and multiple usage methods.

Bear MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI assistants like Claude to read notes from the Bear note-taking app. It connects directly to the Bear SQLite database in a read-only mode, ensuring your notes remain safe and unmodified. Key features include opening notes by title or ID, searching for notes by term or tag, getting all tags, and showing notes with a specific tag.

Manifold Markets MCP Server is a tool for interacting with Manifold Markets prediction markets. It provides comprehensive access to Manifold's features through a clean MCP interface, enabling sophisticated market interactions and collective intelligence mechanisms. Key features include market creation and management, market interaction, trading operations, liquidity management, and information retrieval.

Clojars MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for fetching dependency information from Clojars, the Clojure community's artifact repository. Main features include getting the latest version of any Clojars dependency, checking if a specific version of a dependency exists, and easy integration with Claude through MCP.

Code Explainer MCP is a Cloudflare Worker that serves as an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for code explanation. It analyzes and explains code with a comprehensive breakdown of structure and functionality. Main features include Architecture Diagram generation, Core Functionality Analysis, Component Breakdown, Multi-language Support, JSDoc/Docstring Recognition, and Secure API with Bearer token authentication.

FastDomainCheck MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for checking domain name registration status in bulk. Key features include bulk domain registration status checking, dual verification using WHOIS and DNS, support for Internationalized Domain Names (IDN), concise output format, and built-in input validation and error handling. The tool can check up to 50 domains per request and provides detailed error messages for troubleshooting.

Bitrefill MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that provides access to Bitrefill services, allowing you to search for gift cards, mobile topups, and more. It includes features such as product search, detailed information retrieval, invoice creation, and payment processing. The server also supports various tools for managing orders, invoices, and account balances, and integrates with multiple AI assistants.

Filesystem MCP Server is an implementation providing file system operations, analysis, and manipulation capabilities through a standardized tool interface. It includes directory and file operations, text analysis, file hashing, and compression operations. The server is built on the MCP SDK and organized into distinct layers, including the Server Layer, Tool Registry, Operations Layer, and File System Interface.

SupaUI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for SupaUI that enables AI agents to generate, fetch, and manage UI components through natural language interactions. Main features include creating UI components, fetching UI components, listing UI components, TypeScript support, and API tools for generating, retrieving, and listing components.

mysqldb-mcp-server is a MySQL database MCP server project that provides tools to connect to and execute queries on a MySQL database. Key features include the `connect_database` tool for connecting to a specific MySQL database and the `execute_query` tool for executing SQL queries and returning results in JSON format. The server can be configured using environment variables and supports both development and published configurations.

Perplexity Search MCP Server is a Go implementation that allows large language models (LLMs) to access the Perplexity search API through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Main features include web searches with citations, configurable parameters for search recency, token limits, and more. It supports integration with Claude Desktop and provides Docker support for easy deployment.

eClass MCP Server is an MCP server for interacting with the Open eClass platform, specifically supporting UoA's SSO authentication system. It enables AI agents to authenticate, retrieve course information, and perform basic operations on the platform. Key features include Authentication, Course Management, Session Management, and Status Checking. The server is designed with a focus on security, ensuring that credentials and session data are handled securely.

Volume Wall Detector MCP Server is a tool for real-time stock trading volume analysis, detection of significant price levels (volume walls), and trading imbalance tracking. It supports after-hours trading analysis and uses MongoDB for data persistence. The server is compatible with various MCP clients including Cline, Cursor, and Claude Desktop.

Whoop MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to the Whoop API, allowing language models to query cycles, recovery, strain, and workout data. Key features include cycle queries, recovery and strain data retrieval, profile and authentication management, and an HTTP API server for additional functionality. The server also includes error handling for common issues.

AWS CodePipeline MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with AWS CodePipeline, allowing you to manage your pipelines through Windsurf and Cascade. Key features include listing all pipelines, getting pipeline state and detailed definitions, managing pipeline executions, approving or rejecting manual approval actions, retrying failed stages, triggering and stopping pipeline executions, viewing logs, tagging resources, creating webhooks, and getting performance metrics.

Currents MCP Server is a tool that allows you to provide test results context to your AI agents by connecting them to Currents. It is useful for asking AI to fix or optimize tests failing in CI. The main features include getting API configuration, fetching run information, and retrieving instance information about attempts and errors. It can be used with Cursor Editor and Claude Desktop, and requires an API key for setup.

FastMCP Todo Server is a FastMCP-based server for receiving and storing todo requests in MongoDB. It is compatible with the Swarmonomicon todo worker and provides features such as FastMCP server for receiving todo requests, MongoDB integration for todo storage, and a Python-based implementation. The server can be used to manage and distribute tasks, and it integrates with various AI models and real-time updates via MQTT.

This Spring AI MCP Server is designed to provide course information. It exposes two main tools: one to retrieve all available courses and another to search for specific courses by title. The server is built using Spring Boot and integrates with the Spring AI MCP framework, allowing AI models to interact with custom data services. Key features include defining data models, implementing tool functions, and registering tools with MCP. The project can be extended to add more courses, create new tool functions, implement database storage, and add advanced search capabilities.

Face Generator MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for generating human face images. Key features include the ability to generate human face images, support for multiple output shapes (square, circle, rounded rectangle), configurable image dimensions, transparent backgrounds for non-square shapes, and batch generation of multiple images.

Voice Recorder MCP Server is designed for recording audio and transcribing it using OpenAI's Whisper model. It can be used as a Goose custom extension or standalone MCP server. Main features include recording audio from the default microphone, transcribing recordings using Whisper, integration with Goose AI agent, and support for various Whisper models. The server also includes prompts for common recording scenarios and provides tools for starting, stopping, and transcribing audio.

Super Windows CLI MCP Server is an enhanced fork of the Windows CLI MCP Server with unrestricted system access capabilities. Key features include full system access, unrestricted command execution, network-level access controls, unlimited process capabilities, auto-recovery and fault tolerance, and PowerShell telemetry disabled. It is designed for use in trusted environments where full system access is required.

coco is a developer's helper tool that assists with code review and pair programming. It allows users to get contextual feedback on their code, similar to having a coding partner. The main feature is the 'pair-qa' function, which enables users to review and improve their code through an interactive question-and-answer process.

MCP Function App Tester is a TypeScript-based MCP server that enables testing of Azure Function Apps through Cline. It allows you to test and interact with Function App endpoints directly from your development environment. Main features include support for different HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), detailed response information, custom header support, request body handling for POST/PUT methods, and various authentication methods (Basic Authentication, Bearer Token, API Key).

Flutter Tools MCP Server provides tools for interacting with the Flutter SDK, including `get_diagnostics` to get Flutter/Dart diagnostics for a file and `apply_fixes` to apply Dart fix suggestions. It includes dependencies and scripts for building and running the server, and it requires the Flutter SDK to be installed and available in the PATH.

Voicevox MCP Server is a server that allows the use of VOICEVOX compatible text-to-speech engines (AivisSpeech, VOICEVOX, COEIROINK) via the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It can be used for voice synthesis in agent modes with Claude 3.7 in environments like Cursor. The server supports both Windows and Docker (WSL2) environments and provides detailed setup and configuration instructions.

systemprompt-mcp-reddit is a specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI agents to interact with Reddit, including reading posts, creating content, and managing subreddit configurations. Key features include Subreddit Configuration, Content Retrieval, Content Creation, Writing Style Control, Rule Compliance, Content Guidelines, Flexible Post Types, Smart Replies, MCP Protocol Integration, Type-Safe Implementation, Real-Time Processing, and Advanced Error Handling.

MCP vLLM Benchmarking Tool is a proof of concept for interactively benchmarking vLLM. It allows users to run benchmarks on specified endpoints and models, with options to run multiple iterations and compare results. The tool is still in an exploratory phase and may require further refinement.

MS-Lucidia-Voice-Gateway-MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides text-to-speech and speech-to-text capabilities using Windows' built-in speech services. Key features include Text-to-Speech (TTS) using Windows SAPI voices, Speech-to-Text (STT) using Windows Speech Recognition, a simple web interface for testing, no external API dependencies, and the use of native Windows capabilities.

Cloudinary MCP Server provides tools for uploading images and videos to Cloudinary through Claude Desktop and compatible MCP clients. Main features include uploading files, specifying resource types, custom public IDs, overwriting existing assets, and adding tags.

mcp-server-modal is an MCP Server that allows users to deploy Python scripts to Modal. It provides functionality for setting up and deploying Python applications, with features including installation of the modal package, configuration in the Claude desktop app, and deployment of generated code with a shareable link.

Zoom Transcript MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Zoom Cloud Recording transcripts. It allows you to list, download, search, and manage your Zoom meeting transcripts through a structured interface. Key features include listing meetings, downloading transcripts, getting recent transcripts, searching transcripts, and organized storage.

Perplexity AI MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to the Perplexity AI API. It allows users to interact with Perplexity AI through various tools, including chatting and searching. The server simplifies the integration of Perplexity AI into MCP-based systems and provides a convenient and standardized way to access its capabilities. Key features include chat functionality, search capabilities, and documentation retrieval.

The content describes the setup and usage of a RocketMQ MCP server, which is used for communication purposes. It includes build, run, and check instructions, as well as configuration details for connecting to the server. The server uses SSE (Server-Sent Events) for real-time communication.

Headline Vibes Analysis MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that analyzes sentiment in news headlines from major US publications. It provides features such as analyzing up to 100 headlines per request, even distribution of headlines across major US news sources, sentiment scoring on a 0-10 scale, natural language date parsing, detailed source distribution information, and sample headlines included in results. The server requires a NewsAPI key and can be installed and configured with Node.js.

The privateGPT MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that allows seamless integration between privateGPT and MCP-compatible applications. It provides features such as chat management, group and source management, user management, and robust security measures including encryption, token-based authentication, and TLS. The server supports multiple languages and offers flexible configuration options for enabling or disabling specific functionalities.

js-sandbox MCP Server provides a secure JavaScript execution environment with features such as isolated code execution, configurable execution time and memory limits, and protection against malicious code. It includes tools for executing JavaScript code in an isolated environment, and supports development, building, and debugging with MCP Inspector.

MCP Wechat Moment Server is a tool that uses AppleScript to publish moments on macOS. It requires cliclick for emulating mouse click events and can be installed using uvx. The server can be used with clients like Cherry Studio, and it offers an auto-publish feature that can be enabled via environment variables.

Gentoro MCP Server is a tool that enables Claude and other agents to interact with Gentoro bridges and their underlying capabilities. It allows users to create and integrate tools into a common Bridge, defining all available capabilities. The server is fully integrated with Gentoro, providing control over the agents, tools, and their functionality at the level of Gentoro's bridge. Key features include creating a Gentoro account, generating an API key, defining a Bridge, and integrating Gentoro with Claude or other agents using NodeJS.

Excel MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides Excel file manipulation capabilities without requiring Microsoft Excel installation. It enables workbook creation, data manipulation, formatting, and advanced Excel features such as charts and pivot tables. The server supports comprehensive Excel functionality, data reading and writing, and advanced features like charts and pivot tables, with full error handling.

Self-Hosted Supabase MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed for interacting with self-hosted Supabase instances. It enables database introspection, management, and interaction directly from the development environment. Key features include querying database schemas and data, managing database migrations, inspecting database statistics and connections, managing authentication users, interacting with Supabase Storage, and generating type definitions.

The optimized-memory-mcp-server is a Python implementation of a persistent memory system using a local knowledge graph, designed to help Claude AI remember information about the user across chats. It supports creating and managing entities, relations, and observations, and provides an API for operations such as creating, reading, updating, and deleting nodes and relations in the knowledge graph.

Python MCP Server for Code Graph Extraction is a tool that provides functionality for extracting and analyzing Python code structures, focusing on import/export relationships between files. Key features include Code Relationship Discovery, Smart Code Extraction, Directory Context, Documentation Inclusion, LLM-Friendly Formatting, and MCP Protocol Support. The server can be integrated into any Python application and is compatible with the Model Context Protocol JSON-RPC standard.

MCP Backup Server is a specialized MCP server that provides backup and restoration capabilities for AI agents and code editing tools. It offers instant, targeted backups with agent context, supports file and folder operations, maintains version history, and provides restore safety. Key features include pattern filtering, operation tracking, and cancellation. It is designed for quick safety backups with context, especially before risky edits or folder restructuring.

MCP TTS Say is a tool that uses an MCP server to convert text to speech and play it back in a local environment. It leverages the OpenAI TTS SDK for high-quality text-to-speech synthesis. Key features include text-to-speech conversion, local audio playback, and easy integration with MCP servers.

Hypernym MCP Server provides semantic text analysis and compression tools via Hypernym AI's API. It allows LLMs to access Hypernym's semantic categorization and compression capabilities through standardized MCP interfaces. Key features include text categorization, adaptive compression, similarity scoring, key detail extraction, and support for both standard MCP CLI interface and HTTP/HTTPS JSON-RPC 2.0 endpoints.

MCP Server for Iaptic is a Model Context Protocol server that interacts with the Iaptic API to manage and retrieve data related to customers, purchases, transactions, and statistics. It provides tools for listing and getting details of customers, purchases, and transactions, as well as generating statistics and managing app-specific data. The server can be installed via Smithery or manually, and it requires Node.js and an Iaptic account with API credentials.

This project implements a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) chatbot using Streamlit and the MCP server. The chatbot retrieves relevant information from uploaded PDFs to answer natural language questions. Key features include MCP Tool Integration, PDF Upload and Parsing, Text Chunking, Document Indexing, Similarity Search, Prompt-Based Answer Generation, and an Interactive Interface.

Snowflake Cube Server is an MCP server designed for interacting with Cube Semantic Layers. It provides tools and resources for reading and describing data, including `read_data` for querying the Cube REST API and returning data in YAML format, and `describe_data` for providing a description of the available data in the Cube deployment.

MCP PowerPoint Plugin is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) plugin for PowerPoint operations, allowing AI assistants to create and manipulate PowerPoint presentations programmatically. Main features include creating new presentations, adding slides, getting slide information, exporting to PDF, and reading presentation metadata.

mcp-sage is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides tools for sending prompts to either OpenAI's O3 model or Google's Gemini 2.5 Pro based on token count. It is useful for getting second opinions or detailed code reviews from models that can handle large contexts. Key features include automatic model selection, multi-model debate for high-quality implementation plans, and support for various development tasks like code review and opinion generation.

VseGPT MCP Servers is a collection of MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers written in Python, designed to provide language models with access to current data and knowledge through APIs, perform real-world actions, and ensure security when interacting with external systems. Key features include generation of images and text-to-speech, with the ability to dynamically enable and disable functionality without overloading the model's context.

WildFly MCP is a project that aims to integrate Generative AI capabilities for monitoring and managing WildFly servers. It includes a WildFly MCP Server for natural language interaction, a WildFly Chat Bot for interacting with WildFly servers, container images for deployment, an MCP STDIO to SSE protocol gateway, and a Wait MCP Server for adding delays in workflows.

Lemonade Stand MCP Server is a simple, working example of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that lets you play the classic Lemonade Stand game through Claude Desktop. It features a dynamic weather system affecting sales, business simulation with supply and demand, strategic pricing and inventory management, and a 14-day game cycle with profit tracking. The server is fully playable through Claude Desktop and provides an educational experience in business and economics.

Kakao Mobility & Kakao Map MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) compliant server that integrates with Kakao Mobility and Kakao Map APIs. It provides location search (geocoding), route planning services, and supports various transportation modes. The server offers tools for geocoding, direction search by names and coordinates, and future direction search.

Stellar Smart MCP Demo is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server inspired by Cloudflare's remote MCP servers. It requires setting up a wallet and adding contracts to track, with the option to automate signing using an ed25519 signer. The demo is useful for interacting with blockchain-based applications and smart contracts.

shell-command-mcp is an MCP server for executing shell commands. It allows users to configure and run specific shell commands, with the ability to specify allowed commands via an environment variable. The project is sponsored by ChatWise, an all-in-one LLM chatbot with first-class MCP support.

mcp-docs-rag MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that implements a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) system for documents stored in a local directory. It allows users to query documents using LLMs with context from locally stored repositories and text files. Main features include listing and accessing documents, querying documents using RAG, adding Git repositories and text files, and providing usage guides.

Obsidian Model Context Protocol is a connector that allows Claude Desktop (or any MCP client) to read and search any directory containing Markdown notes, such as an Obsidian vault. It provides installation via Smithery, VS Code, and manual configuration options.

MCP TaskManager is a Model Context Protocol server for task management, allowing Claude Desktop (or any MCP client) to manage and execute tasks in a queue-based system. It supports planning and execution phases, including task queuing, returning the next task, and providing a feedback mechanism for task completion.

YouTube MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that allows you to download subtitles from YouTube and connect them to a LLM. Main features include downloading transcripts from YouTube videos, support for both video IDs and full YouTube URLs, and including timestamps in the transcript.

PopUI is a companion desktop app for macOS that enhances the user experience for Claude Desktop. It creates a bi-directional bridge to a visual context, allowing Claude to create and display user interfaces, read changes, and push updates. Features include real-time visual context, control panels, color pickers, and more. PopUI also provides an automatic SSE proxy to Claude Desktop and can be installed by downloading the latest release.

Gong MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to Gong's API for retrieving call recordings and transcripts. Key features include listing Gong calls with date range filtering, retrieving detailed transcripts for specific calls, secure authentication using Gong's API credentials, and a standardized MCP interface for easy integration with Claude.
