GraphDB MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides read-only access to Ontotext GraphDB, enabling LLMs to explore RDF graphs and execute SPARQL queries. Key features include executing SPARQL queries, listing available graphs, providing class lists, predicates, statistics, sample data, and graph content. The server can be configured using environment variables or command-line arguments and can be used with the Claude Desktop app.

This content describes a demo that uses the Amap (Gaode) weather API to fetch the current weather for a city. It includes instructions on how to configure and use the MCP server with an API key, and how to install it via Smithery for Claude Desktop.

MySQL MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with MySQL databases, providing secure database access capabilities for LLMs. Main features include read and write operations, security measures such as read-only transaction mode, query length and result size limits, performance monitoring, and logging. It supports executing SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE queries, listing tables, and describing table structures.

Kibela MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Kibela, enabling various operations such as searching, creating, and managing notes and folders. It provides tools for note and folder operations, comment management, and other functionalities like getting group lists and feed sections. The server can be used with MCP clients like Claude Desktop or VSCode and supports customization of tool descriptions and prompts.

Nano Currency MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables MCP-compatible clients, including AI agents, to send Nano currency and retrieve account and block information via the Nano node RPC. Key features include sending Nano currency, retrieving detailed account and block information, and integration with MCP clients like Claude Desktop. The server requires setting up environment variables for Nano RPC URL, work generation URL, private key, and maximum send amount.

SSH MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides SSH capabilities for secure remote access and execution. Main features include SSH server implementation using the MCP protocol, SQLite database integration for data persistence, and TypeScript implementation for type safety and better development experience. Tools provided include ssh_exec, add_credential, list_credentials, and remove_credential.

Kiseki-Labs-Readwise-MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server designed to interact with the Readwise API, allowing language models to access and manipulate Readwise documents and highlights. Main features include finding specific documents by name, listing documents based on filters, retrieving highlights by document IDs, and fetching highlights based on date ranges and tags.

Kibela MCP Server is an implementation for Kibela API integration, enabling LLMs to interact with Kibela content. Main features include searching notes with advanced filters, getting the latest notes, managing groups and folders, liking/unliking notes, listing users, viewing note attachments, and more.

mcp-miro MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that connects to the MIRO Whiteboard Application, allowing for board manipulation, sticky creation, bulk operations, and more. It supports OAuth key authentication and can be installed via Smithery or mcp-get. The server provides tools for creating and reading board contents, as well as bulk create operations, and can be used with Claude Desktop.

MCP Tavily is an MCP server implementation for Tavily API, providing advanced search and content extraction capabilities. Main features include multiple search tools (basic search, context-aware search, Q&A focused search), content extraction from URLs, rich configuration options, and extensive search and extract options. The server also includes proper error handling and can be integrated with MCP for advanced search functionalities.

OPC UA MCP Server is a tool that connects to OPC UA-enabled industrial systems, allowing AI agents to monitor, analyze, and control operational data in real time. Key features include reading and writing to OPC UA nodes, seamless integration with MCP clients, and support for natural language interaction.

MCP File System Server is a tool that provides file system operations, including navigation, reading, writing, and analyzing files. It supports basic file and directory operations such as listing, changing directories, reading and writing files, creating and removing directories, and moving or copying files. Additionally, it offers editing and searching capabilities, file analysis, batch operations, project navigation, code quality checks, and command execution.

Deep Reasoning Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides deep reasoning capabilities based on the deepseek-r1 model. It can be integrated with MCP Clients like Cursor to enhance their reasoning and inference capabilities.

Slack User MCP Server is a tool that enables Claude to interact with Slack workspaces as a user. It provides various functionalities such as listing channels, posting messages, replying to threads, adding reactions, getting channel history, and retrieving user information. The server can be set up using a Slack App with specific OAuth token scopes and can be integrated with Claude Desktop via local installation, NPX, or Docker.

MCP Yahoo Finance is an MCP server for interacting with Yahoo Finance, providing tools to get pricing, company information, and generate financial visualizations. Main features include Financial Data (current and historical stock prices, dividends, income statements, etc.) and Visualization Tools (market sentiment dashboard, portfolio tracking, technical analysis).

MCP Git Tools is a library that integrates Git operations with the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides a set of Git commands such as git_status, git_branches, git_log, git_time_filtered_log, git_commit, git_pull, git_push, git_diff, git_add, and git_reset. These commands can be called through MCP to manage and interact with Git repositories.

The content describes a configuration for a MCP server named 'papersearch', which is likely used for searching and retrieving papers or documents. The main feature is the ability to run a search command with specific arguments, indicating its purpose in document or paper search.

Xueqiu MCP is a service based on the Xueqiu API that allows you to easily obtain stock data through Claude or other AI assistants. Key features include real-time stock quotes, index returns, northbound data for Shenzhen and Shanghai-Hong Kong Stock Connect, fund-related data queries, and keyword search for stock codes.

MCP GitHub Repository Server is an MCP server that provides access to GitHub repository contents, allowing AI assistants to browse and read files from specified repositories. Key features include: Access to any file in a GitHub repository via URI, listing repository contents and navigating directories, support for branch-specific file access, and serving file contents as plain text. The server also includes error handling and requires a GitHub Personal Access Token for authentication.

YFinance Trader MCP Tool is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) tool that provides stock market data and trading capabilities using the yfinance library. Main features include real-time stock quotes, company information and financial metrics, historical price data, symbol search functionality, and insider transaction tracking.

Twitter MCP Server is an application that allows you to manage your Twitter account programmatically. It provides features such as retrieving your home timeline, fetching tweets from any public user, searching for tweets with specific hashtags, getting replies and summaries, sending and receiving direct messages, creating and deleting posts, and more.

Emergency Medicare Management MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Google Maps to locate and evaluate medical facilities in emergency situations. Key features include real-time routing, availability checks, detailed information about medical services, and sequential thinking for medical evaluation. The system helps users find appropriate hospitals and clinics within a 10km radius based on specific medical needs, emergency level, and facility capabilities.

Rime MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides text-to-speech capabilities using the Rime API. It exposes a `speak` tool that converts text to speech and plays it through the system's native audio player. Key features include high-quality voice synthesis, customizable behavior via environment variables, and support for multiple operating systems.

BrasilAPI MCP Server allows querying a variety of data from Brazilian resources, including postal codes, area codes, banks, holidays, taxes, and more. It provides a unified interface to access rich and updated data, enhancing AI agents and applications with information from BrasilAPI. The server includes tools for querying every endpoint available from BrasilAPI and can be integrated with various AI applications and development environments.

GitHub MCP Server in Go is a tool that allows AI assistants to interact with the GitHub API, enabling operations such as creating repositories, managing branches, manipulating files, and more. It supports authentication via environment variables or HTTP headers and provides a variety of tools for repository management, issue tracking, and code search.

MCP Substack Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for downloading and parsing Substack posts. It integrates with the Claude.ai desktop app. Main features include downloading and parsing Substack posts, extracting title, author, subtitle, and content, and working with public Substack posts.

Task API Server - MCP TypeScript Implementation is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for Task Management API written in TypeScript. It supports task management operations such as listing, creating, updating, and deleting tasks, with dual interface modes (STDIO and HTTP+SSE). The server also includes comprehensive validation, robust error handling, and quality assurance features.

RFC MCP Server is a tool for fetching, parsing, and reading RFCs from the ietf.org website. It provides features such as fetching RFC documents by number, searching for RFCs by keyword, extracting specific sections from RFC documents, and parsing both HTML and TXT format RFCs. The server also includes caching for better performance.

Cross-System Agent Communication MCP Server enables communication and coordination between different LLM agents across multiple systems. It supports agent registry, message bus, task coordination, context sharing, GitHub integration for issue and PR management, and PlanetScale database for scalable data storage. The server provides API endpoints for agent management, messaging, task management, context sharing, and GitHub integration.

Julia Documentation MCP Server is a tool designed to serve context about Julia documentation and source code. It provides features such as getting documentation for Julia packages, modules, types, functions, and methods, viewing source code, built-in caching, and proper error handling for Julia-specific errors. The server requires Node.js 16 or higher and Julia 1.9 or higher, and it integrates with Claude Desktop.

100ms Raydium Sniper MCP is a high-performance tool for token sniping on the Raydium DEX with multi-region support and Claude AI integration. Key features include multi-region execution, WebSocket monitoring, GraphQL integration, Claude AI integration for natural language instructions, fast execution, and demo mode for testing without real transactions.

Django Migrations MCP Service is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) service for managing Django migrations in distributed environments. It provides features like checking migration status, creating new migrations, applying migrations with safety checks, and additional validation and safety checks. The service can be integrated with CI/CD pipelines and supports local development, Docker, and various deployment scenarios.

Apache Doris MCP Server is an MCP server for Apache Doris, a modern, high-performance, real-time analytical database. It provides integration with the MCP protocol and can be used to manage and interact with Apache Doris databases. The setup includes running the MCP Inspector and publishing the server using uv.
This integration with Directus CMS enables CRUD operations on collections through the REST API, allowing seamless interaction with structured data in a headless content management system.

MacOS Clipboard MCP Server is a tool that provides access to the macOS clipboard via OSAScript, allowing AI assistants to retrieve content such as text, images (PNG), and raw binary data. Features include support for multiple content types and real-time retrieval of clipboard content.

Nodit MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects AI agents and developers to structured, context-ready blockchain data across multiple networks through Nodit's Web3 infrastructure. Key features include access to RPC Node & Node APIs, Web3 Data APIs, and GraphQL Indexer APIs for Aptos. It supports various blockchain networks such as Ethereum, Base, Optimism, Arbitrum, Polygon, Aptos, Bitcoin, Dogecoin, TRON, and XRPL. The server provides tools for dynamic discovery, understanding, and interaction with Nodit's Web3 APIs and data infrastructure.

IMAP MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to check email, process messages, and learn user preferences through interaction. Key features include Email Authentication, Browsing, Content Reading, Actions (move, delete, mark as read/unread, flag), Composition, Search, and planned features like Interaction Patterns and Learning Layer.

The Research Orchestration Service is an AI-driven tool that gathers, analyzes, and synthesizes information from multiple sources to provide comprehensive answers to complex queries. Key features include intelligent query analysis, multi-tool orchestration, iterative research process, AI-powered synthesis, quality assurance, and performance optimization. The service integrates with various specialized tools such as web search, technical information, academic research, current events, content extraction, and reference information.

MCP_Sample is a project that demonstrates an MCP server which searches a SQLite database (quran.db) for a specific search word. The content includes instructions on setting up the project, creating a virtual environment, and installing dependencies.

DuckDuckGo & Felo AI Search MCP is a privacy-friendly Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for web search and AI-powered responses. It supports web search using DuckDuckGo, AI search using Felo AI, URL content extraction with smart filtering, URL metadata extraction, performance optimization with caching, and security features including rate limiting and rotating user agents. The tool does not require API keys and is compatible with various AI assistants and tools.

OpenGov MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that enables MCP clients like Claude Desktop to access Socrata Open Data APIs. It allows users to search for, retrieve, and analyze public datasets from government data portals. Key features include searching and discovering datasets by keyword, category, or tags, viewing dataset metadata and column information, running SQL-like queries to retrieve and analyze data, and getting portal usage statistics.

binary_ninja_cline_mcp is an MCP server that allows Cline to analyze binaries using Binary Ninja. It includes setup instructions for installing the Binary Ninja MCP Plugin, starting the MCP server from within Binary Ninja, and configuring Cline with the necessary tool settings.

The OP.GG Esports MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol implementation that provides AI agents with access to OP.GG Esports data, specifically for retrieving upcoming League of Legends match schedules and information. Features include fetching and formatting match schedules, returning match details such as name, league, status, score, scheduled time, and a direct link to the match. The server is built on TypeScript and Node.js and connects directly to the OP.GG Esports GraphQL API.

The OP.GG MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol implementation that provides AI agents with access to OP.GG data, including features for League of Legends, Esports, Teamfight Tactics (TFT), and Valorant. It offers tools for champion analysis, leaderboards, match schedules, team standings, meta trends, item combinations, and more. The server can be installed via Smithery or connected directly via SSE, and it supports various MCP-compatible clients.

Foundry MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for interacting with Foundry, allowing AI assistants to interact with datasets, ontology objects, and functions. Key features include listing and querying datasets, listing and querying ontology objects, listing and executing functions. It requires Python 3.9+, mcp, pyarrow, pandas, and foundry-platform-sdk, along with several environment variables for configuration.

mcp-paperswithcode is an MCP server that allows AI assistants to find and read papers, as well as view related code repositories for further context. It provides tools for paper search and retrieval, listing paper components, research areas, authors, and conferences. The main features include searching for papers, getting detailed information about specific papers, reading papers from URLs, listing related tasks, methods, repositories, and datasets, and more.

Autodocument MCP Server is a tool that automatically generates documentation for code repositories by analyzing directory structures and code files using OpenRouter API. Key features include Smart Directory Analysis, Git Integration, AI-Powered Documentation, Test Plan Generation, Code Review, Bottom-Up Approach, Intelligent File Handling, Progress Reporting, High Configurability, and Extensible Architecture.

PageSpeed MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that extends AI assistant capabilities with PageSpeed Insights functionality. It provides detailed performance analysis, best practices assessment, SEO analysis, accessibility audits, and resource optimization for websites. The server acts as a bridge between AI models and Google's PageSpeed Insights API, enabling comprehensive web performance metrics and recommendations.

MCP-Puppeteer-Linux is a Model Context Protocol server that provides browser automation capabilities using Puppeteer, with full support for Linux display servers (X11 and Wayland). Key features include automatic X11/Wayland detection and configuration, console log monitoring, screenshot capabilities, JavaScript execution, and basic web interaction such as navigation, clicking, and form filling.

MCP Web Research Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for web research. It integrates with the Claude Desktop app to provide real-time information and research capabilities. Key features include Google search integration, webpage content extraction, research session tracking, and screenshot capture. The server also provides tools like `search_google`, `visit_page`, and `take_screenshot` for conducting thorough web research.

Port MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the Port.io API, enabling natural language interaction with Port.io's developer platform. It provides features such as finding information quickly, analyzing scorecards, and creating resources. The server supports various tools for blueprints, entities, and scorecards, and can be installed and configured using UVX, Docker, or Cursor. It also includes an AI agent tool for invoking Port AI agents with specific prompts.

DiceDB MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for DiceDB, enabling interactions between AI applications and DiceDB database servers. Key features include PING to check connectivity, ECHO to send messages, GET and SET for key-value operations, DEL to delete keys, and INCR/DECR to modify integer values. It supports installation via binary download, Go, and building from source.

A11y MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for performing accessibility audits on webpages using axe-core. It provides detailed accessibility audits, summaries of issues, and filtering by specific WCAG criteria. The server can be used with AI assistants to fix accessibility issues. Features include performing detailed accessibility audits, getting a summary of accessibility issues, and including HTML snippets for easier debugging.

k6-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for running k6 load tests. It provides simple integration with the MCP framework, support for custom test durations and virtual users, an easy-to-use API for running k6 load tests, and configurable environment variables. Key features include real-time test execution output, LLM-powered results analysis, and effective debugging of load tests.

MCP Image Downloader is an MCP server that provides tools for downloading and optimizing images. It includes features such as downloading images from URLs with proper error handling, and optimizing images with options for resizing, quality adjustment, and format conversion.

MCP Filesystem is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes resources for each file in a working directory and sends change notifications. Key features include creating MCP resources for each file, supporting .gitignore rules, detecting file changes, MIME type detection, and handling various text encodings.

This MCP server for kintone is a sample code that allows integration with kintone, enabling users to reference, update, and create kintone data and applications. Key features include record and file operations, app information and management, space operations, and user/group information retrieval.

YouTube Watch Later MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to a custom YouTube playlist. It allows users to retrieve URLs of videos added to the specified playlist within a configurable number of days. Key features include OAuth2 authentication for secure access, a simple interface that returns video URLs, and easy installation and setup via Smithery or manual methods.

This repository contains the Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools for using Graph API, Azure REST API, and Power Platform Admin APIs/Dataverse APIs. It includes features such as integration with VSCode Insiders, Azure CLI, and Power Platform CLI, and provides a framework (GenAIScript) to communicate with AI models. The main functionalities include web service interaction, API usage, and local development setup.

Solana Chad MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server that allows LLMs to interact with your Solana wallet and trade SOL using natural language. Key features include checking SOL balance, getting real-time SOL price, retrieving block information, and generating MACD and RSI charts. It uses Rust for the server, Solana RPC for blockchain interactions, and supports LLMs like Claude and ChatGPT.
This tool integrates with Mermaid to render diagrams as images, enabling on-the-fly generation of visual representations for data structures, workflows, or system architectures.

Kontxt MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to index and analyze local code repositories. It provides tools for AI clients like Cursor and Claude Desktop, using Gemini 2.0 Flash's 1M input window to generate context based on user queries. Key features include connecting to a local code repository, providing context generation tools, supporting both SSE and stdio transport protocols, and tracking token usage. The server also supports user-attached files/docs/context for more targeted analysis.

Minecraft Docker MCP is an MCP server for Minecraft-in-Docker that enables AI interactions with a running Minecraft server using itzg's docker-minecraft-server container. It allows server administration and programmatically creating in-game builds, leveraging RCON commands for interaction.

TxtAI Assistant MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for semantic search and memory management using txtai. It provides features such as semantic search across stored memories, persistent storage with file-based backend, tag-based memory organization and retrieval, memory statistics and health monitoring, automatic data persistence, and integration with Claude and Cline AI. The server also includes comprehensive logging, configurable CORS settings, and robust API endpoints for storing, searching, and managing text-based memories.

LanceDB MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for LanceDB vector database operations. It enables efficient vector storage, similarity search, and management of vector embeddings with associated metadata. Key features include table management, vector operations, and configurable vector dimensions.

EDUCHAIN Agent Kit is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides tools and resources for interacting with EDUCHAIN. It allows users to query information about tokens and pools, perform wallet operations, execute swap operations, and check for arbitrage opportunities. Key features include getting token and pool information, wallet operations, swap operations, and arbitrage detection.

Crypto Trader MCP Tool for Claude Desktop is a tool that provides cryptocurrency market data using the CoinGecko API. It offers real-time cryptocurrency price data, detailed market information, historical price charts, cryptocurrency search functionality, trending cryptocurrencies tracking, and global market statistics. The tool integrates with Claude Desktop and includes features like get_crypto_price, get_crypto_market_data, get_crypto_historical_data, search_crypto, get_trending_crypto, and get_global_crypto_data.

MCP MIDI Server is a FastMCP Server that allows an LLM to send MIDI sequences into any software that supports MIDI input. Main features include creating a virtual MIDI output port, sending MIDI Note On/Off and Control Change (CC) messages, sequencing MIDI events with precise timing, and can be used as a MIDI input device in any application that supports MIDI.

SourceSage is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that efficiently memorizes key aspects of a codebase—logic, style, and standards—while allowing dynamic updates and fast retrieval. It is designed to be language-agnostic and leverages the LLM's understanding of code across multiple languages. Main features include Language Agnostic support, Knowledge Graph Storage, LLM-Driven Analysis, Token-Efficient Storage, Incremental Updates, and Fast Retrieval.

School MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for academic tools, integrating with Canvas and Gradescope platforms. It provides features such as fetching and displaying upcoming assignment deadlines, calendar integration to add deadlines to macOS Calendar or Reminders, and file management to download course materials from Canvas. The server also includes tools for listing courses, adding assignments to reminders, and configuring download paths.

Sentry MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Sentry API, allowing AI assistants to retrieve and analyze error data, manage projects, and monitor application performance. Key features include listing and managing Sentry projects, retrieving and analyzing issues and events, and creating new projects. It supports multiple IDEs and requires a Sentry authentication token.

Inoyu Apache Unomi MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that enables Claude to maintain user context through Apache Unomi profile management. It provides features such as profile lookup and creation, profile property management, basic session handling, and scope management for context isolation. The server supports email-based profile lookup, automatic session management, and tools for getting, updating, and searching profiles. It also includes integration with Claude Desktop and requires a running Apache Unomi server.

Filesystem MCP Server is a Node.js server that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to provide secure, efficient, and token-saving access to project files. It offers a wide range of filesystem tools, including listing, reading, writing, editing, searching, and managing directories and permissions. Key features include batch operations, direct API usage, and robust validation. The server can be easily integrated via `npx`/`bunx`, Docker, or local build, and it ensures all operations are confined to the project root for security.

mcp-jinaai-search is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates Jina.ai's Search API with LLMs. It provides advanced web search capabilities, fast and efficient content retrieval, clean text extraction, and support for various content types. Features include configurable caching, optional image and link gathering, localisation support, and token budget control.

mcp-turso-cloud is an MCP server that integrates with Turso databases, providing a two-level authentication system for organization-level and database-level operations. It supports features like listing, creating, and deleting databases, generating database tokens, listing tables, executing read-only and destructive SQL queries, describing table schemas, and performing vector similarity searches.

Spheron Network MCP Plugin integrates with the Spheron Protocol SDK to provide compute deployment and management capabilities directly through Claude. Main features include deploying compute resources, fetching wallet balance, fetching deployment URLs, and fetching lease ID details. The plugin also includes recent fixes for ES module compatibility and BigInt serialization.

MCP Frontend Testing Server provides tools for frontend testing, including code analysis, test generation, test running, and component testing. It supports JavaScript/TypeScript, Jest, and Cypress. The server can be run using HTTP or Stdio transport and is deployable on Docker or cloud platforms like AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Run, or Azure Functions.
Suno 音乐生成器 MCP 服务器是一个基于 Model Context Protocol (MCP) 的服务器，允许通过调用工具使用 Suno API 生成音乐。主要特性包括与 Suno API 交互、支持自定义模式和灵感模式、继续生成已有歌曲片段、自动轮询任务状态并在完成后返回音频 URL、可配置的 API Key 和模型版本。

docker-mcp is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Docker operations, enabling seamless container and compose stack management through Claude AI. Main features include container creation and instantiation, Docker Compose stack deployment, container logs retrieval, and container listing and status monitoring. It also provides tools for creating containers, deploying Docker Compose stacks, retrieving logs, and listing containers.

MCP Paradex Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for the Paradex trading platform. It allows AI assistants to retrieve market data, manage trading accounts and vaults, place and manage orders, and monitor positions and balance. The server provides a wide range of resources and tools for system, market, account, and vault management, as well as trading analysis prompts for complex trading strategies and portfolio management.

MCP-DBLP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to the DBLP computer science bibliography database. It enables AI models to search and retrieve academic publications, process citations, generate BibTeX entries, perform fuzzy matching on publication titles and author names, extract and format bibliographic information, and process embedded references in documents. Key features include comprehensive search capabilities with boolean queries, fuzzy title and author name matching, BibTeX entry retrieval directly from DBLP, publication filtering by year and venue, statistical analysis of publication data, and direct BibTeX export capability.

Twitter MCP Server is a powerful Twitter integration for AI agents that leverages the Model Context Protocol (MCP) standard. It provides comprehensive Twitter functionality through a clean and consistent interface, including features like fetching tweets, user profiles, searching tweets, user interactions (like, retweet, post), advanced features (trending topics, timeline types, media handling), and more. The server also includes robust error handling, rate limiting, and consistent response formatting.

Notion ReadOnly MCP Server is an optimized read-only server for the Notion API, focusing on performance and efficiency for AI assistants to query and retrieve Notion content. Key features include a read-only design, minimized tool set, parallel processing, extended database access, and optimized for AI assistants. The server exposes only essential read-only Notion API tools, such as retrieving pages, blocks, databases, and comments, and includes a new `API-get-one-pager` tool for recursive retrieval of full Notion pages.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It also supports cryptocurrency data. The server integrates with AI assistants like Claude to facilitate financial data retrieval and analysis.

TriliumNext Notes' MCP Server is a model context protocol server for TriliumNext Notes, providing tools to interact with your Trilium Notes instance. It includes features such as searching through notes, retrieving note content by ID, creating new notes, updating existing notes, and deleting notes. The server can be used with Claude Desktop or VSCode, and it supports the latest version of TriliumNext v0.92.6.

Stock Info Service is a FastMCP-based stock data service that provides historical stock data, fundamental information, news, and more. Key features include fetching stock history, querying basic stock information, listing risk-warning stocks, fetching individual stock news, and providing financial news with pagination. The service is designed with a modular architecture, centralized configuration management, and comprehensive error handling.

MCP Context Manager is a collection of Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers that enhance AI models with persistent context across work sessions. It provides features like Persistent Context, Efficient Access, Session Management, and Cross-Domain Support. The Context Manager orchestrates several domain-specific MCP servers, including Developer, Project, Student, Qualitative Research, and Quantitative Research, each tailored to specific contexts and entities.

The Quantitative Researcher MCP Server is a tool for managing quantitative research knowledge graphs, enabling structured representation of research projects, datasets, variables, hypotheses, statistical tests, models, and results. Key features include persistent research context, study session management, hypothesis testing, dataset management, statistical analysis, variable relationships, research question tracking, data visualization, model performance, and research finding documentation. The server provides tools for starting and ending sessions, loading and building context, and advanced querying. It also includes domain-specific functions for detailed research management.

Tox Testing MCP Server is an MCP server that executes tox commands to run Python tests within a project using pytest. It provides a convenient way to run and manage Python tests through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Main features include different execution modes (all, file, case, directory), support for various test groups (clients, api, auth, uploads, routes), and configuration options for timeout and app directory. The server can be used with VSCode and Cline for efficient test execution and debugging.

Substrate MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Substrate blockchains, written in Rust. It exposes dynamic Substrate blockchain operations such as querying balances, blocks, pallets, storage, events, and more via the MCP protocol. Key features include querying account balances and storage, listing pallets and their entries, fetching and filtering events and extrinsics, submitting and watching signed transactions, accessing system and block information, and making custom RPC calls to Substrate nodes. Potential use cases include AI-driven blockchain operations, custom dashboards, and monitoring systems.

JR東日本 遅延情報 MCPサーバー is a server that provides real-time delay information for JR East Japan trains. It can be used with MCP clients like Claude Desktop or MCP Inspector to fetch delay data by calling the 'getDelays' tool. The project includes setup, build, and test instructions, as well as examples of how to configure the MCP client to use this server.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-nativewind is an MCP server for transforming Tailwind components to NativeWind 4. It provides tools to transform single components, all components in a directory, and analyze Tailwind usage. The server can be used as a CLI tool or integrated into Claude for Desktop.

Website Scraper is a command-line tool and MCP server for scraping websites and converting HTML to Markdown. Key features include extracting meaningful content using Mozilla's Readability library, converting clean HTML to high-quality Markdown with TurndownService, securely handling HTML by removing potentially harmful script tags, and supporting both CLI and MCP server modes.

Twitch MCP Server is a project that integrates Twitch Chat with a Quarkus-based MCP server. It allows for interaction with Twitch chat through an MCP configuration, and can be run using JBang or integrated with Claude Desktop. The main features include building and running the MCP server, setting up the Twitch channel and API key, and integrating it with different tools like MCP Inspector and Claude Desktop.

MCP Codebase Insight is a system for analyzing and understanding codebases through semantic analysis, pattern detection, and documentation management. It includes features such as a Core Vector Store System, Basic Knowledge Base, SSE Integration, Testing Framework, TDD and Debugging Framework, and more. The project is under active development with planned features like advanced pattern detection, performance optimization, and comprehensive error tracking.

MCP Variance Log is an agentic tool that looks for statistical variations in conversation structure and logs unusual events to a SQLite database. It is designed to be used with Claude Desktop or other MCP-compatible clients. Main features include automatic logging, monitoring of conversation patterns, and various query tools for reading, writing, and managing the SQLite database.

Union MCP is an MCP server designed to use Union tasks, workflows, and apps as tools. It includes setup instructions for cloning the repo, installing necessary packages, and configuring it with Claude Desktop. The server can be run locally, and it supports running workflows and using the Model Context Protocol (MCP) inspector.

Variflight MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for VariFlight flight information services. It provides tools to query flight information, weather data, and flight comfort metrics. Features include searching flights by departure and arrival, searching flights by number, getting flight transfer information, flight happiness index, real-time aircraft location, airport weather forecast, and searching flight itineraries.

MCPez is a web-based management platform aimed at simplifying the definition, configuration, management, and monitoring of backend services such as AI models, local scripts, or remote APIs. It provides a standardized proxy interface (SSE or STDIO) to expose these services, making them easy to integrate and use by other applications, especially AI agents. Key features include a web user interface, support for multiple service types (SSE and STDIO), configuration management, service state management, an AI playground for testing and debugging, and Docker support for containerized deployment.

Gmail MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for the Gmail API, providing a standardized interface for email management, sending, and retrieval. Main features include complete Gmail API coverage, support for sending and managing emails, label and thread management, settings management, secure OAuth2 authentication, and various user, message, label, thread, draft, and settings management endpoints.

MCP Server for PipeCD is a Model Context Protocol server that integrates with PipeCD, enabling the management and integration of applications and deployments. It requires configuration with environment variables such as PIPECD_HOST, PIPECD_API_KEY_FILE, and PIPECD_INSECURE. The project is licensed under the MIT License.

x64dbgmcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) plugin for x64dbg, which currently supports four functions from the x64dbgSDK: DbgCmdExec, DbgIsActive, GetModuleList, and FindMemBaseAddr. The plugin aims to make dynamic analysis as easy as conversing with an LLM and includes an HTTP server code generated by Claude Sonnet 3.7. It also provides an easy setup guide and build instructions.

Whois MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for performing WHOIS lookups to retrieve domain details, including domain name, registrar, registrant details, registration and expiry dates, name servers, and domain status. It integrates with AI agents like Claude Desktop, Cursor, and Windsurf, allowing users to check domain availability, ownership, and other important details directly through the AI without needing to browse the web.

ToolBox MCP Server is an AI-powered automation tool development platform. It provides a modular architecture for tool hot-reloading, AI assistance for natural language to tool template conversion, and enterprise-grade capabilities such as integration with MongoDB, Redis, and SSH. Key features include real-time updates, zero-downtime deployment, and a workflow tool for orchestrating complex workflows. The platform supports serial and parallel execution, transaction management, detailed reporting, and customizable output. It also includes a development guide for adding new tools, with steps for template creation, AI verification, test generation, security review, and continuous integration.
OpenDigger MCP Server is a tool that allows LLMs to access OpenDigger data. It enables interaction with the server to retrieve online data from OpenDigger and gain insights from it.

Cerebra Legal MCP Server is an enterprise-grade tool for legal reasoning and analysis. It provides structured legal reasoning, domain-specific guidance, and tools for follow-up questions and presenting legal analysis with proper citation formatting. Key features include domain detection, structured templates, citation formatting, thought quality analysis, and revision support.

MCP-Odoo is a Model Context Protocol server for Odoo integration, enabling AI agents to access and manipulate Odoo data. Key features include easy integration with Odoo instances, standard MCP interface for AI agent compatibility, rich accounting data access, and secure authentication with Odoo. The server allows AI systems to access partner information, view and analyze accounting data, perform financial record reconciliation, and query vendor bills and customer invoices.

jetson-mcp is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that allows for natural language monitoring and remote control of a Nvidia Jetson board from clients on the same network. Key features include: providing MCP tools accessible by network clients using SSE, getting hardware and software information, and easy setup and installation scripts.

This MCP Server (now deprecated) was used to add Bitcoin payment capabilities to LLMs. It includes features such as sending and receiving Bitcoin Lightning Network payments, creating and managing charges, and performing various other payment-related operations. Pprof Analyzer MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implemented in Go, providing tools to analyze Go pprof performance profiles. MCP Server for Zerocracy is a tool that integrates with Zerocracy to provide management advice and development progress updates. dify-server MCP 服务器是一个基于 TypeScript 的 Model Context Protocol 服务器，通过集成 Dify AI API 提供 Ant Design 业务组件的代码生成能力。主要功能包括聊天完成功能、支持文本和图片输入、流式响应处理等。

workos-mcp is a lightweight Model Control Protocol (MCP) server that allows agents to interact with the WorkOS API. It is bootstrapped with create-mcp and deployed on Cloudflare Workers. Unity MCP with Ollama Integration is a Unity package that enables seamless communication between Unity and local Large Language Models (LLMs) via Ollama. Together AI Image Server is a TypeScript-based MCP server for generating images using Together AI API. MCP Calculate Server is a mathematical calculation service based on MCP protocol and SymPy library, providing powerful symbolic computation capabilities. Grok AI Image Generation MCP Server is a server that connects to the xAI/Grok image generation API, allowing for the generation of images based on text prompts. Ansible Tower MCP Server is an MCP server that allows LLMs to interact with Ansible Tower, enabling automation and management of IT operations. It can be used with any LLM provider by creating a .env file based on the provided template.

Lightning Network MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI models to interact with the Lightning Network, allowing them to pay invoices. Key features include paying invoices on the Lightning Network and an MCP-compliant API for AI integration.

Alfresco MCP Proof of Concept (PoC) is a project that integrates Alfresco as a Model Context Protocol server, demonstrating how to connect Alfresco capabilities to AI using standard client-server applications. The Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server is a modular server that implements the MCP standard, providing tools for GitHub, GitLab, Google Maps, Memory storage, and Puppeteer web automation. MCP Server Practices is a Model Context Protocol server that provides tools for enforcing and automating development practices. Solr MCP is a Python package for accessing Apache Solr indexes via Model Context Protocol (MCP). MCTS MCP Server is an Advanced Bayesian Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS) engine for AI-assisted analysis and reasoning. 4o-image MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with the 4o-image API, enabling LLMs and other AI systems to generate and edit images through a standardized protocol. Main features include Text-to-Image Generation, Image Editing, Real-time Progress Updates, and Browser Integration.

MCP server for news-data is a tool that fetches up-to-date news from newsdata.io. It allows users to get the latest news, top headlines, and specific news sources in different languages and regions. MCP Browser Agent is a browser automation agent that uses the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to enable browser interactions. MCP-MultilspyLSP is an MCP server that exposes Language Server Protocol (LSP) capabilities through multilspy, providing language intelligence features such as code completions, definitions, references, and more. This tool enables AI assistants to control macOS applications by capturing screenshots, identifying UI elements, and automating mouse and keyboard actions through the macOS accessibility framework.

@b12/website-generator-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol server for generating websites with AI. It can be used with the Claude Desktop app and requires NodeJS and an MCP client. The server is configured in the 'mcpServers' section of the 'claude_desktop_config.json' file.

Cooper Hewitt Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server is a tool for interacting with the Cooper Hewitt Museum's collection API. BnF API Server is an MCP server that provides access to the Gallica API of the Bibliothèque nationale de France (BnF) and generates sequential research reports. mcp-excel-server is a project based on the Spring AI MCP framework that enables large language models (LLMs) to read and write local Excel files. Crawl4AI MCP Server is a high-performance server for web scraping, crawling, and deep research. CoinGecko API Server MCP is a Node.js solution that provides seamless access to cryptocurrency market data through a RESTful API and MCP interface. This project enhances the Memory server offered by the MCP team, integrating PouchDB for robust document-based storage. Brev MCP server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Brev. It uses the Brev CLI's API access token and currently set org.
