Kubernetes MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides seamless integration with Kubernetes APIs, enabling advanced automation and interaction capabilities for developers, operators, and AI tools. Main features include retrieving and analyzing cluster resources, monitoring deployments, pods, and services, executing common kubectl operations through AI interfaces, and troubleshooting cluster issues with AI assistance. It supports multiple IDEs and provides comprehensive tools for resource and management operations.

Memory Custom is a project that enhances the Memory server offered by the MCP team, allowing for the creation and management of a knowledge graph that captures interactions via a language model (LLM). Key features include custom memory paths, timestamping, and various API endpoints for managing the knowledge graph.

MCP Browser Use is a project that empowers AI agents to perform web use, browser automation, scraping, and automation with Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Selenium. Key features include starting and closing browser sessions, navigating to URLs, clicking elements, filling text, scrolling, sending keys, and taking screenshots. The tool aims to complete any web task with minimal human supervision based on natural language instructions.

Node Omnibus MCP Server is a comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides advanced Node.js development tooling and automation capabilities. Main features include project management, component generation, configuration management, documentation, and AI-powered assistance. It supports React, Next.js, Express, Fastify, and plain Node.js projects, and includes tools for creating projects, installing packages, generating components, and more.

Browse Together MCP is a Playwright browser and MCP Server that allows for browser automation and co-browsing. It provides a Browser Proxy Service to control a persistent Playwright browser instance via HTTP and an MCP Server to expose browser functionality to MCP clients. Features include multiple browser support, persistent browser session, named tabs, HTTP API, MCP integration, type safety, and secure API token.

Ask ChatGPT - MCP Server (Stdio) is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) stdio server that forwards prompts to OpenAI’s ChatGPT (GPT-4o). It is designed to run inside LangGraph-based assistants and enables advanced summarization, analysis, and reasoning by accessing an external LLM. Key features include summarizing long documents, analyzing configuration files, comparing options, and performing advanced natural language reasoning.

mcp-server-iris is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for InterSystems IRIS database interaction and automation. It allows for configuring and interacting with the InterSystems IRIS database, including setting up the environment with necessary parameters such as hostname, port, namespace, username, and password.

DevEnvInfoServer is a Cursor MCP server that provides detailed information about the development environment, including system and hardware details, installed tools, running processes, and more. It enhances Cursor's intelligent agent by providing context-aware assistance, making it a valuable tool for developers.

IMF Data MCP is a server that integrates with the free IMF data API to provide tools and resources for retrieving and processing economic data. It enables users to query datasets, fetch time series data, and list available indicators and countries, making it easier to work with IMF data in a structured and programmatic way. Key features include listing datasets, getting dataset structure, fetching time series data, listing indicators, listing countries, and providing a query prompt template.

mcp-server-chatgpt-app is a tool that integrates with the ChatGPT macOS app to enable chat-based interactions. It requires the installation of specific prerequisites and configuration in the .mcp.json file or in the settings of the chatwise tool. The main features include setting up the MCP server for ChatGPT and running the server locally for development.

Mac Shell MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for executing macOS terminal commands with ZSH shell. It provides a secure way to execute shell commands with built-in whitelisting and approval mechanisms. Features include command execution, command whitelisting with security levels, pre-configured whitelist, approval workflow, and comprehensive command management tools.

Databricks MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Databricks. It provides functionalities to list catalogs, schemas, and tables, execute SQL statements, and list SQL warehouses. The server supports multiple platforms and integrates with VS Code. It uses Databricks unified authentication for secure access.

Spring AI Chrome MCP Server is a tool that allows interaction with the Chrome browser. It supports various functionalities such as opening and closing browsers, managing tabs, performing searches, navigating to URLs, clicking on links, taking screenshots, extracting page text, and more. The server can manage multiple browsers and tabs, and it provides commands for detailed control over browser operations.

Flux Schnell MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that generates images using the Flux Schnell model via the Replicate API. Main features include a `generate_image` tool, support for custom text prompts, automatic communication with the Replicate API, and comprehensive error handling and response.

Claude Deep Research is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that enhances the research capabilities of AI assistants. It integrates web and academic search functionality, allowing AI models to access current information from multiple sources, follow relevant links, and provide well-structured research results. Key features include unified research tool, multi-source integration, content extraction, academic source discovery, smart formatting, visual framework, and structured analysis.

cf-kaizen is a multi-module Spring Boot project that leverages Spring AI to provide a natural language interface for interacting with Cloud Foundry foundations. It includes MCP servers and clients, and integrates with AI models like Claude Desktop or LibreChat. The primary use case is to allow users to interact with Cloud Foundry resources using natural language, without needing to be aware of the underlying APIs. Key features include modular architecture, support for multiple AI model providers, and deployment to Cloud Foundry.

cf-kaizen is a multi-module Spring Boot project that leverages Spring AI to provide a natural language interface for interacting with Cloud Foundry foundations. It includes MCP servers and clients, and integrates with AI models like Claude Desktop and LibreChat. The primary use case is to allow users to interact with Cloud Foundry resources using natural language. Key features include modular architecture, support for multiple AI model providers, and deployment to Cloud Foundry.

@cloudwerxlab/gpt-image-1-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for generating and editing images using the OpenAI gpt-image-1 model. Key features include image generation from text prompts, image editing with text prompts and masks, integration with MCP clients, configurable output directory, and detailed error handling. The tool provides capabilities such as create_image and create_image_edit, with options to customize image size, quality, and background.

Cloudzero Model Context Protocol (MCP) server allows users to interact with their cloud cost data using a Large Language Model (LLM). It provides tools for getting billing data, listing budgets, and accessing insights. The server uses JSON-RPC 2.0 for communication and integrates with the CloudZero API. Key features include cost data retrieval, budget listing, and insight listing.

Search Stock News MCP Server provides real-time stock news search capabilities via Tavily API, with features including multiple customizable search query templates, configurable search parameters and filtering, domain-specific content filtering, and type-safe operations with TypeScript. It is compatible with various MCP clients such as Cline, Cursor, and Claude Desktop.

Crew AI MCP Server is an MCP server that provides AI agent and task management capabilities using the CrewAI framework. Main features include creating agents, creating tasks, and creating and running a crew to manage workflows. It supports Python 3.8 or higher, `jq` command-line tool, and VSCode with Roo Cline extension. The server can be used on macOS, Linux, and Windows (via Git Bash).

Ebay MCP server is a simple server that allows you to fetch auctions from Ebay.com. It uses the official MCP Python SDK for protocol communication and server interactions. The main feature is the 'list_auction' tool, which scans eBay for auctions based on a search query and can return a specified number of results. Installation requires UV, a fast Python package and project manager, and environment variables for your eBay client ID and secret.

Confluence MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Confluence, enabling AI assistants to interact with Confluence content. Key features include authentication using a personal API token, retrieving and searching Confluence pages and spaces, creating and updating content, managing comments and attachments, and handling API communication and error handling. The server also includes basic rate limiting to prevent API abuse.

Cloud Foundry MCP Server provides an LLM interface for interacting with your Cloud Foundry foundation. It is built using the Spring AI MCP project and includes features such as building the server, configuration, and environment setup for MCP client integration.

MCP Expert Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides intelligent query generation and documentation assistance using Claude AI. It analyzes API documentation and offers two main tools: create-query, which generates queries based on natural language requests, and documentation, which provides relevant documentation information based on questions.

mcp-repo2llm is a tool that transforms code repositories into LLM-friendly formats, making it easier to use AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) for code analysis and generation. Key features include Smart Repository Scanning, Context Preservation, Multi-language Support, Metadata Enhancement, and Efficient Processing. It also provides tools for processing code from GitLab, GitHub, and local repositories.

Scryfall MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Scryfall API, providing tools to look up Magic: The Gathering card details, card rulings, and price information. Main features include searching for cards, retrieving card details by ID or name, getting random cards, retrieving official rulings, and fetching current pricing information.

Filesystem MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides filesystem operations for Claude AI. Main features include read_file, read_multiple_files, write_file, create_directory, list_directory, move_file, search_files, get_file_info, and list_allowed_directories. The server ensures security by only allowing operations within specified directories.

Useful Model Context Protocol Servers (MCPS) is a collection of standalone Python scripts that implement MCP servers for various utility functions. These include extracting YouTube data, processing Word documents, rendering PlantUML and Mermaid diagrams, and converting RSS feeds to markdown. Each server provides specialized tools that can be used by AI assistants or other applications that support the MCP protocol.

My YouTube MCP Server is designed to integrate with the YouTube API for aggregated search. It uses sequential thinking to log each step, generates search queries based on user topics, fetches both short and long videos, and compiles and returns video IDs with metadata.

This project is a .NET-based superhero management system with a Clean Architecture API backend and a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for AI assistant integration. Key features include a rich domain model, CQRS pattern, minimal APIs, OpenAPI/Scalar documentation, EF Core data access, and comprehensive testing. The MCP server provides tools for managing heroes, teams, and missions, and integrates with AI assistants.

Editor MCP is a Python-based text editor server built with FastMCP, providing powerful tools for file operations. It enables reading, editing, and managing text files through a standardized API with a unique multi-step approach that significantly improves code editing accuracy and reliability for LLMs and AI assistants. Key features include file selection, read operations, edit operations, file management, testing support, and safety features.

arXiv Search MCP Server is a tool that allows users to search and fetch papers from arXiv.org. It provides features such as searching papers by category, getting the latest papers sorted by submission date, and formatted output with title, authors, summary, and link. The server can be integrated with Claude Desktop and supports various arXiv categories including Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and more.

DeepWriter MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the DeepWriter API. It provides tools for creating, managing, and generating content for DeepWriter projects through the standardized MCP interface. Key features include project management, content generation, project details retrieval, MCP integration, and standard MCP protocol support.

MySQL Query MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides read-only MySQL database queries for AI assistants. It allows users to execute read-only queries, explore database structures, and investigate data directly from AI-powered tools. Key features include support for SELECT, SHOW, and DESCRIBE queries, predefined environments (local, development, staging, production), SSL connections, and query timeouts. The server is designed for data investigation and exploration and is not intended for database administration or data modification.

ScrAPI MCP Server is a web scraping solution that offers powerful, reliable, and easy-to-use features to extract data from any website. It provides tools like `scrape_url_html` and `scrape_url_markdown` to scrape web pages and retrieve the results in HTML or Markdown format. The server can be used with an API key for enhanced capabilities and is available both as a cloud service and through Docker and NPX.

DevHub CMS MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration for managing content in the DevHub CMS system. It provides tools for business and location management, content management, and media management. Features include getting and updating business and location details, managing blog posts, and uploading images. The MCP can be used with Large Language Models (LLMs) that support the MCP, allowing for seamless content management without direct API integration.

xcode-mcp is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides tools for Xcode-related operations, making it easier to work with Xcode projects from MCP clients like Claude Desktop. The server offers utilities for Xcode project management, building, testing, archiving, code signing, and related iOS development tools. Features include Xcode project information retrieval, enhanced build capabilities, comprehensive test execution, app archiving, code signing, Swift Package Manager integration, iOS Simulator management, and real device app deployment.

CockroachDB MCP Server is a tool that connects to a CockroachDB instance, exposing database and table schemas as resources, running SQL queries as tools, and providing prompts for query analysis. Main features include getting information about databases and tables, executing SQL queries with execution plan analysis, and accessing cluster metadata. It also supports integration with Claude for Desktop and Cline, and includes security considerations and troubleshooting tips.

MCP DigitalOcean Integration is an open-source project that provides a comprehensive interface for managing DigitalOcean resources and performing actions using the DigitalOcean API. It includes a wide range of tools and resources to simplify cloud infrastructure management, such as creating, deleting, and managing droplets, CDNs, certificates, domains, firewalls, SSH keys, reserved IPs, partner attachments, and VPCs.

MCP Bybit API Interface is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a convenient interface to interact with the Bybit API. It allows fetching market data, managing account information, and placing/canceling orders via API calls. The main features include tools for getting order book information, K-line data, ticker information, wallet balance, position information, placing and canceling orders, and more.

BirdNet-Pi MCP Server is a Python-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for BirdNet-Pi integration. It provides features such as bird detection data retrieval with date and species filtering, detection statistics and analysis, audio recording access, daily activity patterns, and report generation. The server can be configured using environment variables and includes API endpoints for various functions like getting bird detections, detection statistics, audio recordings, daily activity, and generating detection reports.

This MCP Server, developed in Go, supports SSE and stdio operations. It provides Bilibili-related tools for querying personal information (which may require login), checking the latest followed users (login required), and searching for videos. The server is currently being adapted to support personalized video content selection for AI.

Using MCP Server involves interacting with the MCP Server using supported clients such as Claude Desktop, VSCode, and Cline. The content provides a sample configuration for setting up the MCP Server in these clients, including Docker commands and environment variables.

MCP-Undetected-Chromedriver is an MCP service built on undetected-chromedriver, providing a comprehensive interface for automating Chrome browser control while bypassing anti-bot detection. Key features include rich browser operation APIs, support for screenshots, PDF export, complex page interactions, and seamless integration with the MCP ecosystem.

Patchright Lite MCP Server is a streamlined Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that wraps the Patchright Node.js SDK to provide stealth browser automation capabilities to AI models. It focuses on essential functionality and includes features such as Simple Interface, Stealth Automation, MCP Standard, and Stdio Transport. The server provides tools for browsing, interacting with web pages, extracting content, and closing browsers.

systemprompt-mcp-interview is a specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI-powered interview roleplay scenarios. It provides an interactive voice interface for interview practice, with features including real-time feedback on responses, customizable interview scenarios, advanced natural language processing, and real-time voice synthesis.

Database Tools for Claude AI is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that allows Claude AI to interact directly with MySQL databases. Main features include querying MySQL databases, executing any valid SQL query, getting information about tables, and formatted results for easy reading in Claude.

crate-mcp is a tool that uses `cargo public-api` to provide language models with information about a crate's public interface. It can be built and added to the system path for use in development workflows.

Linear MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Linear, allowing AI assistants to fetch data from Linear. The main feature is the ability to get a user's todo tickets by user ID or email address. It can be used with any MCP client and integrates with Claude Code for accessing Linear tickets directly from conversations.

GCP MCP Server is a comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, enabling AI assistants to interact with and manage GCP resources. Key features include querying and managing GCP resources, receiving AI-guided assistance, and support for various GCP services such as Artifact Registry, BigQuery, Cloud Build, and more. The server can be configured through environment variables or a configuration file and supports Docker deployment.

Enhanced Outlook MCP Server is a modular implementation that connects Claude with Microsoft Outlook through the Microsoft Graph API. It provides tools for email, calendar, folder management, and rule creation. Key features include complete OAuth 2.0 authentication, email management, calendar integration, folder organization, rules engine, modular architecture, enhanced error handling, test mode, rate limiting, and multi-environment configuration.
Device Country MCP is a simple tool that returns the country of the device based on the Cloudflare Country header, useful for web-based applications and services.

F2C MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that enables AI coding assistants to access Figma design data and convert it to high-fidelity HTML/CSS code. Key features include converting Figma design nodes to HTML/CSS, providing Figma design context to AI coding tools like Cursor, supporting Figma file URLs with fileKey and nodeId parameters, using the Figma API to fetch design metadata, and implementing the JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol for communication.

mcp-kubernetes-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to interact with Kubernetes clusters. It translates natural language requests into Kubernetes operations and supports querying, executing kubectl commands, managing, and diagnosing Kubernetes resources. Key features include command execution, read-only access, create, update, patch, and delete operations for Kubernetes resources.

LinkedIn MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol server for LinkedIn API integration, enabling AI assistants to interact with LinkedIn data. Key features include Profile Search, Profile Retrieval, Job Search, Messaging, and Network Stats. It is built with TypeScript, uses dependency injection, and provides structured logging. The server also integrates with the Model Context Protocol for seamless connectivity and includes a REST client with automatic token management.

Backlog MCP Server is an implementation that integrates the Backlog API, providing tools for project, issue, and wiki management. Features include getting, adding, updating, and deleting projects, issues, and wikis. It also includes configuration instructions for setting up the API key and environment variables, as well as usage with Claude Desktop and Docker.

Prefect MCP Server is a configuration for the Prefect workflow management system, tailored for use with the Cursor IDE. It includes setup instructions, environment configuration, and running commands. The server is designed to provide a reliable and consistent development environment for Prefect workflows.

Inked is a powerful drafting tool for novelists, report writers, and anyone working with long-form content. It provides an intuitive interface for drafting, revising, and finalizing written content through Claude's assistance. Key features include draft management, automatic versioning, persistent storage in PostgreSQL or SQLite, chapter-based organization, and multiple output format support (Markdown, Plain text, Microsoft Word, Apple Pages).
Zed GitHub Context Server is an extension that provides a Model Context Server for GitHub, to be used with the Zed AI assistant. It requires a GitHub personal access token for configuration.

Google Drive MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides seamless integration with Google Drive, allowing AI models to search, list, and read files. Key features include full-text search capabilities, file reading with format conversion, and automatic handling of different Google Workspace file types. The server supports OAuth 2.0 for secure authentication and is designed for both command-line and desktop app integration.

The WhatsApp MCP (Model Context Protocol) server is a Node.js application that enables programmatic interaction with the WhatsApp desktop application on macOS. It provides features to send messages, check WhatsApp status, and list recent contacts using AppleScript automation. The server integrates with Claude for natural language-based interactions and includes comprehensive error handling and logging.

notion-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Notion's API to manage a personal todo list. Main features include showing all tasks, adding new tasks, and updating existing tasks. It requires Python 3.11 or higher, a Notion account with API access, and a Notion integration token. The setup involves cloning the repository, setting up the Python environment, creating a Notion integration, and configuring the `.env` file.

MCP DuckDuckGo Search Plugin is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides web search functionality using DuckDuckGo. It offers advanced navigation and content exploration features, including detailed results, related searches, pagination support, domain extraction, advanced filtering, enhanced content extraction, basic web spidering, metadata extraction, social media detection, and more. The plugin is designed to work seamlessly with Claude Code or any other client that supports MCP.

This content describes a work-in-progress Python application that integrates with a local WordPress instance. It provides instructions for setting up and running the application, including creating a virtual environment, installing dependencies, and configuring the `claude_desktop_config.json` file.

MCP Image Generator is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for generating images using Together AI's image generation models. It can be run locally or using an SSE endpoint. The main features include support for Replicate and Together providers, configuration with MCP client, and the ability to generate images based on text prompts with customizable width, height, and number of images.

MCP-BOS is a modular and extensible Model Context Protocol server framework designed for Claude Desktop. It features a modular design, automatic discovery, declarative configuration, plug-and-play functionality, security, and detailed logging. The framework supports FastMCP standards and integrates with Claude Desktop for an enhanced AI experience. It is built using Python and follows a microkernel architecture.

fetch-mcp is an MCP server designed for fetching URLs and YouTube video transcripts. It supports various server types including stdio, SSE, and HTTP with a custom endpoint. The main tools provided are fetch_url, which can return HTML or Markdown, and fetch_youtube_transcript, which fetches YouTube transcripts.

mcp4gql is a Node.js/TypeScript server that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and acts as a bridge, allowing MCP clients to interact with a target GraphQL API. Main features include MCP Server implementation, Stdio Transport for communication, and a GraphQL Client using axios. It also provides generic GraphQL tools such as introspectGraphQLSchema and executeGraphQLOperation.

Obsidian Model Context Protocol is a connector that allows Claude Desktop (or any MCP client) to read and search any directory containing Markdown notes, such as an Obsidian vault. Main features include installation via Smithery, usage with VS Code, and the ability to add configuration to the User Settings (JSON) file or a `.vscode/mcp.json` file in the workspace.

Brasil API MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools to query various Brazilian data services via the Brasil API. It offers access to information such as postal codes, company registration, bank information, area codes, IBGE data, currency exchange rates, and domain registration status. The main features include CEP (Postal Codes) search, CNPJ (Company Registration) search, bank information, DDD (Area Codes) search, IBGE (Geography and Statistics) data, currency exchange rates, and .br domain registration status.

ThemeParks.wiki API MCP Server provides data from the ThemeParks.wiki API, including theme park operating hours, attraction wait times, and show times. Features include getting a list of attractions and shows in a park, getting a park's operating hours for a specific date, getting a list of all parks, and getting an attraction's wait times or a show's show times.

LaTeX to MathML MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that converts LaTeX mathematical expressions to MathML format. It provides both tool-based conversion and resource-based access, adheres to the standard MCP protocol for easy integration, and uses MathJax-node for lightweight and fast conversion. The server supports client integration and offers API details for tool-based and resource-based access.

PostgreSQL Multi-Schema MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides read-only access to PostgreSQL databases with enhanced multi-schema support. Key features include multi-schema support, schema isolation, cross-schema discovery, and metadata security. The server allows LLMs to inspect database schemas across multiple namespaces and execute read-only queries while maintaining schema isolation.

Jenkins Server MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with Jenkins CI/CD servers. It enables AI assistants to check build statuses, trigger builds, and retrieve build logs through a standardized interface. Key features include getting build status, triggering builds, and retrieving build logs.

EntraID MCP Server (Microsoft Graph FastMCP) is a modular, resource-oriented FastMCP server for interacting with Microsoft Graph API. It supports advanced queries for users, sign-in logs, MFA status, and privileged users. Key features include modular resource structure, centralized graph client, comprehensive user and group operations, application and service principal management, sign-in log and MFA operations, password management, permissions helper, error handling, and security best practices.

Rollbar MCP Server is a dynamic MCP server implementation for Rollbar API integration, enabling LLMs to interact with Rollbar error tracking data. Main features include listing and filtering error items, getting detailed error information, viewing error occurrences, accessing project and environment details, tracking deployments, and listing users and teams.

Payman API MCP Server is an MCP server that provides seamless integration with Payman AI's payment APIs, allowing AI assistants to create payees, search for existing payees, send payments, and check balances through natural language. Key features include secure API authentication, multiple payee types (TEST_RAILS, US_ACH, CRYPTO_ADDRESS), payment operations, search capabilities, comprehensive error handling, and support for both stdio and SSE transports.

Hubble AI for Solana is an AI-powered analytics tool that provides data analysis and visualization for Solana blockchain transactions with natural language queries. Main features include data querying (view recent transactions, check current prices, identify top token holders, analyze transaction patterns) and data visualization (transaction volume trends, price movements over time, distribution analytics, custom visualizations based on your queries).

OneNote MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for browsing and interacting with the OneNote web app using browser automation. It allows AI assistants and other MCP-compatible clients to programmatically browse and interact with OneNote notebooks shared via web links. Key features include navigating OneNote's hierarchical structure, reading and adding content to pages, creating new pages, searching within OneNote, taking screenshots, and maintaining state across the session.

iFlytek Workflow MCP Server is a tool that enables the creation and execution of intelligent workflows. It supports 14 types of workflow nodes, various execution modes (sequential, parallel, loop, nested), and multiple development paradigms. The system also includes robust node support, advanced orchestration modes, and multi-model support, making it suitable for diverse business scenarios.

mcp-server-emojikey is an MCP server for persisting LLM relationship context as emoji-based memory keys. It allows Claude to maintain consistent interaction styles and remember relationship context across conversations. Features include storing emojikeys online, setting and retrieving emojikeys, creating superkeys, and viewing emojikey history.

MCP Image Extractor is an MCP server designed for extracting and converting images to base64 for LLM analysis. It provides tools to extract images from local files, URLs, and process base64-encoded images. The server automatically resizes images to optimal dimensions (max 512x512) for LLM analysis to limit the size of the base64 output and optimize context window usage. It also includes manual installation instructions and Docker support.

AWS MCP (Model Context Protocol) is a server that allows AI assistants like Claude to interact with the AWS environment using natural language. Key features include querying and editing AWS resources, support for multiple AWS profiles and SSO authentication, multi-region support, secure credential management, and local execution with your AWS credentials.

Portfolio Manager MCP Server is a tool for managing and analyzing investment portfolios. It offers features such as portfolio management, real-time market data, performance analysis, personalized investment recommendations, and visualization of portfolio allocation. The server can be integrated with Claude Desktop and supports both Stdio and SSE transport modes. Future work includes extracting portfolio data from finance or banking applications, enabling client modifications, automated rebalancing, cryptocurrency support, and mobile application integration.

MCP Status Observer is a tool that allows Claude Desktop to monitor and query the operational status of major digital platforms using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Key features include monitoring the world's most used digital platforms, getting detailed status information for specific services, checking the status of specific components within each platform, and providing real-time updates of service status. It supports natural language prompts and offers a simple query interface with commands like `status --github`.

YouTube Music MCP is a server that allows you to search for and play tracks on YouTube Music directly from your AI assistant. It includes tools like `searchTrack` for searching tracks by name and `playTrack` for playing them in your default browser. The project requires a Google YouTube API Key and can be integrated with Cursor or other AI assistants.

PromptLab is an intelligent system that transforms basic user queries into optimized prompts for AI systems using MLflow Prompt Registry. It dynamically matches user requests to the most appropriate prompt template and applies it with extracted parameters. Key features include Centralized Prompt Management, Dynamic Matching, Version Control, and Extensibility. The system consists of a Prompt Registry, Server, and Client, and supports a wide range of prompt types for various use cases.

ClickHouse MCP Server is an MCP server for ClickHouse, providing features such as executing SQL queries, listing databases, and listing tables. It includes tools like `run_select_query`, `list_databases`, and `list_tables`. The server requires configuration with ClickHouse credentials and can be set up using a Docker Compose environment for development.

Shared Knowledge MCP Server is a knowledge base server that can be used across multiple AI assistants (CLINE, Cursor, Windsurf, Claude Desktop). It utilizes Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) for efficient information search and retrieval. Key features include: shared knowledge base across multiple AI assistants, high-precision information search with RAG, TypeScript implementation for type safety, support for multiple vector stores (HNSWLib, Chroma, Pinecone, Milvus), and extensible interfaces.

Perplexity MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the Perplexity API, enabling AI assistants like Claude and Cursor to access Perplexity's powerful search and reasoning capabilities. Key features include web search and retrieval of up-to-date information, complex reasoning tasks, real-time data access, and seamless integration with AI assistants. The server can be easily installed using Homebrew, from source, or via pre-built binaries.

OpenAPI MCP Server is a command-line tool that transforms any OpenAPI service into a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server, enabling seamless integration with AI agents and tools that support the MCP specification. It acts as a bridge between OpenAPI services and MCP clients, automatically generating an MCP-compliant server and translating between MCP and REST conventions. Key features include taking an OpenAPI specification file as input, proxying incoming requests to the actual OpenAPI service, and making any existing REST API with an OpenAPI specification immediately accessible to AI agents that understand MCP.

mcp-cli-exec MCP Server is a powerful CLI command execution tool that enables running shell commands with structured output. Key features include executing raw and multiple CLI commands in a specific working directory, returning detailed execution results, handling errors gracefully, and providing comprehensive error handling and debugging tools. It supports both Windows and Unix-like systems and can be installed via npm or pnpm.

MCP Tradovate Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Tradovate integration in Claude Desktop. It enables AI assistants to manage Tradovate trading accounts through natural language interactions. Main features include complete Tradovate API integration, secure authentication handling, real-time market data access, account management, risk management controls, and order placement and management.

Tlon MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides tools for interacting with Tlon agents. Key features include sending direct messages, reading DM history, listing contacts, and natural language support for referencing people by nicknames. The server can be configured with environment variables and supports both stdio and HTTP transport types.

Clanki is an MCP server that enables AI assistants like Claude to interact with Anki flashcard decks. Main features include creating and managing Anki decks, creating basic and cloze deletion flashcards, updating existing cards, adding and managing tags, and viewing deck contents and card information. It fully integrates with AnkiConnect.

mcp-document-reader is an MCP server for interacting with PDF and EPUB documents. It can be used with the Windsurf IDE by Codeium, which only supports MCP tools. The tool requires Python 3.11+ and Poetry for installation and setup. It also includes testing and linting commands for development.
Dify Workflows MCP 服务器是一个用 TypeScript 实现的 Model Context Protocol (MCP) 服务器，将 Dify 工作流作为工具暴露出来。主要特性包括：将 Dify 应用程序转换为 MCP 工具、支持从 Dify 工作流流式响应（待实现）、通过命令行参数进行配置、使用 TypeScript 编写以确保类型安全性。

Jina AI MCP Server provides seamless integration with Jina AI's neural search capabilities, enabling semantic search, image search, and cross-modal search functionalities through a simple interface. Main features include semantic search, image search, and cross-modal search, with support for various error handling and response formats.

Joern MCP Server is an MCP Server based on Joern, providing a series of features to help developers with code review and security analysis. It includes tools for setting up the environment, starting the Joern server, testing the connection, and configuring the MCP server. The project structure includes main program, test programs, utility functions, and configuration files.

RedNote MCP is a service for accessing and searching content on the Xiaohongshu (小红书) platform. It provides features such as authentication management, keyword search for notes, command-line initialization, and access to note content via URLs. The tool requires initial login to persist cookies and can be integrated with tools like Cursor for enhanced functionality.

comfy-ui-mcp-server is an MCP server for connecting to a local comfyUI, implementing a simple note storage system. It supports custom note:// URI scheme, storing notes with name, description, and text/plain mimetype. The server provides a prompt to summarize all stored notes and a tool to add new notes, updating the server state and notifying clients of changes.

This MCP Server Guide provides instructions on building an MCP server, including the necessary commands to compile TypeScript files and generate a build directory. It also includes guidance on setting up environment variables and reaching out for support or feedback.

mcp-servers-jos is a collection of Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers by JOS, starting from an MCP Template. It includes the juce-docs-mcp-server, which provides access to JUCE Framework C++ class documentation.
This utility integrates with qrencode to generate QR codes dynamically, supporting various output formats and configuration options for flexible use in applications and workflows.

Biomart MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that interfaces with Biomart databases to provide tools for interacting with biological data. Main features include Mart and Dataset Discovery, Attribute and Filter Exploration, Data Retrieval, and ID Translation. It is useful for researchers and developers working with biological data.

FRED MCP Server is an implementation for accessing the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) API, providing tools to search and retrieve economic data series. Key features include Series Search and Series Observations with options for date range filtering, frequency adjustment, aggregation methods, and sorting/pagination.

Figma to React Native MCP is a tool that converts Figma designs into React Native components. It extracts components from Figma, generates corresponding React Native components with proper typing and styling, maintains component hierarchy, handles component props and types, and supports nested components. The tool also includes features for easy installation, configuration, and usage in the Cursor IDE.

MCP Bitbucket Python is a Python implementation of an MCP server for Bitbucket integration, enabling secure, local tool access for AI applications. The server provides tools for creating and managing repositories, branches, files, issues, and pull requests, as well as searching repositories. It requires Bitbucket credentials to be set up as environment variables.

MCP JIRA Python is a Python implementation of an MCP server for JIRA integration. It provides tools to manage JIRA issues, including creating, deleting, and updating issues, as well as adding comments and attachments. The server runs locally and integrates with the Claude Desktop application. Key features include issue management, user lookup, and JQL search capabilities.

GitHub MCP Server for Pera1 is a Model Context Protocol server that connects GitHub code to Claude.ai. It extracts code from GitHub repositories and provides better context to Claude. Main features include the ability to filter files by directory paths, extensions, specify branches, and display modes. It can be used to ask Claude about specific GitHub repositories, directories, files, and branch structures.

Playwright-Lighthouse MCP Server is a tool that analyzes web site performance using Playwright and Lighthouse. It provides features such as performance analysis with Lighthouse, screenshot capture, and can be integrated with clients that support the Model Context Protocol (MCP). The server supports running Lighthouse performance analysis and taking screenshots of web pages.

Jina AI MCP Server provides access to Jina AI's powerful web services through Claude, offering features such as web page reading and content extraction, web search, and fact checking/grounding. The server supports multiple output formats, configurable search results, and factuality scores with supporting evidence.

KMB Bus MCP Server provides real-time access to Hong Kong's KMB and Long Win Bus route information and arrival times. Features include real-time bus arrival information, comprehensive bus route queries, bus stop information and searches, route-stop mapping, caching system to optimize API calls, and bilingual support (English and Traditional Chinese).

shell-mcp is an MCP server implementation that provides secure shell command execution capabilities for LLMs. Main features include Secure Execution, Resource Control, Timeout Control, Size Limits, and MCP Integration. It supports a variety of shell commands such as ls, cat, pwd, df, and more, and can be integrated with MCP-compatible LLMs like Claude.

MCP Server Template for Cursor IDE is a simple template for creating custom tools for Cursor IDE using Model Context Protocol (MCP). It includes quick start instructions, alternative setup methods (Docker, traditional Python setup, and direct in Cursor IDE), and environment variable configurations. The template also provides integration with Heroku, Smithery, and Glama for easy deployment and management.

Image Tools MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) service for retrieving image dimensions and compressing images, supporting both URL and local file sources. Main features include retrieving image dimensions from URLs and local files, compressing images using TinyPNG API, converting images to different formats, and fetching image links from Figma API.

WhereAmI MCP Server is a lightweight server that provides geolocation data based on the user's current IP address. Main features include fetching specific location data, generating a comprehensive location report, natural language prompts for detailed results, robust error handling, and minimal dependencies. It supports various location types such as IP, country, city, latitude, longitude, timezone, ISP, and ASN.

The Square MCP Server (Old Version) is a deprecated Model Context Protocol server that provides access to Square API functionality, which is primarily used for payment processing. The setup involves installing dependencies, setting environment variables like SQUARE_ACCESS_TOKEN and SQUARE_ENVIRONMENT, and running the server. Users are advised to migrate to the new repository for the latest, officially supported version.

PubMed Enhanced Search MCP Server is a Model Content Protocol server that provides enhanced tools to search and retrieve academic papers from the PubMed database. Key features include searching by keywords with optional journal filters, sorting results by relevance or date, MeSH term lookup, publication count statistics, and PICO-based evidence search. The server also supports detailed paper information retrieval and includes rate limiting and automatic retry mechanisms.

Xcode Diagnostics MCP Plugin is a Model Control Protocol (MCP) plugin for extracting and viewing errors and warnings from Xcode build logs. It connects to Xcode's build system to extract, parse, and display diagnostics (errors and warnings) from Swift projects. Main features include listing all Xcode projects with build logs, extracting and parsing errors and warnings, providing detailed information about each issue, and supporting various types of Xcode diagnostics including errors, warnings, and fix-it suggestions.

XRPL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides AI models with access to XRP Ledger data and functionality. It enables AI models to retrieve account information, query trust lines and issued currencies, view NFTs owned by accounts, retrieve transaction history, access order book data from the DEX, submit signed transactions, and get server status information. The server can be easily integrated with MCP-compatible AI applications.

WIP: MCP Server Superset is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server application built on the Apache Superset REST API. It provides basic query capabilities, including querying databases, tables, and fields, as well as executing SQL. The project includes environment requirements, quick start instructions, configuration details, and deployment steps.

n8n MCP Server provides access to n8n workflows, executions, credentials, and more through the Model Context Protocol. This allows Large Language Models (LLMs) to interact with n8n instances in a secure and standardized way. Core features include listing and managing workflows, viewing workflow details, executing workflows, managing credentials, handling tags and executions, generating security audits, and managing workflow tags. Enterprise features require an n8n Enterprise license and include project management, variable management, and advanced user management.

OpenAI Agents MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes OpenAI agents through the MCP protocol. It includes specialized agents for web search, file search, and computer actions, as well as a multi-agent orchestrator. Main features include real-time web information retrieval, file analysis in OpenAI's vector store, and safe computer actions. The server can be installed via Smithery and configured using environment variables.

ArangoDB MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol for ArangoDB. It provides tools for executing read-only and read-write queries, listing databases and collections, and managing database connections. Key features include `readQuery`, `readWriteQuery`, `listDatabases`, and `listCollections`.

Gmail MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides Gmail integration capabilities to MCP clients like Claude Desktop. Main features include viewing recent emails, searching emails using Gmail's search syntax, and secure OAuth2 authentication with the Gmail API. The server also supports resource access to recent emails, tool support for email search, and automatic token refresh.

markdown-to-html MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that converts Markdown to HTML. The main feature is the `markdown_to_html` tool, which takes mdContent as a required parameter. It includes instructions for installation, development, and debugging.

MCP Yahoo Finance is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Yahoo Finance. It provides tools to get pricing, company information, and generate financial visualizations. Key features include financial data retrieval, such as current and historical stock prices, dividends, income statements, and cashflow statements, as well as visualization tools for market sentiment, portfolio tracking, and technical analysis.

Starknet MCP Server is a comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the Starknet blockchain. It provides AI agents with the ability to interact with Starknet networks, query blockchain data, manage wallets, and interact with smart contracts. Key features include full Starknet blockchain integration using Starknet.js, support for both Mainnet and Sepolia testnet, StarknetID resolution, native token support, smart contract interaction, and dual transport options (stdio and HTTP).

Provides a secure local sandbox for developing, compiling, and visualizing GPU shaders using Vulkan without requiring physical GPU hardware. This tool is useful for developers working on GPU-related projects.

Atrax is a proxy for Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers that aggregates multiple MCP servers and presents them as a single unified interface. Key features include resource aggregation, transparent proxying, protocol compliance, modular design, support for multiple transport types, enhanced error handling, web integration, and authentication support.

Brave Search MCP Server is an implementation that integrates the Brave Search API, providing Web Search, Local Points of Interest Search, Video Search, Image Search, and News Search capabilities. Features include web searches, image searches, news searches, video searches, and local points of interest searches with options for result count, freshness, and more.

Java Conferences MCP Server is a tool that allows AI models to retrieve information about upcoming Java conferences. It fetches and parses data from a public GitHub repository, providing details such as conference names, dates, locations, CFP links, and more. The server is built using Spring Boot and Spring AI with MCP starter, and it can be connected to an MCP client like Claude Desktop for easy access to the conference information.

ledger-service MCP server is a tool for accessing and managing ledger files. It provides three main tools: list-accounts, account-balance, and account-register, which allow users to list all accounts, get the balance for a specific account, and view the transaction register for an account, respectively. The server can be installed via PyPI and configured for use with Claude Desktop.

tailscale-mcp is a small MCP server that allows Claude to query Tailscale status by running the `tailscale` CLI on macOS. It supports both STDIO and HTTP/SSE transports, and requires Python, Tailscale, and uv for dependency management.

Bazel MCP Server is a local MCP server that exposes functionality of the Bazel build system to MCP-enabled AI agents. It provides tools for building, querying, testing, and managing Bazel targets and dependencies. Main features include commands for building, querying, testing, listing, and fetching dependencies, as well as setting the workspace path. The server can be configured using command line arguments, environment variables, or a configuration file.

Ollama-MCP-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with local Ollama LLM instances to provide advanced task decomposition, evaluation, and workflow management. Key features include complex task breakdown, result evaluation and verification, Ollama model management and execution, standardized communication via MCP protocol, enhanced error handling, and performance optimizations such as connection pooling and LRU caching.

NFTGo MCP is a Model Context Protocol server that provides HTTP requests to the NFTGo Developer API. It supports Ethereum and offers key features such as retrieving NFT collection details, accessing NFT asset information, analyzing market data and analytics, viewing user and wallet information, and providing advanced search and filtering capabilities. Additionally, it supports real-time data and notifications through webhooks and live data feeds.

Agentipy MCP Server for Claude Desktop is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides onchain tools for Claude AI, allowing it to interact with the Solana blockchain. Main features include interacting with the Solana blockchain, executing transactions, querying account information, managing Solana wallets, getting price predictions, trading and staking tokens, deploying new tokens, and accessing comprehensive token information from CoinGecko. The server also supports cross-chain bridge transactions using deBridge and real-time price data from Pyth Network.

mcp-idb is an MCP server integration for Facebook's iOS Development Bridge (idb), enabling automated iOS device management and test execution through MCP. Features include automated test development, screenshot testing, automated interactions, and installing/removing applications. It requires idb to be installed and configured.

clickup-operator MCP server is a tool for developers to manage and interact with notes. It provides features such as a custom note:// URI scheme, a prompt to summarize stored notes, and a tool to add new notes. The server can be configured and run on both MacOS and Windows, and it supports building, publishing, and debugging.

nostr-code-snippet-mcp is a tool for developers to integrate with the Claude application, allowing them to run code snippets and interact with Nostr relays. It includes setup instructions for different operating systems and commands for installing dependencies, building the project, and running the inspector.

Norman Finance MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI to interact with the Norman Finance API, providing access to accounting, invoices, companies, clients, taxes, and more. Key features include secure authentication, company management, accounting, invoicing, client management, tax handling, and document management. The server supports OAuth and environment variable-based authentication and can be integrated with Claude.ai for enhanced functionality.

MCP Server for NovaCV is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with the NovaCV resume service API. It provides features such as generating PDF resumes, obtaining available resume templates, converting resume text to JSON Resume format, and analyzing resume text content. The server can be installed and configured with an API key from the NovaCV API website. It also includes command-line options and environment variable configurations for easy setup and use.

Nia Codebase MCP server allows integration with Nia's codebase understanding capabilities through function calling in tools like Cursor, Claude Desktop, and other MCP-compatible clients. Key features include support for two transport methods (stdio and SSE), usage in MCP clients, example prompts for analyzing project structure and understanding code components, debugging options, and environment variable configuration. The main tool provided is lookup_codebase_context, which retrieves relevant code snippets based on user queries.

Ntropy MCP server is a tool for enriching banking data using the Ntropy API. It allows LLM agents working with financial data to easily call various Ntropy API endpoints, including creating and updating account holders, enriching transactions, and managing transaction data. The server provides functionalities such as checking connection, setting API keys, and bulk enrichment of transactions.

Zipic MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides image compression capabilities. It enables LLMs to compress and optimize images through simple and advanced compression tools. Main features include Quick Image Compression, Advanced Compression, Multiple Format Support, Batch Processing, and Size Preservation Option. The server supports various command line arguments and can be configured for use with Claude.app and Cursor. It is useful for website optimization, storage management, format conversion, batch processing, and social media preparation.

ComfyUI MCP Server is a lightweight Python-based MCP server that interfaces with a local ComfyUI instance to generate images programmatically via AI agent requests. It supports flexible workflow selection, dynamic parameters for image generation (such as prompt, width, height, and model), and returns image URLs served by ComfyUI.

Nina_advanced_api_mcp is an interface for AI agents to control N.I.N.A (Nighttime Imaging 'N' Astronomy) software through its Advanced API. It provides complete equipment control for AI agents, including cameras, mounts, focusers, filter wheels, domes, and rotators. The tool also integrates AI features such as natural language command processing, contextual help, intelligent error responses, and automated decision making. It supports most of the NINA advanced API v2 endpoints.

Lightning Network MCP Server allows large language model (LLM) agents to query Lightning node data using natural language. It supports gRPC or Lightning Node Connect (LNC) and returns both human-readable summaries and machine-readable JSON output. Key features include basic channel queries, support for invoices, nodes, and routing data, and compatibility with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) specification.

Kobold MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for interfacing with KoboldAI, enabling integration between KoboldAI's text generation capabilities and MCP-compatible applications. Main features include text generation, chat completion with persistent memory, OpenAI-compatible API endpoints, Stable Diffusion integration, and more.

GitHub MCP Server Plus is a tool for interacting with the GitHub API, providing features such as file operations, repository management, and advanced search. Key features include automatic branch creation, comprehensive error handling, Git history preservation, batch operations, and support for creating and managing repositories, issues, pull requests, and more.

mcp-photoshop is a tool or library that likely provides functionalities related to image editing and manipulation, similar to Adobe Photoshop. Since the content is not detailed, it is classified based on the name, which suggests it is related to photo editing and artistic work.

pinata-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides Claude with access to Pinata, allowing interaction with Public and Private IPFS through Pinata's API. Main features include file operations such as uploading, searching, getting file details, updating metadata, and deleting files; group operations for organizing files; and content access features like creating private download links and fetching content from the IPFS gateway.

GitHub Enterprise MCP Server is a tool for interacting with the GitHub API, enabling file operations, repository management, and search functionality. Key features include automatic branch creation, comprehensive error handling, Git history preservation, batch operations, and advanced search capabilities. It supports various GitHub operations such as creating and updating files, pushing multiple files, searching for repositories, creating and managing issues, pull requests, and more.

playwright-sse-mcp-server is a service that provides Playwright as an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server. It allows MCP clients to utilize Playwright's functionalities. Key features include Docker and docker-compose setup, custom port configuration, and integration with other containers in the same Docker network. The server can be accessed via SSE (Server-Sent Events) and supports various connection methods from different environments, including development containers and host machines.

CLI for Microsoft 365 MCP Server is a work-in-progress project that integrates with the CLI for Microsoft 365. It requires Node.js 20.x or higher and uses the globally installed CLI for Microsoft 365. The server does not handle authentication, which must be done separately using the `m365 login` command. The MCP server can be tested using the MCP Inspector and can also be run in VS Code to integrate with GitHub Copilot Agent, providing 358 new tools.

Alpha Vantage Stock MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides stock market data from the Alpha Vantage API. It allows MCP clients to access real-time and historical stock data, generate stock alerts based on price movements, and access stock data as resources. Key features include getting intraday and daily stock data with customizable intervals, generating stock alerts, and accessing stock data directly as a resource.

MCP QuickJS Runner is a server implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that securely executes arbitrary JavaScript code within a QuickJS engine compiled to WebAssembly (WASM) and run using Node.js's built-in WASI implementation. Key features include secure execution in a WASM sandbox, standard I/O capture, error reporting, MCP integration, and type safety with TypeScript.

Neo N3 Model Context Protocol (MCP) v1.4.0 provides a standardized interface for AI agents and applications to interact with the Neo N3 blockchain. Key features include blockchain information retrieval, wallet and account management, asset transfers, smart contract interaction, and NeoFS (decentralized storage) functionalities. The MCP server can be easily integrated into clients like VS Code and other IDEs, and it also includes an HTTP server for RESTful API access.

MCP Unreal Server is a server implementation for interacting with Unreal Engine instances through remote Python execution. Main features include Unreal Instance Management, Remote Execution, and Logging & Monitoring. It supports automatic discovery of Unreal nodes, real-time node status monitoring, and detailed logging. The server allows executing Python code in Unreal Engine environments with support for both attended and unattended execution modes.

X (Twitter) MCP server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Twitter (X) via AI tools. It allows you to fetch tweets, post tweets, search Twitter, manage followers, and more, all through natural language commands in AI Tools. Main features include fetching user profiles, posting and deleting tweets, searching Twitter, managing bookmarks and timelines, and built-in rate limit handling.

Files-DB-MCP is a local vector database system designed to provide LLM coding agents with fast, efficient search capabilities for software projects via the Message Control Protocol (MCP). Key features include zero configuration, real-time monitoring, vector search, MCP interface compatibility, and the use of open-source models for code embeddings. It supports Docker and Docker Compose, and can be customized with environment variables.

MCP TabNews Integration is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration for TabNews, providing tools to check the status of the TabNews API, get contents, retrieve analytics, and access RSS feeds. It supports integration with AI tools like Cursor and Claude Desktop, and is built with TypeScript and Zod schema validation for type safety.

GitLab MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables interaction with GitLab accounts, providing features such as listing and managing projects, working with merge requests and diffs, adding comments and internal notes, updating merge request attributes, managing CI/CD variables, and more. It integrates with AI assistants to help with code reviews, project workflows, and repository management.

PubMed MCP Server is an implementation for accessing PubMed data, focusing on open access content. Key features include searching the PubMed database for research articles, filtering for open access content, getting detailed article information including abstracts, finding free full-text links where available, and built-in rate limiting for API compliance.

QASE MCP Server is a TypeScript-based MCP server that provides integration with the Qase test management platform. It offers tools for managing various Qase entities such as projects, test cases, test runs, test results, test plans, test suites, and shared steps. The server supports operations like listing, getting, creating, updating, and deleting these entities. It also includes instructions for development, installation, and debugging.

MCP Terminal Server is a secure command-line interface server for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that enables AI models to interact with your terminal while maintaining security and control. Main features include secure command execution with configurable permissions, file system operations within allowed paths, environment variable management, cross-platform support, and remote system connections support via command execution.

Everything MCP Server is a comprehensive Model Context Protocol Server providing system-level operations. It includes features such as file operations (read, write, list), system information retrieval, HTTP requests, and command execution.

The GIS Data Conversion MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides geographic data conversion tools. It allows LLMs to convert between different geographic data formats, coordinate systems, and spatial references. Main features include Reverse Geocoding, WKT/GeoJSON Conversion, CSV/GeoJSON Conversion, TopoJSON/GeoJSON Conversion, and KML/GeoJSON Conversion.

Bear MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to Bear Notes, which are stored in an SQLite database. Main features include reading notes, searching notes by text, and listing all tags. The server can be installed and run using Docker or NPM, and it requires Node.js, the Bear note application, and access to the Bear database.

GitHub Repo MCP is an open-source MCP server that allows AI assistants to browse GitHub repositories, explore directories, and view file contents. Key features include compatibility with various MCP clients, browsing public GitHub repositories, navigating through directories, viewing code and text files, and easy installation via package manager. It also supports optional GitHub token for higher rate limits.

MCPServe by @ryaneggz is a simple MCP Server with Shell Exec. It can be connected to locally via Ngrok or hosted in an Ubuntu 24 container using Docker. The setup includes creating a virtual environment, installing dependencies, and running the server. It also supports client MCP configuration with optional headers for API authentication.

Notion MCP Server is a tool that allows you to query and interact with Notion Pages. It enables you to create, read, and update entries in Notion databases. The server can be installed and run locally, and it requires integration with both Notion and Claude. Main features include querying Notion Pages, creating new database entries, and updating existing pages.
MCP QQ音乐测试服务器通过MCP（模块化控制协议）提供QQ音乐搜索功能。主要功能包括使用关键词搜索音乐曲目，并返回相关歌曲信息。该服务器仅用于测试和学习目的，依赖于qqmusic-api-python库。

Gemini MCP Server for Claude Desktop is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables image generation using Google's Gemini AI models. Key features include easy setup, customizable image generation parameters, integration with Claude Desktop, detailed logging, and Docker support for deployment.
The content provided does not contain enough information to determine a specific category or main features.

mcp-vcd is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for value change dump (VCD) waveforms. It provides tools like `get-signal` to fetch all changes of a specified signal name within a given timestamp range, which is useful for handling large waveform files with many signals. The tool can be installed via pip and configured in the `claude_desktop_config.json` file.

ABS MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides access to the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) Data API. It allows AI assistants to query and analyze ABS statistical data through the SDMX-ML API. Key features include dynamic discovery of available datasets, support for multiple data formats (JSON, CSV, XML), caching for improved performance, and comprehensive logging and error handling.
MCP-gotify is an MCP server designed for sending Gotify push notifications. It supports both stdio and sse installation methods, and requires configuration with a Gotify server URL and token.

Selector AI FastMCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for Selector AI, featuring a streaming-capable server and a Docker-based interactive client. Key features include real-time SSE streaming support, interactive AI chat, minimal boilerplate, built-in health checks, request/response logging, and retries. The client supports both CLI and programmatic access, and the system can be integrated with Claude Desktop.

Wallpaper MCP is a tool that allows users to generate and set wallpaper images on macOS. It uses Luma Labs AI to create images based on text descriptions. Key features include generating images, generating and setting wallpapers, and setting wallpapers from a specific path. The tool integrates with Claude Desktop and can be tested using MCP Inspector.

GitHub PR Comments MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that fetches GitHub Pull Request comments using a GitHub personal access token. Main features include fetching PR comments with file paths, line ranges, and replies, using the GitHub API via Octokit, implementing MCP server with StdioServerTransport, and returning comments in a structured JSON format.

This repository contains a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation that integrates Yahoo Finance API with LLaMA 3.2 3B, allowing the model to retrieve real-time financial data, stock information, and market news. Key features include real-time stock prices, detailed company information, historical stock data, and latest market news headlines. The MCP seamlessly enhances LLaMA's capabilities without interfering with non-financial queries.

DeepSeek MCP Server is a tool that provides code generation and completion capabilities using the DeepSeek API. It supports language-specific code generation, context-aware code completion, code optimization, tool chaining for complex operations, and built-in caching for cost optimization. The server is implemented in TypeScript and can be used with any MCP-compatible client.

MCP Apple Notes is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for semantic search and retrieval over Apple Notes. It provides features such as semantic search using on-device embeddings, full-text search capabilities, vector storage with LanceDB, and native Apple Notes integration. The tool also includes commands for listing, indexing, retrieving, searching, and creating notes.

TiDB AI MCP Server is a Model Control Protocol (MCP) server that allows Cursor to ask questions to TiDB AI. It uses stdio transport for communication with Cursor and provides a simple command-line interface. Key features include the ability to ask questions to TiDB AI, and it can be easily integrated with Cursor by configuring it as a stdio tool.

LLM Bridge MCP is a tool that allows AI agents to interact with multiple large language models through a standardized interface. It supports various LLM providers such as OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and DeepSeek. Key features include a unified interface, type safety and validation with Pydantic AI, customizable parameters, and usage tracking and metrics.

TestRail MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for TestRail that allows interaction with TestRail's core entities through a standardized protocol. Main features include Authentication with TestRail API, Access to TestRail entities such as Projects, Cases, Runs, Results, and Datasets, Full support for the Model Context Protocol, and Compatibility with any MCP client (Claude Desktop, Cursor, Windsurf, etc.).

DataForSEO MCP Server is a stdio-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for DataForSEO API. It supports various request types including SERP, Keywords Data, Backlinks, On-Page, Domain Analytics, App Data, Merchant, and Business Data APIs. The server can be run directly with npx or installed globally, and it integrates seamlessly with Node.js applications.

Modal MCP Server is an MCP server implementation for interacting with Modal volumes and deploying Modal applications from within Cursor. It supports various operations such as listing, copying, removing, uploading, and downloading files in Modal volumes, as well as deploying Modal applications. The server requires Python 3.11 or higher, the `uv` package manager, and a configured Modal CLI with valid credentials.

MCP Atlassian is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for integrating with Atlassian products (Confluence and Jira). It supports both Atlassian Cloud and Server/Data Center deployments. Key features include web scraping, content extraction, deep research, automatic retries, rate limiting, and cloud and self-hosted support. The tool provides extensive configuration options, IDE integration, and a variety of tools for interacting with Confluence and Jira.

Typesense MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that interfaces with Typesense, providing tools for server management, collection management, document operations, and search capabilities. Main features include checking the health status of the Typesense server, managing collections, performing document operations like creating, upserting, and deleting documents, and conducting keyword and vector similarity searches.
通义万相 MCP 服务器是一个基于 TypeScript 的 Model Context Protocol (MCP) 服务器，提供阿里云通义万相的文生图和文生视频能力。主要功能包括文生图能力集成、文生视频能力集成、异步任务处理以及符合 MCP 协议的支持。

SumUp Agent Toolkit is a toolkit that enhances AI applications with SumUp capabilities, enabling smarter payment workflows. It supports Model Context Protocol (MCP) and integrates with AI-powered code editors and apps like Claude or Cursor to interact with the SumUp API and documentation.

Ideogram MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides image generation functionality using the Ideogram API. Key features include prompt-based image generation, customizable parameters such as aspect ratio, model selection, magic prompts, style type, negative prompts, and the number of images to generate.

Super Shell MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for executing shell commands across multiple platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux). It provides a secure way to execute shell commands with built-in whitelisting and approval mechanisms. Key features include automatic platform detection and shell selection, command whitelisting with security levels, non-blocking approval workflow, comprehensive logging system, and platform-specific command whitelists.

k8s-interactive-mcp is a MCP server that can run Kubernetes commands with a given kubeconfig path and provide interpretation of the commands. Main features include running kubectl commands through MCP tools, flexible command line piping, automatic kubectl installation check, support for custom kubeconfig paths, and error handling with helpful messages.

MCP Desktop Automation is a Model Context Protocol server that provides desktop automation capabilities using RobotJS and screenshot functionalities. It enables LLMs to control mouse movements, keyboard inputs, and capture screenshots of the desktop environment. Key features include desktop mouse control, keyboard input simulation, screen size detection, and screenshot capabilities.

mcp-server-diff-typescript is a Model Context Protocol server that provides unified diff generation capabilities. It is useful for comparing and analyzing text differences. Main features include generating unified diffs between two text strings using the `diff` package, and it can be installed as a global package or project dependency. The server can be used with Claude Desktop and supports debugging.

MCP Gemini API 서버는 Google Gemini API를 활용하여 텍스트 생성, 이미지 분석, 비디오 분석, 웹 검색 등의 기능을 제공합니다. 주요 기능으로는 텍스트 생성, 이미지 생성 및 분석, YouTube 비디오 분석, 웹 검색 등이 있으며, Cursor와 Claude와의 연동을 지원합니다. 또한, PM2를 통한 서버 자동화, 오류 복구 기능, 환경 설정 개선 등을 포함하고 있습니다.

A Model Context Protocol server that provides read-only access to PostgreSQL databases. This server enables LLMs to inspect database schemas and execute read-only queries. 本项目旨在让大语言模型扮演海龟汤游戏主持人，使你独自一人也能享受海龟汤游戏的快乐。主要功能包括获取海龟汤游戏的完整玩法说明、获取特定谜题的完整内容、列出所有可用的谜题列表等。此外，还提供了35个谜题供用户游玩，并支持用户贡献新的谜题。
