Key features include wallet creation, wallet properties, blockchain methods, transaction methods, signing methods, provider methods, and network methods.

Raindrop MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Raindrop.io, which allows users to read and update their bookmarks using natural language. It provides features such as accessing and managing collections, creating, updating, and deleting collections and raindrops, and adding or updating tags. The server can be integrated with Claude Desktop and the Firecrawl MCP server for enhanced functionality.

Google Calendar MCP Server (Python) is a Python-based MCP server that acts as an interface between Large Language Models (LLMs) and the Google Calendar API. It enables LLMs to perform calendar operations via natural language requests. Key features include secure OAuth 2.0 authentication, core calendar actions like listing, creating, and managing events, advanced scheduling and analysis, and FastAPI-based RESTful API server.

parquet_mcp_server is an MCP (Model Control Protocol) server that provides tools for performing web searches and finding similar content. It offers two main functionalities: Web Search, which performs a web search and scrapes results, and Similarity Search, which extracts relevant information from previous searches. The server is useful for applications requiring web search capabilities and projects needing to find similar content based on search queries. It integrates with Claude Desktop and supports various APIs and services for embeddings and vector similarity searches.

Alpha Vantage MCP Server provides seamless integration with Alpha Vantage's financial data API, enabling real-time stock market data, cryptocurrency prices, forex rates, and technical indicators. Features include real-time stock quotes, historical price data, comprehensive company information, real-time crypto prices, digital currency exchange rates, live foreign exchange rates, advanced technical indicators, and more.

Meson Cross-Chain Transaction MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implemented with Deno and TypeScript, designed to facilitate cross-chain asset transfers. Key features include conversational cross-chain transaction experience, integration of the complete cross-chain transaction process, support for mainnet and testnet environments, and secure private key management. The server supports various blockchains and tokens, and provides tools for preparing, executing, and querying the status of cross-chain transactions.

Twilio Agent Payments MCP Server is designed to handle agent-assisted payments via the Twilio API. It includes features such as processing secure payments during voice calls, capturing and tokenizing payment information for PCI compliance, asynchronous callbacks, guided workflow with contextual prompts, and support for re-entry of payment information. The server integrates with MCP clients like Claude Desktop and uses Twilio API Keys for improved security. It also provides event-based logging and supports various payment-related tools and resources.

Twilio Messaging MCP Server is a tool for sending SMS messages via the Twilio API. It provides features such as sending SMS, getting status callbacks with enhanced handling, and integrates with Claude AI via the Model Context Protocol (MCP). The server can be executed directly using npx, and it supports environment variables for ngrok for callback handling. It also includes tools, resources, and prompts for interacting with the Twilio Messaging API.

macOS Notification MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to trigger macOS notifications, sounds, and text-to-speech. Main features include Sound Notifications, Banner Notifications, Speech Notifications, Voice Management, and Testing Tools. It supports system sounds, customizable visual notifications, and text-to-speech with adjustable voice, rate, and volume. The tool also provides diagnostic utilities to verify all notification methods.
MCP PPTX Server is a FastMCP server designed for creating and manipulating PowerPoint presentations. It can be installed and used with Claude Desktop.

MCP Chrome Integration is a protocol that enables AI models to control Chrome browser and perform web automation. Key features include page navigation and interaction, element manipulation, page analysis, browser features, and system integration. It supports URL navigation, element clicking, text input, form filling, JavaScript code execution, and more. The tool also includes features for managing bookmarks, browser history, downloads, and handling cookies.

FIWARE MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a bridge between the FIWARE Context Broker and other services. It includes features such as Context Broker version checking, query capabilities, and entity publishing and updating. The server is designed to interact with a FIWARE Context Broker and can be used for basic intent CRUD operations. It also supports comprehensive error handling and can be configured by modifying parameters in the server script.

MCP Docent Server is an AI-based system that generates descriptive text (docent) for images. Key features include uploading image files to generate explanatory sentences, support for registering various docent tools, and a scalable structure based on TypeScript and Express server.

Context Manager MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for managing development context and workflow. It includes features such as socket-based transport, full JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol support, session management, extensible tool registry, project and task management, checkpoint and restore functionality, and QA review workflow support.
This project is currently under active development, with features that may change, break, or improve rapidly. Contributions and feedback are welcome.

IACR Cryptology ePrint Archive MCP Server provides a programmatic interface to the IACR Cryptology ePrint Archive, enabling efficient retrieval of cryptographic research papers. Main features include searching for papers, retrieving paper metadata, and secure access to research publications.

JIRA MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates JIRA directly into any editor or application supporting MCP. Key features include viewing assigned issues, getting detailed information on specific issues, and converting JIRA issues into local tasks. The server supports integration with Cursor IDE and Claude Desktop, and provides tools for JIRA issue management.

Garmin Connect MCP Server is a tool for interacting with the Garmin Connect API, allowing users to manage their Garmin data, including workouts, health metrics, and more. It requires Python 3.x, specific Python packages, and a Garmin Connect account. The server uses the Python Garmin Connect package to interact with the API and provides functionalities such as generating tokens and registering the MCP server.

MCP Server using Spring Boot Java is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides user management tools for AI assistants. It includes features such as user management, synchronous communication mode, support for Standard I/O and Server-Sent Events transports, and integration with DummyJSON external API for user data. The server exposes various user management tools like getAllUsers, getUserById, searchUsers, addUser, updateUser, and deleteUser.

MCP Dust Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to interact with Dust agents. It includes features such as separate MCP server and test client components, interaction with Dust AI agents via the Dust API, real-time streaming responses using SSE and HTTP Stream Transport, full JSON-RPC 2.0 support, robust session management, secure API key handling, and comprehensive error handling. The server also supports the latest MCP specification and provides status endpoints for monitoring and health checks. It integrates with various IDEs and platforms like Windsurf and Claude Desktop.

This Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server provides tools to create images and videos using Amazon Nova Canvas and Amazon Nova Reel models. It requires an Amazon Bedrock account with access to the models, an S3 bucket for storage, and an MCP client like Claude Desktop or LibreChat. The server can be run using Docker, and it integrates with LibreChat to allow users to create images and videos through an agent.

mcpterm is an MCP tool server that provides stateful, TUI-compatible terminal sessions. Main features include running commands in a stateful terminal session, handling TUI apps like vim or a python REPL, and using control sequences for better interaction.

Perplexity Tool for Claude Desktop is a custom MCP tool that integrates Perplexity AI's API with Claude Desktop, allowing Claude to perform web-based research and provide answers with citations. Main features include web-based research, citation provision, and advanced options like temperature control, max tokens, search domain filter, and search recency filter.

content_name: automated bod 25 01 cisa microsoft policies mcp
description: CISA M365 MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that implements CISA Binding Operational Directive 25-01 security controls for Microsoft 365 (Azure AD/Entra ID). MCP Memory Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Claude Desktop that provides structured memory management across chat sessions, specifically designed for project-based work. Vidu MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Vidu video generation API. It provides tools for generating videos from images using Vidu's powerful AI models. EPICS MCP Server is a Python-based server designed to interact with EPICS (Experimental Physics and Industrial Control System) process variables (PVs). MCP-Grep is a grep server implementation that exposes grep functionality through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Journal RAG System is a repository for a journal Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system. base-network-mcp-server is an MCP server for the Base network, allowing LLMs to perform blockchain operations through natural language commands. LiFi MCP Server integrates with the LI.FI API to provide cross-chain swap functionality across multiple liquidity pools and bridges. It includes features such as token and chain information, cross-chain operations, wallet operations, and transaction operations. The server supports various tools for fetching tokens, getting quotes, checking statuses, and executing transactions. It also provides wallet management and can be used in both stdio and in-process modes.

DeepSeek MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with DeepSeek's powerful language models, allowing seamless integration with MCP-compatible applications like Claude Desktop. Key features include natural language request handling, automatic model fallback, resource discovery for available models and configurations, and enhanced conversation features such as multi-turn conversation support. It also provides testing capabilities with the MCP Inspector tool.
This content provides instructions to add a terminal MCP (Model Context Protocol) server to a JSON configuration file, which is useful for developers working with MCP and node.js.

Bitable MCP Server provides access to Lark Bitable through the Model Context Protocol, allowing users to interact with Bitable tables using predefined tools. Key features include listing and describing tables, executing SQL queries, and support for multiple IDEs and installation methods.

Lark MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Lark/Feishu APIs, allowing LLMs to interact with Lark services. Main features include querying employee information using Lark's Contact API, and more features are coming soon. The server supports Node.js 16 or higher, requires a Lark/Feishu application with App ID and App Secret, and can be run using command line arguments or environment variables. It also includes error handling and detailed error messages for troubleshooting.
A Simple Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for setting Vikunja reminders. It requires configuration of environment variables in a .env file.

kubevirt-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol server for KubeVirt, providing tools to list VM names, start and stop VMs, list instance types, and get VM instance types. The demo uses mcp-cli as a bridge between the kubevirt-mcp-server and LLM, with the model used being llama3.2 running locally under ollama.

GIS MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that connects Large Language Models (LLMs) to GIS operations using libraries like Shapely and PyProj. It enables AI assistants to perform geospatial operations and transformations, including comprehensive geometric operations, advanced coordinate transformations, precise distance and area calculations, spatial analysis, and validation. The server supports easy integration with MCP-compatible clients and provides a wide range of tools for geospatial analysis.

Farcaster MCP Server is a tool that allows AI models to interact with the Farcaster network, enabling functionalities such as fetching casts, searching channels, and analyzing content. Key features include retrieving user casts by FID or username, and channel casts, with optional parameters for limiting the number of results.

NVD Database MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that allows querying the NIST National Vulnerability Database (NVD) via its API. Key features include querying specific CVEs by ID, searching the NVD database by keyword, support for Server-Sent Events (SSE) for real-time communication, and compatibility with MCP-compliant clients like Claude Desktop.

Source Map Parser is a WebAssembly-based tool that helps developers map JavaScript error stack traces back to source code. It provides features such as stack parsing, batch processing, and context extraction. The tool can be integrated with MCP services and offers runtime parameter configuration for flexible use in different scenarios.

mongo-mcp-server is an MCP server designed for querying MongoDB databases. It provides a tool to get documents from a specified collection in a MongoDB database, with inputs for the collection name and database name, and outputs a list of documents.

Vapi MCP for Cursor is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates Vapi's voice AI capabilities with Cursor. It provides tools for making outbound calls, managing voice assistants, and retrieving conversation details. The setup includes environment configuration, building the server, and configuring it in Cursor. Key features include vapi_call, vapi_assistant, and vapi_conversation.
This tool provides a bridge to the Linear project management platform, enabling task creation, tracking, and workflow management through robust API interactions and comprehensive error handling.

MCP2Tavily is a MCP protocol server that implements web search functionality using the Tavily API. Main features include web search, support for Chinese descriptions, and integration with Claude extension and MCP Inspector. The setup involves cloning the repository, setting up a virtual environment, and installing dependencies. It also requires a Tavily API key for web search operations.

MCPC is a tool that allows for the creation of scalable agentic MCP servers from thousands of dependent MCPs with just one prompt. It supports general automation workflow declaration, token-saving by internally calling dependent MCP servers, and community & custom MCPs support. Key features include an intuitive web interface for instant setup, the ability to share workflows, and deep integration options via SDK, API, or CLI for advanced automation scenarios.

MySQL MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with MySQL databases, providing secure database access capabilities for LLMs. Main features include read and write operations, security measures, and performance monitoring. It supports executing SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE queries, listing tables, showing table structures, and more.

MySQL Navigator MCP is a powerful MySQL/MariaDB database navigation tool using MCP (Model Control Protocol) for easy database querying and management. Main features include connecting to MySQL/MariaDB databases, switching between different databases, executing SQL queries with type safety, retrieving database schema information, Pydantic model validation for query parameters, secure credential management, comprehensive logging system, connection pooling, retry mechanisms, SSL/TLS support, and more.

Wuying AgentBay MCP Server by Alibaba Cloud is a cloud infrastructure designed for AI Agents. It provides one-click configuration and execution environments for AI Agent tasks, including secure and efficient computing experiences, zero maintenance, and easy integration. Key features include a standard runtime environment, user state persistence, real-time edge-cloud interaction, and support for various MCP tools such as Browser, File, and Terminal. The service also supports serverless capabilities and can scale to 10,000 concurrent operations.

Alpaca MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Alpaca, allowing LLMs like Claude to interact with the Alpaca trading API. It enables trading stocks, checking positions, fetching market data, and managing your account through natural language. Main features include Market Data, Account Information, Position Management, Order Placement, and Order Management.

Azure Revisor MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server project designed for code review. It integrates with Cursor IDE and provides a tool for senior code reviewers to thoroughly review pull requests, focusing on code standards, code quality, best practices, and specific PR-related tasks. The server can be run in production mode and is useful for ensuring code consistency, compliance, and security.

MCP Klaudium is an enhanced MCP memory server with dynamic compression, context management, and thinking process integration. It includes basic knowledge graph functionality, enhanced memory management features such as temporal awareness, memory importance tracking, categorization system, and memory statistics. The project is under active development with plans for dynamic memory compression, context-aware memory management, thinking process integration, advanced memory categorization, and memory summarization.

ddg-mcp MCP server provides DuckDuckGo search capabilities through the Model Context Protocol. It includes features for text, image, news, and video searches, as well as an AI chat tool. The server supports various search parameters and operators, and it can be installed and configured using Python and the uv or pip package managers.

mcp-helper-tools is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides LLM Agents with system utilities and tools, including IP geolocation, network diagnostics, system monitoring, cryptographic operations, and QR code generation. Main features include encoding/decoding tools, network and geolocation services, security tools, and generator tools.

MCP Shell Server is a secure server for executing shell commands that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It allows the remote execution of authorized shell commands with support for stdin input. Key features include secure command execution, support for standard input, comprehensive output, security with shell operators, and timeout control.

Zulip MCP Server enables AI assistants like Claude to interact with Zulip workspaces. It provides tools for listing channels, posting messages, sending direct messages, adding reactions, getting channel history, managing subscriptions, and retrieving user information. The server can be set up with a Zulip bot and integrated with Claude Desktop using either npx or Docker.
The content describes a demo of a simple Figma MCP, including environment variables and testing instructions. It does not clearly fit into any specific category.

ReviewWebsite.com MCP Server provides a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects AI assistants to the ReviewWebsite.com API. It offers features such as creating, reading, updating, and deleting website reviews, converting URLs to Markdown, extracting structured data from URLs, scraping URLs, extracting links, summarizing URLs, customizing AI models, and controlling wait behavior and timing. The server supports multiple transports including stdio and Streamable HTTP, and includes CLI commands for various operations.

Firecrawl MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for web scraping, content searching, site crawling, and data extraction using the Firecrawl API. Main features include Web Scraping, Content Search, Site Crawling, Site Mapping, and Data Extraction. It supports customizable options, intelligent search, advanced web crawling, site structure mapping, and structured data extraction with schema validation and batch processing.

Airtable MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides tools for interacting with Airtable's API. It enables programmatic management of Airtable bases, tables, fields, and records through Claude Desktop or other MCP clients. Key features include base and table management, field and record operations, and support for various field types and colors.

mcp-todo-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for managing TODO.md and CHANGELOG.md files. It provides features such as precise, line-based editing and reading of file contents, efficient partial file access using line ranges, support for a wide range of character encodings, atomic operations across multiple files, robust error handling, and adherence to Semantic Versioning and Keep a Changelog conventions. The server also includes operations for adding, updating, and importing tasks and changelog entries.

TG_MCP is a lightweight Python interface that exposes TigerGraph operations such as queries, schema, vertices, edges, and UDFs as structured tools and URI-based resources for MCP agents. Key features include schema introspection, query execution, vertex and edge upsert, resource URIs, and UDF & algorithm listing.

Aliyun MCP Server provides tools for interacting with Aliyun (Alibaba Cloud) services through Claude. Main features include querying SLS (Simple Log Service) logs, and future capabilities to manage ECS instances and deploy serverless functions. The server can be configured and used with Claude Desktop and Cline in VSCode, allowing users to execute queries and return results.

dafny-mcp is a Dafny Verifier Tool for the Model Context Protocol, which can be used with Claude. It requires Dafny to be installed locally and uses the MCP Python SDK. The setup involves installing the MCP Python SDK and setting up the development environment.

User Prompt MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Cursor that enables requesting user input during generation. It allows the AI to ask for more information during generation, presents input prompts in a dialog box, and supports cross-platform functionality on Linux and macOS. Key features include User Input Prompting, Simple GUI, Cross-Platform support, and Stdio Transport integration with Cursor.

MCP Calc Tools is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides advanced mathematical and financial calculation tools for integration with AI code assistants. It includes features such as symbolic calculus, numerical methods, mathematical transforms, and financial tools like compound interest, present value, NPV, and Black-Scholes model calculations.

CiteAssist MCP server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides BibTeX-formatted citation data from CiteAs and Google Scholar. It enhances research workflows by integrating citation retrieval directly into applications. Main features include tools for retrieving citation data, installation via Claude Desktop or Smithery, and development and debugging support.

NPM Sentinel MCP is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that revolutionizes NPM package analysis through AI. It provides real-time intelligence on package security, dependencies, and performance. Key features include version analysis, dependency mapping, security vulnerability scanning, package quality metrics, download trends, TypeScript support verification, package size analysis, and maintenance metrics. The server integrates with Claude and Anthropic AI and can be installed in various environments such as VS Code, Docker, and Claude Desktop.

C.W.K. Pippa MCP Memory Manager for Cursor IDE is a complete ChatGPT-like memory system for Cursor IDE using MCP (Model Context Protocol). It allows AI assistants to maintain persistent memory across conversations, with features like storing, recalling, browsing, and managing memories. The project includes a user-friendly Streamlit interface and comprehensive documentation on MCP concepts and implementation details.

MCP Browser is a headless browser interface for the Model Control Protocol (MCP) with features including headless browser automation using Playwright, web UI for browser interaction, WebSocket communication for real-time updates, and real-time browser event subscription system. It also integrates with MCP for AI agents and supports Docker deployment.

Release Notes Server is an MCP server that generates beautiful release notes from GitHub repositories. It fetches and organizes commits by type, enriches them with PR data, and presents them in a clean, readable format. Features include smart commit filtering, grouping by commit type, detailed statistics, and efficient API usage with GitHub's `since` parameter.

Lead Qualifier MCP Tool is a lightweight tool that uses ChatGPT to qualify leads over the BANT mechanism (Budget, Authority, Need, Timeline). It guides users to enter lead information question by question. Key features include LLM-powered lead qualification info (BANT) extraction and scoring, one field per turn with conversational flow, in-memory session tracking (extendable to Redis), and compatibility with Dify/Cursor via MCP (sse).

This content provides instructions for setting up a development environment, including installing and configuring the uv tool, setting up a Python project, and configuring a local Claude desktop app. It also includes guidance on debugging MCP servers using the MCP Inspector.

MCP Apple Reminders is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Apple Reminders on macOS. It provides features such as list management, reminder retrieval, creating, completing, and deleting reminders, and proper handling of ISO date formats for due dates. The server uses AppleScript to interact with the Apple Reminders app and provides a standardized interface for AI assistants to manage reminders.

content_name: mcp deepseek v3 et claude desktop
description: Deepseek-Thinking-Claude-3.5-Sonnet-CLINE-MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that combines DeepSeek R1's reasoning capabilities with Claude 3.5 Sonnet's response generation through OpenRouter. Key features include two-stage processing, smart conversation management, optimized parameters, and tools for generating and monitoring responses.

MCP Android Agent is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for automating Android devices using uiautomator2. It allows AI agents to control Android devices through natural language. Key features include app management, UI interactions, device info retrieval, and a health check tool. Use cases include AI agent integration, remote device control, automated QA, and UI testing.

KickMCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that simplifies Kick.com API integration. It provides features such as complete Kick API integration, MCP standard compliance, and a modern TypeScript codebase. Key functionalities include authentication, chat messaging, channel and user management, stream control, polls and predictions, and webhooks. It also offers comprehensive documentation and built-in diagnostics for developers.

API-MARKET MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes API-Market's endpoints as MCP resources, allowing Large Language Models to discover and interact with APIs defined by OpenAPI specifications. It provides access to over 200+ APIs available at API.market, covering a wide range of functionalities including geocoding, routing, domain checking, news search, and more. The server can be configured in various clients like Claude Desktop and Cursor, and it includes tools for adding new APIs and managing the development workflow.

Novita MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides seamless interaction with Novita AI platform resources, specifically for managing GPU instances. Supported operations include listing, creating, starting, stopping, deleting, and restarting GPU instances, as well as managing templates and container registry authentication. It can be accessed through Claude Desktop, Cursor, or any other compatible MCP client.

MCP DateTime is a TypeScript implementation of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides datetime and timezone information to AI agents and chat interfaces. Key features include getting the current time in the local or any valid timezone, listing all available timezones, and accessing timezone information through URI resources. It supports both standard I/O mode and Server-Sent Events (SSE) mode for integration with AI systems.

Shell MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides shell command execution capabilities. It enables LLMs to execute shell commands and receive their output in a controlled manner. Key features include executing shell commands, returning combined stdout and stderr output, and providing the command execution return code. The server can be installed using uv or pip, and it supports configuration for Claude.app and Zed. Security considerations are also highlighted, emphasizing the need for caution when executing shell commands.

This document covers the setup and use of a generic ODBC server for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), referred to as an `mcp-odbc` server. It provides Large Language Models with transparent access to ODBC-accessible data sources via a Data Source Name configured for a specific ODBC Connector. Key features include tools for listing database schemas, tables, describing table columns, filtering table names, executing SQL, SPASQL, and SPARQL queries, and interacting with the Virtuoso Support Assistant/Agent.

mcp-tekton is a proof of concept of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Tekton. It includes tools and resources to list, filter, and inspect PipelineRun or other objects. The repository is archived, and ongoing work is happening upstream in the tektoncd/mcp-server project.

AWS S3 MCP Server is a tool for managing AWS S3 operations, providing secure access to S3 buckets through pre-signed URLs. Main features include listing objects, generating pre-signed URLs for accessing and uploading objects, and deleting objects from the bucket. The server can be set up with environment variables and used with Claude Desktop or via NPX command.

Multichain MCP Server is a comprehensive toolkit for building and deploying AI agents with blockchain capabilities. It includes an MCP server for AI applications, agent development tools for blockchain interactions, and a development kit for building custom AI agents. Key features include interaction with multiple blockchain networks, wallet management, fund transfers, smart contract deployment, and multi-chain DeFi protocol integrations.

MCP Server For OSV is a lightweight MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for the OSV Database API. It provides tools to query CVE IDs, affected versions, and fixed versions for specific packages, as well as to get supported ecosystems. The main features include querying for CVEs, listing affected and fixed versions, and supporting multiple ecosystems.
newsnow-mcp-server is an MCP server for NewsNow, providing access to news from over 40 sources. It can be used to fetch and integrate news data into applications.

allabolag-mcp is a project created using Bun, a fast all-in-one JavaScript runtime. It includes instructions for installing dependencies, running with an inspector, and adding a local or global MCP configuration file.

GitHub MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with the GitHub API. It allows LLM agents to manage GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, branches, files, and releases through a standardized interface. Key features include GitHub API integration, comprehensive GitHub feature management, atomic feature architecture, input validation, error handling, and rate limiting.

JIRA MCP Server integrates JIRA services with MCP, allowing you to fetch JIRA content through MCP for use with LLM. It requires configuration of environment variables such as JIRA_API_KEY, JIRA_EMAIL, and JIRA_URL. The server can be run using a simple command, and it starts an SSE service at https://localhost:8080/sse.

MCP Server for Zoom (No Auth) is a Model Control Protocol server that provides access to Zoom API functionality without requiring direct authentication from the end user. It handles OAuth flows and offers tools for interacting with Zoom recordings and transcripts. Features include OAuth credential management, listing cloud recordings with pagination, getting detailed information about specific meeting recordings, and accessing meeting transcripts.

Cribl MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI interactions with the Cribl API. It allows AI clients to discover and invoke data operations from a Cribl deployment using standardized MCP tooling. Key features include listing worker groups/fleets, getting/setting pipeline configurations, getting source configurations, restarting worker groups, and querying system metrics. The server can be run locally or via `npx` and provides natural language interaction for managing Cribl instances.

MCP-researcher Server is a powerful research assistant that integrates with Cline and Claude Desktop. It leverages Perplexity AI for intelligent search, documentation retrieval, API discovery, and code modernization assistance. Key features include seamless context tracking, advanced query processing, intelligent rate management, and high-performance networking. The server supports tools for general search, getting documentation, finding APIs, and checking deprecated code.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial data and integrating with AI assistants like Claude. The server can be set up with Python and the uv package manager, and it connects to Claude Desktop for easy access to financial information.

Project Hub MCP Server is a comprehensive tool for project management, local Git functionality, and GitHub integration. It provides features such as project creation and management, local commit and branch management, change tracking, note management, and full GitHub repository management. The server also includes tools for file snapshots, rich markdown notes, and seamless integration with GitHub.

Browser Use MCP Server is a FastMCP server that enables browser automation through natural language commands. It allows Language Models to browse the web, fill out forms, click buttons, and perform other web-based tasks via a simple API. The server supports multiple LLM providers and can be easily integrated with various MCP clients.

This module is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) for NASA's Earthdata Common Metadata Repository (CMR). It integrates AI retrievals with NASA's catalog of datasets, allowing users to search and retrieve data. The main features include integration with LLM clients like Claude desktop or chatGPT desktop, and the ability to search CMR for specific datasets based on various criteria such as time range and keywords.

MCP PRIDE Archive Search Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP)-compliant API server that provides tools to search the PRIDE Archive, a major repository for proteomics data. It allows AI models to interact with proteomics datasets programmatically using structured function calling. Main features include MCP Server powered by FastMCP, PRIDE Archive Search Tool, AI-friendly tools for biomedical and proteomics-related research, support for both http (SSE) and stdio connection modes, and easy extensibility with additional tools.

Fireflies MCP Server is designed for the Fireflies.ai API, enabling transcript retrieval, search, and summary generation. Key features include Transcript Management, Detailed Information, Advanced Search, and Summary Generation. The server provides tools to retrieve, filter, and search transcripts, as well as generate summaries in different formats.

GemForge (Gemini Tools) is an enterprise-grade integration for MCP agents, providing real-time web access, advanced reasoning, code analysis, and multi-file processing. Key features include real-time data access, complex problem solving, full repository analysis, and support for 60+ file types. It also offers intelligent model selection, robust error handling, and seamless API fallback mechanisms.

QGISMCP is an integration that connects QGIS to Claude AI through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling prompt-assisted project creation, layer loading, code execution, and more. Key features include two-way communication between Claude AI and QGIS, project manipulation, layer manipulation, execution of processing algorithms, and code execution.

Duck Duck MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation based on the DuckDuckGo search engine. It provides features such as web searching, customizable result count, regional settings, safe search level settings, structured search results with metadata, intelligent content classification, automatic language detection, and topic tag recognition.

MCP Apple Notes is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed for semantic search and retrieval over Apple Notes. Key features include semantic search using on-device embeddings, full-text search capabilities, vector storage with LanceDB, and native Apple Notes integration. It provides tools like list-notes, index-notes, get-note, search-notes, and create-note for managing and searching notes.
This tool enables secure calendar data access and synchronization through the CalDAV protocol, supporting flexible authentication methods for seamless integration into workflow tools.

MCP Git Repo Browser (Node.js) is a tool that allows users to browse and interact with Git repositories. It provides features such as returning a tree-like representation of a repository's directory structure and reading the contents of specified files in a repository. The implementation uses Node.js native modules, fs-extra for file operations, and simple-git for Git repository operations. It also includes clean error handling and resource cleanup, and reuses cloned repositories for efficiency.

REI Crypto MCP Server - Beta is a FastMCP implementation of in-house MCP servers used by Units of the Rei Network. It provides access to various cryptocurrency and DeFi APIs such as DefiLlama Pro, CoinGecko Pro, Arkham Intelligence, Elfa AI, and Codex. The server supports running each API service individually and can be configured to work with Claude Desktop. Prerequisites include Python 3.12, the `uv` package manager, and API keys for the respective services.

CyberMCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed for testing backend APIs for security vulnerabilities. It provides specialized tools and resources to identify common security issues in APIs, including authentication vulnerability testing, injection testing, data leakage testing, rate limiting testing, and security headers testing. It also offers comprehensive resources such as checklists and guides for API security testing.

ITerm MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for iTerm2 terminal integration. It allows AI assistants to interact with iTerm2 terminals, enabling features such as creating and managing terminal sessions, executing commands, reading terminal output, listing active terminals, and closing terminals. The server supports Node.js, requires iTerm2, and is designed for macOS. It includes security considerations like input validation and proper error handling.

SVM-MCP: SOON Model Context Protocol Server is a tool that integrates Claude AI with the SOON ecosystem and other SVM-based blockchains. It provides functionalities for checking wallet balances, fetching recent transactions, and viewing token holdings on both testnet and mainnet. The server uses SOON's RPC endpoints and can be customized to work with any Solana-compatible blockchain or custom SVM implementation.

couchdb-mcp-server is a TypeScript-based Model Context Protocol server for interacting with CouchDB. It provides tools for managing CouchDB databases and documents, including creating, listing, and deleting databases, as well as creating, getting, and updating documents. Additionally, it supports Mango query tools for efficient querying in CouchDB 3.x+.

Xano MCP Server is a simplified Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Xano database integration, allowing Claude to interact with Xano databases through the Xano Metadata API. Main features include listing Xano instances, getting instance details, listing databases in an instance, listing tables in a database, and getting table details. The server can be run locally with Python 3.8 or higher and a valid Xano Metadata API token, and it is also configured for deployment on Smithery.ai.

Phrases MCP Server is an elegant and efficient Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed for managing inspiring phrases. It integrates seamlessly with Claude for Desktop and other MCP clients. Key features include full phrase management (CRUD operations), integration with Claude for Desktop, and a built-in mock API for testing and development.

MCP Server for RSS3 is an implementation that integrates the RSS3 API, allowing users to query data from decentralized chains, social media platforms, and the RSS3 network. It can be used to retrieve information on staking, nodes, and AI intels, among other things. The server can be integrated with various tools like Claude Desktop, Cursor, and ChatWise.

MCP Notmuch Sendmail is a tool that integrates Claude Desktop with the notmuch email database, enabling features such as searching and browsing email threads, viewing conversations in a clean text format, composing new emails using markdown, replying to threads with smart deduplication of quoted content, creating beautifully styled emails, and synchronizing the email database. It uses html2text for HTML email rendering and markdown-it for composing rich HTML emails with inline images.

MedAdapt Content Server is a specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Claude Desktop that enhances AI-assisted medical learning by fetching and processing educational resources from PubMed, NCBI Bookshelf, and user-provided documents. Key features include content search, resource retrieval, topic overviews, learning resources, learning plans, content analysis, and user content import and analysis.

content_name: mcp ai vision debug ui automation
description: Visual UI Debug Agent MCP is an autonomous debugging server that empowers AI models to analyze, debug, and interact with web interfaces through Playwright. It can perform comprehensive visual analysis, detect UI issues, test user workflows, validate API endpoints, track visual changes, monitor console logs, and analyze performance metrics. The server includes tools for enhanced page analysis, UI workflow validation, visual comparison, screenshot capture, navigation flow validation, API endpoint testing, DOM inspection, console monitoring, and performance analysis.

SMTP Email MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides email sending capabilities for Claude and other MCP-compatible AI assistants. Main features include multiple SMTP configurations, email templates, bulk email sending, HTML support, comprehensive logging, and template variables. It also offers tools for managing SMTP configurations and email templates.

MCP Memory Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Claude Desktop that provides structured memory management across chat sessions, specifically designed for project-based work. Key features include storing memories as structured markdown files, indexing memories using Lunr.js for efficient retrieval, tagging and categorizing memories, creating relationships between memories, and searching memories by content, tags, or type. The server helps maintain context and knowledge within project directories, making it ideal for long-term projects such as software development, research, and writing.

MCP Sumo Logic is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Sumo Logic's API to perform log searches. Key features include searching Sumo Logic logs using custom queries, configurable time ranges for searches, error handling and detailed logging, and Docker support for easy deployment.

Wireshark MCP (Model Context Protocol) server integrates Wireshark network analysis capabilities with AI systems like Claude. Key features include capturing live network traffic, analyzing pcap files, extracting protocol-specific information, summarizing network flows, and providing a web interface for easier analysis and visualization. It also includes advanced security features and cross-platform support.

Metabase MCP Server is a Model Control Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to interact with Metabase databases and actions. Key features include database exploration, metadata retrieval, relationship visualization, action management, secure API key handling, and a user-friendly web interface for testing and debugging. It supports Docker for easy deployment and provides tools for listing databases, getting database metadata, running queries, and more.

Linear MCP Server is a Node.js implementation of an MCP server for integrating with Linear issue tracking functionality. Key features include support for searching issues, reading details, updating, and commenting. The server provides a standardized interface for AI models to interact with Linear, and it includes various tools for managing issues, projects, and teams.

Bing Searches Analysis Toolkit is a comprehensive system for collecting, processing, and analyzing Bing search data to extract insights and patterns. Key features include Automated Search Collection, Data Parsing, Trend Analysis, Flexible Output, and Configurable Scraping. It is useful for Market Research, Trend Forecasting, Competitive Intelligence, Content Strategy, and Academic Research.

AER-MCP is a MCP server designed for searching papers from AEA using LLM. It is still under development and inspired by the arxiv-mcp-server. The project includes instructions for quick setup and configuration, as well as references to other academic MCP servers like Stata-MCP and NBER-MCP.

GitHub Repository MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI models to access GitHub repository contents as context. It provides tools to fetch file contents, repository structure, and entire repositories for use in AI interactions. Features include fetching entire repository contents, getting specific file contents, getting repository structure, filtering files by extension, excluding specific paths, and limiting the number of files returned. The server also supports GitHub authentication to increase API rate limits.

Shopify MCP Server is a tool for interacting with Shopify store data through the GraphQL API. It provides features for managing products, customers, and orders, including search and retrieval of product information, customer data management, advanced order querying, and direct integration with Shopify's GraphQL Admin API. The server also includes comprehensive error handling.
mcp-server-imessage is an MCP server designed for iMessage, likely providing functionalities to interact with and manage iMessage communications.

Couchbase Model Context Protocol Server is an implementation of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides semantic search capabilities for Star Wars planets using Couchbase's vector search functionality. Key features include efficient vector search, timeout protection, connection management, error handling, and type safety.
The content describes a simple Figma MCP demo, including environment variable setup and testing instructions. It does not clearly fit into any specific category.

Shopify MCP Server is a tool for interacting with Shopify store data through the GraphQL API. It provides features for managing products, customers, orders, and more, including product management, customer management, order management, and comprehensive error handling. The server offers various tools for getting, creating, and updating products, customers, and orders, as well as managing webhooks and retrieving shop details.

Mermaid Diagram Generator Server is a simple Flask server that generates diagrams from Mermaid syntax using mermaid-cli. It provides a web interface and an API endpoint to create and customize diagrams, with options for themes and background colors. The server also handles temporary files and includes a testing script.

sodukusolver MCP server is a project that implements a simple note storage system. It allows users to add, store, and summarize notes. The main features include a custom note:// URI scheme for accessing individual notes, a prompt to create summaries of all stored notes with an optional style argument, and a tool to add new notes to the server. The server also provides configuration, installation, and development instructions.

The content describes a demo of a simple Figma MCP, including the need for a Figma personal access token and a test command. There is not enough information to clearly place this into one of the more specific categories.

mcp-server-weaviate is an MCP server for Weaviate, providing integration with Weaviate's vector search and storage capabilities. It includes features for installation via Smithery, configuration for Claude Desktop, and requires setting up environment variables and arguments for Weaviate URL, API key, and collection names.

Social Media MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects to multiple social media platforms, allowing users to create and publish content across platforms through natural language instructions. Key features include Natural Language Interface, Research Capabilities, Multi-platform Support, Content Generation, Rate Limit Management, and Analytics.

This is a web application that implements a chat interface similar to LINE, using Ollama and Model Context Protocol (MCP). Key features include a modern LINE-like UI design, AI chat functionality powered by locally running Ollama, flexible integration of external functions like weather and time information via MCP, real-time streaming responses, and a fully browser-based operation.

mcp-duckduckgo-search is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for integrating DuckDuckGo search capabilities with LLMs. It provides comprehensive web search functionality with support for various result types and filtering options, including knowledge graph information, organic search results, news articles, video content, image results, and related searches. Features include region-specific search support, configurable safe search levels, date-based filtering, pagination, and built-in result caching.

mcp-jinaai-grounding is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates Jina.ai's Grounding API with LLMs. It provides advanced web content grounding, real-time content verification and fact-checking, comprehensive web content analysis, and precise content relevance scoring. The tool is optimized for enhancing LLM responses with factual, real-time web content.

MCP Server For OSV is a lightweight MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for the OSV Database API. It provides tools to query the OSV database for CVEs, affected versions, and fixed versions of packages. The main features include querying for CVE IDs, affected versions, fixed versions, and supported ecosystems. The server is tested on Cursor and Claude, and requires Python 3.11 or higher and the uv package for installation.

exif-mcp is an MCP server that allows LLMs (or humans) to read image metadata on-demand, entirely offline. It uses the exifr library to parse metadata from images in formats like JPEG, PNG, TIFF, and HEIC. Key features include local operation, extraction of multiple metadata segments (EXIF, GPS, XMP, ICC, IPTC, JFIF, IHDR), support for various input formats, and flexible image sources (file system, URLs, base64 data, or buffers).

DraCor MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Drama Corpora Project (DraCor) API. It enables analysis of dramatic texts and their character networks, providing features such as access to DraCor API v1, structured data models, play information retrieval, character network analysis, metrics and statistics, search functionality, and more. The server supports operations like corpora and play information retrieval, character relationship data, and full text retrieval in plain text and TEI XML formats. It also includes tools and prompt templates for advanced literary analysis.

STK-MCP is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server designed to enable Large Language Models (LLMs) or other MCP clients to interact with Ansys/AGI STK (Systems Tool Kit) - the leading Digital Mission Engineering software. It allows controlling STK Desktop via MCP tools, leveraging the STK Python API. Key features include MCP Server Implementation, Modular Structure, STK Desktop Integration, Scenario Management Tool, Satellite Creation Tool, Orbit Definition, and TwoBody Propagation.

Element MCP is a Chrome extension that enables users to select and store DOM elements on a webpage. The main features include selecting and storing DOM elements, and viewing stored elements in a table.

MCP Go Debugger is a debugger interface for Go programs that integrates with MCP (Model Context Protocol). It provides features such as launching and debugging Go applications, attaching to existing processes, setting breakpoints, stepping through code, evaluating variables, viewing stack traces, and more. It also supports detailed variable inspection, custom test flags, and integration with the Delve debugger API.

SourceSage MCP is a server that visualizes project directory structures in a beautiful markdown format. It is implemented in TypeScript and offers advanced customization and flexible exclusion patterns. Key features include: directory structure output in markdown, beautiful tree structure display (ASCII art), automatic documentation of file contents with syntax highlighting, flexible exclusion patterns (.SourceSageignore), and modern implementation using ES2022 and Node16 module system.

Luma MCP Server provides video generation capabilities from Luma AI, including generating videos from text or images, extending existing videos, and interpolating between two videos. The server is designed to be used as a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server and includes features such as type definitions, request handlers, and error handling.

@suthio/brave-deep-research-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that combines Brave Search with Puppeteer-powered content extraction for deep research capabilities. It allows AI assistants to perform comprehensive web searches by not only retrieving search results but also visiting the pages to extract full content and explore linked pages. Key features include deep search, configurable depth, content extraction, metadata extraction, debug mode, and headless mode toggle.

Harvest Natural Language Time Entry MCP Server is a tool that allows users to log time entries and handle leave requests using natural language. It supports features like natural language time entry parsing, special leave request handling, configurable work day hours, timezone support, automatic project and task matching, and smart date parsing. The server integrates with the Harvest API and is built using TypeScript, MCP SDK, and chrono-node for natural language date parsing.

UniProt MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to UniProt protein information. It allows AI assistants to fetch protein function and sequence information directly from UniProt. Main features include getting protein information by UniProt accession number, batch retrieval of multiple proteins, caching for improved performance, error handling and logging, and detailed protein information such as name, function description, full sequence, sequence length, and organism.
Obsidian MCP (Model Context Protocol) 服务器实现了一个 Model Context Protocol (MCP) 服务器，用于连接 AI 模型与 Obsidian 知识库。主要功能包括与 Obsidian 知识库的无缝集成、支持笔记的读取、创建、更新和删除、支持文件夹的管理、全文搜索功能等。

Slack Search MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools and resources to access Slack's search functionality. It allows LLMs to search and retrieve users, channels, messages, and more from a Slack workspace. Features include getting lists of users and channels, retrieving channel messages and thread replies, and searching for messages with various parameters. The server also includes comprehensive error handling and security measures.

Grants Search MCP Server is a tool that allows users to search for government grants based on keywords. It interacts with the Simpler Grants API to fetch and format grant data. Key features include searching for grants by keyword, paginating results, and displaying detailed information about each grant, such as opportunity title, funding information, dates, and eligibility requirements.

MCP SysOperator is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Infrastructure as Code operations. It allows AI assistants to interact with Ansible and Terraform, execute playbooks and Terraform plans, manage cloud resources, and perform other infrastructure operations directly. Key features include running Ansible playbooks, listing inventory, checking syntax, listing tasks, AWS integration, Terraform support, and LocalStack integration for local testing.

systemd-coredump MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with systemd-coredump functionality. It allows MCP-capable applications to access, manage, and analyze system core dumps. Key features include listing available coredumps, getting detailed information about specific coredumps, extracting coredump files, removing coredumps, and managing core dump configurations.

mcp-server-fetch-typescript is a Model Context Protocol server that provides web content fetching and conversion capabilities. It includes tools for retrieving raw text, fetching fully rendered HTML, converting web content to Markdown, and extracting main content in Markdown format. The server supports various formats and rendering methods, making it suitable for tasks ranging from simple data extraction to sophisticated web scraping.
Mac iMessage MCP for Claude is an MCP implementation that allows both reading and sending iMessages on a Macbook, enabling AIs like Claude to interact with iMessage.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It also supports retrieving crypto currency data. The server integrates with AI assistants like Claude and offers tools for fetching financial and crypto data.
dify-server MCP 服务器是一个基于 TypeScript 的 Model Context Protocol 服务器，通过集成 Dify AI API 提供 Ant Design 业务组件的代码生成能力。主要功能包括聊天完成功能、支持文本和图片输入、流式响应处理等。

XRPL MCP Service is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides comprehensive access to the XRP Ledger (XRPL). It enables AI models to interact with XRPL through standardized endpoints, offering features such as account information, decentralized exchange, NFT operations, trust lines and payments, and system information. The service includes detailed API usage examples and setup instructions.

Project MCP Server is a tool for managing project knowledge graphs, enabling structured representation of projects, tasks, milestones, resources, and team members. It helps project managers track progress, manage risks, allocate resources, and make informed decisions. Key features include Persistent Project Context, Session Management, Project Status Tracking, Task Dependencies, Milestone Progress, Resource Allocation, Risk Assessment, Decision Logging, Team Member Management, and Project Timeline Analysis.

Qualitative Researcher MCP Server is a tool for managing qualitative research knowledge graphs, enabling structured representation of research projects, participants, interviews, observations, codes, themes, and findings. It provides features such as Persistent Research Context, Study Session Management, Thematic Analysis, Coding Framework, Participant Management, Data Source Organization, Research Question Tracking, Memo Writing, Chronological Data Analysis, Code Co-occurrence Analysis, and Methodology Documentation. The server also includes specialized domain functions and tools for interacting with the research knowledge graph.

MCP Aggregated Tool Service is a modular, extensible, and FastAPI-based platform for aggregating multiple AI tools or microservices into a unified API service. Key features include automatic tool registration, standardized POST method with BaseModel validation, asynchronous httpx interface calls, standardized JSON response format, Docker support for easy deployment, and detailed developer guidelines for extending tool modules.

MCP Toolhouse is a model context protocol (MCP) server that provides access to tools from the Toolhouse platform. It can be installed via Smithery or set up manually, and it requires certain environment variables for proper functionality.

TV推荐MCP服务器是一个基于TMDb API的美剧推荐系统，提供按类型推荐、相似剧集推荐和剧集详情等功能。主要功能包括：按类型获取剧集推荐、获取与指定剧集相似的推荐、获取指定剧集的详细信息、查询特定剧集在指定国家/地区的观看渠道、高级剧集发现、查找演员参演的剧集、获取演员推荐的剧集、获取演员详细信息及其参演的剧集列表、获取当前最热门的剧集、获取近期趋势剧集、获取指定剧集的预告片和相关视频、查看其他用户对特定剧集的评论等。

Gmail MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for the Gmail API, providing a standardized interface for email management, sending, and retrieval. Main features include complete Gmail API coverage, support for sending, drafting, and managing emails, label management, thread operations, settings management, and secure OAuth2 authentication using Google Cloud credentials.

Google Calendar MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides integration with Google Calendar, allowing LLMs to read, create, and manage calendar events. Key features include listing available calendars, listing and managing events, processing events from screenshots and images, and supporting OAuth 2.0 for secure authentication.

This tool connects to Ticketmaster's Discover API to find upcoming events by artist, venue, location, or genre, providing ticket availability information. It enables users to discover local entertainment options and track their favorite artists' tour schedules.

Azure Resource MCP Server provides tools for listing and querying Azure resources directly from any MCP client, allowing efficient browsing of Azure infrastructure and cost analysis. Main features include Resource Discovery, Filtering, Cost Analysis, Secure authentication using Azure service principal credentials, and Detailed View of resource details.

Wikipedia MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that retrieves information from Wikipedia to provide context to Large Language Models (LLMs). Key features include searching Wikipedia, retrieving full article content, getting article summaries, extracting specific sections, discovering related links, and supporting multiple languages.

Android Project MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that facilitates building, testing, and running instrumented tests for Android projects in Visual Studio Code. It provides tools for building the project, running unit tests, and running instrumented tests. The server can be installed using `uv` or `pip`, and it can be configured for use with Claude.app.

YouTube Transcript Extractor is a command-line tool that extracts transcripts from YouTube videos, supporting various URL formats and outputting transcripts with optional timestamps. Main features include support for multiple YouTube URL formats, configurable timestamp inclusion, flexible output options, and comprehensive error handling.

Neo4j MCP Server is a tool for managing graph database operations through the Model Context Protocol. It supports both Cursor and Claude Desktop, and provides features such as executing Cypher queries, environment variable configuration, and integration with Neo4j databases. The server can be run using npx or installed globally, and it includes detailed setup instructions and troubleshooting tips.

Kibana MCP Server is a tool that allows MCP-compatible clients to access and interact with Kibana instances via natural language or programmatic requests. It provides features such as connecting to local or remote Kibana instances, secure authentication, SSL/TLS support, and the ability to search, view, and execute Kibana APIs. The server also supports two prompt modes: tool-based and resource-based, making it versatile for both conversational and advanced use cases.

Todoist MCP Server is an implementation that integrates Claude with Todoist, enabling natural language task management. Key features include Natural Language Task Management, Smart Task Search, Flexible Filtering, Rich Task Details, and Intuitive Error Handling. It supports creating, updating, completing, and deleting tasks using everyday language.

MCP Code Expert System is a Python-based code review system using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides code review capabilities through simulated expert personas like Martin Fowler and Robert C. Martin (Uncle Bob). Key features include code review based on refactoring and clean code principles, knowledge graph storage of code, reviews, and relationships, integration with Ollama for AI-powered reviews, and Server-side Event (SSE) support for web integration.

MCP Server is a Python service that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for Python code execution via standardized API endpoints. It provides a way to run Python code by sending requests to the `/run_python` endpoint. The server can be started and used with simple commands, and it follows a modular structure with tests and documentation.

OpenDeepSearch is an open-source research tool that performs comprehensive, in-depth research on complex topics. It breaks down complex questions into manageable sub-questions, performs iterative searches, analyzes results, and synthesizes findings into a coherent, well-structured report with citations. Key features include MCP integration, WebSocket support, and publication on the Smithery platform.

Dev Memory Server is an MCP server designed for persistent development memory across projects. It automatically captures and organizes development context, code changes, and user interactions. The project is currently blocked due to issues with file system access and JSON response handling. Key features include core functionality, context management, and integration with the MCP SDK.

dolphindb-mcp-server is a server implementation that integrates with DolphinDB for database operations. It includes steps to install necessary packages, configure the DolphinDB server, and deploy the server using FastMCP and Claude Desktop.

MCP Server is a tool that exposes APIs from the Youtube-Summarizer as tools in the MCP protocol, allowing integration with any AI application. It supports local connections and can be set up using Docker. The server can be used with Claude Desktop or as a standalone MCP client, enabling natural language queries to be translated into MCP tool calls.

Unity MCP (Server + Plugin) is a bridge between LLM and Unity, allowing developers to expose and explain Unity's tools to LLM. It includes features such as creating, modifying, and interacting with GameObjects, components, scenes, assets, and more. The system is extensible, allowing custom tool development and integration with AI-driven features. It supports installation via OpenUPM-CLI and can be connected to LLM clients like Claude or Cursor.

MCP Rand is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server providing various random generation utilities, including UUID, numbers, strings, passwords, Gaussian distribution, dice rolling, and card drawing. It can be used as a CLI tool or integrated with MCP clients.

MCP Server for JIRA is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with JIRA, allowing AI assistants like ChatGPT to directly interact with JIRA issues. Key features include the ability to get issue details, and it provides detailed setup instructions for integrating with JIRA and using the MCP server.

xPilot MCP Server Library is a repository that contains Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementations for xPilot. It provides context to LLMs and adds new tools and resources for the model to complete tasks. The library includes server implementations for MultiversX API Service, MultiversX Python SDK CLI, and MultiversX Rust SDK CLI. It also provides configuration options and setup instructions for Node.js, Python, and Rust environments.

Unsloth MCP Server is a library that dramatically improves the efficiency of fine-tuning large language models. It offers 2x faster fine-tuning, 80% less VRAM usage, and up to 13x longer context lengths. Key features include 4-bit quantization, extended context length support, and a simple API for model loading, fine-tuning, and inference. The server also provides tools for checking installation, listing supported models, loading and fine-tuning models, generating text, and exporting models to various formats.

python-mcp-uuid is a tool for generating UUIDs and integrating them with MCP clients. It includes installation instructions, configuration steps for the MCP client, and development tips for NixOS users.

IMDb MCP Server is a Python server implementing Model Context Protocol (MCP) for movie and TV show information using the IMDb API service. Main features include movie and TV show search capabilities, detailed information about movies and TV shows, cast and crew information, top-rated and popular content lists, box office data, country-specific movie information, upcoming releases, and an efficient response caching system.

Business Central MCP Server provides standardized development rules and context for Business Central projects, optimized for use with Cursor editor. Main features include JSON-based static rules, easy deployment to Render.com, fallback mode for working without a database connection, and team-friendly automatic rule application. It also supports dynamic rule management via MongoDB and includes endpoints for getting current rules and server health check.

plugged.in MCP Proxy Server is a middleware that aggregates multiple Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers into a single unified interface. It fetches tool, prompt, and resource configurations from the plugged.in App and intelligently routes requests to the appropriate underlying MCP servers. Key features include Universal MCP Compatibility, Multi-Server Support, Namespace Isolation, Multi-Workspace Layer, Simplified Architecture, API-Driven Proxy, Full MCP Support, and Custom Instructions.

Canvas MCP is a set of tools that allows AI agents to interact with Canvas LMS and Gradescope. Main features include finding relevant resources, querying upcoming assignments, getting courses and assignments from Gradescope, fetching submission status, and more. It supports natural language queries and integrates with various IDEs and platforms.

Claude Web Scraper MCP is a simple Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects Claude for Desktop to a locally running eGet web scraper, allowing Claude to scrape website content through your local API. Main features include web scraping, integration with eGet, and the ability to summarize or get information from websites.

MySQL MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with MySQL databases, providing secure database access capabilities for LLMs. Features include read and write operations, parameterized queries, security measures, and performance monitoring. It supports executing SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE queries, listing tables, showing table structures, and more.

.NET Types Explorer MCP Server is a powerful tool designed to help AI coding agents understand and work with .NET codebases. It provides detailed type information from .NET projects, including assemblies, namespaces, and types. Features include Assembly Exploration, Namespace Exploration, Type Exploration, NuGet Package Search, NuGet Package Version Information, Filtering, and Pagination. The server uses reflection to extract type information and supports integration with AI coding assistants.

Pulse CN MCP Server is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides real-time trending content from the Chinese internet. It acts as a bridge between AI models and real-time data from China's most popular social media platforms, news sites, and content aggregators. Features include real-time access to trending data from 18 major Chinese platforms, such as Weibo, Zhihu, Bilibili, and more. The server also supports integration with MCP-compatible AI models.

GitHub GraphQL API MCP is a tool based on MCP (Model Control Protocol) for querying and using the GitHub GraphQL API. It provides a server that allows users to explore the GitHub GraphQL schema and execute GraphQL queries through MCP client tools. Key features include precise data retrieval, reduced token consumption, single request for related data, self-documenting, and strong type system. The tool supports various operations such as repository information queries, issue data retrieval, user profile access, pull request status view, and project dependency query. Advanced functions include repository contribution trend analysis, issue management and classification, code review pattern analysis, contributor network visualization, and dependency health assessment.

RunwayML + Luma AI MCP Server provides tools to interact with the RunwayML and Luma AI APIs for video and image generation tasks. Main features include generating videos from text prompts, generating videos from images, generating images from text prompts, managing Luma AI generations, adding audio to Luma AI generations, upscaling Luma AI generations, and enhancing prompts using OpenRouter LLMs before generation.

MCP Browser Operator is a Model Control Protocol (MCP) server for browser automation, enabling LLMs to control a web browser, interact with web pages, and analyze web content through a standardized JSON-RPC interface. Key features include Browser Management, Job Management, Web Interaction, Browser Tools, and Auditing capabilities.

Confluence Wiki MCP Server Extension is a VSCode/Cursor extension that provides an MCP Server for Confluence Wiki integration. Key features include easy configuration with secure credential storage, and the ability to convert Wiki content to Markdown format. This tool allows users to fetch and summarize Confluence Wiki content directly within their IDE, enhancing collaboration and productivity.

GPT MCP Proxy is a REST API server that provides HTTP access to Multiple Command Protocol (MCP) tools, acting as a bridge between HTTP clients and MCP-compliant tool servers. It allows for the discovery and execution of tools via REST endpoints, making it useful for integrating MCP tools with custom GPT through Actions. Key features include listing available MCP servers and their tools, getting detailed information about specific tools, executing tools with custom parameters, and automatic public HTTPS exposure via ngrok.

MCP Trakt is an AI-driven tool that bridges AI language models with the Trakt.tv API, providing real-time entertainment data and personal viewing history. Features include access to trending and popular shows and movies, personal watched history, check-ins, comments, and ratings. The server also supports secure authentication and personalized recommendations.

NeoDB MCP Server is a Message Control Protocol (MCP) server implementation for interacting with NeoDB, a social book cataloging service. It provides tools to fetch user information, search books, and retrieve detailed book information through NeoDB's API. The main features include get-user-info, search-books, and get-book.
Obsidian MCP (Model Context Protocol) 服务器实现了一个 Model Context Protocol (MCP) 服务器，用于连接 AI 模型与 Obsidian 知识库。主要功能包括无缝集成 Obsidian 知识库、支持笔记的读取、创建、更新和删除、文件夹管理、全文搜索等。

content_name: cursor talk to figma mcp main
description: Cursor Talk to Figma MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration between Cursor AI and Figma, allowing Cursor to communicate with Figma for reading designs and modifying them programmatically. Main features include Document & Selection tools, Creating Elements, Styling, Layout & Organization, Components & Styles, Export & Advanced, and Connection Management.

Unleash Feature Flag MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Unleash feature flag management system. It allows AI agents to manage feature flags through the Unleash API. Main features include retrieving projects, getting and creating feature flags, updating feature flags, and retrieving specific feature flag details. The server can be used with popular IDEs like Cursor.

GR-MCP is a gnuradio MCP Server that provides a modern, extensible Machine Control Protocol (MCP) server for GNURadio. It enables programmatic, automated, and AI-driven creation of GNURadio flowgraphs. Key features include an MCP API, programmatic flowgraph creation, LLM and automation integration, extensibility, example flowgraphs, and comprehensive unit tests.

Filesystem MCP Server is a secure Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides filesystem operations with controlled access to specified directories. Main features include directory access control via environment variables, file operations within allowed directories, thread-safe caching of allowed directories, proper handling of paths with spaces, and various file and directory management tools such as reading, writing, creating, listing, moving, and searching files.

go_mcp_server_youtube_search is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides tools for searching and retrieving information from YouTube videos. Key features include searching for YouTube videos using a text query, getting detailed information about a video by its ID, and retrieving video subtitles in English or Russian. The server supports both stdio and sse (Server-Sent Events) modes.

YouTube MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with YouTube videos. It provides tools for extracting video metadata, captions, and converting them to markdown format with various templates.
