Key features include video metadata fetching, caption extraction, support for multiple languages, a template system, search functionality, and flexible authentication methods.

scrapbox-mcp MCP Server is a TypeScript-based server that implements a simple notes system. It provides resources for representing text notes with URIs and metadata, tools for creating new notes, and prompts for generating summaries of notes. Features include listing and accessing notes via `note://` URIs, creating new text notes, and generating summaries of all stored notes.

MCP GitLab Review Server is an extension for the GitLab server that adds review functionality to merge requests. It provides features such as fetching merge request information, getting the latest version of a merge request, and posting review comments.

AWS Nova Canvas MCP Server is a tool that allows for the generation and editing of images using the Nova Canvas model of Amazon Bedrock. Key features include Text to Image, Image Inpainting, Image Outpainting, Image Variation, Image Conditioning, Color Guided Generation, Background Removal, and Show Image Thumbnails.

WebforAI Text Extractor - MCP Server is a Cloudflare Workers-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that extracts plain text from web pages. Key features include a simple API for extracting text, clean output in Markdown format, robust error handling, and serverless deployment with global distribution. It is compatible with MCP clients like Claude Desktop and Cloudflare AI Playground.

A flexible system for managing various types of sources (papers, books, webpages, etc.) and integrating them with knowledge graphs. Core features include universal source identification, support for multiple source types, structured note-taking, status tracking, and entity integration with a knowledge graph. The system integrates with the MCP Memory Server for persistent knowledge graph storage and supports SQLite for database management.

Redis MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for interacting with Redis databases. It enables LLMs to interact with Redis key-value stores through a set of standardized tools. Main features include setting, getting, deleting, and listing Redis keys, with support for expiration times and pattern matching. The server can be installed via Smithery, manually, or used with Docker. It also supports integration with Claude Desktop.

RapidOCR MCP Server is a tool that provides an easy-to-use OCR (Optical Character Recognition) interface. It allows users to perform OCR on images, either by providing the base64 encoded image content or the path to the image file. The main features include ocr_by_content and ocr_by_path methods.

Warpcast MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Warpcast integration, allowing interaction with your Warpcast account. Main features include posting and reading casts, searching casts by keyword or hashtag, browsing and interacting with channels, following/unfollowing channels, and getting trending casts. It also provides several tools for Claude to use, such as post-cast, get-user-casts, search-casts, get-trending-casts, and more.

api-doc-mcp is a set of MCP tools for managing and retrieving OpenAPI documentation. It provides features such as listing all API groups, listing APIs in a specified group, getting API details, and searching APIs. It supports both remote API docs and local JSON files, and auto-refreshes API documentation on each request.

cloudflare-api-mcp is a lightweight Model Control Protocol (MCP) server that allows agents to interface with the Cloudflare REST API. It is deployed on Cloudflare Workers and provides tools for interacting with Cloudflare's services, such as creating DNS records. The project includes detailed instructions for installation, local development, and deployment, making it useful for developers working with Cloudflare's API.

frontend-review-mcp is a tool that performs a visual review of a UI edit request. It takes screenshots before and after the edit, and then uses a review model to determine if the edit visually satisfies the request. The tool returns a yes or no response, with a detailed explanation if the edit does not satisfy the request. It supports multiple IDEs and uses models like Qwen/Qwen2-VL-72B-Instruct for the review process.

webdev-mcp is an MCP server that provides useful web development tools, including the ability to take screenshots and list screens. The tool returns screenshots as base64 encoded strings and can be integrated with Cursor and Windsurf IDEs.

workos-mcp is a lightweight Model Control Protocol (MCP) server that allows agents to interact with the WorkOS API. It is bootstrapped with create-mcp and deployed on Cloudflare Workers. Key features include adding new MCP tools by extending the MyWorker class, deploying changes, and managing secrets like API keys and client IDs.

pixabay-mcp MCP Server is a TypeScript-based MCP server that provides access to the Pixabay image API. It includes tools for searching images on Pixabay, formatted results with image URLs and metadata, and error handling for API requests. The main feature is the `search_pixabay_images` tool, which allows users to search for images with optional parameters for image type, orientation, and results per page.
Laravel DebugBar MCP Server is a tool designed to integrate with the Laravel DebugBar, providing developers with enhanced debugging capabilities for their Laravel applications.

Sui MCP Tools is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) toolkit based on the Sui blockchain. It provides functionality to interact with the Sui blockchain and integrates the MCP SDK. Main features include deep integration with Sui blockchain, support for multiple network environments, complete build scripts, and development toolchain. Available tools include Testnet Faucet, Check SUI balance, and Transfer SUI.

X Tools for Claude MCP is a lightweight, open-source toolkit that enables Claude to search Twitter efficiently with natural language and display results based on user intent. Features include Natural Language Search, Twitter Search, Professional Formatting, Flexible Output, Advanced Filtering, and Pagination Support. The tool supports all standard Twitter search operators and can be used for both raw data viewing and optional analysis.
OSS MCP 服务器是一个基于Model Context Protocol (MCP)的服务器，用于将文件上传到阿里云OSS。主要功能包括支持多个阿里云OSS配置、指定上传目录、简单易用的接口，以及与其他MCP工具（如Playwright MCP、Figma MCP和Filesystem MCP）的无缝集成。适用于数据备份、媒体处理和多OSS账号管理等场景。

21st.dev Magic AI Agent is a powerful AI-driven tool that helps developers create beautiful, modern UI components instantly through natural language descriptions. It integrates seamlessly with popular IDEs and provides a streamlined workflow for UI development. Key features include AI-Powered UI Generation, Multi-IDE Support, Modern Component Library, Real-time Preview, TypeScript Support, SVGL Integration, and more.

Veri5ight is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a direct interface between Claude and Ethereum nodes. It offers real-time token balance and delegation info, smart contract information, and direct node access without rate limits. Key features include real-time data, no rate limits, privacy, and full JSON-RPC API availability. It also includes tools for getting token balances, delegation info, contract details, and recent transactions.

MCP Etherscan Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides Ethereum blockchain data tools via Etherscan's API. Features include checking ETH balances, viewing transaction history, tracking ERC20 transfers, fetching contract ABIs, monitoring gas prices, and resolving ENS names.

ClamAV MCP is a simple server that allows scanning files for viruses using the ClamAV engine. It provides an API endpoint to scan files by sending base64 encoded data and returns the scan results, including success status, raw output from clamscan, and any error messages. The project requires ClamAV to be installed on the system and supports various operating systems like Ubuntu/Debian, Windows, and macOS.

tagesschau-mcp-server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for tagesschau.de, providing access to the latest news articles and details. Main features include fetching the latest news articles from various categories and retrieving detailed information about specific news articles.

MCP URL2SNAP is a lightweight Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables LLMs to capture screenshots of specified URLs and return the access URL for the captured image. It simplifies the process of generating and sharing webpage snapshots, making it ideal for integrating visual capture capabilities into AI applications or automation workflows. Key features include email verification, MCP integration, and easy setup with Python and the MCP SDK.

MCP Think Tool Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that implements the 'think' tool to improve Claude's complex reasoning capabilities. It provides a structured thinking space for breaking down complex problems, enhancing performance in tasks requiring policy adherence and reasoning.

Vibe querying with MCP server for Azure Data Explorer (Kusto) is an implementation of an MCP server for Azure Data Explorer (Kusto) built using its Go SDK. It provides tools for interacting with Azure Data Explorer, including listing databases and tables, getting table schemas, and executing read-only KQL queries. The server can be used with VS Code or other MCP tools to make data analysis and exploration easier.

mcp-server-code-assist is a Model Context Protocol server for code modification and generation. It provides tools to create, modify, delete, and rewrite code using Large Language Models. The server supports XML instructions for various file operations and can be installed via uv, pip, or docker. It integrates with development environments like Claude Desktop and Zed.

Harvest Natural Language Time Entry MCP Server is a tool that allows users to log time entries and handle leave requests using natural language. It supports natural language time entry parsing, special leave request handling, configurable work day hours, timezone support, automatic project and task matching, and smart date parsing. The server also provides tools for logging time, generating time reports, listing projects and tasks, and viewing recent time entries.

SearXNG Model Context Protocol Server is a tool that allows language models to perform web searches through the SearXNG search engine using the Model Context Protocol standard. It provides a clean interface for sending search queries and receiving formatted results, with support for various search parameters and easy deployment via Docker.

Configurable Puppeteer MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides browser automation capabilities using Puppeteer. It enables LLMs to interact with web pages, take screenshots, and execute JavaScript in a real browser environment. Key features include browser automation, console log monitoring, screenshot capabilities, JavaScript execution, basic web interaction (navigation, clicking, form filling), and configurable Puppeteer options through environment variables.

Filesystem MCP Server provides filesystem operations for Claude AI, including reading, writing, and managing files and directories. Key features include read_file, read_multiple_files, write_file, create_directory, list_directory, move_file, search_files, get_file_info, and list_allowed_directories. The server ensures security by restricting operations to specified directories.

Ankr API MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that fetches on-chain data via the Ankr API. It provides token operations such as getting account balances for a given address on a specific network. The server can be integrated with AI models and applications that support MCP, and it includes detailed instructions for setup, usage, and integration with Claude Desktop.

Lightning Tools MCP Server allows interaction with lightning addresses and use of other common lightning tools with your LLM. It can be integrated with NWC MCP Server and uses the official MCP TypeScript SDK. The server can be added to Claude Desktop or Cline, and it supports Node.js 20+ and Yarn for installation and building.

Metaplex MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed for accessing Metaplex documentation and repository information. Key features include searching Metaplex documentation, getting repository details from the metaplex-foundation, and searching code across Metaplex repositories.
This content integrates with geolocation APIs to provide location-based functionality, enabling personalized recommendations and localized content delivery based on user IP addresses.

Tradovate MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Tradovate API. It provides tools for managing contracts, positions, orders, and accounts in Tradovate. Main features include authentication with the Tradovate API, real-time data fetching with caching, and tools for contract details, position management, order placement, and more. The server also includes fallback to simulated data when the API is unavailable.

Illumio MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides an interface to interact with Illumio PCE (Policy Compute Engine). It enables programmatic access to workload management, label operations, and traffic flow analysis. Key features include creating, updating, and deleting workloads and labels, getting traffic summaries, security analysis, and PCE health. The server also supports comprehensive error handling and logging, and can be run in a Docker container or standalone.

scaflog-zoho-mcp-server is an MCP server designed for Zoho Creator Scaflog App, implementing a simple note storage system. It supports custom note:// URI scheme, note creation, and summarization. The server provides tools to add new notes and generate summaries with optional style preferences. It also includes configuration and quickstart instructions for installation, building, publishing, and debugging.
mcp-gnews is an MCP server that enables clients to search for related news on the internet. It requires specific configuration in the MCP config file to function.

Godspeed MCP is a Model Context Protocol connector for the Godspeed Task Management API, providing features such as listing all tasks, getting task details, creating new tasks, updating and deleting tasks, completing or uncompleting tasks, managing task lists, and duplicating existing lists. It can be used via npx or installed globally, and supports configuration through environment variables or command line arguments.

db-mcp is a utility that allows AI assistants supporting the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to query databases. It supports multiple database systems including PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQLite. Key features include simple database connection using DSN, running queries, and returning results in CSV format.

mcp-installer is an MCP server designed to install other MCP servers. It allows users to request the installation of MCP servers hosted on npm or PyPi. The server requires `npx` and `uv` for node and Python servers, respectively. Users can configure it in their `claude_desktop_config.json` and use simple prompts to install various MCP servers.

Claude Terminal Monitor (MCP) is a powerful terminal monitoring plugin for Claude AI that provides real-time terminal output monitoring. Key features include real-time terminal output monitoring, multiple terminal support, configurable output history, automatic integration with Claude Desktop, TypeScript support, robust error handling, file system watching capabilities, and clean shutdown handling.

Illustrator MCP Server is a tool that allows bots to send JavaScript scripts directly to Adobe Illustrator and view the results. It is specifically designed for use with MacOS and has been tested with Claude Desktop. The server enables programmatic generation of content in Illustrator, making it useful for automating artistic and design tasks.

Puppeteer is a Model Context Protocol server that provides browser automation capabilities using Puppeteer. It enables LLMs to interact with web pages, take screenshots, and execute JavaScript in a real browser environment. Key features include browser automation, console log monitoring, screenshot capabilities, JavaScript execution, and basic web interaction (navigation, clicking, form filling).

MCP Apple Calendars is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Apple Calendars on macOS. It allows AI models to access and manipulate calendar data through a standardized interface. Main features include listing calendars, getting calendar events, creating, updating, and deleting calendar events, and support for various date formats.

My Tavily Search MCP Agent is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server powered by the Tavily API, providing high-quality, reliable information from business, news, finance, and politics. Key features include lightning-fast async search responses, built-in fault tolerance with automatic retries, clean markdown-formatted results, smart content snippets, comprehensive error handling, optional image results, and specialized news search.

Figma MCP Server with Chunking is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the Figma API, featuring memory-efficient chunking and pagination capabilities for handling large Figma files. Key features include memory-aware processing, chunked data retrieval, pagination support, node type filtering, progress tracking, configurable chunk sizes, resume capability, debug logging, and config file support.

MCP ArcKnowledge is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows you to manage and query a list of knowledge base webhook endpoints. Key features include adding new document sources, listing all registered sources, and querying the knowledge base with text questions. The tool aggregates results from queried sources and provides them to the user.

SparkMango is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that converts Solidity bytecode into a functional server implementation, providing a bridge between Solidity smart contracts and Python-based server applications. Key features include automatic server generation, state management for contract variables, RESTful API endpoints, event handling, and a comprehensive testing framework.

scdl-mcp is a tool for downloading songs and playlists from Soundcloud. It integrates with Claude, an AI assistant, to provide features for music download. Installation involves cloning the repository, running setup scripts, and installing dependencies like ffmpeg and scdl.
This tool integrates with ImageMagick's CLI to enable image processing and manipulation tasks such as resizing, format conversion, and applying filters or effects.

Artemis MCP is a tool that provides API and formula generation tools for interacting with the Artemis API, primarily for retrieving and validating data related to crypto tokens and metrics. Main features include validating Artemis API key, retrieving data from Artemis API, and generating formulas for crypto prices, fees, revenue, and other time-series data.

arXiv MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables interacting with the arXiv API using natural language. Main features include retrieving metadata about scholarly articles, downloading articles in PDF format, searching the arXiv database, and loading articles into a large language model (LLM) context. Tools provided include get_article_url, download_article, load_article_to_context, get_details, and search_arxiv.

Argus is a powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) tool for analyzing code repositories, performing security scans, and assessing code quality across multiple programming languages. Key features include multi-language support, integrated security scanning, Git operations, and detailed error handling. It supports Go, Java, Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, and more.
百度向量数据库MCP Server提供对百度云向量数据库功能的访问，支持数据库、表、索引和数据操作等功能。主要工具包括Database操作（如创建、列出和切换数据库）、Table操作（如列出表、获取表详情和统计信息）、数据操作（如删除和查询数据）以及索引操作（如创建、重建和删除向量索引）。此外，还支持全文检索和向量相似性检索。

Instantly MCP Server provides access to the Instantly API v2, which includes features for email campaign and lead management, analytics, and account management. Key functionalities include creating, listing, and updating leads and campaigns, as well as testing and managing email accounts. The server also supports comprehensive analytics for monitoring email deliverability and campaign performance.

Apache Doris MCP Server is an MCP server implementation for Apache Doris, a modern, high-performance, and easy-to-use analytics database. The server provides integration with the Apache Doris database, allowing for seamless data interaction and management. Features include setting up the environment, running the MCP Inspector, and publishing the server.

MCP Server for MySQL based on NodeJS is a Model Context Protocol server that provides access to MySQL databases. It enables LLMs to inspect database schemas and execute SQL queries. Key features include multi-IDE support, comprehensive database information, security features like SQL injection prevention, performance optimizations, and monitoring and debugging capabilities.
Apple MCP Server is a server application for running apps in MacOS. It includes instructions for installation and running the server, and supports prompts like 'play music' and 'next song'.

clj-kondo MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides clj-kondo linting capabilities for Clojure/ClojureScript/EDN files. It supports all clj-kondo analysis capabilities and can be configured with an optional explicit configuration directory. The server can be installed and run via npm, and it integrates with IDEs to provide linting as a tool call.

Gauntlet-Incept is a system for generating high-quality educational content tailored to K-8 students' knowledge levels and interests. It includes features such as generating and tagging questions and articles, grading them against quality standards, and integrating with an MCP server for Claude Desktop to generate, tag, and grade educational content. The project also provides API endpoints for question and article management, and supports Docker for containerized deployment.

Adjust MCP is a server that interfaces with the Adjust API, allowing users to query reports, metrics, and performance data. It is useful for on-demand lookups such as checking install numbers for specific campaigns. The tool supports installation via Smithery and can be run locally. It requires an Adjust API key for authentication.

usgs-quakes-mcp is an MCP server implementation that provides access to the USGS Quakes API, allowing users to get earthquake data through various search parameters and details about specific earthquakes. It enables natural language queries and integrates with Claude Desktop. Key features include searching for earthquakes based on magnitude, location, and time, and retrieving detailed information about specific seismic events.

KOI-MCP Integration is a bridging framework that integrates the Knowledge Organization Infrastructure (KOI) with the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling autonomous agents to exchange rich personality traits and expose capabilities as standardized tools. Key features include a Coordinator-Adapter pattern, agent personality models, MCP endpoint integration, and dynamic trait updates. The project is built on Python 3.12 and uses FastAPI for the server implementation.

MCP Remote Server (Node.js Version) is a Node.js implementation of the BluestoneApps Coding Standards and Examples MCP server. It provides access to React Native coding standards and code examples through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Features include access to React Native coding standards, component, hook, screen, service, and theme code examples, fuzzy matching for finding examples by name, and full integration with the MCP protocol. The server also offers various tools for getting project structure, API communication, component design, state management, and specific code examples.

Marginalia MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to Marginalia Search, a search engine focused on finding non-commercial content and hidden gems of the internet. Main features include web search using the Marginalia Search API, configurable search parameters, rate limiting protection, and built-in error handling. The server also supports text-to-speech capabilities through integration with the say MCP server.

Grok AI Image Generation MCP Server is a server that connects to the xAI/Grok image generation API, allowing for the generation of images based on text prompts. It supports multiple image generation (up to 10 images), different response formats (URL or base64 JSON), and includes Docker support for containerization. Key features include proper error handling, lazy API key initialization, and the ability to set the API key at runtime.
mcp-server-brian is a simple MCP server that uses Brian APIs to retrieve transaction data from a prompt. The main feature is the ability to fetch and handle financial transaction data.

The content describes the process of connecting an application to Claude Desktop, which involves adding a configuration file to the Application Support directory and running a build command. It mentions that currently, only SMS functionality is implemented, indicating that the primary purpose is related to communication.

YouTube Translate MCP is a server for accessing the YouTube Translate API, allowing you to obtain transcripts, translations, and summaries of YouTube videos. Main features include getting transcripts, translating transcripts to different languages, generating subtitles in SRT or VTT format, creating summaries of video content, and searching for specific content within videos.

BrowserCat MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides browser automation capabilities using BrowserCat's cloud browser service. Key features include navigating to URLs, taking screenshots, clicking and hovering elements, filling out forms, selecting dropdown options, executing JavaScript, and monitoring console logs. It requires no local browser installation and can be configured with an API key.

Spring MCP Bridge is a tool that automatically converts REST endpoints from Spring Boot applications into an MCP (Message Conversation Protocol) server, allowing AI assistants and other MCP-compatible tools to directly interact with your APIs. Key features include automatic scanning of REST endpoints, zero configuration, model preservation, Javadoc extraction, and complete documentation.

MLflow Prompt Registry MCP Server is a tool that enables access to prompt templates managed in MLflow, allowing users to discover and use prompt templates for repetitive tasks or common workflows. Key features include listing available prompts, retrieving and compiling specific prompts, and integration with MLflow and Claude Desktop.

Google Calendar MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Google Calendar, built with TypeScript. It provides features such as seamless Google Calendar integration with OAuth 2.0 authentication, persistent token storage for automatic authentication, comprehensive event operations (create, read, update, delete), fetching calendar events between specified dates, and real-time updates via Server-Sent Events (SSE). It also supports simple integration with Claude and other MCP-compatible AI assistants.

Cal.com Calendar MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with the Cal.com Calendar API, providing appointment scheduling capabilities. Main features include adding, updating, deleting, and listing appointments. It supports various operations such as creating new calendar appointments, modifying existing ones, canceling and removing appointments, and viewing scheduled appointments for specific date ranges. The server can be configured with an API key and used with Docker or NPX.

ynab-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server built with mcp-framework that provides tools for interacting with YNAB budgets. It allows users to manage their budgets, add and approve transactions, check spending vs income, and more. Key features include ListBudgets, BudgetSummary, GetUnapprovedTransactions, CreateTransaction, and ApproveTransaction.

TKU-MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration that connects TronClass to Claude AI, allowing Claude to directly interact with TronClass. It is intended for demonstration purposes and not for production use. The setup involves Python 3.10 or newer, uv package manager, and environment variables for authentication.

Supabase MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows Claude and other LLMs to interact with Supabase to perform CRUD operations on Postgres tables. Main features include database operations such as querying, inserting, updating, and deleting data, as well as listing tables. It also provides support for Node.js, npm or yarn, and requires Supabase project credentials.

Search Intent MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) based service for analyzing the intent behind search keywords. It provides features such as intent analysis, possible categories, reasoning, related reference links, and search suggestions. The service can be installed via npm and requires an API key from aisearchintent.com.

Basilisp nREPL MCP Bridge is a project that provides a bridge between Anthropic's Model Control Protocol (MCP) and Basilisp's nREPL server, enabling Claude Code to interact directly with a Basilisp REPL. Key features include executing code with pretty-printed, syntax-highlighted results, getting documentation for symbols, listing all available namespaces, finding variables in a namespace, checking nREPL server connectivity, and enhanced error reporting and formatting. It also supports Python interop with proper syntax for attribute access and method calls.

TokenScope is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that helps Large Language Models (LLMs) efficiently explore and understand codebases and directory structures. Key features include token-aware directory exploration, automatic summarization, respect for token limits, built-in security, smart filtering, and accurate directory statistics. It provides tools for exploring directories, viewing file contents, and generating comprehensive reports.

Git Prompts MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that offers several commands to generate prompts based on the Git repository's content. It includes commands for generating diff results, pull request descriptions, and cached diff results. The server can be used with the Zed Editor and supports various options for excluding files and formatting the output.

This content describes a tool for searching and retrieving articles. It includes features such as keyword-based article search, fetching article details by ID, and listing articles by a user. The tool allows for specifying parameters like the maximum number of results and starting position for searches, and it requires some setup steps including cloning a repository, installing dependencies, and configuring a JSON file.

content_name: mcp qdrant server with qdrant db
description: MCP Server with Qdrant is a system that integrates Qdrant vector database and MCP (Model Control Protocol) server to store and search code snippets. Main features include code snippet storage and management, natural language-based code search, semantic search for related code, and support for SSE (Server-Sent Events). The system consists of Qdrant as the vector database server, MCP Server for code snippet management, and an embedding model. Tools provided include qdrant-store for storing information and qdrant-find for searching related information.

ResearchMCP is a Model Completion Protocol (MCP) service for internet research using Perplexity AI. It provides features such as internet research through Perplexity AI, integration with MCP protocol, graceful error handling, and configurable settings through environment variables. The service allows querying Perplexity AI's API for in-depth, up-to-date information on a wide range of topics.

Ordnance Survey - MCP Server is a Python-based MCP server that provides access to the Ordnance Survey APIs, enabling easy querying of geographic data. Key features include collection management, feature search with spatial and attribute filters, individual feature retrieval by ID, linked identifier operations, and bulk feature operations. The service handles authentication, rate limiting, and provides a simplified interface to complex OS APIs.

Grey Hack MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Grey Hack game development, designed to work with Cursor IDE and other MCP-compatible tools. Main features include GitHub Code Search, Greybel-JS Transpilation, GreyScript API Validation, and Script Generation for common game tasks.

Chromia MCP is a tool that enables Claude AI to interact with Chromia Wallet for sending $CHR transactions. The setup involves cloning the repository, configuring environment variables, and setting up the Claude Desktop App to use the MCP server.

Flux Image MCP Server provides image generation capabilities using the Flux Schnell model on Replicate. Main features include generating images based on text prompts, comprehensive error handling, and security measures such as validating input parameters and managing API tokens securely.

ClimateTriage MCP Server is an implementation that integrates with the ClimateTriage API, providing tools to search for open source issues related to climate change and sustainability. Main features include Issue Search, Multiple Filters, and Sorting Options. It allows users to filter by category, programming language, keywords, and more, and sort issues by creation date, update date, or stars.

MCP Command Executor is a server implementation that allows safe execution of system commands via the MCP protocol. It ensures security by only executing commands that are registered in an allowlist. Main features include command execution via MCP protocol, command filtering using an allowlist, customizable allowed commands via environment variables, and support for global and per-command environment variables. The server also provides logging and command-line parameter options.

NumPy MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for numerical computations using NumPy. It provides mathematical calculations and operations through a standardized MCP interface, making it easy to perform numerical computations directly through Claude or other MCP-compatible LLMs. Main features include basic arithmetic operations, linear algebra computations, statistical analysis, and polynomial fitting.

Time MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides time and timezone conversion capabilities. It enables LLMs to get current time information and perform timezone conversions using IANA timezone names, with automatic system timezone detection. Key features include getting the current time in a specific or system timezone, converting time between timezones, and customization options for system timezone.

content_name: spring boot ai confluence mcp server
description: Confluence MCP Server Example is a repository containing the complete source code for a Confluence MCP Server built with Spring Boot AI. It integrates with Confluence Cloud to manage spaces, pages, and document history, and exposes various document management operations as callable tools using the @Tool annotation. Features include Confluence Cloud Integration, Callable Tools, Tool Registration, and testability with MCP clients.

CosmWasm MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with CosmWasm smart contracts, enabling AI agents to manage and interact with blockchain-based contracts programmatically. It is written in Rust and uses cw-orchestrator to interact with the smart contracts. Key features include building the server, configuring the server in the `claude_desktop_config.json` file, ensuring MCP UI elements appear in Claude Desktop, and chatting with the server to query, increment, and get the balance of a contract.

mcp-teamtailor is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides integration with the Teamtailor API. It allows for listing and filtering candidates, as well as retrieving a single candidate by their ID. The server uses stdio transport and requires no additional dependencies. Configuration can be done using Claude Desktop or similar clients.

MCP Stock Market is a tool for retrieving stock market data using the Alpha Vantage API. It provides daily stock market data for any stock symbol through a simple MCP interface. Key features include retrieving daily stock data, requiring Node.js v18 or higher, and an Alpha Vantage API key. The tool is useful for financial data retrieval and analysis.

Decent Sampler Drums MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for generating Decent Sampler drum kit configurations. It provides specialized tools and prompts for creating drum kit presets, including WAV file analysis, XML generation, global pitch and envelope controls, multi-mic routing with MIDI controls, round robin sample playback, flexible velocity layer handling, muting group support, and auxiliary output routing.

Cyberlink MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the CW-Social smart contract on Cosmos-based blockchains. It provides a standardized interface for creating, updating, and querying cyberlinks - semantic relationships between entities on the blockchain. Key features include core operations (CRUD), transaction management, advanced features like semantic embedding generation, and rich query capabilities.

Database MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for connecting to and interacting with various database systems. Main features include Multi-Database Support, Unified Interface, Database-Specific Extensions, Schema Management, Query Execution, and Transaction Support. It supports SQLite, PostgreSQL, MySQL/MariaDB, and SQL Server databases.

Git Forensics MCP is a specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for deep git repository investigation and analysis. It provides detailed insights into repository history, branch relationships, and development patterns. Main features include Branch Overview, Time Period Analysis, File Changes Analysis, and Merge Recommendations. The server outputs JSON files containing detailed analysis results, summary statistics, risk assessments, and recommendations.
MCP Clever Demo is an MCP Server based on the JavaScript SDK that exposes Clever Cloud's Tools. It can be used in an MCP client such as Claude Desktop and can be run locally using the MCP Inspector.

Amplify Data API MCP Server is a tool that allows interaction with AWS Amplify Gen2 application's data through natural language. Key features include Natural Language Interface, View Schema Information, Query and Modify Data, Secure Authentication, and more. It uses Cognito for authentication and requires proper admin permissions for full functionality.

mcp-playwright-scraper is an MCP server that scrapes web content and converts it to Markdown. It uses Playwright for headless browser automation, BeautifulSoup for HTML parsing, and Pypandoc for high-quality HTML to Markdown conversion. The main tool provided is `scrape_to_markdown`, which scrapes content from a URL and converts it to Markdown. It supports various IDEs and can be installed using pip or uv.

Coding Todo Server is a tool for managing a coding project's todo list. It allows users to view, add, update, and delete todo items, as well as manage their status and details. The server provides resources like `todo://list` and `todo://item/{todo_id}` for accessing and managing todo items, and tools like `add_todo`, `update_todo_status`, `delete_todo`, and `update_todo` for performing various operations on the todo list.

browser-use MCP server is an AI-driven browser automation server implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for natural language browser control. Key features include MCP Integration, Browser Automation, Visual Understanding, State Persistence, and Multi-LLM Support. It supports various LLM providers and provides detailed configuration options for environment setup.

Desktop Image Manager MCP Server is a desktop image management server based on Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides features such as counting, listing, and compressing image files. The main functionalities include: counting the number of images on the desktop, listing all image file names, and compressing images in various formats like JPG, PNG, WebP, and more. The server supports Node.js and pnpm for development and operation.
Remote MCP is a service that can be remotely invoked, built on FastMCP. It provides a way to run and invoke the service remotely, suitable for web-based applications.
mcp-server-diceroll is a server that simulates dice rolling, likely for entertainment purposes. The content mentions it is based on code from fumieval and provides a reference link for more details.

MCP Development Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables Claude to manage software development projects. It provides complete project context awareness and handles code execution through Docker environments. Key features include project context management, file system operations, template-based project creation, Git integration, and support for build, test, and Docker operations.

X (Twitter) MCP Server enables comprehensive platform operations including posting tweets, searching content, managing accounts, and organizing lists. Features include post operations, account management, and list management, with available tools like post_tweet, search_tweets, get_profile, update_profile, follow_user, unfollow_user, list_followers, list_following, create_list, get_list_info, and get_user_lists.

Google Drive & Sheets MCP Server is a tool built in Rust for interacting with Google Drive and Google Sheets. It provides MCP-compatible interfaces for Google Workspace services, allowing it to be used in larger agent workflows. Key features include listing and filtering files in Google Drive, reading and writing data to Google Sheets, creating new spreadsheets, and clearing values from ranges. The server can be integrated with agent frameworks like Distri and requires OAuth 2.0 credentials for authentication.

mcp-server-birdstats is a plugin that allows you to analyze BirdNET-Pi/BirdWeather detections by cross-referencing them with eBird's extensive database. It provides a natural language interface for querying bird data, data-driven visualizations, and integrates with both BirdWeather and eBird APIs. The plugin ensures data integrity by using only actual API response data and providing clear indications when data is unavailable.
A documentation search tool that retrieves the latest Python library documentation from LangChain, LlamaIndex, and OpenAI through targeted Google searches and content extraction.

MCP Proxy Sidecar is a fork of the JetBrains MCP Server that adds WebSocket monitoring capabilities. It allows MCP clients to communicate with JetBrains IDEs, translating and forwarding commands, and broadcasting tool calls via WebSocket for real-time monitoring. Key features include WebSocket notifications, customizable port configuration, and compatibility with Claude Desktop.

DreamFactory MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for integrating DreamFactory with Claude. It provides instructions for installation, setting up Claude Desktop, and configuring the MCP server. The main features include integration with DreamFactory, configuration of environment variables, and usage through Claude's interface.

EOL MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to check software end-of-life (EOL) dates and support status using the endoflife.date API. It provides real-time information about software lifecycle and security status, including version validation, support status checking, security vulnerability analysis, and natural language query processing.

Huntress API MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with the Huntress API. It enables programmatic access to Huntress functionality including account management, organization management, agent management, incident reports, and more. Key features include account information retrieval, organization and agent management, incident and summary report access, billing report access, built-in rate limiting, and error handling.

This tool enables remote code execution in multiple programming languages through Judge0's API, allowing for testing, validation, and demonstration without the need for a local development environment.

KaiaFun MCP is an MCP server for listing and trading tokens on KaiaFun and interacting with the Kaia blockchain. Main features include token listing, trading, and interaction with the Kaia blockchain, such as checking token balances of configured wallets. The project also includes a TypeScript SDK for building custom applications.

mattermost-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Mattermost integration. It connects to Mattermost API endpoints to retrieve and process information, supporting multiple transport modes like SSE and Standard I/O. Key features include real-time message processing, team and channel-specific monitoring, and secure token-based authentication.

mcp-backlog-server is a TypeScript-based server that integrates Backlog with the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides access to Backlog projects, issues, and Wiki pages, and includes tools for interacting with the Backlog API. Key features include resource management, tools for user and project information, issue and comment handling, and prompts for summarizing and analyzing Backlog data.

Linear Issues MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides read-only access to Linear issues. It allows language models to fetch Linear issues and their associated data using a Linear API token. The server includes two main tools: `linear_get_issue` for fetching basic details about a Linear issue, and `linear_get_issue_with_comments` for fetching complete information including all comments.

TINY CONFLUENCE MCP (Model Context Protocol) is a reference server implementation for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) integrated with Confluence. It enables AI assistants to interact with Confluence resources and perform operations programmatically. Key features include dependency installation, environment configuration, and server startup, as well as integration with Cursor AI.

Fugle MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed for interacting with the Fugle trading system. It supports real-time stock quotes, historical data queries, and trading functionalities. The server can be deployed using Docker or NPM and is fully compatible with the MCP protocol. Key features include support for real-time stock quotes, historical data queries, and optional trading functions.

Joplin MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Joplin that enables note access and management. Key features include full-text search, reading, editing, and deleting notes, importing markdown files, and seamless integration with AI assistants like Claude.

@modelcontextprotocol/web-content-pick is a powerful tool for extracting structured content from web pages with customizable selectors and crawling options. Main features include the ability to extract structured content, customizable CSS selectors, recursive crawling with depth control, automatic retry mechanism, fast and efficient processing, and clean, hierarchical output format.

MCP Server Template for Cursor IDE is a simple template for creating custom tools for Cursor IDE using Model Context Protocol (MCP). It provides quick start and alternative setup methods, including Docker and traditional Python setup. The template includes features such as easy deployment to Heroku, configuration in Cursor IDE, and environment variable management.

MCP YNAB Server is an implementation that provides access to YNAB (You Need A Budget) functionality through the Model Context Protocol. Main features include viewing account balances and transactions, creating new transactions, and accessing YNAB data through standardized MCP resources. The server requires a YNAB API key for configuration and can be used in both development and production environments.

Linode MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Linode's API to manage cloud resources. It enables Large Language Models (LLMs) like Claude to manage Linode instances through a standardized interface. Key features include listing and managing Linode regions, instance types, and instances, creating, viewing, deleting, and rebooting instances, and providing a secure and easy-to-use interface for LLMs.

Korea Tour MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server providing Korean tourism information. Main features include area code lookup, tourism information search based on region, keyword, and location, and detailed information about attractions, festivals, and accommodations.

Zendesk MCP Integration Setup Guide provides instructions for setting up and using the MCP server to integrate with Zendesk. The integration includes functions such as retrieving, creating, updating, and adding notes to tickets, as well as searching for tickets. It also covers repository setup, building the project, configuring the Claude Desktop app, and troubleshooting common issues.

DuckDuckGo Web Search MCP Server is a tool that allows you to search the web using the DuckDuckGo search engine and optionally fetch and summarize the content of the found URLs. Key features include web search, result extraction, content fetching, parallel fetching, error handling, and configurability. It also uses Jina API to convert HTML to markdown and is designed to be used with any MCP-compatible client.
A Rust-based server that provides a fetch tool for retrieving content from URLs, enabling access to web documentation, online resources, and specific website information during conversations.

MCP Azure DevOps Bridge is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration server for Azure DevOps, enabling comprehensive project management. Key features include work item management, wiki documentation, sprint planning, and handling attachments and discussions. It supports creating, updating, querying, and managing work items, wiki pages, and sprints, as well as adding and retrieving attachments and comments.

Sound Notification MCP is a server that plays notification sounds when AI coding assistants like Windsurf or Cursor require user attention. It can play notification sounds when coding is complete or when user approval is needed. Features include support for macOS, customizable notification sounds, and integration with popular AI coding assistants.

LLM Responses MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables collaborative debates between multiple AI agents, allowing them to discuss and reach consensus on user prompts. Key features include session-based collaboration, deliberative consensus, real-time response sharing, and four main tool calls: register-participant, submit-response, get-responses, and get-session-status. The server supports multi-turn conversations and facilitates extended discussions among LLMs.

LLM Responses MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows multiple AI agents to share and read each other's responses to the same prompt. It includes two main tool calls: `submit-response` for submitting an LLM's response to a prompt, and `get-responses` for retrieving all responses from other LLMs for a specific prompt. The server also supports testing and debugging with MCP Inspector and can be deployed using Docker on EC2 or any other server environment.

SMCP Proxy is a secure reverse proxy for Model Context Protocol (MCP) services with OIDC authentication. It provides a secure layer in front of MCP services, enabling enterprise-grade authentication and authorization. Key features include configurable authentication modes, support for multiple MCP backends, path-based routing, local MCP process management, and comprehensive logging and metrics. The project is designed with security, scalability, and configurability in mind.

Token Revoke MCP is a server for checking and revoking ERC-20 token allowances, enhancing security and control. Main features include Fetch Token Approvals, Revoke Allowances, Check Transaction Status, and Multi-Chain Support for over 50 EVM-compatible chains.

Uniswap PoolSpy MCP Server is a tool that tracks newly created liquidity pools on Uniswap across nine blockchain networks, providing real-time data for DeFi analysts, traders, and developers. Main features include monitoring Uniswap V3 pool creation, customizable time range and result limits, and sorting by various metrics such as timestamp, transaction count, volume, or TVL.

Lighthouse MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables interaction with your Lighthouse.one portfolio data. It provides features such as secure authentication, portfolio overview, asset details, transaction history, and performance analysis. Users can query and analyze their crypto portfolio using natural language through Claude.

EigenLayer MCP Server built on Next.js is a tool that provides EigenLayer documentation to AI assistants via MCP. It can run as a standalone server locally or as a serverless function on Vercel. Key features include providing documentation, local and serverless deployment, and integration with Claude Code for testing and queries.

ClickUp MCP Integration is a Model Context Protocol server that provides seamless integration with ClickUp, allowing Large Language Models to interact with your ClickUp workspace tasks and data. Main features include Task Management, Document Management, Custom Fields, Assignees, and Workspace Structure tools, enabling comprehensive interaction with ClickUp's functionalities.

pickapicon-mcp is a tool for FE/UI/Designers to get SVG icons via the Iconify API. It simplifies the workflow by allowing users to request icons through LLMs, eliminating the need to manually search and copy SVGs from websites. Key features include getting all icon repository names, fetching icons based on description and prefix, and retrieving detailed SVG code by prefix and icon name.

WordPress MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for WordPress integration, compatible with Windows, macOS, and Linux. It enables interaction with WordPress sites through the WordPress REST API, providing tools for creating, retrieving, and updating posts using JSON-RPC 2.0 protocol. Main features include methods for creating, getting, and updating posts, support for environment variables for WordPress credentials, and security recommendations for using application passwords.

LetzAI MCP Setup Guide provides a step-by-step process for setting up and using the LetzAI MCP (Model Context Protocol) for image generation. The guide covers prerequisites, downloading the repository, installing dependencies, compiling the project, configuring the Claude Desktop App, and running the MCP server. Key features include Node.js integration, API key setup, and image generation and upscaling capabilities.
PostgreSQL-MCP 是一个基于 MCP 框架的 PostgreSQL 数据库接口服务，提供了简单易用的 PostgreSQL 数据库操作工具。主要功能包括执行 SQL 查询、列出指定模式中的所有表、获取表结构和列出数据库中的所有模式。

NASA MCP Service is a comprehensive tool for querying NASA data, supporting various NASA API services and natural language queries. Key features include astronomical image service (APOD), Mars rover photos, Earth satellite images, near-Earth object data, and space weather data. The service provides detailed information such as image titles, descriptions, URLs, and more, and can be used in Cursor IDE, Node.js, and command line.

GeoFS MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for the GeoFS flight simulator, allowing AI models to control and interact with aircraft in the GeoFS browser-based flight simulator. Main features include controlling aircraft flight parameters, accessing real-time flight data, navigating between waypoints and airports, selecting different aircraft models, and executing flight maneuvers. The server supports HTTP and WebSocket APIs for real-time communication and provides a standardized MCP interface for AI model interaction.

Financial Datasets MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It also includes tools for retrieving crypto currency data. The server can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude to provide financial data through the MCP interface.

kube-mcp is a project that integrates with Codename Goose, an AI agent for automating coding tasks. It uses the Gemini API and the Kubernetes Python client to manage and interact with a Minikube cluster. Key features include setting up a Gemini API key, installing Codename Goose, developing an MCP server, installing Minikube, and connecting the MCP server to Codename Goose to enable interaction with the Kubernetes cluster.

A secure filesystem server that provides controlled access to local files and directories through robust path validation, comprehensive file operations, and a Sequential Thinking tool for step-by-step problem solving.

LSD MCP is an updated MCP server for LSD, designed to leverage dynamic tools (trips) using the provided SDK. It includes features such as authentication, configuration, and environment variable setup, and can be used with a PostgreSQL-compatible database. The server supports web interactions, content extraction, and extending capabilities with TypeScript and LSD trips.

mitmproxy-mcp MCP server is a project that implements a simple note storage system. It supports a custom note:// URI scheme for accessing individual notes, each with a name, description, and text/plain mimetype. The server provides a prompt to summarize all stored notes and a tool to add new notes, updating the server state and notifying clients of changes. It also includes configuration, building, publishing, and debugging instructions.

Playlist-MCP is an experimental MCP server that makes the transcripts of a YouTube playlist available. It comes preloaded with KubeCon London 2025 transcripts, but you can change this by providing a different URL. The server includes setup instructions for use with Claude Desktop and requires Python dependencies to be installed.

LumbreTravel MCP Server provides access to LumbreTravel API, which is a platform for managing travel programs and activities. It includes features such as creating, updating, and deleting programs, activities, passengers, agencies, hotels, services, service languages, providers, leaders, vehicles, includes, and seasons. The server can be installed via Smithery or locally, and it requires a LumbreTravel Client ID and Client Secret for authentication.

The image-generator MCP Server is a TypeScript-based tool that generates images based on given prompts using OPENAI's DALL-E 3 model. Key features include the ability to generate an image for a given prompt and save it in a specified directory, as well as support for development, debugging, and integration with Claude Desktop.

WebSearch is an advanced web search and content extraction tool built with Python, leveraging the Firecrawl API. It offers features such as advanced web search, content extraction, web crawling, and web scraping. The tool also integrates with Model Context Protocol (MCP) for seamless integration and supports various output formats.

SearXNG MCP Server is a Model Control Protocol (MCP) server for SearXNG, allowing AI assistants to search the web through a SearXNG instance. Main features include searching the web using SearXNG via simple API calls, getting information about available search engines, and configuring search parameters including categories, languages, and safe search settings.

MCP ITSM Integration is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for IT Service Management (ITSM) tools, designed to work with Smithery. It provides a unified interface for LLMs to interact with multiple ITSM systems (ServiceNow, Jira, Zendesk, Ivanti Neurons for ITSM, and Cherwell) using the Model Context Protocol. Key features include a unified interface, intelligent routing, context management, MCP compliance, and Smithery integration. The integration supports operations such as creating, retrieving, updating, and listing tickets, as well as assigning tickets and adding comments.

MailPace MCP (Model Context Protocol) Server is an MCP server implementation that allows sending emails over MailPace's fast transactional email API. Main features include the ability to send emails to one or more recipients, and it integrates with the MailPace Transactional Email API.

YouTube Transcript Extractor MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to extract transcripts from YouTube videos. Key features include easy integration with Cursor and Claude Desktop, built with TypeScript for type safety, simple setup and deployment, and based on the Model Context Protocol. It requires Node.js and pnpm or npm, and works with public YouTube videos that have captions/subtitles enabled.

Audio MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides audio input/output capabilities for AI assistants like Claude. It enables interaction with the computer's audio system, including recording from microphones and playing audio through speakers. Main features include listing audio devices, recording audio, playing back recordings, and playing audio files.

The Verge News MCP Server is a tool designed to fetch and search news from The Verge's RSS feed. It provides features to fetch today's news, a random selection of news from the past week, and search for news articles by keyword. The server can be used with Claude for Desktop and Smithery, and it includes tools like get-daily-news, get-weekly-news, and search-news.

AMOCA (Autonomous Merit On Chain Agent) is an intelligent agent for Solana blockchain development, providing enhanced capabilities through a standardized interface. Key features include Solana RPC tools, wallet management, trading tools, and Helius API integration. The project also includes autonomous workflows and merit-based validation of on-chain operations.

Phalcon MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to execute Phalcon 5.0.x framework commands. It allows AI assistants to create and manage Phalcon projects, controllers, models, and more. Key features include creating new projects, modules, controllers, and models, generating database migrations, scaffolding CRUD interfaces, initializing Phalcon Webtools, and starting the development server.

MarkItDown MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that converts various file formats to Markdown using the MarkItDown utility. Supported formats include PDF, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Images (with EXIF metadata and OCR), Audio (with EXIF metadata and speech transcription), HTML, text-based formats (CSV, JSON, XML), and ZIP files (iterates over contents). It can be integrated with any MCP client and supports commands like converting a specified file to Markdown.

MCP MarkLogic Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for MarkLogic, allowing interaction with a MarkLogic database. It provides operations such as creating, reading, deleting, and searching documents in the database. The server supports optional collections and query strings with collection filters. It requires specific environment variables for configuration and can be installed and run using pip.

FreeAgent MCP Server is a Claude MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for managing FreeAgent timeslips and timers. It allows users to track time, manage timers, and handle timeslip operations. Main features include listing and filtering timeslips, creating new timeslips, updating existing timeslips, starting and stopping timers, deleting timeslips, automatic OAuth token refresh, comprehensive error handling, and Docker support.

mcp-gsuite MCP server is designed to interact with Google products, specifically Gmail and Calendar. It supports multiple Google accounts, email management (search, retrieval, creation, deletion, and replying), and calendar event management (creation, deletion, and time slot suggestions). The server requires OAuth2 authorization for accessing Google APIs and provides flexible configuration options for managing different environments or multiple sets of credentials and accounts.

Discord MCP Bot - Server Component is a Discord bot server that integrates with Mastra's MCP Bot component to provide intelligent assistance and answer questions about Mastra.ai. Main features include handling Discord interactions, managing bot commands and permissions, providing Discord-specific functionality like threads and DMs, and integrating with the Mastra component for intelligent responses.

MCP Filesystem is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes resources for each file in a working directory and sends change notifications. Key features include creating MCP resources for each file, respecting .gitignore rules, detecting file changes, MIME type detection, and handling various text encodings.

Zoom MCP Server is a tool that allows users to manage Zoom meetings with AI assistance. Features include listing, creating, deleting, and retrieving details of meetings. It can be used within VS Code and requires configuration with Zoom Client ID, Zoom Client Secret, and Account ID.

Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme (PBS) MCP AI Enabled API Server is a standalone Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for accessing the Australian Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme (PBS) API. It provides tools for querying the PBS API endpoints, allowing AI models to access pharmaceutical data such as medicine listings, pricing, and availability. Features include support for both stdio and HTTP/SSE transport layers, comprehensive error handling, and seamless LLM integration. The server can be used in various modes, including stdio, HTTP, and as a command-line tool, and it supports multiple endpoints for different types of PBS data.

Financial Datasets MCP Server provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial and crypto data, and can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude for financial analysis.

Jira MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI assistants to interact with Jira. It enables actions like fetching user's assigned tickets, adding comments to tickets, getting available status transitions, and updating ticket status. The server can be run locally using Docker or Python, and it requires a Jira account with API access and environment variables for configuration.

GitHub Workflow Debugger MCP is a utility for diagnosing and fixing GitHub Actions workflow failures using the GitHub API. Main features include fetching recent failed workflow runs, analyzing workflow run jobs and steps, identifying common failure patterns, suggesting specific fixes, and viewing and updating workflow files.

DhanHQ Trading Assistant is an AI-powered trading assistant for the DhanHQ broker, built with Model Context Protocol (MCP). It enables natural language interaction for placing orders, managing portfolios, and handling account information. Features include order management, portfolio management, and account information retrieval. The assistant supports various types of orders, such as regular, super, and after-market orders, and provides tools for viewing holdings, positions, and fund balance. It also includes advanced trading commands and contextual trading based on technical signals and thematic criteria.

mcp-traQ is an MCP protocol server implementation that uses traQ as a data source. It allows LLMs to access and utilize information about messages, channels, and users. Key features include searching for messages, searching for channels, retrieving user information, getting a list of stamps, and fetching pinned messages.

Freepik MCP Server is an implementation for interacting with Freepik's API, providing access to stock photos and Mystic AI image generation capabilities. Main features include searching Freepik resources, getting detailed resource information, downloading resources, generating images using Mystic AI, and checking image generation status. It also includes comprehensive error handling and input validation.

PermShell MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for executing shell commands with permission notifications. Key features include: execution of shell commands with explicit permissions through growl notifications, built on the Model Context Protocol for standardized LLM tools, multiple safeguards to prevent unauthorized command execution, and transparent permission dialog showing exactly what commands will be executed. It also includes security measures such as requiring explicit permission through desktop notifications, displaying commands with their working directory for full transparency, timeout limits, and input sanitization to prevent command injection.

mcp2brave is a server based on the MCP protocol that uses the Brave API to implement web search functionality. It includes features such as web search and web search with Chinese descriptions, and requires a Brave API key for operation. The setup involves cloning the project, creating and activating a virtual environment, and installing dependencies.

PHP MCP Server is a PHP library that simplifies the creation of Model Context Protocol (MCP) compliant servers. It allows developers to expose parts of their PHP applications as MCP Tools, Resources, or Prompts with minimal effort, primarily using PHP 8 Attributes. Key features include attribute-based definition, automatic metadata inference, PSR compliance, flexible configuration, and support for multiple transports like stdio and HTTP+SSE.

MemoDB MCP Server is a server for managing AI application's conversation context and personal knowledge base. It provides tools for user data, conversation content, and knowledge management through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Main features include user management, conversation data management, and knowledge base management with full-text search, filtering, and relationship management.

Memory Plugin is a Python-based memory plugin that uses SQLite for persistent storage. It provides memory storage functionality using SQLite as the backend database, designed to store and manage data persistently across sessions. The plugin can be configured with environment variables and integrated into applications via MCP servers.

MeterSphere MCP Server is an implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for API testing. It allows LLM clients like VS Code, Claude, and Cursor to interact with testing services, fetch API definitions, execute test cases, and receive results. Key features include HTTP + SSE, STDIO, or Docker connections, natural language commands for testing, and seamless integration with development environments. It supports interface testing, documentation retrieval, Mock service creation, and compatibility verification, promoting DevTestOps practices.

JSON Query MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for querying large JSON files. It provides tools for working with large JSON data, including features such as querying JSON files using JSONPath expressions, searching for keys and values similar to a query string, and can be used by LLM models implementing the Model Context Protocol.

@davewind/mysql-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol server that provides read-only access to MySQL databases. Key features include read-only database access, schema discovery, SQL query execution, MCP compliance, and simple configuration. It ensures security by validating SQL queries to allow only SELECT statements and executing all queries within READ ONLY transactions.

Deepseek r1 reasoning extension for locally running models is a technical agent system that uses a combination of models, including deepseek r1 as a reasoning model, and can be coupled with a tool calling model. It is designed to run entirely locally and can be integrated into any agent system, provided ollama is running.
