ClickUp MCP Server is a tool that enables interaction with ClickUp workspaces via the ClickUp API. It provides functions for authentication, retrieving tasks by ID or custom ID, and managing multiple tasks. The server can be set up using either npx or Docker, and it requires a valid ClickUp API token and workspace ID for authentication.

MAGI MCP Server is a code review system that provides a standardized interface for submitting code reviews and monitoring their progress using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Key features include code submission and review orchestration, integration with MAGI Gateway for distributed code review, multi-agent review system with Melchior, Balthasar, and Casper agents, and majority-based decision making for code quality assessment. The server can be deployed using Python or Docker, and it includes a test client for verifying functionality.

Binance Cryptocurrency MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) service for accessing Binance cryptocurrency market data. It allows AI agents to execute Binance API calls and obtain real-time data such as prices, candlestick charts, order books, and more. The service provides tools like get_price, get_order_book, get_klines, and others to fetch various types of market information.

GitHub MCP Server is a tool for the GitHub API, enabling file operations, repository management, search functionality, and more. Main features include Automatic Branch Creation, Comprehensive Error Handling, Git History Preservation, Batch Operations, Advanced Search, and Project Management. It provides tools for creating, updating, and managing files, repositories, issues, pull requests, and projects.

Crewai Crew is a project that helps set up a multi-agent AI system with ease, leveraging the powerful and flexible framework provided by crewAI. It allows for the creation of a collaborative environment where AI agents can work together on complex tasks. Key features include dependency management, customizable agent and task configurations, sequential and hierarchical execution, and MCP server integration for exposing CrewAI tools through a REST API.

Asset Price MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server for retrieving and displaying current asset price information. It provides tools to fetch real-time price information for various assets, including precious metals and cryptocurrencies, making it easy for large language models to access and display this data.

Perplexity MCP Server is designed to work with the Perplexity API, allowing users to request chat completion with citations. It integrates with the Claude Desktop client and provides a tool called 'ask_perplexity' for making requests. The server has some limitations related to processing time and long-running operations.

Azure DevOps MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides integration with Azure DevOps, allowing AI assistants to interact with work items, pull requests, and wikis. Main features include Work Items Management, Pull Request Operations, and Wiki Page Management.

This tool enables AI to generate natural-sounding speech and clone voices using Mobvoi's text-to-speech APIs, with customizable parameters for audio output. It is useful for creating realistic voiceovers and audio content.

Figma MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides integration with Figma's API, allowing you to interact with Figma files, comments, components, and more. Main features include file operations, comment management, project and team features, and webhook management.

Lithic MCP Server (TypeScript) is a TypeScript implementation of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Lithic API that provides read-only access to Lithic banking and card services. Main features include modern TypeScript implementation using the MCP SDK, read-only access to all Lithic API endpoints, type-safe tools for accessing Lithic resources, Docker support, and improved error handling and validation. It also supports various resource types such as card, account, financial_account, transaction, and more.

Crossmint HR Airdrop MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to help corporate HR teams airdrop Solana tokens to employees. Key features include wallet management, token creation, liquidity management, custodial wallet generation, CSV import for employee data, role-based allocation, gas fee estimation, compressed airdrops, and email notifications.

MCP Template Server is a template server implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) with integrations for OpenAI, Anthropic, and EnrichB2B. It includes features such as GPT-4 and Claude text generation, LinkedIn data integration, FastAPI and Uvicorn server, environment configuration, and a structured project layout. The server provides tools for getting LinkedIn profile details, recent activities, and text analysis.

Desktop Commander MCP is a tool that allows the Claude desktop app to execute long-running terminal commands on your computer and manage processes through Model Context Protocol (MCP). It also provides filesystem operations, code editing capabilities, and process management. Key features include executing terminal commands, managing processes, handling long-running commands, and performing file and directory operations with search/replace functionality.

ScreenshotOne.com - MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects AI assistants to the ScreenshotOne.com API to capture screenshots of websites. Key features include taking screenshots of any URL, rendering HTML content, customizing viewport size, capturing full-page screenshots, selecting specific elements with CSS selectors, multiple output formats (PNG, JPEG, WebP, PDF), blocking ads and trackers, injecting custom CSS and JavaScript, and controlling wait behavior and timing.

This MCP Server, developed in Go, supports SSE and stdio methods. It provides Bilibili-related tools such as querying personal information, checking the latest followings, and searching for videos. The server aims to offer personalized video content selection for AI. It also allows users to access private information by providing a configuration file with their Bilibili cookie.

Twitch MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that interacts with the Twitch API to retrieve channel information, stream details, game data, and more. Key features include getting channel and stream information, searching categories/games, retrieving live streams, global emotes, chat badges, user information, clips, chat settings, videos, and comments from archived videos.

web-search-mcp is an MCP server designed for web searches. It requires configuration through environment variables, including a SERPER_API_KEY and a specified PORT, and can be started using Docker Compose.

MCP Notes Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server implementation that manages markdown notes in a given directory. It provides functionality to create, read, and update markdown notes using the stdio transport. Main features include creating new markdown notes, reading existing notes, updating notes, listing all notes in the vault, automatic file management, proper error handling and logging, and timestamp tracking for note creation and modification.

MCP URL Format Converter is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that fetches content from any URL and converts it to desired output formats such as HTML, JSON, Markdown, or plain text. It supports universal input, automatic content detection, and uses industry-standard libraries for robust format processing. Features include advanced format processing, history tracking, and security measures to prevent XSS attacks.

typecast-api-mcp-server-sample is an MCP Server for Typecast API, enabling seamless integration with MCP clients. It provides a standardized way to interact with the Typecast API through the Model Context Protocol, with features such as Get Voices, Text to Speech, and Play Audio.

MCP Server for Netwrix Access Analyzer is a FastMCP-based server designed for data analysis, integrating with Claude Desktop. Key features include SQL Server integration, dynamic database schema exploration, SQL query execution, and Netwrix Access Analyzer File System tools. It provides various tools for database connection, data query, schema exploration, access analysis, and operational tasks.

Status Invest - MCP Server is a project that provides tools to interact with external APIs and manage specific domain models, specifically for querying stock market data such as stock prices, indicators, and payment dates using the Status Invest API. Key features include fetching basic stock information, detailed stock indicator information, and stock payment dates, with input validation using Zod and integration with the Status Invest API.

GitHub Action Trigger MCP Server is a TypeScript-based MCP server designed for GitHub Actions integration. It provides tools for fetching available GitHub Actions, getting detailed information about a specific GitHub Action, triggering GitHub workflow dispatch events, and fetching the latest releases from a GitHub repository. Key features include get_github_actions, get_github_action, trigger_github_action, and get_github_release.

MongoDB MCP Server for LLMS is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables LLMs to interact directly with MongoDB databases. It supports collection schema inspection, document querying and filtering, index management, and document operations (insert, update, delete). The server provides tools for database interaction, including query and index tools, and can be integrated with Claude Desktop for seamless use.

Code Summarizer is a command-line tool that summarizes code files in a given directory using Gemini Flash 2.0. It includes features like recursive processing, .gitignore support, MCP server integration for LLM tools, configurable detail level and summary length, secure API key management, and rate limiting. The tool supports various programming languages and integrates with LLM tools like Claude Desktop, Cursor AI, and Cline.

blogger-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI models like Claude to interact directly with the Google Blogger API. It provides functionalities to list and retrieve blogs, manage posts (list, search, create, update, delete), and manage labels. The project includes detailed installation, configuration, and deployment instructions, and it can be deployed on various platforms such as Vercel, Docker, Heroku, AWS Lambda, and Google Cloud Run.

YouTube MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that allows AI assistants like Claude to interact with the YouTube API. It provides tools to search for videos, get video details, search for channels, and obtain channel information. The server acts as a bridge for AI to access up-to-date information from YouTube.

MCP Harbor is a Node.js application that provides a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Harbor container registry. It supports operations for projects, repositories, tags, and Helm charts. Features include MCP Server, Harbor Operations, TypeScript support, and Automated Tests.

This content provides a Docker-based development environment for building and testing MCP-compatible applications. It supports TypeScript, Express.js, and Bun runtime, making it a useful tool for developers.

MCP Server Demo with Arista CloudVision is a tool that allows users to interact with Arista CloudVision through a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server. It enables users to ask Claude (an AI) to get connectivity monitor data and create tags for Studios and dashboards. The setup involves creating a .env file, downloading Claude Desktop, and configuring the claude_desktop_config.json to run the MCP server script.

Novu MCP Implementation is a TypeScript implementation of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Novu, allowing AI agents to interact with Novu's notification infrastructure. It supports various operations such as triggering and broadcasting events, managing notifications, subscribers, and topics. Key features include sending notifications, listing and updating subscribers, and creating and deleting topics.

GitHub MCP Tools is a Multi-Claude Program (MCP) for interacting with GitHub APIs through Claude Desktop. It provides features such as searching GitHub repositories and issues, creating, updating, and managing GitHub issues and pull requests, managing repository settings and configurations, handling repository workflows and actions, searching for users and organizations, and managing repository collaborators and teams.

spotify-mcp MCP server is a project to connect Claude with Spotify, built on top of spotipy-dev's API. Main features include starting, pausing, and skipping playback, searching for tracks/albums/artists/playlists, getting info about a track/album/artist/playlist, and managing the Spotify queue. The project also includes configuration, troubleshooting, and deployment instructions.

Local Git MCP Server is a Python-based Git repository management server using the MCP (Message-based Communication Protocol) server framework. It allows users to create, manage, and interact with local Git repositories, perform Git operations such as repository creation, adding files, committing changes, pulling and pushing, and diff generation.

aws-ses-mcp is a simple MCP server that sends emails using AWS SES. It supports sending plain text and HTML emails, CC and BCC recipients, configurable reply-to addresses, customizable sender email, full request/response logging, and email scheduling. The service integrates with Cursor or Claude Desktop to compose and send emails directly without copy-pasting.

Custom Context MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for structuring and extracting data from text according to JSON templates. Key features include Text-to-JSON Transformation, Group Text by JSON, and Text to JSON. It supports any arbitrary JSON structure with nested placeholders, intelligent extraction of key-value pairs, and processes AI outputs into structured data for downstream applications.
cv-mcp-tools is a repository that demonstrates the integration of specialized computer vision tools with language models through MCP, focusing on advanced scientific and technological applications.

A Java-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for JDBC, built with Quarkus. This server is compatible with Virtuoso DBMS and other DBMS backends that have JDBC drivers. Main features include fetching and listing all schema names, retrieving table information, describing table structures, filtering and retrieving tables based on name substrings, executing stored procedures, and executing queries in various formats (JSONL, Markdown). It also supports Virtuoso-specific features like SPASQL and SPARQL queries.

OpsLevel MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides AIs with tools to interact with your OpsLevel account. It offers read-only access to various resources such as Actions, Components, Documentation, Domains, Filters, Infrastructure, Repositories, Systems, Teams, and Users. The setup process includes installing the MCP server via Homebrew, Docker, or manually, and configuring it with an API token for authorization. Integration with AI tools like Claude, VS Code, Cursor, and Windsurf is also supported.
Connects to O'Reilly Media's content search API for discovering relevant books, articles, and technical resources with detailed metadata and filtering capabilities.

MacOS Clipboard MCP Server is a tool that provides access to the macOS clipboard, allowing AI assistants to retrieve content such as text, images (PNG), and raw binary data. It uses AppleScript via the `osascript` command to interact with the clipboard and supports multiple content types, returning content with appropriate MIME types.
MCP Get Terminal Logs is a guide on how to set up videos, specifically mentioning YouTube in 4K. The content includes links to external resources but does not clearly fit into any specific category.

Linear MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides access to Linear's issue tracking system. It offers features such as creating and updating issues, retrieving project information, advanced search capabilities, and comprehensive error handling. The server is built with TypeScript, uses Linear's official SDK, and supports type-safe operations, rate limiting, and clean data transformation.

Scenario.com MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows users to generate images from text prompts and remove backgrounds from images using the Scenario.com platform. Key features include image generation, background removal, and integration with various IDEs and tools like Roo-Cline. The project includes example scripts, utility scripts, and comprehensive documentation for setup and usage.

This repository contains a project that shows how to create an MCP Server and client for Azure Cosmos DB. The project includes a frontend application using NextJS 15, which displays a products catalog and features an AI Assistant to help users find products and get past orders. The backend is an MCP Server component connected to the Azure Cosmos DB NoSQL database, responsible for reading products and orders from the database.

Encoding DevOps MCP Server is an AI-powered video encoding assistant that helps manage and troubleshoot video encoding workflows. Key features include smart error translation, real-time analysis, human-friendly responses, auto-email drafting, 24/7 monitoring, and suggestions for actions. It integrates with Claude Desktop and your encoding workflow API.

SourceSync.ai MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for the SourceSync.ai API, which allows AI models to interact with a knowledge management platform. Key features include managing namespaces, ingesting content from various sources, retrieving and updating documents, performing semantic and hybrid searches, and managing connections to external services.

Roam Research MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects AI assistants like Claude to your Roam Research graph. It allows for content creation, search and retrieval, memory system management, and URL content processing. Key features include creating and updating pages and blocks, searching by various criteria, storing and recalling memories, and processing external content from webpages, PDFs, and YouTube videos.

Blabber-MCP is an MCP server that gives LLMs a voice using OpenAI's Text-to-Speech API. Main features include Text-to-Speech, Voice Selection, Model Selection, Format Options, File Saving, Optional Playback, and Configurable Defaults.

Prysm MCP Server enables AI assistants to scrape web content with high accuracy and flexibility. Main features include multiple scraping modes (focused, balanced, deep), content analysis, format flexibility (markdown, HTML, JSON), image support, smart scrolling, responsiveness, and file output. The server also provides detailed integration guides for popular MCP-compatible applications and configuration options for customizing output directories.

Pipedream is an integration platform for developers that provides a free, hosted platform for connecting apps and developing event-driven automations. It includes features such as Workflows, Event Sources, Actions, Custom Code, and Destinations. The platform supports over 1,000 fully-integrated applications and allows running custom code in Node.js, Python, Golang, or Bash. Pipedream also offers SOC 2 compliance and a generous free tier for individual developers.

Substack Reader is a tool to fetch and read articles from Trade Companion by Adam Mancini on Substack. Key features include fetching the latest articles, extracting article content in plain text format, preserving headings, paragraphs, and list items, and excluding specific articles. The tool requires Python, uv package manager, and Claude AI assistant for setup and usage.

PHPocalypse-MCP is an MCP server designed for PHP developers to run tests and static analysis. It allows users to define and run various tools like php-cs-fixer, php-stan, and different types of tests (unit and behat) by configuring a `phpocalypse-mcp.yaml` file. The setup involves cloning the repository, installing dependencies, and adding the MCP configuration to the Cursor settings. This tool is particularly useful for developers who are too busy to manually run these tools.

Cryptocurrency Daemon MCP Server (BETA) is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with cryptocurrency daemon RPC interfaces. It enables AI assistants to manage and interact with cryptocurrency nodes, including sending transactions, accessing wallet information, modifying wallet settings, and executing daemon commands. The server provides tools, resources, and prompts for transaction management, wallet operations, and daemon management, with a strong emphasis on security best practices.

Postgres MCP Pro is an open-source Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to support the entire development process for PostgreSQL. It includes features such as database health checks, index tuning, query plan analysis, schema intelligence, and safe SQL execution. Key functionalities include analyzing index health, connection utilization, buffer cache, vacuum health, sequence limits, and replication lag, as well as generating and optimizing indexes, and providing read-only or restricted access modes for safety.

locust-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for running Locust load tests. pty-mcp is an MCP tool server that provides a stateful terminal. It can be installed using pipx, which creates an isolated environment for the server.

@qpd-v/mcp-delete is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides file deletion capabilities. Analytical MCP Server is a specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) server providing advanced analytical, research, and natural language processing capabilities. Key features include Dataset Analysis, Decision Analysis, Correlation Analysis, Regression Analysis, Time Series Analysis, Hypothesis Testing, and advanced NLP capabilities such as Enhanced Fact Extraction, Named Entity Recognition, Coreference Resolution, Relationship Extraction, Sentiment Analysis, Text Similarity, Part of Speech Tagging, Lemmatization, and Spell Checking.

jcrawl4ai-mcp-server is a Spring Boot-based MCP server that interacts with the Crawl4ai API to perform web crawling. MCP Command History is a powerful tool for exploring, searching, and managing your shell command history through the MCP (Model Control Protocol) interface. azure-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools, prompts, and resources to interact with and manage Azure resources.

This MCP Server supercharges your AI with web search capabilities, allowing it to search the web using OpenAI's 4o-mini Search model. Neo4j MCP Clients & Servers is a tool that allows users to interact with Neo4j databases and Aura cloud services using natural language. GitHub MCP Server is a tool for interacting with the GitHub API, providing features such as file operations, repository management, search functionality, and project management. mcp-server-server is a proof of concept MCP server that exposes another stdio MCP server over a websocket. It aims to simplify the use of MCP servers by converting them into network-accessible services, thus eliminating the need for process management and improving performance. Key features include conversion of stdio MCP servers to websocket MCP servers, programmatic interaction without managing processes, and the ability to build the setup into a Docker image.

AGE-MCP-Server is a tool that integrates with Apache AGE, a PostgreSQL Graph database, and Azure Database for PostgreSQL. Google Drive server is an MCP server that integrates with Google Drive to allow listing, reading, and searching files, as well as the ability to read and write to Google Sheets. It includes tools for searching files, reading file contents, reading and updating data in Google Spreadsheets, and provides access to various file types. Bitcoin Price MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides real-time Bitcoin price data. It fetches the current price of Bitcoin in USD, 24-hour change percentage, and market cap. The server handles API calls to cryptocurrency data providers like CoinMarketCap and CoinGecko, with automatic fallback between APIs. Amazon VPC Lattice MCP Server is a tool for accessing and managing AWS VPC Lattice resources. It provides features such as listing sources, getting sample prompts, listing and getting details of prompt templates, and executing AWS CLI VPC Lattice commands. MindManager MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for the `mindm` library, providing a standardized interface to interact with MindManager on Windows and macOS. It allows for programmatically interacting with MindManager documents, topics, relationships, and other mindmap elements. Key features include retrieving mindmap structure, exporting mindmaps to various formats, and getting information about MindManager installation and library folders. The server can be integrated with LLMs like Claude to access and manipulate mindmap content.

Make_MCP is an MCP server designed for creating other MCP servers. It integrates with Claude Desktop and allows users to generate and add new MCP servers to their configuration. Features include the ability to request a new MCP server with specific functionalities, such as a simple URL fetch tool, and then integrate it into the Claude Desktop environment.

Runbook MCP server integrates with Runbook to allow listing, reading, and searching over documents. SearxNG MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides web search capabilities using SearxNG, a privacy-respecting metasearch engine. Documentation MCP Server is an MCP server that enables Claude to search and access documentation from popular AI libraries like LangChain, LlamaIndex, and OpenAI. Figma MCP Python is a tool that allows AI coding agents to access Figma files and prototypes directly. It can be installed via pipx and integrated into IDEs like Cursor and Windsurf using an MCP server configuration. The package also supports setting up a virtual environment with uv.

shadow-cljs-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that monitors shadow-cljs builds and provides real-time build status updates. eToro MCP Server provides tools for interacting with eToro's public API endpoints, allowing users to fetch a user's portfolio, look up instrument details, and search for instruments by name prefix. content_name: spring boot ai mongo mcp server
description: Mongo MCP Server is a project built with Spring Boot AI, designed to interact with a local MongoDB instance and expose various database operations as callable tools. Key features include MongoDB Integration, Callable Tools, Tool Registration, and Testable with MCP Clients.

mcp-upload-file is a file upload service based on MCP (Model Context Protocol). It allows users to configure the target URL, file field key, file name, and additional form data for file uploads. The service is useful for handling file uploads in a structured and configurable manner.

Vercel MCP Integration is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration for Vercel's REST API, providing programmatic access to Vercel deployment management. Tools provided include listing deployments, retrieving specific deployment details, creating new deployments and projects, managing environment variables, and listing all accessible teams and projects.

This MCP server implementation is designed for interacting with cryptocurrency exchanges, providing features such as real-time price data retrieval, order book access for both spot and linear markets, funding rate monitoring, open interest tracking, and price change percentage calculations. It supports Bybit, OKX, and Binance public API endpoints.

holaspirit-mcp-server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to Holaspirit's API, allowing AI assistants to interact with organizational data. Features include listing and getting details of tasks, metrics, circles, roles, domains, policies, meetings, member feeds, tensions, and searching for members by email.

Twitter MCP Server is an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides tools for interacting with Twitter. It includes features such as retrieving a tweet by its ID and posting a new tweet to Twitter. The server requires Node.js, npm or yarn, and Twitter account credentials. It is built using FastMCP and the agent-twitter-client library.

BigQuery MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for accessing Google BigQuery. It enables Large Language Models (LLMs) to understand BigQuery dataset structures and execute SQL queries. Key features include authentication and connection management, tools for querying, listing datasets and tables, getting table information, and dry-running queries. The server also includes security features such as read-only access, query limits, and secure handling of credentials.

URL Shortener MCP Tool is a simple URL shortening tool using the CleanURI API, designed to run as a FastMCP server. Main features include URL shortening, proper error handling and response validation, and integration with agent or tool-based systems via `stdio` transport.

UseScraper MCP Server is a TypeScript-based MCP server that provides web scraping capabilities using the UseScraper API. It offers a single tool 'scrape' to extract content from web pages in various formats, with features like URL extraction, format selection, advanced proxy usage, and data extraction object specification.

UUID MCP Provider is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that generates timestamp-based UUIDs using UUID v7. It provides a single tool `generateUuid` with no input parameters needed, easy integration with LLMs like Claude, and follows the latest RFC standards for UUID generation. The server ensures strong uniqueness and chronological sortability, making it reliable for distributed systems.

Shopify MCP Server is a tool for interacting with Shopify store data through the GraphQL API, providing features such as Product Management, Customer Management, and Order Management. It includes comprehensive error handling and direct integration with Shopify's GraphQL Admin API.

Tecton MCP Server & Cursor Rules is a tool designed for developers to integrate with LLM-powered editors like Cursor. Penrose MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Penrose, which allows users to create beautiful mathematical diagrams through natural language. Features include fetching all content types, retrieving entries for specific content types, and structured responses.

The Developer MCP Server is a powerful context management system designed for software development teams. The server provides tools for interacting with Spinnaker applications and pipelines, and it automatically maintains context about deployments.

Log Analysis with SQLite MCP Server is a project that provides tools to create an SQLite database from compressed log files and interact with it using the Model Context Protocol (MCP) SQLite server. Main features include creating an SQLite database from log files, querying the database, and managing log data in structured tables such as `logs`, `stack_traces`, and `parsing_errors`.

Financial Datasets MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to stock market data, including income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, stock prices, and market news. It offers tools for retrieving financial and crypto data, and can be integrated with AI assistants like Claude for financial analysis and queries.

Spotify-Claude MCP Server is a tool that connects to the Spotify API and uses Claude as an AI assistant for enhanced music discovery and interaction. Main features include getting artist information, potential for extending to other queries like top tracks, genres, creating playlists, and getting user profile data. It requires a Spotify Developer Account, Spotify API credentials, and Claude Desktop.

GitHub MCP Server is an API-based tool that interacts with GitHub using the MCP (Modular Command Processor) framework. It provides functionalities such as fetching user details, repository information, and authenticated user data using GitHub's REST API. The project is built using Python and includes features like asynchronous API calls, secure handling of GitHub authentication tokens, and modular command processing.

MCP Server is a project built on FastAPI and MCP (Model Context Protocol) that enables standardized context interaction between AI models and development environments. It simplifies model deployment, provides efficient API endpoints, and ensures consistency in model input and output. Key features include JSON-RPC 2.0, SSE Connection, Modular Design, Asynchronous Processing, and a Complete Client for testing.

Perplexity MCP Server Configuration is a project that provides MCP (Machine Control Protocol) servers for integrating with Perplexity AI. It includes configurations for a local development server and setup instructions, emphasizing the importance of securing API keys.

Serveur MCP Airbnb is a tool for searching and obtaining details of Airbnb listings. It provides direct links to Airbnb listings in search results. Main features include Airbnb search, listing details, respect for robots.txt rules, HTML parsing with cheerio, no API key required, structured JSON data, and reduced context load.

MCP Ethereum Address Info Server provides information about Ethereum addresses across multiple chains using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). This tool integrates with Search1API to enable web searches, website crawling, and content extraction. It features configurable parameters and specialized tools for image search, as well as integration with Coze AI for generating structured research plans.

Ldoce MCP Server is a Node.js and TypeScript-based server that extracts information from the Longman Dictionary for a given word and returns the data in a standardized JSON format. It connects to the URL 'https://www.ldoceonline.com/dictionary/<word>', extracts details such as introduction, related topics, entries (verb and noun), corpus examples, and origin, and structures these into a JSON object. The project follows Model Context Protocol (MCP) standards and uses Axios and Cheerio for HTTP requests and HTML parsing.

The server also supports a simple note storage system and can summarize stored notes.

browser-use-mcp-server is an MCP server that enables AI agents to control web browsers using browser-use. It supports browser automation, dual transport (SSE and stdio protocols), VNC streaming for real-time viewing, and asynchronous task execution. The tool integrates with various IDEs and provides a consistent environment via Docker.

ClickUp MCP Integration is a Model Context Protocol server that provides seamless integration with ClickUp, allowing Large Language Models to interact with your ClickUp workspace tasks and data. Main features include task management, document management, custom fields, assignees, and workspace structure tools.

Cloud PC Management MCP Server is a tool for managing Azure Cloud PCs using the Microsoft Graph API. It provides features such as listing users and Cloud PCs, rebooting, renaming, troubleshooting, ending grace periods, retrieving review status, and reprovisioning Cloud PCs with specific configurations.

Sonos MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol server that allows you to control and interact with Sonos devices on your network. It provides various functionalities such as discovering devices, controlling playback, retrieving device states, and managing queues. Features include discovering Sonos devices, retrieving and controlling playback state, managing playback queues, and exposing functionalities as MCP tools.

Apache Doris MCP Server is an MCP server implementation for Apache Doris, a modern, high-performance, and easy-to-use analytics database. wongames-mcp is a project created using Bun, a fast all-in-one JavaScript runtime. The main features include installing dependencies and running the project with Bun.

wordware-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows you to run Wordware apps locally, integrating powerful AI flows into your development environment. Key features include local API endpoint support, automatic tool discovery, interactive installation, enhanced CLI, and improved error handling. It also supports global and local installation, configuration via .env files or command-line arguments, and integration with Claude Desktop.

Textwell Write Tool (MCP Server) is a specialized MCP server designed for writing text to the Textwell application on macOS. It provides three modes: Replace Mode, Insert Mode, and Add Mode, each serving different use cases for text manipulation. The tool is write-only and does not support read operations. Development setup requires Node.js, npm, and macOS.

It includes features like rate limiting, pagination, parameter validation, and error handling. The server can be used as a Goose extension or as a standalone server and requires a PagerDuty API key for configuration.

Better Qdrant MCP Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for enhanced Qdrant vector database functionality. It provides tools for managing Qdrant collections, adding documents, and performing semantic searches. Key features include listing collections, adding documents with various embedding services, performing semantic searches, and deleting collections.

go-mcp is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to provide Go documentation tools for AI assistants. It allows AI systems to access official Go documentation and understand Go codebases more effectively. Main features include Go Documentation Access and Package Listing, with tools like go_doc and go_list.

MySQL MCP Server is an MCP server implementation that integrates with MySQL databases, providing secure database access capabilities for LLMs. Main features include read and write operations, security measures, and performance monitoring. Shortcut.com MCP Server is an implementation of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for accessing and searching tickets on Shortcut.com. mysql-server MCP Server is a TypeScript-based Model Context Protocol server for MySQL database access.
